the Bolivar Peninsula for the missing crew member of a fishing boat.\nThe  Coast Guard Sector Houston-Galveston command center received the alert around 8:58 a.m. from the captain of the St. Joseph VII, a commercial fishing vessel, the U.S. Coast Guard said in a news release. The captain informed the Coast Guard of their missing crew member, who is a Nicaraguan man and was last seen wearing black windbreaker pants and a blue sweater.\n'BOLIVAR' INDIE FILM: Why 'Bolivar' is the Galveston County-shot indie film we need right now\nAn urgent marine information broadcast was issued and led to the launch of two Coast Guard Station Galveston response boat crews and a Coast Guard Air Station Houston helicopter crew, according to the release.\nThe Galveston County Sheriff’s Office is also assisting in the search.\nAnyone with information that could help assist in the search can contact the Coast Guard at 281-464-4851.\nEditor's Picks\nWhat we learned from Lina Hidalgo's essay in Vogue\nFact check: What the 'Landman' finale got (sorta) wrong\nWhitmire: Houston police haven't assisted ICE raids\nTop 23 Chinese restaurants in the Houston area\nMost Popular\nHarris County Judge Lina Hidalgo talks destination wedding, Chloe Dao dress and more in Vogue\nHISD’s Yates High School will lose International Baccalaureate designation in 2025-26 school year\n‘Landman’ fact-check: What did the Season 1 finale of the Paramount+ show get wrong about Texas oil?\nHouston faces strong storm, flooding risk after Tuesday. Get help\nPassword recovery\nRecover your password\nyour email\nA password will be e-mailed to you.\nColombo Gazette\nHome\nNews\nFeature\nSpecial Report\nOpinion\nLifestyle / Events\nAdvertorial\nTamil\nLeisure Plus\nHome  News  Fisherman killed, another missing after ship crashes into boat\nFisherman killed, another missing after ship crashes into boat\nMay 18, 2024\nFacebookTwitterPinterestWhatsAppLinkedinEmailPrintViber\nOne fisherman was killed and another fishermen is missing after ship crashed into a boat off Trincomalee.\nIn a search and rescue operation led by the Sri Lanka Navy, in coordination with the Maritime Rescue Coordination Centre (MRCC) Colombo, 03 fishermen from a distressed local fishing vessel were rescued off the east coast of Sri Lanka, about 42 nautical miles (77km) off the Batticaloa Lighthouse on 17th May 2024. One (01) of the rescued individuals was transferred to Trincomalee by the Sri Lanka Coast Guard for medical attention, while the remaining two (02) were transferred to Valaichchenai by another fishing vessel that was in the vicinity.\nThe distressed trawler ‘ASWAR’ (IMUL-A-0266-TLE), had been at sea for a routine fishing expedition, having left from Valaichchenai Fisheries Harbour on 12th May 2024. In an unfortunate turn of events, it has faced this distress whilst in eastern seas.\nHaving picked up the distress signal disseminated by the Communication Center at Valaichchenai Fisheries Harbour, a Fast Attack Craft of the 4th Fast Attack Flotilla and another craft from the Sri Lanka Coast Guard were rushed to the designated sea area, at the directives of the Commander of the Navy Vice Admiral Priyantha Perera.\nMeanwhile, a critically ill fisherman (01) was transferred to Trincomalee Harbour by the Sri Lanka Coast Guard craft CG 407 and subsequently he was rushed to Trincomalee General Hospital for further treatment. Further, the other two fishermen (02), who were unharmed, were safely escorted to Valaichchenai by another fishing trawler.\nAdditionally, the body of one of the two missing fishermen from the ill-fated fishing trawler has been recovered. Meanwhile, search operations are still underway for the remaining fisherman.\nFacebookTwitterPinterestWhatsAppLinkedinEmailPrintViber\nbugsbunny\nRELATED ARTICLESMORE FROM AUTHOR\nDilshan’s daughter helps Sri Lanka stun Australia in U19 T20 World Cup\nSeveral people injured after two buses crash head-on in Habarana\nSri Lanka may scrap Chief of Defence Staff post\nABOUT USFOLLOW US\nFacebook\nInstagram\nTikTok\nTwitter\nYoutube\nNews\nWorld News\nBusiness\nAdvertorial\n‘Tis the season\nCover Girl\nEntertainment\nFashion\nFeature\nFood Impressions\nGazette clicks\nHotel/Restaurant deals\nLifestyle / Events\nOpinion\nPolitical cartoon\nSociety by Zarani\nSpecial Report\nSports\nSpotlight\nAbout us\nContact us\n©",
    "https://dailyguidenetwork.com/2-missing-in-fishing-boat-disaster-in-ada-waters/": "2 Missing In Fishing Boat Disaster In Ada Waters - DailyGuide Network\nSearch\nNews\nGeneral\nHealth\nElectionGuide\nElection Archives\nElection 2024 Main Dashboard\nElection 2024 Results\nPolitics\nBusiness\nEntertainment\nBeatwaves\nNewsone\nSports\nGallery\nPhotos\nVideos\nGuide Radio\nGuide Radio Live\nShows\nUp & Running\nFlight Time\nSimmer Down\nE-Guide Radio\nGuide Sports\nDGN\nTV Programs\nNews Updates\nE-Guide TV\nDGN Sports Live\nDGN Sports Blitz\nOpinions\nEditorial\nColumnist\nWhat's New\nGeneral News\nFormer President Kufuor Consoles Rev Wengam\nPolitics\nAnnoh-Dompreh Files Complaint Against Petroleum CEO\nBusiness\nOmniBSIC Bank Unveils New Tagline ‘Not Just Another Bank’\nGeneral News\nBagbin Vows Action Against ‘Galamsey’ MPs\nGeneral News\n‘I’m Committed To Addressing Farmers’ Concerns’\nGeneral News\nChief Imam Visits BOST\n2 Missing In Fishing Boat Disaster In Ada Waters\nJune 4, 2024\nGeneral News\nTwo Ghanaian fishermen are still missing after a fishing boat capsized at sea near Ada in the Greater Accra Region, DGN Online can report.\nThe boat, named “Seafearer”, owned by the Obuorwe Company, left Tema on Wednesday with ten sailors on board, including two Chinese nationals.\nThey had been fishing around We, waters in the Volta Region.\nAround 7pm on Thursday, the boat encountered turbulent on its return journey towards Tema. One of the sailors attempted to relieve the Chinese captain, who was reportedly speeding excessively.\nHowever, the captain declined, and the boat sustained a perforation beneath.\nThe Chinese captain continued to speed towards Tema, ignoring the need to seek safety at nearby coastal communities.\nThe sailors attempted to pump out water from the boat, but were eventually overwhelmed and the vessel submerged around Kablevu waters in the Ada West District at around midnight.\nSix of the sailors, including the two Chinese, managed to swim ashore with the aid of wooden slaps. They were found by local fishermen at around 5:20 am and brought to Goi. The Goi Chief Fisherman, Nene Joseph Tetteh Agamah lV, appealed to his colleagues and all fishers to help locate the two missing fishermen.\nThe names of the missing fishermen are yet to be disclosed.\nStaff members of the Anyamam Zone of Ada West NADMO have taken detailed accounts of the incident.\nThe Ada West District Commander of Police, Superintendent Daniel Yaro, arranged with the Tema Regional Police Command to assist in the safe return of the rescued sailors to Tema.\nHowever, the two Chinese nationals left soon after the rescue without informing the police.\nSearch and rescue efforts are ongoing to locate the two missing fishermen.\nBy Vincent Kubi\nTags: drown, general news\nShare this article:\nPrevious Post\nFamily Of Slain 3-Year-Old Boy Satisfied With LilWin Arrest\nNext Post\nI'll Escape Your Traps- Dame Speaks Out\nLocation :\n2nd turn left, opposite Nima Police Station, turn right to Stephen Amartey Close, Nima Residential\nPhone :   (+233) 302 229 576 | (+233) 302 232 760 | (+233) 302 231 459\n© 2024  Daily Guide Network.     "https://dailytrust.com/iswap-kills-2-fishermen-seizes-over-100-canoes-after-clash-with-b-haram/": "ISWAP kills 2 fishermen, seizes over 100 canoes after clash with B/Haram - Daily Trust                           ✕ CLOSE Online Special City News Entrepreneurship Environment Factcheck Everything Woman Home Front Islamic Forum Life Xtra Property Travel &amp; Leisure Viewpoint Vox Pop Women In Business Art and Ideas Bookshelf Labour Law Letters             ☰Trust TV  Teen Trust Trust Radio Aminiya  Nigeria Daily  Najeriya a Yau       Search     E-Paper Home NewsBusinessPoliticsPodcastVideosAgricultureSportsOpinionEducationEntertainmentInternational ☰ Click Here To Listen To Trust Radio Live      News\tISWAP kills 2 fishermen, seizes over 100 canoes after clash with B/Haram   Kwara Waterways during the Patigi boat mishap recently  By Hamisu Kabir Matazu Thu, 14 Sep 2023 6:57:11 WAT             Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) terrorists have killed two fishermen and seized over 70 fishing boats in the Lake Chad area in Borno State, victims of the attack and security sources have revealed to Daily Trust.One of the security sources said the latest attacks were in Falinkime and Madangwiyya Island, in which the two fishermen from Kano and Bundaran in Doron Baga were killed on Wednesday morning. “They shot the two fishermen dead. I saw over 40 people that were beaten to pulp by the insurgents in Daban Wanza and Tumun Barebari. They seized over hundred boats from the fishermen. SPONSOR AD  “They used speed boats in rounding up the fishermen’s canoes, merged them in one canoe and led them to the river bank. None of the fishermen made it out with even a single tool,” he said.   Invest time, resources for nation’s economic growth – Commissioner Kano govt justifies N854m for mass weddings as palliativesOne of those wounded, Malam Murtala, told our correspondent that they were first rounded up by Boko Haram fighters loyal to Abubakar Shekau, who handed a stern warning to them to stop paying royalty to ISWAP. “They claimed to be the original owners of the area, not ISWAP, and that anybody that violates that would pay with his life. However, before they finished talking to us, the ISWAP fighters arrived and started shooting. “All the fishermen, about 50 of us, dived into the lake to escape the clash, but two people were killed. Thank God I escaped alive though with a bullet lodged in my buttock, while another brushed my chin.“Later on, the ISWAP said all the fishing canoes we left behind: almost 100 boats have been seized for being informants to security and aiding their members to escape and surrender to the military,” he said.Murtala said dozens of insurgents were killed during the clash, adding that “The shooting continued after we left the place. I learnt that dozens of them died during the clash but the ISWAP have superior firearms.Another witness, who escaped the attack unhurt but preferred to be named Garba, said the boats seized by the insurgents had kept over 2,000 fishermen in serious hardship.He said the fishermen taxed by the ISWAP to fish in Tirigulla, Duguri, Kuyiram, Musaram and Kilma were all sacked.“These are communities that produce at least one trailer per week. It’s the heart of fishing and farming in the Lake Chad area.“For us that operate at the Lake Chad fringes of Monguno, Marte and Ngala, we paid the insurgents N40,000 for Taro (dredging nets fixture), giving them one-third of our daily catch and N3,000 per every Rothmans carton of fish loaded on a trailer to Maiduguri.“They seized over 100 canoes, 5,000 Gura (Malian traps), dredging nets and gill nets that are worth millions of naira. They would tell you to drop everything, including your slippers and leave,” he said.Garba said the insurgents have made fishing in the Lake Chad a feat for only those who dare, “but it’s the only occupation we have since childhood, and we have large families to feed. So, for many of us, it’s worth making sacrifices for.“What happened today has taken us back several years in the progress we recorded in fishing here,” he said.Another fisherman, Mamman Labo, said there were over 144 settlements in the Lake Chad area that had been annexed by the insurgents.“Currently, we only have people in Doron Baga, Bundaram, Fish Dam in Kukawa and Wilgo in Ngala local government areas.He called on the military to go beyond protecting their formations in the Lake Chad area and take the war to the insurgents.“For many years, the military has been here, the Navy occupying the Fish Dam, while Baga, Bundaram and Wilgo are manned by the military, but without any advancement. “We, the residents, are calling on the military to take the war to the insurgents and we will give them every support in taking the war to the insurgents. Because we don’t know how we can survive without fishing,” he said. They all belonged to Karachi's Ibrahim Haidri area.\nPolice and rescuers launched rescue activities. A good number of fishermen from Ibrahim Haidri locality also reached to assist rescuers and divers.\nThe body and the injured were shifted to Jinnah Hospital. celebrate Year of the Snake\nTwo Vietnamese fishermen dead, 13 missing at sea\nBy Vo Thanh, Dac Thanh  &nbspOctober 17, 2023 | 07:21 am PT\nTwo Vietnamese fishermen died and 13 others were missing after two boats sank in rough waters off the Truong Sa (Spratly) Islands in the East Sea.\nA 2018 photo of one of the two fishing boats that sank at sea off the coast of central Vietnam on October 16, 2023. Photo by VnExpress/Dac Thanh\nThe two boats carrying a total of 93 fishermen were catching squid off the archipelago's Song Tu Tay Island when strong winds and high waves sunk both vessels.One of the boats sank with 54 fishermen aboard at 7:30 p.m. Monday and a nearby fishing boat was able to rescue 40 of them. Rescuers found two men on Tuesday morning, but they died soon after being pulled out of the water. 12 crew members from the boat remain missing.The second boat sank in the same area with 39 fishermen aboard at 1 a.m. on Tuesday. Thirty-eight of them were rescued by a nearby fishing boat, leaving a 63-year-old man missing.Quang Nam Province Border Guard Command said 20 fishing boats and three Navy ships are currently looking for the missing.Heavy rain storms have been ravaging parts of central Vietnam for more than a week, causing severe flooding in Da Nang and nearby provinces. Two people were killed and more than 7,000 others have had to be evacuated so far.An approaching tropical depression is forecast to worsen the situation, bringing strong winds and thunderstorms.\nComments  (0)\nLatest first | Highest rated\nLatest firstHighest rated\nView more\n20/1000\nTắt chia sẻ\nLog out\n0/1000\nBack to top\nNews\nPolitics\nEducation\nEnvironment\nTraffic\nCrime\nBrainteaser\nBusiness\nDataSpeaks\nProperty\nBillionaires\nMarkets\nCompanies\nEconomy\nMoney\nQuiz\nTech\nTech news\nEnterprises\nTravel\nPlaces\nFood\nGuide\nVisa\nPuzzle\nLife\nTrend\nArts\nCelebrities\nVogue\nLove\nWellness\nSports\nFootball\nBoxing\nMarathon\nTennis\nGolf\nOther sports\nTrivia\nWorld\nPerspectives\nReaders' Views\nContact us\nAdvertise with us: 090 293 9644\nDownload App\nInternational\nSubsidiary of VnExpress\nLicense number: 71/GP-CBC, Ministry of Information andCommunications, September 22, 2021\nEditor-in-Chief: Pham Van Hieu\nEmail: evne@vnexpress.netTel: 028 7300 9999 - Ext 8556\nFPT Tower, 10 Pham Van Bach Street, Dich Vong Ward, Cau Giay District, Hanoi, Vietnam\n© Copyright 1997 VnExpress.net. All rights reserved.\nGo\nThe most read Vietnamese newspaper\nVietnamese Edition\n|\nContact us\n|\nFollow us on\nNews\nPolitics\nEducation\nEnvironment\nTraffic\nCrime\nBrainteaser\nBusiness\nDataSpeaks\nProperty\nBillionaires\nMarkets\nCompanies\nEconomy\nMoney\nQuiz\nTech\nTech news\nEnterprises\nTravel\nPlaces\nFood\nGuide\nVisa\nPuzzle\nLife\nTrend\nArts\nCelebrities\nVogue\nLove\nWellness\nSports\nFootball\nBoxing\nMarathon\nTennis\nGolf\nOther sports\nTrivia\nWorld\nPerspectives\nReaders' Views\nAll sections\nNews\nPolitics\nEducation\nEnvironment\nTraffic\nCrime\nBrainteaser\nBusiness\nDataSpeaks\nProperty\nBillionaires\nMarkets\nCompanies\nEconomy\nMoney\nQuiz\nTech\nTech news\nEnterprises\nTravel\nPlaces\nFood\nGuide\nVisa\nPuzzle\nLife\nTrend\nArts\nCelebrities\nVogue\nLove\nWellness\nSports\nFootball\nBoxing\nMarathon\nTennis\nGolf\nOther sports\nTrivia\nWorld\nPerspectives\nReaders' Views\nNews\nPolitics\nEducation\nEnvironment\nTraffic\nCrime\nBrainteaser\nCopy link\nMost Read\n1.\nForeign spouses adapt to Tet traditions in Vietnam\n2.\n10 most high-protein plant-based foods\n3.\nQuiz: Which country has the largest number of TikTok users in Southeast Asia?\n4.\nMy mother-in-law keeps boasting about buying our house despite contributing little\n5.\nHanoi, HCMC embrace tranquility on first day of Tet\n6.\nMore foreigners buy homes in Hanoi\n7.\nChinese actress Zhao Lusi makes comeback after month-long depression treatment\n8.\nAngelina Jolie's Vietnamese-born son Pax Thien, 21, crashes e-bike while riding hands-free\n9.\nI avoid hiring or promoting workers with tattoos\n10.\nHundreds of millions in Asia celebrate Year of the Snake\nOne dies, two missing after cargo ship splits fishing boat in half\nBy Pham Linh  &nbspFebruary 22, 2024 | 08:53 pm PT\nFishermen try to stay afloat after their boat was split in half following impact with a cargo ship in the seas of Quang Ngai in central Vietnam on Feb. 23, 2024. Photo courtesy of the Quang Ngai border guards\nA fisherman died and two others went missing when their fishing boat was split in half by a cargo ship in the seas of central Quang Ngai Province on Friday.\nThe fishing vessel, helmed by 46-year-old Nguyen Dam, was catching fish about five nautical miles away from the shore on the Tinh Ky sea region when it was hit by a ship of the Trung Thang company, based in Nam Dinh in northern Vietnam.The impact caused the fishing vessel to be split in half. Nine people were on board at the time, and all of them fell into the sea. Two of them went missing, while seven others were rescued by a nearby fishing vessel and brought to shore.A representative of Tinh Ky Commune said one of the rescued fishermen, named Phuc, was taken to the hospital but died from his severe injuries. A search is ongoing to look for the missing fishermen.\nOne dies, two missing after cargo ship splits fishing boat in half\nTàu hàng đâm tàu cá Quảng Ngãi\nThe aftermath of a collision between a ship and a fishing vessel at a sea region of Quang Ngai.\nLe Van Luong, director of the Quang Ngai Maritime Administration, said the ship involved in the collision was carrying goods from HCMC to Ha Tinh in central Vietnam. Authorities had requested the owner of the ship to stop its voyage to help look for the missing fishermen, and to cooperate with an investigation to figure out the cause of the incident.The seas of Quang Ngai are experiencing favorable weather conditions. Several vessels are out in the water as it is currently prime time to catch anchovies.Ships often travel through the seas of Quang Ngai to carry goods along the north-south waterway.\nComments  (0)\nLatest first | Highest rated\nLatest firstHighest rated\nView more\n20/1000\nTắt chia sẻ\nLog out\n0/1000\nBack to top\nNews\nPolitics\nEducation\nEnvironment\nTraffic\nCrime\nBrainteaser\nBusiness\nDataSpeaks\nProperty\nBillionaires\nMarkets\nCompanies\nEconomy\nMoney\nQuiz\nTech\nTech news\nEnterprises\nTravel\nPlaces\nFood\nGuide\nVisa\nPuzzle\nLife\nTrend\nArts\nCelebrities\nVogue\nLove\nWellness\nSports\nFootball\nBoxing\nMarathon\nTennis\nGolf\nOther sports\nTrivia\nWorld\nPerspectives\nReaders' Views\nContact us\nAdvertise with us: 090 293 9644\nDownload App\nInternational\nSubsidiary of VnExpress\nLicense number: 71/GP-CBC, Ministry of Information andCommunications, September 22, 2021\nEditor-in-Chief: Pham Van Hieu\nEmail: evne@vnexpress.netTel: 028 7300 9999 - Ext 8556\nFPT Tower, 10 Pham Van Bach Street, Dich Vong Ward, Cau Giay District, Hanoi, Vietnam\n© Copyright 1997 VnExpress.net. Earth\nFreedom Project\nImpact Your World\nInside Africa\nCNN Heroes\nWatch\nLive TV\nCNN Fast\nShows A-Z\nCNN10\nCNN Max\nCNN TV Schedules\nListen\nCNN 5 Things\nChasing Life with Dr. Sanjay Gupta\nThe Assignment with Audie Cornish\nOne Thing\nTug of War\nCNN Political Briefing\nThe Axe Files\nAll There Is with Anderson Cooper\nAll CNN Audio podcasts\nAbout CNN\nPhotos\nInvestigations\nCNN Profiles\nCNN Leadership\nCNN Newsletters\nWork for CNN\nAd Feedback\nPhilippines says three fishermen killed after boat collides with ‘foreign’ vessel in South China Sea\nBy Kathleen Magramo, CNN\n4 minute read\nUpdated\n4:25 AM EDT, Wed October 4, 2023\nLink Copied!\nSurvivors arrive ashore in the province of Pangasinan on October 3 after a collision in the South China Sea.\nPhilippine Coast Guard\nCNN\n—\nThe Philippines is investigating the deaths of three Filipino fishermen after they were killed in a collision with a “foreign” vessel in the South China Sea, authorities in the country said on Wednesday.\nPhilippine fishing boat FFB Dearyn was struck at around 4:20 a.m. on Monday near Scarborough Shoal, according to the Philippine coast guard, citing a crew member.\nEleven crew members survived the crash and used their own service boats to reach land on Tuesday morning, carrying the dead – including the captain – to Pangasinan province in northern Luzon, the country’s largest island, the coast guard said.\nIn a post on X, formerly Twitter, Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said the coast guard is “backtracking and checking all monitored vessels in the area as part of its ongoing investigation.”\n“We assure the victims, their families, and everyone that we will exert every effort to hold accountable those who are responsible for this unfortunate maritime incident,” Marcos said.\nHe also asked that all parties “refrain from engaging in speculation” while the investigation is ongoing.\nIn an update Wednesday, the coast guard said it would reach out to an oil tanker registered under the flag of the Marshall Islands, which may have been in the area at the time of the incident, based on marine traffic data and survivors’ accounts.\nAccording to information collected by authorities, the tanker came from South Korea and was heading to Singapore, Rear Adm. Armand Balilo told CNN affiliate CNN Philippines in a TV interview.\nBalilo said the oil tanker was in the area during the time of the collision and authorities were still collecting evidence.\nThe South China Sea is a 1.3 million-square-mile waterway that’s vital to international trade, with an estimated third of global shipping worth trillions of dollars passing through each year. That means huge container ships and oil tankers routinely sail through the region.\nThe sea is also home to vast fertile fishing grounds upon which many lives and livelihoods depend on, often using much smaller vessels.\nUp to 85% of all maritime accidents are a result of navigation hazards and poorly regulated commercial operations that continue to pose risks to shipping and undermine the security environment, said John Bradford, international affairs fellow in Indonesia for the Council on Foreign Relations.\nSuch incidents are particularly common in Southeast Asia, where crews are often mistreated and under trained, he added, citing the Information Fusion Centre in Singapore, which has counted 1,882 individuals as dead or missing at sea in the first half of 2023.\n“Sometimes the collisions, even those resulting in death, aren’t reported because there is a lack of trust in the authorities or fear of prosecution for the collision or other activities. This speaks to the overall governance problem,” Bradford said.\nPhotos released by the Philippine coast guard show the scene at Barangay Cato on October 3.\nPhilippine Coast Guard\nThe South China Sea is also a major maritime flashpoint.\nBracketed by China and several Southeast Asian nations, parts of the sea are claimed by multiple governments, with Beijing asserting ownership over almost all of the waterway, in defiance of an international court ruling.\nOver the past two decades, China has occupied a number of obscure reefs and atolls far from its shoreline across the South China Sea, building up military installations, including runways and ports.\nScarborough Shoal, known as Bajo de Masinloc in the Philippines and Huangyan Island in China, is a small but strategic reef and fishing ground 130 miles (200 kilometers) west of Luzon that has been a major source of tensions between Manila and Beijing.\nRichard Heydarian, senior lecturer in international relations at the University of the Philippines’ Asian Center, said that even if this incident did not directly involve China, the territorial disputes may have had an indirect influence.\n“The reality is that China has structural culpability for what’s happening because of China’s bullying and various means of preventing Filipino fishermen from accessing traditional fishing grounds. What’s happening here is that [Filipino fishermen are] being pushed farther and farther into the high seas,” Heydarian said.\nChina’s Foreign Ministry has defended the behavior of its vessels in the waterway and said Beijing will “firmly safeguard” what it views as its territorial sovereignty.\nThe area has witnessed increasingly frequent run-ins between Philippine vessels and tiny wooden fishing boats against much larger Chinese coast guard ships and what Manila says are shadowy Chinese “maritime militia” fishing vessels.\nIn 2016, an international tribunal in The Hague ruled in favor of the Philippines in a landmark maritime dispute, which concluded that China has no legal basis to claim historic rights to the bulk of the South China Sea. Manila says Beijing has ignored the ruling.\nCNN’s Brad Lendon contributed reporting.\nAd Feedback\nAd Feedback\nAd Feedback\nAd Feedback\nAd Feedback\nAd Feedback\nAd Feedback\nAd Feedback\nSign in\nMy Account\nSettings\nTopics You Follow\nSign Out\nYour CNN account\nSign in to your CNN account\nLive TV\nListen\nWatch\nWorld\nAfrica\nAmericas\nAsia\nAustralia\nChina\nEurope\nIndia\nMiddle East\nUnited Kingdom\nUS Politics\nSCOTUS\nCongress\nFacts First\n2024 Elections\nBusiness\nTech\nMedia\nCalculators\nVideos\nMarkets\nPre-markets\nAfter-Hours\nFear & Greed\nInvesting\nMarkets Now\nNightcap\nHealth\nLife, But Better\nFitness\nFood\nSleep\nMindfulness\nRelationships\nEntertainment\nMovies\nTelevision\nCelebrity\nTech\nInnovate\nForeseeable Future\nMission: Ahead\nWork Transformed\nInnovative Cities\nStyle\nArts\nDesign\nFashion\nArchitecture\nLuxury\nBeauty\nVideo\nTravel\nDestinations\nFood & Drink\nStay\nNews\nVideos\nSports\nFootball\nTennis\nGolf\nMotorsport\nUS Sports\nOlympics\nClimbing\nEsports\nHockey\nScience\nSpace\nLife\nUnearthed\nClimate\nSolutions\nWeather\nWeather\nVideo\nClimate\nUkraine-Russia War\nIsrael-Hamas War\nFeatures\nAs Equals\nCall to Earth\nFreedom Project\nImpact Your World\nInside Africa\nCNN Heroes\nWatch\nLive TV\nCNN Fast\nShows A-Z\nCNN10\nCNN Max\nCNN TV Schedules\nListen\nCNN 5 Things\nChasing Life with Dr. Sanjay Gupta\nThe Assignment with Audie Cornish\nOne Thing\nTug of War\nCNN Political Briefing\nThe Axe Files\nAll There Is with Anderson Cooper\nAll CNN Audio podcasts\nAbout CNN\nPhotos\nInvestigations\nCNN Profiles\nCNN Leadership\nCNN Newsletters\nWork for CNN\nWorld\nWatch\nListen\nLive TV\nFollow CNN\nSign in\nMy Account\nSettings\nTopics You Follow\nSign Out\nYour CNN account\nSign in to your CNN account\nTerms of Use\nPrivacy Policy\nAd Choices\nAccessibility & CC\nAbout\nNewsletters\nTranscripts\n© 2025 Cable News Network. Shahid\n14 October 2023, MVT 16:50\nMissing fisher Yoosuf Ibrahim\nMalika Shahid\n14 October 2023, MVT 16:50\nPolice have launched a search for a man who went missing while fishing alone.\nThe missing individual is a 65-year-old man named Yoosuf Ibrahim from Alif Dhaal atoll, Dhangethi.\nYoosuf Ibrahim disappeared while fishing in a small boat. He was reported missing at 11:42 am today. He had gone fishing earlier in the morning, as is his usual routine of going alone.\nThe Coast Guard has initiated a search operation to locate the missing individual.\nShare this story\nTopics\nMissing Persons\nMNDF\nDiscuss\nMORE ON NEWS\nThakandhoo's cultural tourism to be expanded\nAll-male panel's sexual harassment probe sparks criticism\nPolice investigate case of teen suffering burns\nState requests to place Lamha back in custody\nNews\nBusiness\nSports\nFeatures\nReports\nTravel\nWorld\nEntertainment\nLifestyle\nmihaaru.com\nCopyright © 2025 The Edition\nTerms of Use\nPrivacy Policy\nContact\nmihaaru.com",
    "https://elanhub.net/rivers-fisherman-drowns-as-boat-capsizes-at-amadi-ama-creek-kinsmen-blame-nlng/": "Rivers: Fisherman Drowns as Boat Capsizes at Amadi-Ama Creek; Kinsmen Blame NLNG | ELANHUB MEDIA\nHomeAbout UsOur TeamPrivacy PolicyCookie Policy (EU)Terms and Conditions     Wednesday, January 29, 2025        HomeNewsPoliticsSportsWorld NewsOpinionEducationLecture NotesSTUDY GUIDEEntertainmentCelebrity TrendsMoviesMusicShort StoriesLifestyleFashionFoodTravelScienceCovid DiaryCOVID-19DevotionalsDaily MannaESOCS Daily DevotionalOpen HeavenRhapsody of Realities    No Result  View All ResultHomeNewsPoliticsSportsWorld NewsOpinionEducationLecture NotesSTUDY GUIDEEntertainmentCelebrity TrendsMoviesMusicShort StoriesLifestyleFashionFoodTravelScienceCovid DiaryCOVID-19DevotionalsDaily MannaESOCS Daily DevotionalOpen HeavenRhapsody of Realities    No Result  View All Result         Home  News Rivers: Fisherman Drowns as Boat Capsizes at Amadi-Ama Creek; Kinsmen Blame NLNG  by Stanley Uhegbu January 22, 2024 in News  0Photo Credit: Elan Pics0 SHARES38 VIEWS Share on FacebookShare on Twitter  A fisherman identified as Precious Imabibo from Koko-Ama community in Rivers state, has drowned after his canoe capsized at the Amadi Creek on Saturday.Source say the accident was caused by a speeding NLNG passenger boat which was driven by a woman.Meanwhile, the company had in a statement promised to investigate the incident after boats were prevented from using the Amadi-Ama water channels by members of the community to protest the death of the fisherman.The Company said,“Nigeria LNG Limited (NLNG) is aware of protests stemming from a grievance concerning a capsized canoe in the Amadi-Ama and Koko-Ama communities’ water channel.”“The incident is linked to an alleged strong wave generated by a transiting passenger boat chartered by NLNG.”“Reports indicate that the incident has resulted in one fatality and the subsequent blockade of the Amadi-Ama and Koko-Ama channel used by the passenger boat.”“NLNG has urgently initiated investigations into the matter. Furthermore, NLNG is actively engaging with the passenger boat operator and the protesting communities, Amadi-Ama and Koko-Ama, with the aim of reaching a peaceful resolution.”“The engagement has led to the removal of the blockade.”“NLNG urges for calm during the ongoing investigation and resolution process. The company is committed to addressing the concerns raised and working towards a peaceful outcome for all parties involved.”Share this:TweetWhatsAppLike this:Like Loading...Tags: #elanhub.netNLNGRivers State  Previous PostBreaking: Burna Boy to Perform at the 66th Grammys   Next PostOPEN HEAVEN 23 January 2024: Friends Stronger Than Brothers    Stanley Uhegbu      Next Post    OPEN HEAVEN 23 January 2024: Friends Stronger Than Brothers  Leave a Reply Cancel replyYour email address will not be published. January 2024 15:03 (UTC +04:00)\nAt least three people were killed and two others went missing Tuesday when a fishing boat sank off Türkiye's Aegean coast, APA reports citing local media.\nThe incident occurred around 2:00 a.m. local time (2300 GMT on Monday) when the boat was sailing for fishing with 10 people onboard near the western province of Izmir, the Demiroren news agency said.\nThe report said the cause of the accident remained unclear while search and rescue operations were launched.\nExit polls in Croatia show incumbent Milanovic winning presidential runoff by wide     "https://en.prothomalo.com/bangladesh/si5nhypxoq": "25 Fishermen Still Missing After 20 Days | Prothom Alo\nLoginBangladeshInternationalSportsOpinionBusinessYouthEntertainmentLifestyleClaim vs FactSearchই-পেপারবাংলাLogin\nBangladesh25 fishermen still missing after 20 days Correspondent BargunaUpdated: 08 Dec 2023, 07: 49 The family of Nantu Khan of Gazi Mahmud area of Naltona Union of Sadar Upazila of Barguna. Nantu Khan went missing in the sea during Cyclone MidhiliProthom AloA total of 25 fishermen from two fishing trawlers that sank in the Bay of Bengal due to Cyclone Midhili remain missing even after 20 days. The families of these fishermen are enduring days of worry and anxiety, with some facing dire circumstances as the primary breadwinners are still missing.  According to the Barguna District Trawler Owners Association, in early November, 17 fishermen set out to the Bay of Bengal for fishing in a trawler named FB Elahi Bharasa, owned by Rafiqul Islam in the Charduani area of Patharghata in Barguna.  On 17 November, all the fishermen aboard that trawler went missing after being hit by Cyclone Midhili. Additionally, a trawler named FB Mayer Doa of Patharghata, which had gone fishing in the sea a few days before the cyclone, sank on 17 November in a storm. Eight fishermen aboard that trawler also went missing. Out of the 17 fishermen missing from FB Elahi Bharasa, 16 are from Barguna Sadar Upazila. Among them, seven are from Gazi Mahmud village in Naltona union, and nine are from Dhalua Union.  Salma Begum, the wife of the missing fisherman Md Liton Howlader, 42, from Barguna Sadar Upazila Naltona Union, said, \"My husband left home to fish in the sea a week before the storm. The day before the storm, I spoke with him on the phone for the last time. Since then, there is no trace of him. I lost my husband.\" Hasib, the son of Monir Hossain, another missing fisherman from Naltona Union, shared, \"We talked with my father the day before the cyclone. My father was the sole earner in our family. Currently, we have to go through a lot of difficulties.\" Golam Mostafa Chowdhury, president of the Barguna District Trawler Owners Association, has conveyed that no trace of the missing fishermen was discovered during Cyclone Midhili. The fate of the trawler named MV Mayer Doa, and whether it sank in the sea due to the storm, remains uncertain. Similarly, it is unclear whether the trawler named Elahi Bharasa floated to India or sank.  UNO Shamim Mia of Barguna Sadar has stated that there is no trace of the missing fishermen in the aftermath of Cyclone Midhili. It is not possible to determine whether they are alive or dead. The list of missing fishermen has been submitted to the office of the Deputy Commissioner. Follow the Google news channel to get Prothom Alo's latest newsRead more from BangladeshCycloneBargunaFishermen",
    "https://en.tempo.co/read/1606047/7-indonesian-sailors-escape-from-korean-boat-one-dies": "7 Indonesian Sailors Escape from Korean Boat; One Dies -  En.tempo.co\nTEMPO EXCLUSIVE\nTempo English\nSupport Tempo\nLOGIN\nREGISTER\nHome\nPopular News\nNews\nAsean & Beyond\nSport\nEnvironment\nSci & Tech\nLife & Style\nOutreach\nInterviews\nPhoto\nIndex\nHorizons & People\nOpinion\nYour View & Story\nWorld\nHome\nNational\n7 Indonesian Sailors Escape from Korean Boat; One Dies\nTranslator\nRirie Ranggasari\nEditor\nPetir Garda Bhwana\nJune 27, 2022 | 11:44 am\nTEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Manpower Ministry had confirmed that seven Indonesian sailors escaped from a Korean-flagged ship by swimming to shore. During the escape, one person died.The ministry's PR Bureau chief, Chairul Fadli Harahap, said that the government is currently assisting the sailors. The ministry, he said, continues to communicate with the Indonesian Embassy in Soul.\"The Indonesian government through the Indonesian Embassy in Seoul continues to provide legal assistance. We will provide further information at the first opportunity,\" Chairul told Tempo via text message on Sunday evening, June 26.According to authorities' reports, the seven Indonesian sailors escaped from the Korean fishing boat by swimming 1.6 kilometers to shore. They received help from another Indonesian who worked as a sailor in a different foreign fishing vessel by getting them transportation and accommodation.One sailor died during the escape, and the body was sent home to Brebes, Central Java on June 17.Following reports from the boat owner, the Korean Police traced down and arrested the six sailors and the migrant worker that helped them escape. \"They are now being detained at the Korean Immigration pending trial,\" Chairul said.MUHAMMAD HENDARTYOClick here to get the latest news updates from Tempo in Google News\nKorea Chose Rojas  26 June, 2022     TwitterWhatsAppEmailImpresiónTelegramCopy url   At the height of Marhuanta, Ciudad Bolívar, the bodies of three fishermen who had been missing since last Sunday, June 19, were rescued on Friday afternoon, according to police sources.They are José Luis Grillet, Carlos Barrios and Irma Moronta, who along with three others had boarded a fishing boat on Sunday June 19 in El Palmar, Boca del Pao parish, Francisco de Miranda municipality (Pariaguán), Anzoátegui.That boat was shipwrecked in the vicinity of El Almacén, near Ciudad Bolívar, when they were already returning from their fishing work and heading to the Nueva Guayana sector.Three of the occupants survived and reported the disappearance of their other three companions. It transpired that the rescue of the three deceased was carried out by other fishing workers. SIZE\nABCDEFG\nABCDEFG\nABCDEFG\nABCDEFG\nABCDEFG\nJEJU, South Korea, Oct. 27 (Yonhap) -- A 24-ton fishing boat with eight sailors on board capsized in the sea north of the southern resort island of Jeju on Friday afternoon, leaving one of them missing, the Coast Guard said.\nThe Coast Guard said it rescued seven sailors using a helicopter after the accident, which occurred in waters about 22 kilometers north of the port of Jeju at around 2:30 p.m.\nA rescue operation was under way for the remaining sailor, the Coast Guard said.\nA rescue operation is under way near a fishing boat that capsized in waters north of Jeju Island on Oct. 27, 2023, in this photo provided by the Jeju Regional Headquarters of the Korea Coast Guard. terror\nInvestigations\nPodcast\nVideo\nPublish date\nAnd\nSort by\nRelevanceMost Recent\nTRENDING NOW\nBreadcrumb\nNews\nWorld\nSuspected jihadists kill six Nigerian fishermen in Cameroon: official\nAn administration official in the Logone and Chari department and a gendarme officer said suspected jihadists killed six Nigerian fishermen in Cameroon's Far North region.\nWorld\n2 min read\nThe New Arab Staff & Agencies\n16 June, 2022\nA gendarme officer deployed in the area in Cameroon confirmed the killings [Manuel Augusto Moreno/Getty-file photo]\nSuspected jihadists have killed six Nigerian fishermen in Cameroon's Far North region, close to the Lake Chad hideouts of insurgents, a local official and a police officer told AFP on Thursday.\n\"Three armed men from Boko Haram arrived on a motorbike and attacked the fishermen,\" overnight Wednesday, said an administration official in the Logone and Chari department, asking not to be named.\nA gendarme officer deployed in the area confirmed the killings close to the border with Chad and Nigeria.\nNigeria's Boko Haram and its dissident branch, the Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP), have in recent years carried out deadly attacks against security forces and civilians in northern Cameroon, as well as adjacent parts of Nigeria, Niger and Chad.\nThe Cameroonian authorities call both groups \"Boko Haram\".\nRelated\nThe rise of jihadist groups in Africa\nAnalysis\nLive Story\nStasa Salacanin\nBoko Haram launched an insurgency in northeast Nigeria in 2009 before it spread through the region.\nMore than 36,000 people have been killed since, mainly in Nigeria, and three million forced to flee their homes, the United Nations says.\nA multinational force with troops from all four countries last week said it had killed over 800 jihadists in about two months in the volatile Lake Chad region.\nThe Multinational Joint Task Force said 805 \"terrorists\" were killed on Lake Chad's islands and neighbouring areas between 28 March and 4 June.\nThe vast, swampy Lake Chad basin stretches across the borders of Nigeria, Niger, Cameroon and Chad, and the jihadists have established bases in its many small islands.\nThe Gaza ceasefire at a crossroads: What next and will it hold?\nRead More\nUS envoy kickstarts Israel visit to oversee Gaza ceasefire\nRead More\nIsrael strikes on The deceased was identified as Thumba native Alexander Peter (32). Louis Daniel, Simon and Raju, who accompanied Alexander, escaped unhurt.\nGet Latest Mathrubhumi Updates in English\nFollow Channel\nThe incident took place about 16 kilometres away from Thumba coast on Friday by 10.30 pm. They left the shore on a fibre boat owned by Louis Daniel by 4 in the evening. Alexander fell unconscious after being struck by lightning. Immediately, they returned and reached the shore by 12 night.\nThough he was rushed to a private hospital in Kazhakkoottam immediately, his life could not be saved. The inquest was completed by Vizhinjam Coastal Police and postmortem was carried out at medical college. Last rites were held at Thumba Fathima Matha hospital. Police Colonel Alexander Lorenzo, chief of the Zamboanga City police, said the boat left the city's port around 5 p.m. local time Saturday and was sailing to a remote island in Sulu province for a fishing venture when it encountered big waves late Saturday night, which sank the boat in the waters on the city's west coast.   Lorenzo said a fishing vessel spotted the ill-fated boat on Sunday morning and rescued 15 people. News\nBrexit\nQuirky News\nEnvironment News\nSpain\nCosta del Sol\nCosta Blanca North\nCosta Blanca South\nAxarquia\nMallorca\nAlmeria\nGranada / Jaen\nMadrid\nCosta Calida\nValencia News\nBarcelona News\nCanary Islands\nNews in Brief\nEuropean News\nBelgium\nDenmark\nFinland\nFrance\nGermany\nGibraltar\nIreland\nItaly\nNetherlands\nNorway\nPortugal\nSweden\nOur Mission\nIt is often said that knowledge is power, and this is never more accurate than when you establish yourself as a foreign resident in a new country, like Spain. Being able to quickly familiarise yourself with the culture, rules, events, and customs can help ease the transition during a challenging time.\nThis is why Euro Weekly News makes it our mission to provide you with a free news resource in English that covers both regional and national Spanish news – anything that we feel you will benefit from knowing as you integrate into your new community and live your best life in Spain.  In this way, you can forget about translating articles from Spanish into awkward English that probably don’t make much sense. Let us be your convenient and essential guide to all things that will likely affect you as a foreign resident living in Spain.\nFinance\nFinance\nBusiness\nCryptocurrency\nTechnology\nProperty & Investment\nLifestyle\nLifestyle\nHealth and Beauty\nHomes and Gardens\nMotoring\nPets\nHoroscopes\nEntertainment\nTV\nFilm\nTravel\nTravel Guides\nLiving in Spain\nCamping\nDining out on the Costas\nPuzzles\nPuzzles\nQuick Crossword\nSudoku\nCodeWord\nSolutions\nColumnists\nNewspapers\nRead The EWN Online\nAlmeria\nAxarquia\nCosta Blanca North\nCosta Blanca South\nCosta del Sol\nCosta Calida\nMallorca\nSocial Scene – Costa del Sol\nLatest NewspaperAlmeriaAxarquiaCosta Blanca NorthCosta Blanca SouthCosta del SolCosta CalidaMallorcaSocial Scene – Costa del Sol\nAdvertise\nHoliday Rentals\nMore\nContact Us\nContact Us\nAbout Us\nCareers\nTestimonials\nOur View\nViewpoint\nNewsletter\nFollow Us\nMedia Pack\nNewsdesk:\n+34 600 583 579\nSales:\n+34 600 583 578\nSpain\nTragedy in Spain’s Calpe as body of missing fisherman found at sea\nBy Matthew Roscoe •\nUpdated: 13 Dec 2022 • 11:14                                                                • <1 minute read\nTragedy in Spain's Calpe as body of missing fisherman found at sea. Image: Cesar M. Amor/Shutterstock.com\nHEARTBREAKING news from Alicante’s Calpe on Tuesday, December 13, as Spain’s Salvamento Marítimo found the body of Gonzalo, a 43-year-old fisherman, who reportedly fell into the sea on December 12.\nThe body of the fisherman was found by a Maritime Rescue helicopter “Helimer 220” in the sea between Altea and Calpe on the morning of December 13, after reports that he had disappeared the previous day.\nGonzalo was found floating in the sea less than a mile from the Morro de Toix, a majestic headland jutting out into the Mediterranean, midway between Altea and Calpe on the Costa Blanca.\nMost Read on Euro Weekly News\nLionel Messi announces sensational Barcelona return to family and friends\nRobbie Williams ship blessing Malaga\nNew €1,350 monthly payout: How to get it\nThe 43-year-old sailor was part of the “El Villa” crew, a fishing trawler from Almeria based in Gandia, a city on the east coast of Spain, as reported by Levante-EMV.\nAccording to reports, the trawler unloaded its catch in the port of Altea on December 12 and was on its way back to Gandia when the sailor, who had around 27 years of fishing experience, went missing.\nSpeaking to the Spanish news outlet, Gonzalo’s colleagues said that he was “an excellent person”.\nOne of the fishermen added: “We all liked him very much. We are brothers at sea. We think he may have suffered from seasickness and that is why he fell into the sea.”\nThe crew of “El Villa” were unloading its catch in the port of Xàbia on December 13 when the news that Gonzalo’s body had been discovered.\nA search for the missing fisherman began at around 2 pm on December 12 and involved Salvamento Marítimo helicopters “Helimer 220” and “V1”, boats Salvamar LEO and LS Montgó, officers from the Guardia Civil and the Red Cross, who searched the coastline of Altea, Calpe, Benissa and Moraira.\nOther fishing crews from Calpe, Altea and Xàbia also joined the search until nightfall on December 12.\nThank you for taking the time to read this article, do remember to come back and check The Euro Weekly News website for all your up-to-date local and international news stories and remember, you can also follow us on Facebook and Instagram.\nShare this story\nshare on Facebook\nshare on Twitter\nshare on WhatsApp\nshare on LinkedIn\nshare on Flipboard\nshare on Email\nSign up for personalised news\nSubscribe to our Euro Weekly News alerts to get the latest stories into your inbox!\nDaily\nWeekly\nBy signing up, you will create a Euro Weekly News account if you don't already have one. missing after boat capsized\nEyewitness News\nJuly 29, 2022\n3:58 am\nOne Comment\n0\nSHARES\n1\nVIEWS\nShare on FacebookShare on Whatsapp\nTags: Always a headline aheadBahamasBahamas newsewnewsewnews.comewnews.comEyewitness NewsEyewitness News Online\nOne survivor swam for hours to shore\nNASSAU, BAHAMAS — Officials are searching for a fisherman who attempted to swim to land with two other men after their boat capsized in Andros waters yesterday morning.\nMP for Mangrove Cay & Central and South Andros Leon Lundy told Eyewitness News that the three fishermen departed Andros shortly after 8am.\nThe vessel reportedly capsized sometime after 10am and the three men attempted to swim to land.\nLundy said one fisherman swam for hours until he made it to land at Mangrove Cay around 7pm.\nLast night, he was due to be airlifted to the capital for medical treatment.\nChief Superintendent Chrislyn Skippings confirmed last night that the body of a man has been recovered, and the search continues for the third man missing at sea.\nPrevious Post\nPM says vaccination uptake key to lifting mask mandate\nNext Post\nEYEWITNESS NEWS JULY 29 2022\nPolls\nShould Killarney MP Dr     "https://fitv.co.fk/news-and-events/coroners-court-mr-r-p-aseedick/": "Coroner’s Court | Mr R P Assidiq | Falkland Islands Television\nSkip to content\nCurrent Affairs\nEnvironment\nHistory\nLifestyle\nSport\nFeatures\nFalklands In Focus\nTalking Point\nMore…\nSearch\nFeatures\nFalklands In Focus\nTalking Point\nFalklands In Focus\nTalking In Focus\nMore 🞂\nWeek 726\nJanuary 24, 2025\nWeek 725\nJanuary 17, 2025\nReview of the Year Part 2\nJanuary 3, 2025\nMore from FITV\nAbout\nMeet the Team\nServices\nContact\nAbout\nMeet the Team\nServices\nContact\nJobs\nViewers Charter\nJobs\nViewers Charter\nFollow us\nFacebook-f\nTwitter\nInstagram\nYoutube\nSpotify\nSoundcloud\nFalklands In Focus\nMenu\nCoroners | Court\nCoroner's Court | Mr R P Assidiq\nMay 31, 2021\n14:06\nby\nHannah Newton\nThe inquest hearing into the death of fisherman Mr Ramdan Assidiq concluded on the 11th of August, with Her Majesty’s Coroner, Mrs Sarah Whitby, recording a narrative verdict in which she stated that Mr Assidiq “died from a natural condition, some symptoms of which were apparent, but which were not responded to.”\nMr Assidiq was a crew member on board a Taiwanese-owned Jigger vessel, the Jih Da Yng, which was fishing in Falklands waters when he died on Wednesday the 19th of May of pulmonary tuberculosis.\nThe final stages of the inquest led by Her Majesty’s Coroner, Mrs Sarah Whitby, heard evidence from Chief Medical Officer, Dr. Rebecca Edwards, who compared the appearance of Mr. Assidiq’s body post-mortem to that of a “concentration camp victim”.\nThe court also heard from the general manager of the shipping company that employed Mr. Assidiq. Mr. Chang of Cheh Yng Marine Products Company Limited, confirmed neither the Captain or 1st Officer of the vessel had received specialist medical training nor had any previous experience of dealing with Tuberculosis.\nIn Mr. Assidiq’s final days, the 1st Officer of the vessel explained to the court that he had instructed Mr. Assidiq “to rest” after complaints of a swollen ankle, and made temperature and diet checks on his colleague, but that these checks were not recorded.\nIn her final assessments examining the issue of neglect, Mrs. Whitby stated that no action had been taken to provide the “appropriate medical help” to Mr. Assidiq, but there was no evidence to suggest the crew management responsible for his health “knew” his illness was “potentially fatal”. Meaning, it would therefore “not be logically possible” to identify neglect as a factor in the case.\nMr. Chang, as General Manager of the Taiwanese Shipping Company, spoke of plans to provide more TB training for their Captains and 1st Officers as well as introduce improved medical equipment on board.\nChief Medical Officer Dr. Rebecca Edwards also recommended an increased use of “early warning” report forms on board vessels, to help medical workers in Stanley respond to future “treatable” medical emergencies.\nConcluding her inquiry, Mrs. Whitby expressed her condolences to the family of Mr. Assidiq.\nShare this\nPrevPreviousSupreme Court | Judicial Review\nNextSummary Court | Mr H OyarzoNext\nLatest in Court\nSummary Court | Mr Alfonso Hobman\nFebruary 16, 2022\nSummary Court | Mr L Clarke\nJanuary 12, 2022\nSummary Court | Mr I Ford\nJanuary 12, 2022\nSummary Court | Mr I Ford\nDecember 7, 2021\nSummary Court | Mr M Gilbert\nDecember 1, 2021\nOther News\nGreen Building Practices in The Falklands\nJanuary 28, 2025\nFuture Housing Developments Discussed in New Focus Group\nJanuary 28, 2025\nFalklands Volleyball Club Training For First International Competition\nJanuary 27, 2025\nConcerns Raised Over Cost of Electricity in The Falklands\nJanuary 27, 2025\nMLA Jack Ford wants to remove private rentals properties from the contractor housing pool\nJanuary 24, 2025\nHave a     "https://icsf.net/newss/gujarat-body-of-31-yr-old-fisherman-who-died-in-pak-jail-transported-to-state/?utm_source=mailpoet&utm_medium=email&utm_source_platform=mailpoet&utm_campaign=South%20Asia%20News%20Alerts": "Gujarat: Body of 31-yr-old fisherman who died in Pak jail transported to state – ICSF\nhttps:/icsf.net/news\nHomepageNewsICSF NewsSouth Asia News AlertGujarat: Body of 31-yr-old fisherman who died in Pak jail transported to state Gujarat: Body of 31-yr-old fisherman who died in Pak jail transported to state\nViews:65\nThe body of a 31-year-old fisherman, who died in a Pakistani jail last month, was handed over to his family in his native village of Nanavada in Gujarat’s Junagadh district, officials said on Monday.\nAccording to the officials, Haribhai Sosa, a resident of Porbandar, had been imprisoned in Karachi for over three years after he was apprehended by Pakistani security forces in early 2021. He was arrested near the international maritime border while fishing in the Arabian Sea.\nAccording to officials, Sosa died of heart failure on October 25 while in the jail in Karachi. The body was handed over to the Indian authorities at the Attari border in Punjab and flown to Ahmedabad from where it was transported to Nanavada village by road on Sunday night.\nSosa, along with other fishermen, was intercepted by the Pakistan Marines while fishing off the Porbandar coast and taken to Karachi, said Ashish Vaghela, the Fisheries Officer from Porbandar. “The provisional postmortem report provided by Pakistani authorities confirmed that Sosa died of heart failure,” he said.\nSosa’s sentence was completed in July 2021. Still, he was not released, despite a 2008 bilateral agreement between India and Pakistan stipulating that such convicts should be repatriated within a month of serving their sentence and after their nationality is confirmed, said activist Jatin Desai, who has been working for the welfare of Indian fishermen. According to Desai, five Indian fishermen died in Pakistani custody in 2023, and three have died so far this year. Over the past decade, a total of 26 fishermen have lost their lives in Pakistani jails, Desai said. He said 212 fishermen, mostly from Gujarat, and some from Maharashtra and Diu, are currently lodged in Pakistani jails.\nURL:  https://indianexpress.com/article/cities/ahmedabad/gujarat-body-of-31-yr-old-fisherman-who-died-in-pak-jail-transported-to-state-9690252/\nICSF\nInternational Collective  in Support of Fishworkers\nNews\nYemaya Newsletter\nSAMUDRA Report\nOUR WORK\nRight to Resources\nGender in Fisheries and Aquaculture\nDisasters and Climate Change\nDecent Work\nFisheries Trade\nAquaculture\nBiodiversity\nAbout ICSF\nSSF Guidelines\nICSF Campaigns\nResources\nICSF Archives\nSign-up for News Alerts\n×\nName*\nEmail*\nPlease tell us about your work  This helps us network better\nNature of Work\nCountry*\nAfghanistan\nAfghanisthan\nAfrica\nAlaska\nAlbania\nAlgeria\nAmerica\nAmerican Samoa\nAndaman and Nicobar Islands/India\nAndaman Nicobar Islands/India\nAndhra Pradesh\nAndhra Pradesh/India\nAndhra Pradesh/Odisha/India\nAndhra Pradesh/Tamil Nadu/Puducherry\nAngola\nAnguilla\nAntarctica\nAntigua and Barbuda\nArctic Ocean\nArgentina\nArunachal Pradesh/India\nASEAN\nAsia\nAssam/India\nAustralia\nAustralia.     "https://icsf.net/newss/kerala-775-fishing-workers-from-killed-and-113-went-missing-in-accidents-during-deep-sea-fishing-between-2011-and-2024/?utm_source=mailpoet&utm_medium=email&utm_source_platform=mailpoet&utm_campaign=South%20Asia%20News%20Alerts": "Kerala: 775 Fishworkers killed and 113 went missing in accidents during fishing between 2011 and 2024 – ICSF\nhttps:/icsf.net/news\nHomepageNewsICSF NewsSouth Asia News AlertKerala: 775 Fishworkers killed and 113 went missing in accidents during fishing between 2011 and 2024 Kerala: 775 Fishworkers killed and 113 went missing in accidents during fishing between 2011 and 2024\nViews:357\nIn the more than 13 years between April 2011 and July 2024, as many as 775 fishing workers have died in the State an 113 have gone missing in accidents during deep-sea fishing, according to the response to a Right to Information (RTI) application.\nDuring the period, 3,082 fishing vessels were involved in accidents. The office of the Fisheries Deputy Director and the Kerala Fishermen Welfare Fund Board had collectively handed over compensations to the tune of ₹39.34 crore to the families of the deceased and the missing, besides those who lost their vessels and fishing gears. The RTI application was filed by RTI activist Raju Vazhakkala.\nThiruvananthapuram accounted for the loss of maximum number of fishing workers, 392, while another 102 had gone missing. Kozhikode was second on the list of lives lost with 155 while four had gone missing. Ernakulam accounted for 77 deaths and while one fishing worker had gone missing. The number of deceased in Alappuzha stood at 68, while it was 64 in Kannur and 19 in Malappuram. The statistics of the deceased and missing workers were not available for districts such as Kollam, Thrissur and Kasaragod.\nDuring the period, 978 vessels were involved in accidents in Thiruvananthapuram, 832 in Ernakulam, 407 in Kollam, 324 in Kozhikode, 209 in Alappuzha, 141 in Kannur, 118 in Thrissur, and 73 in Kasaragod.\nThe most number of lives lost, 159, was in 2017 when Kerala felt the impact of the severe cyclonic storm Ockhi. In 2016, 54 lives were lost followed by 38 in 2014, and 33 in 2015.\nSince 2017, the number of casualties registered a considerable drop and remained below 20 all through except 2023 when 22 lives were lost. Nine lives have been lost till July this year.\nThiruvananthapuram received the highest compensation of ₹16.60 crore towards the deceased and the missing and over ₹9 crore towards lost vessels and fishing gear. This was followed by Kozhikode with ₹11.8 crore and ₹1.72 crore and Ernakulam with ₹4.43 crore and ₹1.07 crore respectively.\nUnder the insurance scheme of the Kerala Fishermen Welfare Fund Board, a fishing worker who dies or goes missing during the course of his work is entitled to an insurance coverage of ₹10 lakh each while it is ₹10 lakh and ₹5 lakh respectively for permanent complete and partial disability. Two children of the deceased fishing worker are entitled to assistance not exceeding ₹10,000. Assistance not exceeding ₹25,000 would be given for hospital treatment exceeding 24 hours and ₹2,500 would be given towards funeral expenses.\nURL: https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/kerala/775-fishing-workers-from-kerala-killed-and-113-went-missing-in-accidents-during-deep-sea-fishing-between-2011-and-2024/article68881845.ece\nICSF\nInternational Collective  in Support of Fishworkers\nNews\nYemaya Newsletter\nSAMUDRA Report\nOUR WORK\nRight to Resources\nGender in Fisheries and Aquaculture\nDisasters and Climate Change\nDecent Work\nFisheries Trade\nAquaculture\nBiodiversity\nAbout ICSF\nSSF Guidelines\nICSF Campaigns\nResources\nICSF Archives\nSign-up for News Alerts\n×\nName*\nEmail*\nPlease tell us about your work  This helps us network better\nNature of Work\nCountry*\nAfghanistan\nAfghanisthan\nAfrica\nAlaska\nAlbania\nAlgeria\nAmerica\nAmerican Samoa\nAndaman and Nicobar Islands/India\nAndaman Nicobar Islands/India\nAndhra Pradesh\nAndhra Pradesh/India\nAndhra Pradesh/Odisha/India\nAndhra Pradesh/Tamil Nadu/Puducherry\nAngola\nAnguilla\nAntarctica\nAntigua and Barbuda\nArctic Ocean\nArgentina\nArunachal Pradesh/India\nASEAN\nAsia\nAssam/India\nAustralia\nAustralia.     "https://iharare.com/crocodile-attacks-claim-lives-of-three-fishermen-at-lake-kariba/": "3 Fishermen Lose Lives in Separate Crocodile Attacks in Kariba - iHarare News\nHome\nOpinion\nReligion\nTechnology\nWorld News\nEntertainment\nBusiness\nPolitics\nScandals\nCrime and Courts\nContact Us\nPrivacy Policy\nTerms of Service\nCookie Policy (UK)\nHOME\nNEWS\nPOLITICS\nCRIME&COURTS\nENTERTAINMENT\nSOUTH AFRICA\nPRICE CHECK\nJOBS\nNATURE&LIFESTYLE\nCONTACT US\nNo Result\nView All Result\nHOME\nNEWS\nPOLITICS\nCRIME&COURTS\nENTERTAINMENT\nSOUTH AFRICA\nPRICE CHECK\nJOBS\nNATURE&LIFESTYLE\nCONTACT US\nNo Result\nView All Result\nNo Result\nView All Result\nHome\nNature And Lifestyle\nLake Kariba Horror: Deadly Crocodile Attacks Claim Lives of Three Brave Fishermen\nby\nChris Matambanadzo\nNovember 21, 2023\nin\nLocal Zimbabwe News, Nature And Lifestyle\n0\nCrocodile (Image: A-Z Animals)\nShare on FacebookShare on Twitter\nCrocodile Attacks Claim Lives of Three Fishermen at Lake Kariba\nThe Zimbabwe Republic Police (ZRP) has released the names of three fishermen who lost their lives in separate crocodile attacks at Chinhandowa, Gatche Gatche fishing Camp, Lake Kariba.\nTwo of the fishermen were attacked while they were fishing while another was dragged into the water while looking for a fellow fisherman who had been dragged into the water by a crocodile.\nAlso Read: When Love Bites Back: Mexican Politician’s Unconventional Marriage To Crocodile Ends In Tears\nFirst Incident: November 18, 2023\nThe first incident happened last Saturday when Shameton Sibanda was pulled into the water by a crocodile while fishing on a small boat in Lake Kariba. A search team, comprising of George Mawandiwa and other fishermen, was formed to find Shameton. During the search, another crocodile grabbed George Mawandiwa, and despite efforts, his body was recovered later.\nOn Sunday, the search team found Shameton Sibanda’s body. Both victims’ bodies were taken to Kariba District Hospital for post-mortem examinations.\nAlso Read: Clever 12-Year-Old Buhera Boy Uses Grandmother’s Wisdom To Evade Becoming Crocodile’s Next Meal\nSecond Crocodile Attack: November 19, 2023\nThe second incident occurred the same Sunday when Bayton Chikomo was attacked by a crocodile while casting nets from a small boat on Lake Kariba.\nThe search party shot and killed the crocodile, recovering the remains of Bayton Chikomo. The body parts were taken to Kariba District Hospital mortuary for postmortem.\nThe police are urging the public to prioritise safety during fishing expeditions, especially when using dingy boats.\nAlso Read: Kariba Fisherman Cheats Death After Being Attacked By Crocodiles On Several Occasions\nZRP’s Full Statement on Crocodile Attacks in Kariba\nBelow is the complete statement released by the ZRP:\nThe Zimbabwe Republic Police confirms the death of three people who were attacked by crocodiles while fishing at Chinhandowa, Gatche Gatche fishing Camp, Lake Kariba on 18 and 19 November 2023.\nThe victims have been identified by their next of kin as listed:-\nShameton Sibanda (35) a male adult of Lanlolly Village, Magunje\nGeorge Mawandiwa (38) a male adult of Mahombekombe, Kariba\nBayton Chikomo (29) a male adult of Kaponda Village, Magunje.\nIn the first incident which occurred on 18 November 2023, Shameton Sibanda was dragged into water by a crocodile while fishing using a dingy boat in Lake Kariba.\nSubsequently, a search party comprising George Mawandiwa and other fishermen was instituted. During the search a crocodile emerged and dragged George Mawandiwa into water. The search team later managed to retrieve the body of George Mawandiwa.\nOn 19 November 2023 the search team retrieved the body of Shamerton Sibanda. The bodies of the victims were taken to Kariba District Hospital for post mortem.\nIn the second incident which occurred on 19 November 2023, Bayton Chikomo was attacked by a crocodile while casting nets using a dingy boat in Lake Kariba.\nThe remains of the victim were retrieved from the annals of a crocodile after it was shot dead by the search party.\nThe body parts were taken to Kariba District Hospital mortuary for post mortem.\nThe urges members of the public to. be safety conscious in order to safeguard their lives during fishing expeditions especially when using dingy boats.\nFollow Us on Google News for Immediate Updates\nShareTweetPinSendShareShare\nPrevious Post\n“What an ABSOLUTE JOKE”: Citizen Coalition For Change (CCC) Controversial New Constitution Comes Under Heavy Criticism\nNext Post\nKarma Strikes: Zimbabweans Rejoice as Bafana Bafana Falls 2-0 to Rwanda Following Hugo Broos’ Ban Proposal\nChris Matambanadzo\nComing from a long line of television and radio personalities, it was only natural for Chris Matambanadzo to venture into the media space. The max potential is 300 gallons of diesel fuel, currently no active sheen. Another fishing boat rescued them later.\nRead | Fisherman drowns, three others missing as trawler capsizes near Nandigram\nIt is suspected that the other fishermen were sleeping and did not get the time to escape, officials said.\nThe nine bodies were found in the cabin of the trawler, which was loaded with fish, after a day of search and rescue efforts, they said.\nThe Coast Guard is leading the search for missing fisherman Anadi Sashmal, a resident of Haripur in Namkhana block.\nStory continues below this ad\nApart from patrol vehicles, drones have been deployed to locate him, an official said.\nThe trawler, owned by one Jamuna Rani Lal, left for the sea five days back with 12 fishermen from the 10 Mile area in Namkhana, he said.\nMore Premium Stories\nASER 2024 | Reading, math skills improve: What explains theSubscriber Only\nHow Pune’s 6-year-old survived Guillain-Barré SyndromeSubscriber Only\nTN meets Jharkhand meets Tripura in PM’s Vadnagar schoolSubscriber Only\nWhy Trump wants to buy GreenlandSubscriber Only\nIn our Constitution, two competing visions of powerSubscriber Only\nAt home with Irfan Habib: The History KeeperSubscriber Only\nRepublic Day: How the passport mapped the journey of IndiaSubscriber Only\nA creeping horror about how politics distorts the personal\nTags:\nBay of Bengal\ncoast guard\nSouth 24 Parganas\nLatest Comment\nPost Comment\nRead Comments\nExpand\nAdvertisementPune BPO murder: ‘Accused was carrying kitchen knife in his laptop bag for three days’ Cities2 hr agoPune Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar said on Wednesday that the accused, who allegedly murdered a 28-year-old woman accountant working for a multinational business process outsourcing (BPO) firm in Pune, was carrying a kitchen knife — the murder weapon — in his laptop bag for three days till he assaulted her on January 7.     "https://informante.web.na/?p=355123": "Man allegedly drowned while fishing - Informanté\nSelect your Top Menu from wp menus\nHome\nNews\nBusiness\nEnvironment\nSports\nOpinion\nVacancies\nTrustco\nMenuHome\nNews\nBusiness\nEnvironment\nSports\nOpinion\nVacancies\nTrustco\nHomeNewsMan allegedly drowned while fishingDate: February 29, 2024in: NewsMaria DavidANOTHER case of drowning has been reported by the Namibian Police Force in the Omusati Region, where a 39-year-old man reportedly drowned while allegedly fishing at Auyongolo Lake/Dam, Osisiya Village, in the Outapi Constituency.The deceased was identified as Simon Enghali Akushanga.This marks the second drowning incident reported in the region involving people fishing.The first incident occurred five days ago when Akushanga Simon Petrus Eita Shipingana Tangomwene (13) reportedly drowned while catching fish with his friends at Okano Dam. The deceased began to swim, and in the process, went deep into the water.Omusati Crime Investigation Coordinator, Deputy Commissioner Moses Simaho, said that Akushanga’s body was discovered floating in the lake on Wednesday morning.“It is alleged that the deceased was last seen on Monday when he went fishing at Osisiya village and did not return home. The family then reported a missing person case at Outapi police station on Tuesday,” he said.He added that it is further alleged that the family continued searching until they discovered the body floating in the lake on Wednesday, after being informed by members of the public.Simaho indicated that no foul play is suspected in the matter.  share\n0\n0\n0\nPrevious : Multiple regions experience impressive rainfall, further showers expected\nNext : Oshakati invests significantly for Mayoral CupRelated posts\nKombat mine flooded, workers face retrenchment\nJanuary 29, 2025\nNorthern regions see good rainfall since December, Gondwana reports\nJanuary 29, 2025\nKavango West region has highest unemployment statistics\nJanuary 29, 2025\nSocial Media\nSearch\nEmail Informanté NewsNewsdesk Email: news@informante.web.naInformanté – Facebook PageTrustco Products\nOnawaMedDent ShieldTrustco Finance\nTrustco Group Holdings",

    "https://jamaica-gleaner.com/article/lead-stories/20220809/missing-clarendon-fishermen-feared-dead": "Missing Clarendon fishermen feared dead | Lead Stories | Jamaica Gleaner\nSkip to main content\nTop Menu\nMobile Apps\neGleaner\nLogin\nSubscribe Now\nWed | Jan 29, 2025\nSearch\nMenu\nMain menuHomeLead StoriesNewsSportsEntertainmentBusinessLettersCommentaryHealthLifestyle\nSecondary Menu\nWorld News\nIn Focus\nAuto\nFood\nShipping\nArt & Leisure\nClassifieds\nElections\nFlair\nHeritage\nJobs\nPodcast\nPuzzles\nMobile version\nSubscribe to this feed\nJoin us on Facebook\nFollow us on Twitter\nMissing Clarendon fishermen feared dead\nPublished:Tuesday | August 9, 2022 | 12:09 AMOlivia Brown/Gleaner WriterPhotoVideo\nPrevious\nPause\nNext\nContributed\nLucky Ellis\nContributed\nRobert Weir\n1\n2\nTwo Clarendon fishermen who were seen heading to sea south of Rocky Point last Friday have gone missing and have been feared dead.\nThe men, 42-year-old Robert Weir, and 29-year-old Lucky Ellis, both of Portland Cottage addresses, reportedly set out about 10 a.m.\nJonathan Weir, father of Robert, believes his son is dead.\nThe senior Weir told The Gleaner that another fisherman had related that his son’s boat had become faulty and that Robert and his colleague ran into difficulties while returning from Pedro Bank where they had gone fishing.\n“Him say him stop den him see Robert a bail out water out a the boat wid a bucket, den him drive off,  but when him turn an look back roun’, him nuh see Robert. After dat, him see di next two boat roun’ a back an’ him ask dem if dem see Robert  and dem sey, ‘How come yaah go ask wi fi Robert an’ a yuh an’ him a drive?’,” recounted Weir.\nHeadlines Delivered to Your Inbox\nSign up for The Gleaner’s morning and evening newsletters.\n“I hear sey di boat dem a come in, an’ my son boat burst. If di boat burst, dem did fi stop an’ wait pan him an’ travel wid him,” said Weir. “If di boat a sink, all him would a fi do a jump out an guh in a fi dem boat. But true dem leave him now, di boat burst and sink and nobody nuh see him from dat. Him dead lef’ two little girls.”\nWeir said several hours-long searches by other fisherfolk since Friday have failed to locate the fishermen.\n“Dem nuh find no boat, no jug, nutten,” he bemoaned.\nEllis’ family is also shaken. His aunt, Winsome Malabre, said the family was still clinging to hope.\n“Even now, I’m just looking to see him walking in the yard. The family is really shocked and we’re just hoping and wishing that he would just come home. We’re not taking it good at all,” Malabre told The Gleaner on Monday.\nBarbara Graham of the Portland Cottage Citizens’ Association told The Gleaner that the men were active members of the community and their disappearance has shocked fellow residents.\nRecounting her last encounter with Robert Weir, Graham said, “The last time I saw him, we were together at a function, and he was the representative from my community, and he was there giving his input at a mangrove project meeting and how it affects them in terms of fishing, etcetera.”\nAnyone knowing the whereabouts of the men is asked to contact the Lionel Town police at 876-986-3233, police emergency at 119, or the nearest police station.\nThe men’s disappearance follows the April 2020 case of four men from the neighbouring communities of Rocky Point and Race Course who went missing. Their remains were among five sets found in shallow graves along the banks of the Sandy Gully in St Andrew weeks later.\nolivia.brown@gleanerjm.com\n«SPOTLIGHT ON KAMINA’S SHADOWS Update | Suspected gunrunner got two firearm permits – sources »\nView the discussion thread.\nMore Lead Stories\nEmail this story\nPrint this page\nE-mail the editor\nMore Stories\nGov’t allocates $315m to help vulnerable with home repairs\nDr Alfred Sangster: The architect behind UTech’s rise\nLegal customers of JPS pay $1,000 extra per month for electricity theft\nPORT SICKOUT\nState sets stage for making Portmore parish no. 15\nPrincess emerging as a special gem in Jamaica’s tourism crown\nBarclay seeking to ramp up localised focus of data protection law\nVaz: My hands are tied\nMark Golding draws the line against wrongdoers in party hierarchy\nDEADLY MISSION\nVideos\nFor more videos click here.\nJust for you\nTable of Contents\nThe Gleaner ArchivesDigital Archives: Online editions 2006-Now\nLibrary: Research and Assistance\nPrint Archives: Editions 1834-Present\nGleaner Your WayMobile: Get the Gleaner on your mobile\nNewsletter: Get headline news\nRSS Feeds\nGallery\nGames\nVideos\nGCML WebsitesThe Star\nGleaner Classifieds\nGo Jamaica\nGleaner - North America\nYouthlink\nVoice UK\nFlair\nGCML WebsitesRestaurant Week\nDiscover Jamaica\nGo Jamaica Hosting\nFirst Look\nWeather\nGleaner LinksOur Products\nAdvertise with us\nAbout Us\nContact Us\nSuggestion\nSubscription\nTerms and Conditions\nSubmit a Letter\nPrivacy Policy\nRJRGLEANER Merger Q&A\nCopyright © 2025 The Gleaner Company (Media) Limited.     "https://jerseyeveningpost.com/news/2022/02/22/missing-fisherman39s-remains-found/": "Missing fisherman's remains found - Jersey Evening Post\nMissing fisherman's remains found - Jersey Evening Post\nProperty\nJobs\nMotoring\nFamily Notices\nPhoto Store\nRead the eEdition\nSign-up to our newsletter\nAccount Login\nHome\nNews\nBusiness\nSport\nSport\nUK Sport\nViral Sport\nMore News\nVoices\nUK News\nWorld News\nViral News\nEntertainment\nMotoring\nWeather\nPuzzles\nCompetitions\nSubscribe\nSearch\nHome\nNews\nBusiness\nSport\nSport\nUK Sport\nViral Sport\nMore News\nVoices\nUK News\nWorld News\nViral News\nEntertainment\nMotoring\nWeather\nPuzzles\nCompetitions\nSubscribe\nProperty\nJobs\nMotoring\nFamily Notices\nPhoto Store\nRead the eEdition\nSign-up to our newsletter\nAccount Login\nSearch\nSearch\nMissing fisherman's remains found\nNews, Top Stories        |\nPublished: 22 February 2022        |\nLast Updated: 22 February 2022        |\nBy Newsdesk\nPicture: PETER MOURANT\nHUMAN remains found on a Normandy beach belong to a fisherman who went missing at the Minquiers last year, French authorities have confirmed.\nThe man, 32-year-old Cédric Pacary, had been working on the Mascaret III potting boat near the reef on 29 April when he fell overboard. This was not immediately noticed by his fellow crew members.\nThat morning, after the alarm was raised, a major search operation involving the JLA, the RNLI’s St Helier vessels, lifeboats from Normandy and Brittany got under way.\nTwo helicopters, the Channel Islands Air Search plane, a French police cutter and several fishing boats were also involved.\nAt the time, French coastguard officers reported that strong tidal currents were making the search difficult and that the water temperature was hovering at around 10°C.\nDespite an extensive search lasting 13 hours, the man, a father to a two-year-old girl, was not found.\nOn 4 December, two low-water fishermen were walking on the beach near Jullouville, south of Granville, when they discovered a fisherman’s boot with a foot and leg still inside.\nOfficers from the Gendarmerie, the French military police, collected the remains and DNA analysis has since confirmed they belong to Mr Pacary.\nPlease enable JavaScript to     "https://kalingatv.com/state/4-fishermen-went-missing-after-boat-capsized-in-mahanadi-in-paradeep/": "4 fishermen went missing after boat capsized in Mahanadi River\nFollowers      Subscribers      Followers\nThursday, January 30, 2025\nPublisher - Kahe thik, Dekhae Thik\nHOME\nLIVE TV\nODISHA NEWS\nNATION\nWORLD\nRECRUITMENT\nSPORTS\nWEB STORIES\nBUSINESS\nAUTOMOBILE\nMOVIES\nTECHNOLOGY\nOFFBEAT\nASTRO\nMISCELLANY\nFEATURES\nHomeOdishaParadeep: 4 fishermen went missing after boat capsized in Mahanadi River\nParadeep: 4 fishermen went missing after boat capsized in Mahanadi River\nFour fishermen went missing after the boat in which they went for fishing capsized in Mahanadi River in Paradeep.\nBy Deepa Sharma\nLast updated Aug 12, 2023\nRepresentational Image\nParadeep: Four fishermen went missing after the boat in which they went for fishing capsized in Mahanadi River in Paradeep of Odisha’s Jagatsinghpur district on Saturday.\nAccording to sources, the group of fishermen went to Mahanadi River for fishing on Saturday, when due to high current of water the boat broke and capsized. Following the incident, four fishermen went missing.\nAfter receiving information, Odisha Disaster Rapid Action Force (ODRAF) team and police team have reached the spot and initiated a search operation. capsizes\nBy Abhilasha\nOn Jul 5, 2022\nJakarta: A search and rescue operation was underway on Tuesday for 15 Indonesian fishermen who went missing after their boat capsized in the Arafura Sea, an official said on Tuesday.\nThe boat, KM Setia Makmur 06, was hit by huge waves during poor weather when it was sailing in the rough waters on July 2, Darmawan Widi, spokesman of the search and rescue office in Indonesia’s Papua province, told Xinhua news agency.\nThe operation was launched after the office received the information about the incident, and several other fishing boats near the site were asked to help, said the official.\n“Ten people have been rescued safely, but 15 others remain missing,” he said.\nThe search for the victims was also conducted by air and a plane of the Indonesian Air Force was involved, according to the official.\n“Today, a navy’s warship would also be deployed to the scene,” he said.\nThe fishing boat departed from a seaport in Dobo, the capital of Four were later declared dead. [YONHAP]               Four people were killed and 14 others suffered minor injuries after their fishing boat capsized off the southwestern coast of Korea, Coast Guard officials said Sunday.           According to officials, 18 crew members were aboard the vessel when it overturned at sea at 5:57 a.m. on Sunday after colliding with a tugboat near the coastal town of Buan, South Jeolla.           The four dead were already unconscious when they were rescued, while the remaining 14 people suffered minor injuries, officials said.           The four were later declared dead after being transported to a hospital.           The Coast Guard said that it was investigating the cause of the collision.         BY MICHAEL LEE   [[email protected]]\nKorea\nsinking\nfishing boat\naccident\ncollision\nBuan\nSouth Jeolla\nKorea Coast Guard\nMore in Social Affairs\nMajor highways remain congested on Lunar New Year; traffic expected to ease in evening\nNo. of injured victims from Busan airplane fire rises to 7, all with minor injuries\nAir Busan plane on fire at Gimhae International Airport: fire authorities\nSick during the Lunar New Year?
