    "https://newsday.co.tt/2022/09/17/claxton-bay-fisherman-dead-in-attack-at-sea/": "Claxton Bay fisherman dead in attack at sea - Trinidad and Tobago Newsday\nNews\nLatest News\nSports\nSections\nTobago\nBusiness\nFeatures\nOpinion\nSpecial Publications\nClassifieds\nMultimedia\nCollections\nNewsday on Facebook\nNewsday on Instagram\nNewsday on Twitter\nNewsday on YouTube\nNewsday on LinkedIn\nNews\nClaxton Bay fisherman dead in attack at sea\nLaurel V Williams\nSaturday 17 September 2022\nClaxton Bay Fishing Association president Nicholson Seecharan speaks with media on Friday at the Claxton Bay fishing facility about the death of fisherman Lennox Joefield whose body was found at sea on Thursday evening. - Marvin Hamilton\nA pirate attack at sea between Wednesday night and Thursday has left a fisherman dead, and his colleagues and friends are calling on the authorities to beef up security measures.\nLennox \"Knox\" Joefield's body was fished out of the Gulf of Paria near Marabella on Thursday night and brought ashore at the Claxton Bay fishing depot, where he had lived for the past few years.\nClaxton Bay Fishing association president Necolson Seecharan believed that Joefield, who was in his 50s, was attacked and thrown overboard.\nJoefield left the depot on Wednesday night to go fishing. Fishermen were told the boat had been spotted in San Fernando with the engine, worth over $20,000, and net missing.\nFisherman Sean Johnson reacts to the death of his fishing partner Lennox Joefield at the Claxton Bay Fishing Facility on Friday. - Marvin Hamilton\n>\nFishermen began searching for Joefield, and at around 5 pm, they found his body tangled in a net near Paria Trading Jetty.\nSeecharan said Joefield was originally from Piparo, lived in Marabella for a few years, relocated to Claxton Bay, and slept at the depot.\nOn Friday, fisherman Sean Johnson wept at the depot, saying he had lost his best friend.\n\"We went San Fernando Boys' RC together. He did not have a bad bone in his body. He would give his last to anyone. I feel as if part of me is gone. He was a true friend.\n\"They (pirates) touched everyone in Claxton Bay. They bring tears to everyone.\"\nCarli Bay Fishing Association president Imtiaz Khan, as well as corporate secretary of the NGO Fishermen and Friends of the Sea (FFOS) Gary Aboud, joined fishermen at the depot and complained about the lack of protection at sea.\nFisherman Sean Johnson speaks to Newsday about the death of his fishing partner Lennox Joefield at the Claxton Bay Fishing Facility on Friday. - Marvin Hamilton\nAboud proposed that the Government set up a multi-stakeholder committee/a national security oceanic committee to address the fishermen's woes.\nThat committee, he said, should include the Fisheries Division, the Coast Guard, the police, the regiment, the Ministry of National Security, and \"perhaps the permanent secretary.\"\n>\nSpeaking on behalf of the disgruntled fishermen, Aboud said, \"We are asking the Government to consider that we should be appointed honorary wardens. We should have some direct link to the senior members of national security. Wardens could report illegality, risks, hotspots, and smuggling areas.\"\nHe said piracy is growing, and the Gulf of Paria is a hotspot. For that reason, stakeholders should increase their presence compared to other areas.\n\"That committee could dictate and direct the use of resources, the concerns of threats on the sea and could have a direct mechanism for reporting the reports of the honorary security wardens,\" Aboud said.\n\"We have advised that our fishermen should arm themselves, I am told to say legally armed. A spear gun is a legal weapon. \"\nHe believes fishermen need to be prepared and ready to flee any vessel approaching within 300 metres, and coming within such proximity should be considered an act of violation.\nHe made several allegations against the Prime Minister, government ministers, and the Venezuelan military, saying he had proof to back his claims.\nInvestigations are ongoing.\nTrending\nview all\n1\nWI players can't bat to save their lives\nNewsday\n2\n$300,000 bail for suspended cop accused of rape\nJada Loutoo\n3\nMan freed of murder after 21 years: Justice system ‘hell and failure'\nJada Loutoo\n4\nMove faster on African snails\nNewsday\nComments\n\"Claxton Bay fisherman dead in attack at sea\"\nMore in this section\nNews\nNPTA: Parents need to be more involved in their children's education\nClint Chan Tack\nNews\nDetention orders issued for Diego Martin, Belmont men\nJada Loutoo\nNews\nFormer Carib executive launches business support company\nRyan Hamilton-Davis\nNews\nNew bmobile tech lets users talk, surf web simultaneously\nRyan Hamilton-Davis\n© 2020 - 2025 Trinidad and Tobago Newsday.\nNewsday on Facebook\nNewsday on Instagram\nNewsday on Twitter\nNewsday on YouTube\nNewsday on LinkedIn\nAbout Us\nClassifieds\nAdvertise\nPrivacy Policy\nContact Us",
    "https://newsday.co.tt/2023/02/08/dr-browne-on-missing-fishermen-venezuelan-authorities-approached-for-help/": "Dr Browne on missing fishermen: Venezuelan authorities approached for help - Trinidad and Tobago Newsday\nNews\nLatest News\nSports\nSections\nTobago\nBusiness\nFeatures\nOpinion\nSpecial Publications\nClassifieds\nMultimedia\nCollections\nNewsday on Facebook\nNewsday on Instagram\nNewsday on Twitter\nNewsday on YouTube\nNewsday on LinkedIn\nNews\nDr Browne on missing fishermen: Venezuelan authorities approached for help\nPaula Lindo\nWednesday 8 February 2023\nSTILL MISSING: Rishi Khemchan.\nFOREIGN and Caricom Affairs Minister Dr Amery Browne said the Venezuelan authorities have been contacted to assist in the search for four missing fishermen from Mayaro who may have drifted into Venezuelan waters.\nHe was responding to a question from Opposition Senator Wade Mark in the Senate on Tuesday.\nThe four men, Rishi Khemchan, 38, of Grand Lagoon, boat owner Heeralal \"Lenus\" Cooblal, 54, Andy \"Tallman\" George, 40, and the boat’s captain, identified only as \"Criminal George,\" both of Guayaguayare, left on a pirogue, Benom 2 TFN 5906, at around 2 pm last Tuesday from the Guayaguayare fishing depot.\nThey were expected to return on Thursday evening or Friday morning. However, they have yet to return. On Sunday, the pirogue with its engine was found partially submerged in the Gulf of Paria near Venezuela’s borders.\nSTILL MISSING: Heeralal Cooblal.\n>\nBrowne said the relevant information and requests had been passed to the Venezuelan authorities.\n“All available means of assistance are being pursued as guided by the TT Coast Guard. The matter is ongoing and the searches are underway.”\nBrowne said he could not give a current update on the situation in his capacity as the Foreign and Caricom Affairs Minister and the question should be put to the Minister of National Security.\nMAN'S BODY WASHES ASHORE\nIn an unrelated incident, a body which washed ashore in Guayaguayare on Tuesday morning, is believed to be that of fisherman Suresh Heeraman.\nHeeraman of Ridge Road, Rio Claro, went missing on February 4. Around 8.30 am on Tuesday, the Hunters Search and Rescue team led by Captain Vallence Rambharat, which was searching for four other fishermen who went missing last week, spotted the body.\nReports indicate that Heeraman was at Isthmus Road, Point Galeota, Guyaguyare last Saturday with four other men to fish and camp out on the beach overnight.\nAround 2 am on Sunday, he told one of the men he was going for a walk. He never returned.\n– Additional reporting by YVONNE WEBB\n>\nTrending\nview all\n1\nWI players can't bat to save their lives\nNewsday\n2\n$300,000 bail for suspended cop accused of rape\nJada Loutoo\n3\nMan freed of murder after 21 years: Justice system ‘hell and failure'\nJada Loutoo\n4\nMove faster on African snails\nNewsday\nComments\n\"Dr Browne on missing fishermen: Venezuelan authorities approached for help\"\nMore in this section\nNews\nNPTA: Parents need to be more involved in their children's education\nClint Chan Tack\nNews\nDetention orders issued for Diego Martin, Belmont men\nJada Loutoo\nNews\nFormer Carib executive launches business support company\nRyan Hamilton-Davis\nNews\nNew bmobile tech lets users talk, surf web simultaneously\nRyan Hamilton-Davis\n© 2020 - 2025 Trinidad and Tobago Newsday.\nNewsday on Facebook\nNewsday on Instagram\nNewsday on Twitter\nNewsday on YouTube\nNewsday on LinkedIn\nAbout Us\nClassifieds\nAdvertise\nPrivacy Policy\nContact Us",

April Mier-Manjares @MaAprilMierINQ -                             @inquirerdotnet\n05:45 PM January 20, 2023\nLEGAZPI CITY — The two missing fishermen in Mercedes town in Camarines Norte were found dead on Thursday and Friday, said authorities.\nThe body of Alex Toyado was found around 1:30 p.m. Friday, Jan. 20, in the coastal waters off Daet town.\nArticle continues after this advertisement\nAlfie Hernandez, team leader in the operations section of the Mercedes municipal disaster office, said in a report that three children found the victim’s body in the area.     "https://newsroom.gy/2023/12/19/body-of-missing-fisherman-found-at-crabwood-creek-backdam/": "Body of missing fisherman found at Crabwood Creek backdam - News Room Guyana\nFacebook\nInstagram\nTikTok\nTwitter\nYoutube\nHome\nAll News\nCrime & Security\nPolitics\nSports\nOil & Gas\nBusiness\nEducation\nMORE\nHealth\nAgriculture\nEntertainment\nRegional\nFeatures\nLetters\nSearch\nWednesday, January 29, 2025\nHome\nEntertainment\nAdvertise\nGet The App\nContact Us\nFacebook\nInstagram\nTikTok\nTwitter\nYoutube\nNews Room Guyana\nHome\nAll News\nCrime & Security\nPolitics\nSports\nOil & Gas\nBusiness\nEducation\nMORE\nHealth\nAgriculture\nEntertainment\nRegional\nFeatures\nLetters\nHome  Crime  Body of missing fisherman found at Crabwood Creek backdam\nCrime\nBody of missing fisherman found at Crabwood Creek backdam\nDecember 19, 2023   1\nFacebookTwitterPinterestWhatsAppLinkedinReddItEmailPrintTelegramCopy URL\nGowcharran Persaud who was missing.\nThe body of a man who left his home last Thursday to go on a fishing trip with two friends was discovered on Tuesday.\nThe body was identified as that of Gowcharran Persaud, 37, of Grant 1809 Crabwood Creek, Upper Corentyne, Berbice.\nAccording to the brother of the deceased, Pravesh Persaud, his brother visited him on Thursday and told him he was going fishing with “Ameir” and “Bharrat”.\nHe added that his brother wouldn’t spend longer than three days out but on Saturday he was informed by “Ameir” that his brother was shot and killed by “Bharrat” but that he escaped to avoid being shot at too. He said “Ameir” told him his brother was shot at in Link Canal, Crabwood Creek backdam.\nFollowing a Police report, a search was carried out and the body of Persaud  was discovered in a drain covered with “stuff.”\nThe body is presently at the Skeldon Hospital mortuary.\nNo arrests have been made.\nAdvertisement\n_____\nFacebookTwitterPinterestWhatsAppLinkedinReddItEmailPrintTelegramCopy URL\nPrevious articleDespite dry season woes, Agri.     "https://newsroom.gy/2024/01/27/fisherman-reportedly-drowns-at-berbice-canal/": "Fisherman reportedly drowns at Berbice canal - News Room Guyana\nFacebook\nInstagram\nTikTok\nTwitter\nYoutube\nHome\nAll News\nCrime & Security\nPolitics\nSports\nOil & Gas\nBusiness\nEducation\nMORE\nHealth\nAgriculture\nEntertainment\nRegional\nFeatures\nLetters\nSearch\nWednesday, January 29, 2025\nHome\nEntertainment\nAdvertise\nGet The App\nContact Us\nFacebook\nInstagram\nTikTok\nTwitter\nYoutube\nNews Room Guyana\nHome\nAll News\nCrime & Security\nPolitics\nSports\nOil & Gas\nBusiness\nEducation\nMORE\nHealth\nAgriculture\nEntertainment\nRegional\nFeatures\nLetters\nHome  Crime  Fisherman reportedly drowns at Berbice canal\nCrime\nFisherman reportedly drowns at Berbice canal\nJanuary 27, 2024   0\nFacebookTwitterPinterestWhatsAppLinkedinReddItEmailPrintTelegramCopy URL\nPolice are investigating the death of Tilach Nateram called ‘Boy’ or ‘Rice’, a 42-year-old fisherman of No. 4 Settlement, Blairmont Village, West Bank Berbice.\nPolice Headquarters on Saturday said that the man’s body was found floating face down in a canal in the area at about 23:45 hrs Friday.\nPolice said Nateram was an alcoholic and suffered from Epilepsy. He was last seen alive in the village at about 17:30 hrs consuming alcohol. At about 23:45 hrs, Erol Collins, a 57-year-old sluice attendant, was contacted by Dichand Balgobin, a 45-year-old fisherman who told him that he found the motionless body of Nateram in the canal, near the sluice where Collins work.\n“The body was taken out of the canal and examined by the ranks but no marks of violence were seen. The body was clad in short red pants,” the Police reported.\nPersons in the area were questioned and information received that Nateram would usually set seine in the said canal.\nThe body was escorted to the Fort Wellington Public Hospital where it was certified dead by Dr. Fernandes. It was then escorted to Bailey Funeral Parlour, awaiting a post-mortem examination. Investigations are ongoing.\nAdvertisement\n_____\nFacebookTwitterPinterestWhatsAppLinkedinReddItEmailPrintTelegramCopy URL\nPrevious articleEssequibo aiming for strong showing at GCB U-15 Inter-County championshipNext articleAnother commitment fulfilled as Lethem residents get keys to $3M clay brick houses Editor\nRELATED ARTICLESMORE FROM AUTHOR\nCrime\nCity Constabulary Dept. still facing staff shortage\nCrime\nMiner, 70, dies in Region #7 pit collapse\nCrime\nKilcoy/Chesney NDC ransacked\nLEAVE A REPLY Cancel reply\nPlease enter your comment!\nPlease enter your name here\nYou have entered an incorrect email address!\nPlease enter your email address here\nSave my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment.\nNotify me of follow-up comments by email.     "https://newsroomodisha.com/tn-one-fisherman-killed-one-missing-following-clashes-between-two-groups/": "TN: One fisherman killed, one missing following clashes between two groups | News Room Odisha\nLikes      Followers      Subscribers\nThursday, January 30, 2025\nHome\nAbout US\nଓଡ଼ିଆ ରେ ପଢନ୍ତୁ\nContact us\nDisclaimer\nPublisher - Latest Odisha News, Breaking News Live, Odisha Current Headlines\nHome\nOdisha\nଓଡ଼ିଆ\nPolitics\nSc & Tech\nEconomy\nSports\nEntertainment\nOpinion\nIndia\nWorld\nHealth-Lifestyle\nHomeIndiaTN: One fisherman killed, one missing following clashes between two groups\nTN: One fisherman killed, one missing following clashes between two groups\nIndia\nBy Newsroom Odisha Network\nOn Feb 26, 2024\nShare\nChennai: In a mid-sea fight between two groups of fishermen in Tamil Nadu, one fisherman has been killed and another is missing while a third one has been admitted to hospital with serious injuries.\nThe incident occurred near the eastern side of Nagapattinam in Tamil Nadu fishing harbour.\nThe deceased has been identified as S. Sivanesa Selvam while the missing has been identified as S. Kalathinathan. The injured has been identified as S. Atmanathan and is admitted at Nagapattinam Medical College hospital.\nAll three are brothers and hail from Akkaripettai coastal hamlet of Nagapattinam district of Tamil Nadu.\nVedaranyam Police said that they have arrested seven persons related to the case.\nThey were identified as R. Balakrishnan, M. Velayudham, S. Srithar, S. Kaliyappan, S. Mariyappan, P. Kannan and R. Dhandapani. The police have also launched a search to arrest R. Balakumar, who is absconding.\nReportedly, the three brothers had ventured out into the sea to fish, in a fibreglass boat, on Sunday evening.\nWhile they were fishing about two nautical miles east of the Nagapattinam fishing harbour, a group of fishermen from Keechankuppam, in a mechanised boat, reportedly damaged their fishing nets.\nAn argument broke out between the two groups and the Keechankuppam fishermen banged their mechanised boat against the fiberglass boat.\nThe injured fisherman Athmanathan told hospital authorities that the mechanised boat fishers reportedly attacked the trio using fishing equipment.\nSivanesa Selvam and Kalathinathan suffered severe blows, while Athmanathan, who suffered injuries on his left hand and face, managed to escape, and was rescued by a group of fishermen who were fishing in the vicinity and admitted him to Nagapattinam Government Medical College Hospital for treatment.\nThe body of Sivanesa Selvam, found with cut injuries mid-sea, was recovered and sent to the Nagapattinam Government Medical College for an autopsy.\nThe police and fishermen have launched a search to locate Kalathinathan.\nA heavy police contingent has also been deployed in Akkaraipettai and Keechankuppam coastal villages to prevent further untoward incidents.\n–IANS\nShare\nFacebookTwitterGoogle+WhatsAppEmailPinterestFacebook MessengerLinkedin\nNewsroom Odisha Network\nPrev Post\nAmit Shah to inaugurate 6-storey library in Gandhinagar on Tuesday\nNext Post\nPolice Outpost to Be Established at Babasaheb Bhim Rao Ambedkar Bus Terminal\nYou might also like\nMore from author\nIndia\nHuge influx of devotees in Ayodhya on Mauni Amavasya;     "https://newsroomodisha.com/two-fishermen-missing-in-kerala-after-fishing-boat-capsizes/": "Two fishermen missing in Kerala after fishing boat capsizes | News Room Odisha\nLikes      Followers      Subscribers\nThursday, January 30, 2025\nHome\nAbout US\nଓଡ଼ିଆ ରେ ପଢନ୍ତୁ\nContact us\nDisclaimer\nPublisher - Latest Odisha News, Breaking News Live, Odisha Current Headlines\nHome\nOdisha\nଓଡ଼ିଆ\nPolitics\nSc & Tech\nEconomy\nSports\nEntertainment\nOpinion\nIndia\nWorld\nHealth-Lifestyle\nHomeIndiaTwo fishermen missing in Kerala after fishing boat capsizes\nTwo fishermen missing in Kerala after fishing boat capsizes\nIndia\nBy Newsroom Odisha Network\nOn Aug 7, 2022\nShare\nThiruvananthapuram: Two fishermen, who had gone to the sea on Sunday morning from here, were missing after their boat capsized in Muthala Pozhi near Perumathura.\nThe missing fishermen have been identified as Suneer and Safeer, who are from Chermunathuruthu here.\nThe fishing boat in which they had gone to the sea along with another fisherman Ansari overturned near the Muthala Pozhi due to high waves and wind.\nAnsari swam to safety and reached the shores while Suneer and Safeer have not been found till now.\nKerala Marine police and local fishermen were trying to rescue the two fishermen but high waves and winds were preventing the rescue operation.\nA fishermen association leader while speaking to IANS said that there have been several casualties in the Muthala Pozhi area and that the unscientific construction at the Vizhinjam port of Adani is the main reason for these accidents. The fishermen’s leader said that earlier it was easy for the fishermen to swim back to safety when boats capsized, but after the construction commenced at Vizhinjam it is difficult to reach the shore safely.\nThe sand deposits in the Muthalapozhi are also another reason for the boats overturning in the area while entering the sea.\nA Marine coastal police officer while speaking to IANS said that the search was on for the missing fishermen and the local people were also involved in the search operations.\n–IANS\nShare\nFacebookTwitterGoogle+WhatsAppEmailPinterestFacebook MessengerLinkedin\nNewsroom Odisha Network\nPrev Post\nPM Modi praises Chhattisgarh’s Godhan Nyay Yojana\nNext Post\nFiring at Kolkata museum: CISF jawan remanded to 14-day police custody\nYou might also like\nMore from author\nIndia\nHuge influx of devotees in Ayodhya on Mauni Amavasya; over 50 lakh pilgrims visit…\nIndia\nRG Kar protest: SC passes protection order for doctors who returned to work after…\nIndia\nCalcutta HC seeks report on ‘threat culture’ at RG Kar Hospital\nIndia\nMaha Kumbh stampede: Four from Karnataka confirmed dead\nPrev\nNext\nComments are closed.\nFacebook  Join us on Facebook      Twitter  Join us on Twitter      Youtube  Join us on Youtube\nHome\nAbout US\nଓଡ଼ିଆ ରେ ପଢନ୍ତୁ\nContact us\nDisclaimer\n© 2025 - All Rights Reserved.\nSign in\nWelcome, Login to your account.\nForget password?\nRemember me\nSign in\nRecover your password.\nA password will be e-mailed to you.",

Families and friends of the nine crew members are concerned because none of them have been located.\nThe boat’s owner, Kwame Tawiah, told the reporters that the crew had left the Ngyirasia fishing harbor for the Half Assini region but hadn’t come back. He continued by saying they had contacted the police for help and were hopeful the team would show up shortly.\nMr. Tawiah further disclosed that on the morning of July 7, the crew that went missing made a quick phone contact to him to say they were all still alive but the boat was out of fuel. However, their phone quickly rang, and it is currently unknown where they are.\nMTN has been notified to assist in locating the missing crew members, and six additional boats have been despatched to search for them. In the evening, when they were returning they were caught up in a gale accompanied by rainfall. Consequently, the boat capsized.\nREAD LATER\nFacebook\nTwitter\nTelegram\nWhatsapp\nRescue operation\nOne person died while two others swam ashore after a boat carrying them capsized in the Chitrakonda reservoir in Malkangiri district on Wednesday evening. While the deceased has been identified as Krupa Benia, two others who managed to swim to safety are Hari Sagaria and Kailash Nayak. They are residents of nearby Dyke-3 village. According to sources, Krupa, Hari and Kailash had gone to the reservoir to catch fish. They were catching fish near Singaram. In the evening, when they were returning they were caught up in a gale accompanied by rainfall. Consequently, the boat capsized. While Hari and Kailash managed to swim ashore, they couldn’t find Shirpa. They immediately informed the villagers who launched a rescue operation. However, they had to suspend the search operation midway due to darkness. The villagers resumed the operation on Thursday morning. Another fisherman is also missing in the boat capsize incident.As per reports, seven fishermen on a boat had set out from Kashaphala sea-mouth area in Balasore to catch fish in the sea on Saturday night.During their return to the shore, the boat capsized in the sea under the strong influence of strong winds and tidal waves.While one fisherman drowned to death, another is still missing. Five other fishermen were rescued by another boat and brought back to the shore safely. Later, they were rushed to the nearby hospital for treatment.Narrating the incident, a survivor said, “We left the shore at 2 am last night. We were happy because fishing activity was allowed after a ban of two months. During return, the boat overturned because of high tides. We all jumped out of the boat except for one person who got drowned. A boat coming behind us rescued us.”Following a ban for nearly two months, fishing activities in the area resumed after permission from the forest department on June 14.(Reported By Ranjit Pakala, OTV)\nRead more\nAdani, Vedanta, Tata among top investors in Utkarsh Odisha; know which companies invested how much\nOdisha\nUtkarsh Odisha exhibition extended till Jan 31\nOdisha\nOdisha secures landmark investment proposals of over Rs 16 lakh crore in Utkarsh Odisha Conclave\nOdisha\nBJP & BJD at loggerheads over Utkarsh Odisha Conclave\nOdisha\nNo eviction without notice! in Coron watersPOLITICS & GOVERNANCEMunicipal NewsSearch on for missing fisherman in Coron watersBy Gerald Ticke and Arphil Ballarta - March 09, 2024 FacebookTwitterCopy URL A fisherman went missing after the boat he was aboard, along with 20 others, sank early Friday morning in the waters off Coron, Palawan.A Palawan News source said that the FB Epirose II, owned by Mercidar Fishing Corporation and registered in Navotas, Metro Manila, encountered unfavorable weather conditions around 3:40 a.m. on Friday, March 8, causing it to submerge approximately 5 nautical miles southeast of Brown Rock Island, Barangay Tara, Coron.Aboard the fishing boat were 21 crew members, 20 of whom were rescued by another fishing boat that responded to the incident, while one went missing.Coast Guard District Palawan spokesperson Ensign Chrieson Dave Gabayan said the fishing boat originated from Navotas and headed to Coron to conduct fishing activities near Diwaran Island.Personnel of Coast Guard Station Northeastern Palawan are still conducting search and rescue operations for the missing individual.Share this:Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window)Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new Meg Ryan and Billy Crystal Recreate the Iconic Fake Orgasm Scene from When Harry Met Sally for Hellmann's 2025 Super Bowl Ad (Exclusive)\nHuman Interest\nReal People\nReal People Tragedy\nBody Found During Search for Missing Shrimp Boat Captain Whose Boat Sank During Storm\nCurtis Lee Cowling, the captain of the 63-foot boat named \"Miss Jordi,\" was last seen around 11 p.m. local time on Saturday, according to police\nBy\nAbigail Adams\nAbigail Adams\nAbigail Adams is a Human Interest Writer and Reporter for PEOPLE. She has been working in journalism for seven years.\nPeople Editorial Guidelines\nPublished on December 18, 2023 02:00PM EST\nAuthorities located a body in a submerged boat while searching for a missing shrimp boat captain.\nDivers with the Tampa Police Department recovered the body around 10:30 p.m. local time on Sunday after it was found “on board the submerged vessel,” according to police.\nThe 63-foot boat named “Miss Jordi” was found underwater on Saturday after multiple witnesses reported seeing the vessel submerged, the TPD said in a news release on Monday.\nCurtis Lee Cowling, the captain of the boat, was last seen around 11 p.m. on Saturday.\nAuthorities have not publicly identified the victim found inside the boat. Additional information will be released after the victim’s next-of-kin is notified, according to the TPD, which did not immediately respond to PEOPLE's request for comment.\nMan Killed, Woman Injured After Attack by Shark or Crocodile at Mexico Resort, Officials Say\nPolice said Cowling is believed to have been on board at the time the boat sank, according to ABC affiliate WFTS-TV.\nLogan Lirette, who works at the shrimp dock, told NBC affiliate WFLA-TV that he had taken Cowling to the grocery store earlier that evening before dropping him back off at the boat.\nNever miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.\nDive teams were initially unable to enter the water “due to the amount [of] diesel fuel contaminating the water” after the boat became submerged.\n2 Passengers Survive Small Plane Crash That Ended in Fiery Blaze on North Carolina Highway\nThe United States Coast Guard is still conducting clean up efforts around the scene of the spill, which “was successfully contained” to the McKay Bay area, they added.\nThe Coast Guard believes this weekend’s storm that slammed into southeastern states this weekend may have caused the ship to sink, according to CBS affiliate WTSP.\nAn investigation into the incident is ongoing.\nClose\nRelated     "https://phys.org/news/2022-08-dead-storms-lash-france-corsica.html": "Five dead after storms lash France's Corsica: police\nTopics\nWeek's top\nLatest news\nUnread news\nSubscribe\nScience X Account\nRemember me\nSign In\nClick here to sign in with\nor\nForget Password?\nNot a member?\nSign up\nLearn more\nNanotechnology\nPhysics\nEarth\nAstronomy & Space\nChemistry\nBiology\nOther Sciences\nMedicine\nTechnology\nshare this!\n6\n3\nShare\nEmail\nHome\nEarth\nEnvironment\nAugust 18, 2022\nFive dead after storms lash France's Corsica: police\nRescue workers at a campground in Coggia, Corsica, where a 13-year-old girl was killed Thursday when a tree fell on her bungalow.\nBrutal storms with winds gusting up to 224 kilometres per hour (140 miles per hour) left five people dead on the French Mediterranean island of Corsica early Thursday, including a 13-year-old girl who was killed when a tree fell onto her campground bungalow, authorities said.\nIt was the third day of intense rains across much of southern France that had produced flash floods and lightning, but left no casualties until now.\nThe girl was killed at a campground near Sagone, on the island's rugged western coast, where nine others were also injured, including one seriously, rescue workers told AFP.\nAt a nearby beach in Coggia, a 72-year-old woman died after the roof of a beachside hut was blown off and landed on the vehicle she was in, regional authorities said.\n\"I was woken around 7:30 am by a very huge storm\" that knocked out both electricity and mobile phone networks, said Benjamin Roux, a 26-year-old tourist, at the beach near where the woman was killed.\nHe had been planning to go scuba diving, but instead helped the passengers of a boat who were sleeping aboard when it was suddenly thrown onto the shore by the choppy waves.\n\"They managed to get out without injuries, but they're just devastated,\" he told AFP.\nFurther north near the resort of Calvi, a 46-year-old Frenchman was also killed at a campground, and a 23-year-old Italian woman suffered serious injuries while camping nearby.\nViolent storms washed several boats ashore near Sagone, and dozens of rescue operations were carried out at sea.\nMaritime authorities later said a fisherman had died near Girolata, and a female kayaker near Erbalunga, north of Bastia.\n\"Several rescues of pleasure boats\" were also undertaken near the capital Ajaccio, said Jean-Jacques Peraldi, head of the SDIS fire and rescue service.\nMaritime authorities reported 60 to 70 sea rescue operations, mainly along the western coast that bore the brunt of the overnight storm, which the Meteo France weather service said was now moving towards Italy.\nAuthorities had urged people to avoid travel and take other precautions after storm alerts were issued Wednesday for several Mediterranean departments, but also along the Normandy coast and near the southeast city of Lyon.\nAround 35,000 homes on Corsica remain without electricity, power provider EDF said.\n© 2022 AFP\nCitation:\nFive dead after storms lash France's Corsica: police (2022, August 18)\nretrieved 29 January 2025\nfrom     "https://policetv.tv/archives/24207": "บิ๊กโจ๊ก ลงพื้นที่ตรวจสอบ ลูกเรือประมงสูญหาย พบแล้ว1ราย เจ้าตัวยืนยันเป็นอุบัติเหตุ ไม่ได้ถูกทำร้ายร่างกาย – สถานีโทรทัศน์สำนักงานตำรวจแห่งชาติ\nSkip to content\nPOLICETV สถานีโทรทัศน์สำนักงานตำรวจแห่งชาติ\nFacebook\nTwitter\nYoutube\nหน้าหลัก\nข่าวทั่วไป\nข่าวประชาสัมพันธ์\nรูปภาพกิจกรรม\nรายการทีวี\nผังรายการ\nดาวน์โหลด\nเกี่ยวกับเรา\nMenu\nหน้าหลัก\nข่าวทั่วไป\nข่าวประชาสัมพันธ์\nรูปภาพกิจกรรม\nรายการทีวี\nผังรายการ\nดาวน์โหลด\nเกี่ยวกับเรา\nSearch\nบิ๊กโจ๊ก ลงพื้นที่ตรวจสอบ ลูกเรือประมงสูญหาย พบแล้ว1ราย เจ้าตัวยืนยันเป็นอุบัติเหตุ ไม่ได้ถูกทำร้ายร่างกายข่าวทั่วไป / By\nadmin\n/  พฤษภาคม 4, 2022 พฤษภาคม 4, 2022\nพล.ต.ท.สุรเชษฐ์ ให้ตรวจสอบลูกเรือประมงตกเรือทุกลำ หลังพบว่าสถิติการรับแจ้งสูง พบแล้วหนึ่งในลูกเรือประมงที่แจ้งสูญหายระหว่างการทำประมง เจ้าตัวเผย ตกเรือเพราะประมาทไม่มีการทารุณกรรม ระหว่างการทำประมง โดยช่วงสองปีที่ผ่านมามีแรงงานตกเรือกว่า 200 ราย โดย 1 ใน 3 เสียชีวิต แต่ไม่ใช่จากการทารุณกรรม\nพลตำรวจโทสุรเชษฐ์ หักพาล ผู้ช่วยผู้บัญชาการตำรวจแห่งชาติได้ลงพื้นสะพานปลาวราสินธิ์ ต.แสมสาร อ.สัตหีบ จ.ชลบุรี พร้อมกับกลุ่ม เอ็นจีโอ และนักสิทธิมนุษยชน เพื่อสอบสวนนาย ออง ซอ วิน ลูกเรือประมงเรือ เก่งเจริญชัย 1 ซึ่งถูกแจ้งว่าตกน้ำสูญหาย ระหว่างการทำประมงในพื้นที่จังหวัดชลบุรี เมื่อวันที่ 9 มิถุนายนที่ผ่านมา โดยล่าสุดพบตัวแล้ว ซึ่งเจ้าตัวได้ไปสมัครงานเป็นลูกเรือของเรือประมงสหชัย 6 ซึ่งเป็นของอีกนายจ้าง แทน\nทั้งนี้ เจ้าตัว ยืนยันว่าสาเหตุที่ตกเรือไม่ใช่การถูกทำร้ายร่างกาย หรือการทารุณกรรม ระหว่างการทำประมง แต่เป็นเพราะอุบัติเหตุและความประมาท เนื่องจากไปทำธุระท้ายเรือ จนทำให้ตกน้ำ แต่เคราะห์ดีมีเรือที่อยู่ใกล้กัน สามารถช่วยเหลือมาได้\nผู้ช่วยผู้บัญชาการตำรวจแห่งชาติบอกว่า การสืบสวนจนพบลูกเรือที่สูญหายโดยไม่ได้ถูกทำร้ายหรือทารุณกรรม เป็นเครื่องยืนยันว่าการทำการประมงในประเทศไทยปัจจุบัน ไม่ได้มีการทำผิดเงื่อนไขหรือทารุณกรรมแรงงานเกิดขึ้นอีก หลังมีทีมสหวิชาชีพลงตรวจสอบอย่างเข้มงวด\nทั้งนี้จากการตรวจสอบฐานข้อมูล พบว่า ปี 63-64 มีลูกเรือประมงแจ้งตกน้ำ 231 ราย ในจำนวนนี้ 54 ราย เสียชีวิต จากการตกน้ำ เพราะอุบัติเหตุ ส่วนอีก 53 ราย ยังมีชีวิต โดยมีเรือลำอื่น ช่วยไว้ได้ ขณะเดียวกัน ยังมีผู้สูญหายอีก 3 ราย ซึ่งเจ้าหน้าที่สันนิษฐานว่า อาจจะเป็นการสูญหายจากขั้นตอนการลงทะเบียน ที่เกิดข้อผิดพลาด หลังจากมีการติดตามสอบสวนตั้งแต่ต้นทางถึงปลายทางแล้ว\nขณะเดียวกันพบว่าปัจจุบันอุตสาหกรรมประมงในพื้นที่แสมสาร กำลังเผชิญกับปัญหาเรือจำนวนมากไม่กล้าออกไปทำประมงเนื่องจาก หลังตรวจสอบพบว่า มีเจ้าหน้าที่ของบริษัทเรือ ที่รับจ้างทำสมุดคนประจำเรือ หรือ ซีบุ๊ค ปลอมขึ้นมา เจ้าของเรือจึงเกรงจะถูกดำเนินคดีหากออกไปทำประมง\nซึ่งตามกฎหมาย หากยังฝืนออกไปทำประมง และถูกจับ อาจจะถูกเพิกถอนใบอนุญาตการทำประมง และปรับเป็นเงินสูงสุด 4 แสนบาท หรือ 4 เท่า ของมูลค่า ที่จับสัตว์น้ำมาได้\nนี่ทำให้ราคาอาหารทะเล ในพื้นที่จังหวัดชลบุรีเพิ่มสูงขึ้นและเริ่มหายากหากยังไม่รีบแก้ไขก็ยังไม่มีเรือลำใดกล้าออกไปทำประมง\nPost Views: 940\nเว็บไซต์อื่น ๆ\nสำนักงานตำรวจแห่งชาติ\nสำนักงานเทคโนโลยีสารสนเทศและการสื่อสาร\nโรงพยาบาลตำรวจ\nกองตำรวจสื่อสาร\nรัฐบาลไทย\nราชกิจจานุเบกษา\nที่อยู่และการติดต่อ\nอาคาร 8 ชั้น 5 สำนักงานตำรวจแห่งชาติ ถนนพระราม 1     "https://pragativadi.com/balasore-fisherman-dead-another-sustain-bullet-injury-while-fishing-in-restricted-zone-of-chandipur/": "Balasore: Fisherman Dead, Another Sustain Bullet Injury While Fishing In Restricted Zone Of Chandipur | Pragativadi | Odisha News, Breaking News Odisha, Latest Odisha News\nE-Paper\nAbout Us\nPrivacy Policy\nContact Us\nThursday, January 30, 2025\n|\nEpaper\nOdisha\nTwin City\nBhubaneswar\nCuttack\nNation\nWorld\nSports\nBusiness\nEntertainment\nMovies\nOTT\nLifestyle\nTechnology\nNo Result\nView All Result\n|\nEpaper\nOdisha\nTwin City\nBhubaneswar\nCuttack\nNation\nWorld\nSports\nBusiness\nEntertainment\nMovies\nOTT\nLifestyle\nTechnology\nNo Result\nView All Result\nNo Result\nView All Result\nBalasore: Fisherman Dead, Another Sustain Bullet Injury While Fishing In Restricted Zone Of Chandipur\nby\nPragativadi News Service\n28-Sep-2022\nin\nBreaking, Odisha, Top News\n0\n0\nSHARES\n2\nVIEWS\nBalasore: A fisherman died while another sustained bullet injuries after the boat in which they were fishing, went fishing a few miles away from Balaramgadi estuary in the restricted area of arms and ammunition testing range in Chandipur in Balasore.\nThe deceased has been identified as Kamalakant Madal (35) of Kasaphala area, and the injured person is identified as Padmalochan Mallick (26). While Mandal owned the boat, Mallick was a worker.\nAccording to sources, while they were fishing in the boat, around 12:00 noon, some bullet-like object hit both when they trespassed into the no-entry zone. It is feared that the firing of artillery shells hit them.\nThe fishermen were brought to Balasore District Headquarters Hospital in critical condition. However, the doctor declared Kamalakant brought dead. Besides, the critically injured Padmalochan is undergoing treatment.\nIf sources are to be believed, bruises were noticed on the bodies of the deceased and the injured.\nIt is pertinent to mention here that artillery testing is often conducted from the Integrated Test Range (ITR) in Chandipur off the Odisha coast by the Defence Department. Many nearby areas have been restricted by the Defense Department for safety measures.\nIt is suspected that the fisherman might have sustained injuries while fishing in the no-entry zone when artillery testing was underway. On the other hand, it is also suspected that someone may have shot the fishermen due to past enmity over a territorial dispute.\nHowever, it is yet to be ascertained whether any artillery testing was conducted by the Defence Department today or not. A proper investigation into the incident can unravel the actual reason that led to the incident.\nTags: Balasore newsChandipur ITRFisherman DeadRestricted Zone Of Chandipur\nRelated AdMoreSportsTBS GraduatesThoughtsSplashBangladeshSupplementInfographArchiveGalleryLong ReadInterviewsOffbeatTechMagazineClimate ChangeHealthCartoonsবাংলা\nTHURSDAY, JANUARY 30, 2025\nFishing trawler with 17 fishermen missing for 22 days\nBangladesh\nTBS Report\n12 October, 2023, 04:10 pm\nLast modified: 12 October, 2023, 04:49 pm\nRelated News\n15 fishermen kidnapped in Sundarbans: 3 robbers held\n90 Bangladeshi sailors, fishermen return home from India\nBangladesh, India complete repatriation of 185 detained fishermen\nBangladesh, India worked out exchange of fishermen to aid fishing communities: MEA\nBangladesh, India to exchange 185 detained fishermen on Sunday: Foreign adviser\nFishing trawler with 17 fishermen missing for 22 days\nFB Ramim, with 17 fishermen aboard, departed from the Bakkhali river ghat in Cox's Bazar municipality for fishing in the deep sea\nTBS Report\n12 October, 2023, 04:10 pm\nLast modified: 12 October, 2023, 04:49 pm\nFamily of missing fisherman Belal. Photo: TBS\nSeventeen fishermen have been missing for the past 22 days since they set sail on a fishing trawler on 20 September.\nKhorshed Alam, the owner of the fishing trawler FB Ramim, filed a general diary at the Cox's Bazar Sadar Police Station on 3 October.\nThe missing fishermen are Mizan, Belal, Amir Ali, Nahir, Bekka, Madu, Khokon, Ehsan, Aziz, Azizul Haque, Mia, Rubel, Syed, Abdullah, Kashem, Riaz Uddin, and Md. Amen. All of them reside in various areas of Cox's Bazar city.\nKeep updated, follow The Business Standard's Google news channel\nAccording to Khorshed Alam, FB Ramim, with 17 fishermen aboard, departed from the Bakkhali river ghat in Cox's Bazar municipality for fishing in the deep sea. The trawler was expected to return within 10 to 11 days. However, when they failed to return on time, attempts were made to contact the fishermen via their mobile phones, all of which were found switched off.\nAdditionally, turbulent weather conditions were reported at sea on 30 September.\nCox's Bazar Sadar Police Station OC Rokibuzzaman said they are using information technology to pinpoint the fishermen's last known location.\nFurthermore, they have sought assistance from the Naval Police and Coast Guard in this matter, he added.\nTop News\nFishing trawler / Fishermen\nComments\nWhile most comments will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive, moderation decisions are subjective. Maya hotelEmergency services rush three to hospital from Riviera Maya highway crashEmergency services rush three to hospital from Riviera Maya highway crash\nHome » Mexico » Holbox News » Helicopter added to 9 vessels and 33 personnel in search of missing Holbox fishermen\nHelicopter added to 9 vessels and 33 personnel in search of missing Holbox fishermen\nBy Riviera Maya News on February 16, 2024 | Holbox News\nHolbox, Q.R. — State officials have stepped up search efforts for two missing Holbox fishermen. A helicopter was added to efforts Thursday in search of the men while Marina personnel continue to search by sea.\nIn a breif notice Thursday, the SSC of Quintana Roo (Secretaría de Seguridad Ciudadana de Q.Roo) said “the State Coordination of Civil Protection of Quintana Roo in coordination with Municipal Civil Protection and the Secretariat of Citizen Security of Quintana Roo are in an intense search operation by air, where they are also accompanied by a fisherman. In this sense, the Secretary of the Navy (SEMAR) is reinforcing actions by sea.”\nState Civil Protection (Coordinación Estatal de Protección Civil QRoo) also posted information regarding the ongoing search.\n“The search for fishermen in Chiquilá intensifies. Civil Protection of Quintana Roo reports that the search and rescue work for lost fishermen in the community of Chiquilá is intensifying in coordination with SEMAR, the SSC and Municipal Civil Protection.\n“In addition to the aircraft used to search for them by sky, nine vessels with 33 elements from different state authorities join the operation and all the necessary technology is used to locate the fishermen on the high seas.”\nThe two lost Holbox fishermen left the Port of Chiquila February 9 aboard vessel Ruth Selene in search of sawfish with a scheduled return date for February 11. After days of failed private searches, their families requested help from the state.\nShareClick to share on Facebook (Opens in new window)Click to share on WhatsApp (Opens in new window)Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window)Click to share on Reddit (Opens in new window)Click to share on Pocket (Opens in new window)Click to share on LinkedIn (Opens in new window)Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window)Click to share on Tumblr (Opens in new window)\nMore from Holbox NewsMore posts in Holbox News »Holbox man given maximum 50 year sentence for island murderHolbox man given maximum 50 year sentence for island murderHolbox mayor looking to solve island garbage problem with thermal valorizationHolbox mayor looking to solve island garbage problem with thermal valorization\nRiviera Maya News Official Cancun, Playa del Carmen, Daily Mexico News Headlines\nGoogle News\nBluesky\nAbout\nContact\nPrivacy Policy\nTerms of Use\nCopyright\nLetters to the Editor\nStay current! Four fishermen were in the vessel and two were rescued, according to the National Sea Rescue Institute. The deceased man’s body has been sent to the police’s forensic pathology services. Police and lifeguards are continuing the search for the missing man.\nGreytown – The former mayor of Umvoti (Greytown) local municipality, Thami Ngubane from the ANC, has weighed in on the political and administrative issues in the municipality. Ngubane says the power struggle over who is the rightful municipal manager between Noxolo Ndaba and acting municipal manager Martin Manslow should not be an issue as the provincial Cooperative Governance department had ruled that Manslow’s appointment as chief financial officer was irregular in the first place.\nVerulam—Reaction Unit South Africa, a private security company based in Verulam, north of Durban, has been called in to try to locate a container containing a stock of toothpaste that was stolen on 1 June at Terrance Park. The truck was later recovered but the container was missing. The hijacking of trucks with valuable goods has become common in the Durban area in the past few months.\nHowick – Howick Falls, one of the prominent tourist attractions in the KZN Midlands, is undergoing maintenance. According to the DA-run Umngeni local municipality, the planned maintenance will take place throughout the remainder of this year, and some sections of the falls that attract international visitors will be periodically closed. It added that the maintenance was being undertaken to enhance the beauty of the falls for future generations.\nMargate – The KZN Sharks Board says it has removed all shark safety nets and temporarily banned public bathing from Port Edward to Isipingo in the south of Durban. It said on Tuesday, it would remove the Sharks Board’s safety gear from Anstey’s and Brighton beaches, and bathing at these beaches will also be banned. This has been done to allow a seamless annual sardine run along the south coast of the province.\nPictured above: Umgababa beach.\nSource: SAVenues\nFacebookTwitterPinterestWhatsApp\nRecent articles\nDA not leaving the Government of National Unity\nTrump pulls the plug on HIV aid in Mzansi\nFilthy conditions force morgue to close its doors\nKwaZulu-Natal man arrested for possession of police firearms\n#RealNewsForMobile\n© Copyright Scrolla.Africa\nMORE STORIES\nTrump pulls the plug on HIV aid in Mzansi\n29th January 2025\nFilthy conditions force morgue to close its doors\n28th January 2025\nKwaZulu-Natal man arrested for possession of police firearms\n28th January 2025",

Details of the missing yacht: Name: ILAN7 Flag: Great Britain (UK) MMSI: 232029740 Callsign: MIBL9 Description: White with a blue underline, 14 meters long with a maximum width of 4 meters. Last known position: Latitude 37° 52.9282 N, Longitude 18° 22.9029 E (communicated on April 21, 2024). Departed from: Malta on April 11, 2024. Destination: Preveza, Greece. Number of people on board: One. Weather conditions in the search area: Winds up to 28 knots with gusts up to 38 knots. Waves up to 3.5 meters. All vessels in the Ionian Sea are requested to: Maintain a sharp lookout for the yacht \"ILAN7\". Kalpitiya killed after boat capsizes\nPublished 2 years ago on July 5, 2023\nBy editor\nShare\nTweet\nA fisherman was killed after a boat had capsized in the Kalpitiya area due to adverse weather conditions today, Police said.\nTwo other fishermen on the boat had managed to swim to the shore.\nThe victim was identified as Ajith Chandra Kumara (35) a resident of Kandakuliya.\nThey had gone out for fishing early today (05) despite authorities warning naval and fishing communities about rough sea conditions and strong winds.\nRelated Topics:deathlkaSriLanka\nUp Next\nSuspension on Perpetual Treasuries, extended\nDon't Miss\nSchools in N’Eliya & Hatton to be closed for 2 days\neditor\nContinue Reading\nYou may like\nAir quality across SL remains low\nSL Customs clarifies reports on containers released\nUS Ambassador meets Speaker (Pics)\nMP Ramanathan Archchuna arrested\nParliament to meet from Feb. 05 – 07\nChief of Defence Staff post to be abolished\nNews\nAir quality across SL remains low\nPublished 5 hours ago on January 29, 2025\nBy editor\nThe air quality across all districts in Sri Lanka remains low.\nDirector of the Environmental Studies & Services Division at the National Building Research Organization, Sarath Premasiri said that wind flow from India is contributing to this condition.\nHe also noted that several South Asian countries are experiencing rising levels of air pollution.\nMain districts, including Colombo and Jaffna, have reported higher pollution levels.\nSarath Premasiri advised those with respiratory conditions to exercise caution due to the current air quality.\n(news1st.lk)\n(Except for the headline, this story, originally published by News1st has not been edited by SLM staff)\nContinue Reading\nNews\nSL Customs clarifies reports on containers released\nPublished 6 hours ago on January 29, 2025\nBy editor\nSri Lanka Customs today (Jan. 29) issued a clarification, stating that no cargo designated to Expolanka Holdings among the 323 containers released without inspections.\nAn 8-point special media release issued by Sri Lanka Customs states that the 323 containers in question were released by the Screening Unit which was appointed on 18 July, 2024 as a solution to the container traffic congestion.\nThe containers were released by the Screening Unit under the relevant criteria as per the advice of the committee while also considering the advice by the President and the committee chair Minister Bimal Ratnayake on Jan. 12, 2025.\nThe release also states that it s not possible for weapons, gold and narcotics to enter the country or for any losses in the Customs duties.\nමාධ්_ය_නිවේදනය_-_ශ්_රී_ලංකා_රේගුවDownload\nContinue Reading\nNews\nUS Ambassador meets Speaker (Pics)\nPublished 6 hours ago on January 29, 2025\nBy editor\nU.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka – Julie Chung, met with the Speaker of the Parliament of Sri Lanka – Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne, at the Parliamentary premises on January 24.\nSecretary General of Parliament, Mrs. Kushani Rohanadeera, was also present on the occasion.\nThe ambassador expressed her warm congratulations to the Speaker, who in return, extended his felicitations to the newly elected President of the United States.\nShe also welcomed the revival of the Sri Lanka – United States of America Parliamentary Friendship Association in the Tenth Parliament, emphasizing its importance in strengthening bilateral ties.\nDuring the discussion, Dr. Wickramaratne expressed his deep appreciation for the United States’ steadfast support during critical times, including the COVID-19 pandemic and Sri Lanka’s recent economic challenges. He acknowledged the U.S. government’s continued assistance to the Parliament and highlighted the importance of furthering cooperation between the two nations.\nAmbassador Chung emphasized the shared democratic values between the United States and Sri Lanka. She noted the potential for deeper collaboration through initiatives such as the Open Government Partnership, which fosters transparency, accountability, and citizen engagement in governance. The Ambassador also commended the notable increase in women representation within the Parliament of Sri Lanka and reiterated U.S. support for the Women Parliamentarians’ Caucus.\nFurther discussions focused on topics such as deepen parliamentary collaboration, enhance institutional capacities, and exchange best practices to strengthen democratic governance.\nContinue Reading\nLatest\nTrending\nVideos\nNews5 hours ago\nAir quality across SL remains low\nNews6 hours ago\nSL Customs clarifies reports on containers released\nNews6 hours ago\nUS Ambassador meets Speaker (Pics)\nWorld2 years ago\nPutin grants Russian citizenship to Snowden\nCARTOON2 years ago\nCartoon 2022-10-14\nVideos10 months ago\nSearch operation underway after Baltimore bridge collapse\nNews2 weeks ago\nSL signed 15 MoUs with China – Vijitha (Video)\nNews2 weeks ago\nTalks between Xi – AKD commences (Video / Pics)\nNews2 weeks ago\nPresident AKD warmly welcomed in Beijing ( Video / Pics )\nTrending\nFEATURES2 days ago\nPlanet Parade 2025: The perfect guide to watch the six planets lined up in the night sky\nNews5 days ago\nAir Vice Marshal Vasu to lead SLAF\nBIZ2 days ago\n‘Unaccompanied baggage’ at Customs turns out to be goods with NOLIMIT tags!\nNews1 day ago\nPoor air quality due to polluted air from India: NBRO\nNews4 days ago\nYoshitha Rajapaksa remanded (Update)\nNews4 days ago\nIndia’s 76th Republic Day celebrated in Colombo (Pics)\nNews15 hours ago\n2024 (2025) G.C.E O/L exam timetable released\nNews15 hours ago\nAutomated system to block mobile phones with TRCSL approval\nCopyright © 2024 Sri Lanka Mirror. police social media matterWednesday Jan 29 0°C  St. Lucia News2 min readFamilies concerned as two Vieux Fort fishermen missing at seaKingsley Emanuel February 21, 2023 12:52 PM ETDeleson Jn Marie, missing at seaTwo fishermen from Vieux-Fort have been reported missing at sea since Saturday, February 18.Missing are Pius 'Norppy' Mathurin, the captain of the fishing vessel, and Deleson Jn Marie.The men left the Vieux-Fort fishing port to fish and have not been seen or heard of since.Family members of both fishermen say that despite their concerns regarding the situation, they feel that their loved ones are still alive and waiting to be rescued.Zoya Jn Marie, the sister of Deleson Jn Marie said: “We are hoping and praying he is safe and makes it back home.”She said her brother normally goes out to sea with his father, who recently passed away, and that both incidents are taking a toll on the family.“We feel a lot of pain but we are coping,” she lamented.According to the girlfriend of Mathurin, Melissa James, the family is struggling to come to terms with the situation.Melissa JamesShe said it is not the first time her boyfriend has been missing at sea, and that he has previously been lucky to return safely.Boat owner Gregory Joseph told Loop News the situation is of grave concern to him.“It is very sad news and I hope they are safe,” Joseph said.He said he is not sure what went wrong, but was told that the boat had hit a wall in the sea near shore and the captain went out to sea without checking it with a mechanic.According to Joseph, if that’s the case, the captain should have berthed the boat.He said the men left shore with food, water, and were equipped with a GPS, but he is not sure, whether they had enough food to last them for the time they have been missing.\nLoop is better in the app. Customize your news feed, save articles for later, view your reading history and more. saintlucianewsonline, st lucia news online, stlucia news online, loop news, loopnewsbarbados\nSearch Suspended For Fisherman Who Went Missing In The Saint Lucia Channel\nBy Editorial Staff\n1Comment(s)\nDecember 13, 2023\nShare\nWhatsAppFacebookTwitter\nSearch and rescue teams have suspended the search for a Martinique fisherman reported missing in the Saint Lucia Channel on Sunday.\nMartinique’s Prefect announced the suspension in a press release on Tuesday.\nHelicopters and two private boats were among the air and sea resources involved in the operation to find Daniel Florian amid poor visibility, rough seas, and adverse weather.\nThe Antilles-Guyana Regional Operational Surveillance and Rescue Center (Marine Directorate) learned at 1:05 p.m. on Sunday that Florian had fallen into the water.\nThe circumstances surrounding the incident were not clear.\nHowever, local reports said his empty boat was towed back to its home port in Sainte-Luce.\nHeadline photo Though other fishermen searched for him, they could not find him, following which they informed the police.\nAlso Read\nFisherman drowns in irrigation tank in Nalgonda\nFishermen drowns in tank in Sircilla\nThe police have reached the spot and launched search and rescue efforts.\nFollow Us :\nTags\nFisherman\nHyderpalli\nJagtial\nmissing\nRelated News\nFormer sarpanch makes suicide bid in grama sabha in Jagtial\nLeopard movements recorded in Rajanna-Sircilla, forest officials alert people\nVehicular traffic comes to standstill near Jagtial\nAnother Telangana farmer ends life after missing out on crop loan waiver, this time in Jagtial\nLatest News\nGovernment sanctions Rs 5.13 crore for BT road repairs: Harish Rao\n33 mins ago\nTelangana: Man drowns in Kudavelly vagu while taking holy dip\n41 mins ago\nTelangana: Annual Brahmotsavams to start at Kodakanchi temple on February 1\n50 mins ago\nNava Limited develops facilities at Burgampad Zilla Parishad Girls’ High School\n1 hour ago\nTelangana: BRS leaders condole deaths at Maha Kumbh stampede\n1 hour ago\nThree die of suspected Guillain-Barre Syndrome in West Bengal\n1 hour ago\nTelangana High Court permits Atal Bihari Vajpayee’s statue in Secunderabad Public Garden\n2 hours ago\nTelangana High Court gives directions to JNTU on Swami Vivekananda Institute of Technology\n2 hours ago\ncompany\nHome\nAbout Us\nContact Us\nContact Us\nbusiness\nSubscribe\ntelangana today\nTelangana\nHyderabad\nLatest News\nEntertainment\nWorld\nAndhra Pradesh\nScience & Tech\nSport\nfollow us\n© Copyrights 2024 TELANGANA PUBLICATIONS PVT.     "https://telanganatoday.com/fisherman-killed-in-attack-by-marlin-fish-off-visakhapatnam-coast": "Fisherman killed in attack by Marlin fish off Visakhapatnam coast-Telangana Today\nThursday, Jan 30, 2025\nSearch\nHyderabadTelanganaAP NewsIndiaWorldEntertainmentSportScience and TechBusinessRewind\n...\nNRIView PointcartoonMy SpaceOlympicsEducation TodayReviewsPropertyLifestyle\nE-Paper\nNRIView PointcartoonMy SpaceReviewsEducation TodayPropertyLifestyle\nHome |\nAndhra Pradesh | Fisherman Killed In Attack By Marlin Fish Off Visakhapatnam Coast\nFisherman killed in attack by Marlin fish off Visakhapatnam coast\nThe fisherman was attacked by the giant fish with its spear-like snout when he along with four others was fishing in the deep sea 60 nautical miles from the shore.\nBy\nIANS\nUpdated On - 3 February 2022, 05:01 PM\nRepresentational Image\nVisakhapatnam: A fisherman was killed in an attack by a huge Black Marlin fish in the Bay of Bengal off Visakhapatnam coast.\nThe fisherman was attacked by the giant fish with its spear-like snout when he along with four others was fishing in the deep sea 60 nautical miles from the shore.\nThe incident, said to be the first of its kind in the region, occurred on Wednesday.\nMolli Joganna (40) of Muthyalamma Palem in Parwada mandal along with four others had gone into the deep sea for fishing on Tuesday evening and continued catching fish till the next morning.\nThey netted a huge fish and since it was heavy and they were unable to lift the net, Joganna ventured into the waters to check. Suddenly, the fish popped out and pierced Joganna’s stomach with its sharp snout. The other fishermen tried to rescue him but in vain.\nAccording to the fishermen accompanying Joganna, he was attacked by ‘Kommu Konam’, as the Black Marlin Fish is called locally.\nJoganna’s body was brought to the shore by the other fishermen. On learning about the incident, local police rushed there and recorded the statements of the eyewitnesses.\nThe body was shifted to Government Hospital at Anakapalle for autopsy. Parwada police said the case was transferred to Coastal Security Police for investigation.\nA police officer said while there have been incidents of giant fish attacking fishermen in the past, this was the first incident where a fisherman lost his life in the attack.\nMarlin fish are said to be very aggressive and fast swimmers and attack with their sharp upper snouts. Marlin are often spotted off Visakhapatnam beach during winter months.\nFollow Us :\nTags\nAndhra Pradesh\nFisherman\nMarlin fish\nVisakhapatnam\nRelated News\nAndhra Pradesh realtor held for murdering divorced sister to claim Rs 1 crore insurance\nHyderabad: Man from AP succumbs to burns caused in Hussain Sagar boat blaze\nHyderabad: Bharat Dynamics Limited announces major hiring\n‘Matter of Pride’: Andhra CM Naidu delighted over Etikoppaka tableau in R-Day parade\nLatest News\nGovernment sanctions Rs 5.13 crore for BT road repairs: Harish Rao\n1 hour ago\nTelangana: Man drowns in Kudavelly vagu while taking holy dip\n1 hour ago\nTelangana: Annual Brahmotsavams to start at Kodakanchi temple on February 1\n1 hour ago\nNava Limited develops facilities at Burgampad Zilla Parishad Girls’ High School\n2 hours ago\nTelangana: BRS leaders condole deaths at Maha Kumbh stampede\n2 hours ago\nThree die of suspected Guillain-Barre Syndrome in West Bengal\n2 hours ago\nTelangana High Court permits Atal Bihari Vajpayee’s statue in Secunderabad Public Garden\n2 hours ago\nTelangana High Court gives directions to JNTU on Swami Vivekananda Institute of Technology\n2 hours ago\ncompany\nHome\nAbout Us\nContact Us\nContact Us\nbusiness\nSubscribe\ntelangana today\nTelangana\nHyderabad\nLatest News\nEntertainment\nWorld\nAndhra Pradesh\nScience & Tech\nSport\nfollow us\n© Copyrights 2024 TELANGANA PUBLICATIONS PVT.     "https://thechanzo.com/2023/05/25/villagers-clash-with-rangers-in-arushas-mto-wa-mbu-two-people-die": "Villagers Clash With Rangers in Arusha’s Mto wa Mbu. Two People Die - The Chanzo\nSkip to content\nThe Chanzo is hosting Digital Freedom and Innovation Day on April 20, 2024. Register Here\nWhatsapp\nTwitter\nFacebook\nYoutube\nInstagram\nSearch\nSearch\nClose this search box.\nHome\nNews\nFeatures\nOp-Ed\nPodcasts\nAfrica\n2024/2025 Elections\nMenu\nHome\nNews\nFeatures\nOp-Ed\nPodcasts\nAfrica\n2024/2025 Elections\nHome\nNews\nFeatures\nOp-Ed\nPodcasts\nAfrica\n2024/2025 Elections\nMenu\nHome\nNews\nFeatures\nOp-Ed\nPodcasts\nAfrica\n2024/2025 Elections\nTwitter\nFacebook\nYoutube\nInstagram\nSearch\nSearch\nClose this search box.\nFeatures\nVillagers Clash With Rangers in Arusha’s Mto wa Mbu. Two People Die\nIt follows authorities’ decision to block fishermen from Jangwani village of Mto wa Mbu from fishing in Lake Manyara, a protected area.\nThe Chanzo Reporter\nMay 25, 2023\nsubscribe to our newsletter!\nName\nEmail\nSubscribe Now!\nDar es Salaam. Authorities in Tanzania’s northern region of Arusha will spend some sleepless nights in the coming few days trying to repair the damaged relations between villagers of the region’s Mto wa Mbu area and rangers whose latest face-off left two people dead, with two others feared drowned in the region’s Lake Manyara.\nReports of the clashes started to emerge on May 22, 2023, when rangers from the Tanzania National Parks (TANAPA), the agency tasked with managing the country’s national parks, blocked fishermen from Jangwani village of Mto wa Mbu from fishing in a section of Lake Manyara\nVillagers told journalists that rangers knocked several fishermen’s boats, causing them to capsize, leaving the fishermen floating helplessly on the water, trying to save themselves from drowning.\n“The rangers started to knock our boats out with their motor-powered boat,” a fisherman from the Jangwani village, Samson Nyakisi, recounted. “There were about 36 people who were left floating on water.”\nREAD MORE: Ngorongoro: A Blot on Samia’s Human Rights Record?\nAfter the fishermen noticed two of their colleagues were missing, they returned to the village to report the incident to their fellow villagers, who subsequently organised demonstrations, blocking the main road connecting Mto wa Mbu and Karatu, one of Arusha’s seven districts.\nThe villagers protested the alleged drowning of their two fellow villagers at the village government offices, leading police officers to open fire on the protesting villagers, leaving two villagers dead, one on the spot and another while receiving treatment at the Mount Meru Hospital.\nPolice claim that the villagers were “causing destructions and tried to enter TANAPA offices,” a claim villagers refute.\nReports indicate that police opened fire in the presence of the area’s ward councillor and the Monduli district commissioner, Mr Joshua Nassari, who arrived at the scene intending to calm the situation and bring some order.\n“It was a challenge,” Mr Nassari, who took the villager’s body that police shot dead, described what he saw. “The misunderstanding between fishermen and conservators led to this demonstration which erupted into a big scuffle.”\nInvestigation underway\nOn May 23, 2023, Arusha regional police commander Justine Masejo said the region’s law enforcement agency would investigate the incident, pointing out that police are already holding twelve individuals in connection with the clashes.\nAddressing the incident on May 23, 2023, Minister for Tourism and Natural Resources Mohamed Mchengerwa applauded the rangers for their bravery in protecting Tanzania’s natural resources even at a time when doing so risked their lives.\n“Although our rangers were armed, they never used force in arresting these criminals and poachers,” Mr Mchengerwa told journalists. “Thanks to this, these criminals organise and attack our rangers and disappear with criminals already under arrest.”\nREAD MORE: Conservation: This is How Humans, Wild Animals Can Coexist In Tanzania\nBut fishermen from the village deny being involved in criminal activities, complaining instead of being on the receiving end of violence from park rangers. According to villagers, confusion exists on what constitutes a protected area and what does not.\nFor example, Richard Rogert, a fisherman and villager of the Jangwani area, told local media that they have been pleading with authorities for a long time to clear the confusion park rangers use to harass the villagers daily.\n“We carry out our fishing activities in a nonprotected zone, but [rangers] still come and knock our boats,” Rogert complained. “They do that while saying the area is a TANAPA protected zone but no beacons proving that can be seen.”\nBut TANAPA’s conservation commissioner William Mwakilema told reporters that beacons used to exist, but villagers themselves removed them.\nREAD MORE: LHRC Wants Existing Conservation Laws Scrapped Off Tanzania’s Law Book\n“The conserved areas include the Marang Forest, the Rift Valley corridors, and part of the Lake Manyara,” Mr Mwakilema noted while addressing the recent clash between his rangers and villagers. “The areas were identified and demarcated in collaboration with stakeholders, but some unruly residents have destroyed the beacons.”\nThis is not the first time that conservation authorities in Mto wa Mbu become at loggerheads with villagers in the area.\nOn November 17, 2018, three fishermen – Paulin Ngalabushi, Isack Nyingi, and Cornelius Karabona – who had camped at Lake Manyara were reported to have gone missing, never to be seen again, with unconfirmed reports suggesting that park rangers took them.\nMain drivers\nGeographically Mto wa Mbu sits right at the bottom of the Rift Valley. It connects two important national parks, Tarangire National Park and Lake Manyara National Park. Together, the two form the Tarangire Manyara Ecosystem.​​\nThe town lies along a vital transport route connecting Arusha and Mara regions through the Serengeti. It is on a flat terrain with wealthy soils and is drained by tributaries from the upper part of the Rift Valley.\nREAD MORE: Majaliwa Receives Indigenous Peoples’ Recommendations on Conservation\nDr Ronald Ndesanjo, a human ecologist from the University of Dar es Salaam, thinks these factors are the main drivers for Mto wa Mbu’s rapid urbanisation and expansion.\nHe told The Chanzo during an interview that more recently, the towns of Mto wa Mbu and Karatu have attracted enormous tourist investments, especially lodges, campsites and support infrastructures and other facilities.\n“Amidist all these dynamics is population growth and subsequent rise in demand for food and fresh produce to feed the town’s burgeoning population and nearby areas,” Dr Ndesanjo said. “This is coupled with rising demand for areas to settle the expanding population and influx of people.”\nThese dynamics have resulted in spillover effects on Lake Manyara National Park and the lake itself, Dr Ndesanjo thinks.\nThey include lake eutrophication from farming and other human activities in Mto wa Mbu and rapid expansion of farms into the lake’s wetlands and fringes, posing a threat to the lake’s existence.\n“The ecological impacts on the lake are slower and hardly attract violent response from conservation authorities,” Dr Ndesanjo told The Chanzo. “The villagers’ encroachment is likely to trigger an immediate and often violent response by park rangers. The latter aspect might have led to the recent incident.”\nStopping the violence\nAsked for his opinion on how best the government can improve the relations between conservation authorities and surrounding communities, Dr Ndesanjo said there is no shortcut to achieving that, laying out what he calls “long-term but important” initiatives to prevent violence from recurring.\n“The government should make long-term investments to create alternative livelihood opportunities to park neighbouring communities,” he suggested. “These could range from eco-tourism, community-based conservation in its truest sense and other secondary livelihood options.”\nDr Ndesanjo also called on the government to re-evaluate its population and conservation policies to bring about harmony between rapid population expansion and efforts to expand conservation areas and initiatives in the country.\n“Proceeds from tourism should be adequately shared with park neighbouring communities as opposed to being appropriated by central government and the political and business elite class,” he suggested.\n“This way, a common Tanzanian will see the true benefits of conservation and very likely support it,” the expert added.\nThe Chanzo is hosting Digital Freedom and Innovation Day on Saturday April 20, 2024 at Makumbusho ya Taifa.\nRegister to secure your spot\nThe Chanzo Reporter\nOne Response\nKathie knell says:\n29 December 2023 at 9:42 PM\nVery interesting I am doing some research on the conflict between ranges and local villages. Designing some training for the Tanzania wildlife service. Do you have any more information like this?\nReply\nLeave a Reply Cancel replyYour email address will not be published. Dies\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nTragedy Onboard Belgian-Registered Beam Trawler as Fisherman Dies\nby Oliver McBride | Dec 20, 2023 | European Fishing Industry, Latest News\nA fisherman has died, and another has been seriously injured after an accident onboard the Belgian-registered beam trawler Photo: O-51 Stormvogel Facebook\nA young fisherman has died, and another has been seriously injured after an accident onboard the Belgian-registered beam trawler O-51 Stormvogel.\nThe Stormvogel, is now berthed in Plymouth where the deceased has been removed from the fishing vessel.\nThe fisherman was killed on Tuesday afternoon, 19 December 2023, while operating in the English Channel.\nEMK-Vissers has confirmed the name of the deceased as Michael Hubert from Bredene, a 23-year-old father of two young daughters.\nThe name of the injured man has not been released.\nCLICK HERE SEE MORE INFORMATION ON RESQUNIT\nThe fishing boat is part of the Flemish Fisheries Cooperative in Ostend. There were five people on board at the time of the accident.\nDetails of the accident that led to the death and injury has emerged but as yet not confirmed.\nThe Fishing Daily has been in contact with the Devon and Cornwall Police and the UK Maritime and Coastguard     "https://thefishingdaily.com/european-fishing-industry-news/tragedy-strikes-fishing-crew-second-loss-as-skipper-succumbs-to-grief/": "Tragedy Strikes Fishing Crew: Second Loss as Skipper Succumbs to Grief\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nTragedy Strikes Fishing Crew: Second Loss as Skipper Succumbs to Grief\nby Oliver McBride | Jan 29, 2024 | European Fishing Industry, Latest News\nTragedy strikes the fishing crew of the Belgian-registered beam trawler O-51 Stormvogel with a second loss as skipper succumbs to grief\nIn a devastating turn of events for the crew of the 0.51 Stormvogel, a month after the death of fisherman Michael Hubert (23) in a sea accident, their skipper, Dave Orban (37), has taken his own life, reports Laurens Kindt of Belgian news publisher KW.\nThe crew is grappling with the heart-wrenching question, “Why, Dave? You were our captain, our friend.”\nOn 19 December 2023, a maritime tragedy unfolded in English waters when tragedy struck the 0-51 Stormvogel. While repairing nets after a tear, crew members Ilir Devick and Michael Hubert were on duty when a safety line unexpectedly snapped. This resulted in the part to which the nets were attached crashing down, proving fatal for Michael Hubert, a father of two daughters, who succumbed on the spot. His colleague Ilir Devick sustained serious injuries and is currently undergoing recovery in a rehabilitation centre.\nCLICK HERE SEE MORE INFORMATION ON RESQUNIT\nLead Story:\nTragedy Onboard Belgian-Registered Beam Trawler as Fisherman Dies\nThe incident prompted investigations from both English authorities and the Belgian Work Welfare Supervision Service. Skipper Dave Orban (37), visibly distressed upon their return, stated, “Before departure in Belgium, we had checked everything, as is standard procedure. Everything was in order. We don’t understand how this could have happened. We did everything we were supposed to do; no one could have prevented this.”\nDespite assertions that all safety protocols were followed, Dave, also a father of two daughters, grappled with a profound sense of responsibility for the accident. “As a skipper, you bear the responsibility for your men on board your ship. Of course, I feel guilty,” he confessed. This overwhelming guilt took a toll on Dave in the following weeks, culminating in an unbearable burden. On Monday evening last, 22 January, the skipper’s lifeless body was discovered; he had taken his own life.\n“Why, Dave? It was already tough enough. You were our captain, our friend,” lamented Ilir Devick on social media, capturing the crew’s deep emotional turmoil over the second loss within their team. Fellow crew members echoed sentiments, emphasising that Dave should not shoulder blame, underscoring the familial bond among them.\nThe owner of the 0-51 Stormvogel, VVC Equipment, expressed profound sorrow over the skipper’s death, stating, “This is not a colleague we lose but a brother. That goes for the entire crew. They are not just colleagues; they are family.” The owner emphasised the importance of collective processing of grief, highlighting the close-knit nature of life on board where crew members spend 24 hours a day together, sharing both joys and sorrows.\nHowever, collective coping became challenging due to the ongoing investigation. The ship remained docked, and the crew was prohibited from sailing or even boarding. The vessel was sealed, and extensive interrogations took an emotional toll on everyone. Dave, in particular, struggled with these interrogations. The crew contends that the relentless focus on assigning blame for the accident neglected the well-being of the crew. Instead of solely seeking a culprit, they argue that authorities should have supported the crew in their grieving process.\nThe labour prosecutor’s office is actively investigating the fatal accident involving Michael Hubert. “That is the normal procedure. If there was an error, it needs to be investigated whether someone can be held responsible. A technical expert has also been appointed to examine exactly what happened,” confirmed labour prosecutor Filiep De Ketelaere.\nFollow The Fishing     "https://thefishingdaily.com/featured-news/faroese-longliner-sinks-intense-search-for-two-missing-crewmen-underway/": "Faroese Longliner Sinks – Intense Search for Two Missing Crewmen Underway\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nFaroese Longliner Sinks – Intense Search for Two Missing Crewmen Underway\nby Oliver McBride | Feb 6, 2024 | European Fishing Industry, Featured News, Latest News\nAn intense search operation is underway for two missing crewmen from a Faroese longliner which sank due south of the Islands this morning\nA major search operation is underway for two missing crewmen from a Faroese longliner which sank due south of the Islands after it ran difficulties this morning.\nAt 0900 (8.00am GMT) this morning, the alarm sounded at the Joint Rescue Coordination Centre (HRS) in Northern Norway. Speaking to Norwegian fishing magazine Fiskeribladet, Linda Hansen, the rescue leader at HRS Northern Norway, informed that its journalists that the centre received a distress signal via the Cospas-Sarsat system at 0900 on Tuesday morning, signalling that a fishing vessel was in the process of sinking.\n“It is an international system for picking up distress signals. Our job then is to ensure that the rescue centre responsible for the area where the alarm is triggered has received the alarm and that a rescue operation has been initiated,” Hansen told Fiskeribladet this afternoon.\nCLICK HERE SEE MORE INFORMATION ON RESQUNIT\nThe MRCC rescue station in Torshavn confirmed to Fiskeribladet that that the fishing vessel concerned in the incident was the longliner ‘Kambur’. The longliner had previously sailed under the Norwegian flag, first as ‘Geir’ when owned by the H.P. Holmeset shipping company. Later, it was sold to Austevoll and named ‘Østerfjord’. As previously reported by Fiskeribladet, ‘Østerfjord’ was sold to the Faroe Islands in 2021, where it has since operated under the name ‘Kambur’.\nThe vessel was just south of the Faroe Islands when it encountered difficulties. Fiskeribladet confirmed from the rescue station at 1345 (12.45pm GMT) that the boat in question has sunk. MRCC reported that the boat listed severely, leading to its sinking. There were 16 people on board, and 14 of them have been rescued. A search is currently underway for the two missing crew members.\nAccording to the newspaper KVF, the police report that the two missing individuals are in their 40s and 50s. The 14 rescued crew members have been sent to the hospital but are not believed to be seriously injured.\nA helicopter and four to five boats are involved in the search. According to MRCC, a reconnaissance plane from Denmark was planned to assist, but it has encountered technical problems. The weather is poor, with strong northeast winds in the area, as reported by MRCC to Fiskeribladet.\nFollow The Fishing Daily\nFollowFollowFollowFollowFollow\nDisclaimer\nSearch for:\nDive into the     "https://thefishingdaily.com/featured-news/lifejacket-might-have-improved-survival-odds-for-lone-boater/": "Lifejacket Might Have Improved Survival Odds for Lone Boater\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nLifejacket Might Have Improved Survival Odds for Lone Boater\nby Oliver McBride | Aug 29, 2024 | Featured News, Irish Fishing Industry, Latest News\nAn MCIB report into a drowning incident at Bruckless, Co Donegal advises that wearing a lifejacket might have improved survival odds. Image: MCIB Report\nThe Marine Casualty Investigation Board (MCIB) has released its investigation report into the tragic marine casualty which occurred on 28 September 2023, near Bruckless Pier in Donegal, when a recreational boater, operating alone, fell overboard and drowned.\nThe incident happened between 15:30 and 16:30 in challenging weather conditions, with wind gusts up to 35 knots. The boater, a man in his late sixties, was not wearing a lifejacket, and his vessel was found moored approximately 50 metres offshore.\nInvestigation Findings: The Marine Casualty Investigation Board (MCIB) conducted an investigation into the incident, revealing several factors that contributed to the tragedy:\nVessel Condition: The boat, an older model, lacked modern safety features such as a reboarding ladder, which became mandatory after 2013 under the EU Recreational Craft Directive.\nLack of Safety Equipment: The victim was not wearing a personal flotation device (PFD) and had no means of raising the alarm or reboarding the vessel from the water.\nCold Water Immersion: The water temperature was 14°C, and the victim likely succumbed to cold water shock and incapacitation, which led to his drowning.\nChallenging Weather: A Small Craft Warning was in effect, and the conditions were described as challenging, with strong winds and rain.\nCLICK HERE SEE MORE INFORMATION ON CATCHAM\nCLICK HERE SEE MORE INFORMATION ON RESQUNIT\nEmergency Response: The incident was reported by a member of the public, and a swift multi-agency response was coordinated by the Marine Rescue Sub-Centre at Malin Head. Despite the prompt actions of rescuers, who performed CPR on the victim after recovering him from the water, the man was pronounced dead at the scene.\nSafety Recommendations: In light of the investigation, the MCIB made several recommendations to improve safety and prevent similar incidents in the future. These include better adherence to safety guidelines, ensuring the availability and use of PFDs, and enhancing awareness of the risks associated with operating alone in adverse conditions.\nConclusion: This incident highlights the importance of safety precautions, particularly the use of lifejackets, proper voyage planning, and the need for adequate training in operating recreational craft. The MCIB urges boaters to take heed of these recommendations to avoid further tragedies on Irish waters.\nREAD THE MCIB INCIDENT REPORT IN FULL BY CLICKING HERE\nFollow The Fishing
