    "https://thefishingdaily.com/featured-news/maib-launch-investigation-into-fatal-man-overboard-from-kingfisher/": "MAIB Launch Investigation Into Fatal Man Overboard from Kingfisher\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nMAIB Launch Investigation Into Fatal Man Overboard from Kingfisher\nby Oliver McBride | Jul 16, 2024 | Featured News, Latest News, UK Fishing Industry\nThe MAIB has launched an investigation into a fatal man overboard from FV Kingfisher. Photo: Marine Traffic/Ian Greenwood\nThe Marine Accident Investigation Branch (MAIB) is to investigate a tragic incident occurred which approximately 30 nautical miles east-northeast of Wick, Scotland, resulting in the fatality of a crew member from the UK-registered fishing vessel Kingfisher (DH110).\nThe unfortunate event unfolded on Friday 12 July 2024, when a crew member went overboard while the vessel was conducting routine fishing operations. Despite immediate efforts by the crew to rescue their colleague, the situation ended in tragedy.\nThe Kingfisher, an 18.35-metre fishing vessel, was operating in the North Sea when the incident took place. The crew quickly initiated a man overboard protocol, deploying life-saving equipment and issuing distress calls to nearby vessels and maritime authorities.\nThe UK’s Maritime and Coastguard Agency (MCA) coordinated a swift response, dispatching search and rescue teams, including helicopters and lifeboats, to the location. Unfortunately, despite the comprehensive search efforts, the individual was recovered but pronounced deceased.\nCLICK HERE FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CATCHCAM\nCLICK HERE FOR MORE INFORMATION ON RESQUNIT\nReplying to a request on the incident, a Police Scotland spokesperson said:\n“Around 5.10pm on Friday, 12 July, 2024, we were made aware of a man having gone overboard from a fishing vessel in the North Sea, 30 miles east of Orkney.\n“Emergency services attended however the 42-year-old man was pronounced dead at the scene.\n“Enquiries to establish the full circumstances surrounding the incident are ongoing and a report has been submitted to the Procurator Fiscal.”\nAs investigations continue, the maritime industry is reminded of the critical importance of safety protocols and preparedness for such emergencies. The MAIB will release a comprehensive report with recommendations to prevent similar incidents in the future.\nFollow The Fishing Daily\nFollowFollowFollowFollowFollow\nDisclaimer\nSearch for:\nDive into the Marine Institute and Fisheries Management with Dr Ciaran Kelly\nhttps://youtu.be/kdn4MfMLEyUIrish Fish Processing Industry Facing Uncertain Futurehttps://youtu.be/iOS3-aWj10I\nRecent     "https://thefishingdaily.com/featured-news/report-finds-reul-a-chuain-tragedy-stresses-importance-of-wearing-a-pfd/": "Report finds Reul a Chuain tragedy stresses importance of wearing a PFD\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nReport finds Reul a Chuain tragedy stresses importance of wearing a PFD\nby Oliver McBride | Dec 16, 2022 | Featured News, Latest News, Scottish Fishing Industry\nThe MAIB Report on the fatal man overboard on the Reul a Chuain stresses the importance of wearing a PFD at sea as it increases survivability\nThe Marine Accident Investigation Branch (MAIB) has released its report into the fatal man overboard from the trawler ‘Reul a Chuain’ in the Sound of Rum on 24 June 2021.\nThe Report stresses the importance of wearing a personal floatation device (PFD) when at sea because it can increase the chances of survivability in the case of a man overboard situation.\nOn the evening of 24 June 2021, the 18-metre Reul a Chuain (OB915) was on passage with three crew to Mallaig, Scotland when a deckhand fell overboard in adverse weather while trying to recover one of the vessel’s nets, which had slipped over the stern during heavy rolling. The skipper attempted to recover him from the water but also fell overboard. Neither of them were wearing personal flotation devices.\nBoth men were recovered by the inexperienced remaining crew member. The skipper was unresponsive and, despite efforts by the vessel’s crew and search and rescue personnel, he could not be revived. The MAIB says, their investigation found that control measures identified in the vessel’s operational risk assessments had not been implemented immediately after the net was taken on board after the fishing operation ended. This allowed, with the deteriorating weather conditions, for the net to slip overboard, which led to an emergency situation that continued to escalate with dire consequences.\nIn the report they say, “Given the existing extensive safety guidance to fishing vessel owners and skippers, specifically on mitigating the risks of falling overboard, and the requirement for fishermen to wear a personal flotation device or to have measures in place to prevent falling overboard, no recommendations are made in this report.”\nIn the Report analysis the MAIB finds that the skipper “died from immersion in water” after falling overboard while attempting to rescue the boat’s senior deckhand who have fallen overboard while trying to retrieve the trawl net.\nIt says, “He was not wearing a restraint arrangement, which would have prevented his fall overboard, nor a PFD, which would have increased his chance of survival once in the water. While the skipper and senior deckhand had extensive fishing experience at sea, the sequence of events that led to the falls overboard and subsequent rescue attempts resulted from poor work practices, infrequent emergency drills, and consequently a lack of familiarity with rescue techniques and equipment.”\nThe Report also points to the stowage and recovery of nets. It says:\n“The stowed nets protruded above the 700mm bulwark and made them vulnerable in adverse weather. Recovery of the nets during fishing was a daily operation for the crew and the nets’ stowage position was unchangeable. The situation changed when Reul a Chuain encountered unexpected bad weather that caused the vessel to roll heavily and an unlashed net to slip overboard. The net recovery operation then changed when the net hook became unusable, and the conditions made rerigging it impractical and risky. The decision to recover the net by hand may have been a logical solution, but it introduced additional 12 risks on the cluttered deck that the crew had not considered. The risk assessments found on board Reul a Chuain appeared to cover the risks associated with the vessel’s operation. Poor stowage of equipment was identified as a hazard and the listed control measure was for equipment to be stowed appropriately and lashed down. Despite this, the nets had not been lashed down at the end of fishing and before starting passage to port.”\nThe report also found that the senior deckhand placed himself in a vulnerable position by standing on top of the nets to pull them in. The report finds:\n“Furthermore, he was neither wearing a safety harness and lifeline to prevent a fall overboard nor a PFD. Once he had fallen overboard, he required assistance to reboard the vessel as there was no foothold. Having seen the senior deckhand fall overboard, the skipper’s action to reach down to help him in the water below was probably instinctive and without thought for his own safety or the consequences. The skipper’s position by the low bulwark, the vessel’s continued rolling and the additional force required to assist the senior deckhand likely caused him to overbalance and then fall overboard, leaving the inexperienced junior deckhand to cope on his own with two men in the water.”\nThe Report examined the survivability in cod water. It says:\n“Survivability in cold water It is likely that the skipper’s initial fall into the water, the effect of the waves and the induced stress and confusion, combined with his later incapacitation due to the lifebuoy around his knees, caused him to inhale water. Reported observations during the attempted resuscitation were consistent with water inhalation.\n“After his initial fall overboard, the skipper would have expended a significant amount of energy trying to remain afloat. Additionally, the cold water would have limited his capacity to operate within minutes of immersion, and cold water shock and hypothermic effects would have caused stress in his system.\n“MAIB statistics have consistently shown that survivability following a man overboard is more likely if a PFD or lifejacket is worn.”\nOn casualty recovery, it found:\n“The junior deckhand had not taken part in a practical man overboard drill on Reul a Chuain and consequently was unaware of the presence of any man overboard recovery equipment. Although the skipper had talked him through emergency scenarios during his time on board, his focus was on operating the fshing gear. The junior deckhand was unprepared to respond when faced with the situation of both his colleagues falling into the water in adverse weather. However, despite unfamiliarity with the operation of the winch, he managed to successfully follow the senior deckhand’s instructions to set it up and use it to recover both men. The junior deckhand subsequently applied his training to perform CPR on the skipper in an attempt to save his life.”\nThe Report also found regulatory oversight:\n“Regulatory oversight The MCA’s 5-yearly surveys and intermediate inspections of Reul a Chuain enabled surveyors to assess the vessel and issue it with a fishing vessel certificate for operation. However, surveyor’s inspections are carried out in port and are thereby limited to the presentation of the vessel, its equipment and paperwork on the day of the survey or inspection. Surveyors do not have oversight of a vessel’s day-to-day operations once it is at sea and cannot know if risk mitigation measures are regularly applied.\n“Reul a Chuain’s safety folder appeared to have been completed correctly; however, risk assessments had not been updated for some time and several risk mitigation measures were not routinely applied by the crew once the vessel was at sea.\n“The permitted low bulwark heights of Reul a Chuain meant that there was an increased risk of falling overboard. There was no requirement to ft safety rails or guard wires as this would have interfered with the operation of the vessel. The alternative was the provision of restraint arrangements where there was a risk of falling overboard. However, the crew did not wear restraint arrangements, and not all the crew routinely wore PFDs when working on deck.”\nThe MAIB Report reaches the conclusions:\nThe net falling over the stern was an emergency situation. The crew became task focused to bring it back on board and did not take a moment to step back and reassess the risks to either themselves or each other.\nThe volume of the trawl nets at the stern resulted in them being above the height of the bulwark in the stowage area; they were not secured, and partially fell overboard when Reul a Chuain rolled in heavy weather. The subsequent net recovery was hampered by the failure of the net hook, which prompted the senior deckhand to put himself in danger to try and help recover the net by hand.\nThe net retrieval operation changed when the hook slipped out, and the process was not fully reassessed for risks. Consequently, when the senior deckhand climbed onto the net he was neither wearing a restraint arrangement nor one of the PFDs that were on board. The senior deckhand fell overboard because he was standing on the net, attempting to bring it back on board, when it slipped overside as the vessel rolled heavily.\nThe skipper fell overboard because he leant over the side while attempting to help the senior deckhand back on board. The vessel was rolling heavily and he was not wearing a fall prevention harness.\nLachlan Robertson died from the effects of immersion in water. His chances of survival would have been improved had he worn his PFD.\nReul a Chuain’s crew had not practised man overboard recovery and were unfamiliar with the vessel’s man overboard recovery equipment. Therefore, the reaction to the senior deckhand going overboard was ineffective.\nReul A Chuain’s low bulwark increased the risk of falling overboard but the vessel had been granted an exemption from the regulations due to its age, type of operations and the mandatory provision of restraint arrangements for the crew. The vessel’s risk assessments recognised this hazard and identifed the use of restraint arrangements and PFDs as mitigation measures.\nThe mitigation measures identified in Reul a Chuain’s risk assessment concerning falling overboard were not routinely implemented on the vessel. Restraint arrangements were not found on board Reul a Chuain by the MAIB during its post-accident investigation.\nThe junior deckhand managed to recover both men, transmit a distress call to the coastguard, perform CPR, and assist search and rescue personnel. These actions were commendable given his limited experience\nRead the MAIB report in full here\nFollow The Fishing Daily\nFollowFollowFollowFollowFollow\nDisclaimer\nSearch for:\nDive into the Marine     "https://thefishingdaily.com/latest-news/crab-fisherman-found-dead-in-sea-authorities-launch-investigation/": "Crab fisherman found dead in sea - Authorities Launch Investigation\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nCrab fisherman found dead in sea – Authorities Launch Investigation\nby Oliver McBride | Aug 16, 2023 | Latest News, Norwegian Fishing Industry\nNorwegian authorities have launched an investigation after a fisherman operating a single-handed crab boat was found dead in the sea\nA fisherman operating a single-handed crab boat lost his life at the weekend after he went overboard from his vessel at the Tanafjord, Finnmark county, in the very north of Norway.\nAs a result of the incident, the Norwegian Safety Investigation Authority has decided to investigate the accident which happened on on 12 August 2023 with the fishing vessel Otterøy. The fishing vessel was found unmanned with the engine running, and later a deceased person was found in the sea.\n“It seems that he was holding onto a buoy in order not to drift away,” says operations manager Robin Fure at the police operations centre in Finnmark.\nClick here to learn more about RESQUNIT\nSignificant resources were dispatched following concerns raised by people onshore, including the Norwegian coastguard helicopter.\nDiscovery of Fisherman\nThe Main Rescue Coordination Centre (HRS) received a report of a missing fisherman at 06:45 on Sunday morning. The rescue helicopter from Banak, the rescue vessel RS “Peter Henry von Koss,” and local fishermen were sent to the location where the boat was registered at its last known AIS position.\nThe missing man in his 60’s was found deceased at approximately 08:40 by a fisherman, as was reported by iFinnmark.\nClung to a buoy\nThe man was found around half past eight near his vessel, a 9.5-metre-long fishing boat.\n“He clung to a buoy attached to a trap. He was transported to Mehamn, where the police have assisted in notifying the closest relatives,” said Operations Leader Robin Fure at the police operations centre in Finnmark, as told to the newspaper Kyst og Fjord.\nThe accident occurred slightly southwest of Kisteneset in Langfjorden, which is a side fjord of Tanafjorden.\nReportedly, the area experienced calm and fair weather.\nThe Finnmark Police has confirmed that an autopsy on the deceased will be carried out as they do not have any information about the cause or time of death.\nFollow The Fishing     "https://thefishingdaily.com/latest-news/fatal-marine-accident-onboard-fv-seimi-reveals-safety-lapses/": "Fatal Marine Accident Onboard FV Séimi Reveals Safety Lapses\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nFatal Marine Accident Onboard FV Séimi Reveals Safety Lapses\nby Oliver McBride | Aug 22, 2024 | Featured News, Irish Fishing Industry, Latest News\nThe FV Séimi at her home harbour, Ballyglass pier, Broadhaven, Co Mayo. An MCIB investigation into a fatal accident onboard the boat found safety lapses\nA marine investigation has revealed critical safety failures following a tragic incident on February 4, 2023, involving the fishing vessel Séimi near Arranmore Island.\nThe Marine Casualty Investigation Board (MCIB) report, released on August 22, 2024, details how a crew member lost his life after being dragged overboard during routine operations.\nThe vessel was engaged in shooting crab pots when the crew member on deck became entangled in the line of the last pot, leading to his swift descent into the cold Atlantic waters. Despite the crew’s immediate response, which included halting the vessel and retrieving the man within 15 minutes, the crew member, who was not wearing a Personal Flotation Device (PFD), could not be resuscitated.\nThe MCIB report highlights several safety shortcomings aboard the Séimi, including the failure to enforce the use of PFDs and the lack of sufficient safety training among the crew. The report notes that while the vessel was compliant with the Code of Practice for vessels under 15 metres, these gaps in safety practices contributed to the fatal outcome.\nThe FV Séimi at Ballyglass pier. Image: MCIB Report\nCLICK HERE SEE MORE INFORMATION ON CATCHAM\nCLICK HERE SEE MORE INFORMATION ON RESQUNIT\nThe incident underscores the importance of stringent safety protocols and adequate training in the fishing industry, particularly for small vessels operating in challenging conditions. The MCIB has issued recommendations aimed at preventing similar tragedies in the future, urging vessel owners to enforce safety regulations more rigorously and ensure that all crew members are adequately trained and equipped.\nAnalysis Summary\nUnsafe Work Practices: Crewmember E wrapped the line attached to a block around his hand to maneuver it. When weight was applied, his hand became trapped, causing him to be dragged overboard. This unsafe system of work was a direct cause of the incident.\nCasualty’s Inexperience and Lack of Training: The casualty was on his fourth trip aboard FV Séimi with limited maritime experience and no formal safety training. His lack of experience and insufficient training contributed to his inability to recognize the dangers, leading to the incident.\nLack of Risk Assessment and Safety Statement: There was no risk assessment or safety statement prepared for the vessel’s activities, as required by the Safety, Health, and Welfare at Work Act 2005. The absence of these safety measures was a contributing factor to the incident.\nNon-Compliance with Basic Safety Training Requirements: At the time of the incident, only two out of five crew members had valid BIM Safety Training Cards, with three crew members lacking basic safety training. The owner and skipper’s failure to ensure all crew members met the minimum safety training standards contributed to the incident.\nFailure to Wear Personal Flotation Devices (PFDs): The casualty was not wearing a lifejacket or PFD when he went overboard, violating legal requirements. The failure to enforce the use of PFDs was another contributing factor to the incident.\nThe Conclusions and Safety Recommendations from the MCIB report on the FV Séimi include the following:\nConclusions:\nThe owner or Master of an Irish registered fishing vessel must ensure sufficient qualified crew are onboard, which was not adhered to on FV Séimi.\nThe validity of the Declaration of Compliance (DoC) is contingent on the vessel being maintained, equipped, and operated in compliance with the Code of Practice (CoP). FV Séimi did not meet these requirements.\nA significant portion of recent MCIB reports involved fishing vessels, indicating a need for greater attention to safety standards onboard such vessels .\nSafety Recommendations:\nRisk Assessment: The owner should conduct a risk assessment covering all onboard work activities, particularly in rough seas.\nSafety Statement: Prepare a safety statement as required by the Safety, Health and Welfare at Work Act 2005.\nOperational Review: Review the procedure for shooting pots, considering automation or developing clear procedures when manual operation is necessary.\nCrew Training: Establish a system for ensuring that both new and existing crew receive necessary onboard training and familiarization before being assigned any potentially dangerous tasks.\nREAD THE FULL INVESTIGATION REPORT INTO A MARINE CASUALTY  INVOLVING THE  FISHING VESSEL SÉIMI BY CLICKING HERE\nFollow The Fishing Daily\nFollowFollowFollowFollowFollow\nDisclaimer\nSearch Pioneer NN200 – Photo: Peter Cook\nThe Marine Accident Investigation Branch has announced that’s it is investigating the incident a fatal incident involving of a man overboard from UK registered fishing vessel approximately 4.5 nautical miles South of Hastings England on Thursday, 29 July 2021.\nThe Coast Guard recovered the fisherman from the sea at around 10:00am on July 29. The man was airlifted to Eastbourne District Hospital where he was later pronounced dead.\nA Sussex Police spokesperson said: “Police were informed by HM Coastguard that a man had been recovered from the sea after falling overboard from commercial fishing vessel off the coast of Hastings on Thursday July 29th at about 10:00am.\n“He had been airlifted to hospital but had sadly died there.\n“His next of kin has been informed and inquiries are ongoing.\nHM Coastguard said its helicopter from Lydd and RNLI lifeboats were called to a ‘mayday broadcast’ related to a fishing vessel with two people on board, south of Hastings at 9.30am.\nA Maritime and Coastguard Agency spokesperson said: “At 9.30am today (29th July), HM Coastguard received a report of a Mayday broadcast from a fishing vessel with two people onboard, south of Hastings.\n“The coastguard helicopter from Lydd and Hastings RNLI lifeboats were sent to assist.\n“One casualty from the vessel was flown to Eastbourne Hospital.”\nThe Marine Accident Investigation Branch announced:\n“We have started a safety investigation into a fatal man overboard from the UK registered fishing vessel Pioneer (NN200), which Photo: Marine Traffic/Ian Greenwood\nThe Marine Accident Investigation Branch will investigate the circumstances which led to the death of a crewman onboard the Honeybourne III PD 905 16 nautical miles southwest of Beachy Head, East Sussex on Friday 06 October last.\nThe man was found dead onboard the UK-registered boat after what has been described by the MAIB as a “failure of fishing gear”.\nSussex Police were notified by HM coastguard of a mayday call being received from a vessel at about 01:40 BST on the morning in question.\nA man was confirmed to have died on the boat, which     "https://thefishingdaily.com/latest-news/nsia-to-investigate-man-overboard-incident-on-norwegian-snow-crabber/": "NSIA to investigate man overboard incident on Norwegian snow crabber\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nemail editor\nFishing News\nFeatures\nSeafood\nPodcasts\nAdvertise\nAbout\nNSIA to investigate man overboard incident on Norwegian snow crabber\nby Oliver McBride | Feb 2, 2023 | Latest News, Norwegian Fishing Industry\nNorwegian Safety Investigation Authority (NSIA) will investigate a fatal man overboard incident on the snow crabber Hunter in the Barents Sea. Photo: Vela Seafood\nThe Norwegian Safety Investigation Authority (NSIA) will investigate a fatal incident on a fishing vessel in the Barents Sea on Monday 30 January last.\nThe fisherman, originally from Latvia and in his 30s, died after falling overboard from the fishing vessel ‘Hunter’ which is affiliated with the fishing company Havøy Kystfiske. The incident took place at around 18.10 local time in stormy conditions as the fishing vessel was shooting pots for snow crab.\nThe Coastguard was immediately contacted and a search and rescue operation was started but the mission was changed to a search and recovery after it was believed the fisherman was dragged overboard by a launched pot and was presumed dead. The pot was hauled, but the missing man was not found.\nThe Hunter was fishing snow crab in an area of the east Barents Sea known by the fleet as good crabbing ground when the accident happened. After searches in the area were exhausted yesterday, Wednesday 01 February, it was confirmed by police the Hunter was on its way back to Tromso harbour in northern Norway.\nThe incident onboard the Hunter brings the number of drowning accidents in Norway during January this year to four, all of whom were men. The other three incidents were:\nA young man in his late teens was found dead in the sea after being reported missing after a party on Averøy in Møre og Romsdal.\nA man in his 60s fell into the sea when he was about to board a fast boat in Abelvær in Trøndelag.\nIn Agder, a man in his 40s died in a diving accident outside Arendal.\nHunter was built in Norway in 1989 and is 45 metres long. The vessel has accommodation for 23 crew members and has a gross tonnage of 840. The vessel can produce both cooked frozen and raw frozen.\nAccording to Marine Traffic, the vessel fished as a trawler in the UK between 2010 and 2013 as UNITY (FR165).\nFollow The Fishing     "https://thephuketexpress.com/2023/04/17/four-bodies-found-after-many-fishing-boats-capsized-in-nakhon-si-thammarat/": "Four Bodies Found After Many Fishing Boats Capsized in Nakhon Si Thammarat - The Phuket Express\nFacebook\nFlipboard\nInstagram\nLinkedin\nPinterest\nTikTok\nTumblr\nTwitter\nYoutube\nHome\nLocal\nNational\nCrime\nSports\nBusiness\nLife\nTraffic\nPolitics\nEvents\nSocial Events\nAdvertise With Us\nSearch\nThe Phuket ExpressReal. Unbiased. Impactful. In the moment.\nBusiness Directory\nThe Phuket ExpressReal. Unbiased. Impactful. In the moment.\nHome\nLocal\nNational\nCrime\nSports\nBusiness\nLife\nTraffic\nPolitics\nEvents\nSocial Events\nAdvertise With Us\nSearch\nBusiness Directory\nHome  Thailand National News  South Thailand  Four Bodies Found After Many Fishing Boats Capsized in Nakhon Si Thammarat\nThailand National NewsSouth ThailandWeather\nFour Bodies Found After Many Fishing Boats Capsized in Nakhon Si Thammarat\nBy Goongnang Suksawat -   Monday, 17 April 2023, 17:57\nShare\nFacebookTwitterReddIt\nNakhon Si Thammarat –\nAt least four bodies were found and six people have been rescued after many local fishing boats capsized in Nakhon Si Thammarat during recent heavy storms.\nThe Nakhon Si Thammarat Public Relation Offices told the Phuket Express that storms hit many parts of Nakhon Si Thammarat on Sunday (April 16th). Waves were up to four meters high in the open sea especially in the Sichon and Tha Sala district in the north of the province and in the Hua Sai and Park Panang district in the south of the province.\nMany local fishing boats were reportedly capsized and many fishermen were reported missing. As of Monday morning (April 17th) at least four bodies were found and six people have been rescued.\nAn air search from the Royal Thai Air Force continues as of press time.\n-=-=-=-=-=-=-=–=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=\nHelp support The Phuket Express in 2023!\nGoongnang SuksawatGoong Nang is a News Translator who has worked professionally for multiple news organizations in Thailand for many years and has worked with The Pattaya News for five years. Specializes primarily in local news for Phuket, Pattaya, and also some national news, with emphasis on translation between Thai to English and working as an intermediary between reporters and English-speaking writers. He said the complainant was notified of the incident by his worker through a walkie-talkie. âThe victim was shot in the head and the body has been sent to the Raja Permaisuri Bainun Hospital in Ipoh for post-mortem,â he said in a statement today. Asean Now Forum Thaiger Talk Forum About The Thaiger Contact Us Play Games at The Thaiger   Advertise       Search for            Subscribe ad-free\nRescuers keep up the search for missing young fisherman in Prachuap Khiri Khan     Tara AbhasakunTuesday, July 25, 2023Last Updated: Tuesday, July 25, 2023 350  1 minute read         Share this article    Facebook    X    LinkedIn    Messenger    Messenger    WhatsApp    Line    Share via Email    Print       Photo via Hua Hin Today.    Photo via Hua Hin Today.  In a concerning turn of events, rescuers are keeping up the search for a 19 year old fisherman who was reported missing at sea in Ao Prachuap, or Prachuap Bay, located in Thailand’s Prachuap Khiri Khan province. The young man, identified as Pokaphon Chomchaw from Bangsaphan district, was reported missing on Sunday. Advertisements\nPokaphon’s disappearance was brought to the authorities’ attention by Wisanu Pinobchay, the owner of the fishing boat Lap. Wisanu reported the disappearance to the National Maritime Law Enforcement Center of Prachuap Khiri Khan, according to Hua Hin Today. Pokaphon was last seen near the Khlong Wan sub-district municipality, approximately 3.5 nautical miles offshore. A swift search and rescue operation was launched, involving 32 local fishing boats, two patrol boats, and two jet skis, all working together to find the missing fisherman.    Related Articles             Thai couple arrested for swindling millionaire out of 21 million baht  11 hours ago             Thai cops shut down illegal steroid lab in Bangkok  11 hours ago        Throughout the day, these dedicated teams conducted thorough searches in an area spanning a 6 to 7-nautical-mile radius from the incident location. Despite their painstaking efforts, Pokaphon has not been located. The vice governor of Prachuap Khiri Khan, Maj. Adisak Noisawan, conveyed his deep concern for the missing man’s family during this trying time. He assured the family that rescuers are putting forth all their efforts to find Pokaphon, and expressed hope for his swift and safe recovery. As the search continues, the rescuers remain determined to locate the young fisherman and are doing everything possible to bring him back to safety. Advertisements\nLast month, a fishing crew member tragically drowned at sea near Prachuap Khiri Khan after resuscitation efforts were unsuccessful. Investigations into the cause of death revealed that the victim was holding onto a net while fishing in the middle of the sea. The rope used to fasten the net broke, which consequently led to the victim being pulled into the sea by the net’s weight.     "https://theugpost.com/fisherman-drowns-while-fleeing-fisheries-protection-unit/": "Fisherman drowns while fleeing Fisheries Protection Unit – The UGPost\nNews\nPolitics\nCrime\nBusiness\nHealth\nEntertainment\nSports\nOpinion\nTravel\nInternational News\nGrants\nConnect with us\nThe UGPost\nNews\nPolitics\nCrime\nBusiness\nHealth\nEntertainment\nSports\nOpinion\nTravel\nInternational News\nGrants\nFisherman drowns while fleeing Fisheries Protection Unit\nShare\nTweet\nAmerican Tourist Dies, Three Injured in Kanungu Road Crash\nPolice Investigating Mob Lynching of Alleged Thief in Kanungu District\nJoint Security Forces Recover 60mm Bomb in Moroto District\nGomba: Father Arrested for Aggravated Defilement of Three Daughters\nCrime\nFisherman drowns while fleeing Fisheries Protection Unit\nBySarah Kobusingye\nPublished on January 10, 2024\nShare\nTweet\nComment\nPolice in Buikwe are investigating the drowning of a fisherman who attempted to escape from the Fisheries Protection Unit on Lake Victoria.\nThe incident occurred on the evening of 8/1/2024 at approximately 20:00 hrs, involving two fishermen identified as Kigongo Gerald, 34 years old, and Kayungo Francis.\nBoth individuals were residents of Kivubu village, Lugoba parish, Ssi Subcounty in Buikwe District. They were engaged in illegal fishing when they encountered officers on patrol, prompting their attempt to flee.\nAccording to SP Hellen Butoto, the PRO for the Ssezibwa Police Region, as the fishermen tried to escape, they jumped into the lake. Fortunately, the officers managed to rescue Kayungo, while Kigongo became entangled in a heavy fishing net and tragically drowned.\nThe lifeless body of the deceased was recovered and handed over to the relatives for burial. Investigations into the circumstances surrounding the incident are currently underway.\nShare this:FacebookXLike this:Like Loading...\nContinue Reading\nYou may also like...\nAmerican Tourist Dies, Three Injured in Kanungu Road Crash\nPolice Investigating Mob Lynching of Alleged Thief in Kanungu District\nJoint Security Forces Recover 60mm Bomb in Moroto District\nGomba: Father Arrested for Aggravated Defilement of Three Daughters\nRelated Topics:Featured, Fisheries Protection Unit, Uganda Police\nSarah Kobusingye\nClick to comment\nLeave a ReplyYour email address will not be published.     "https://ticotimes.net/2022/02/18/crocodile-attack-kills-costa-rica-fisherman": "Crocodile Attack Kills Costa Rica Fisherman :\nFacebook\nInstagram\nTwitter\nYoutube\nLocal News\nCoffee\nSports\nScience and Tech\nLatin America News\nExpat Life\nWeather\nTravel\nWildlife\nTico Shop\nClassifieds\nAdvertise\nSearch\nTico TimesCOSTA RICA\\'S LEADING ENGLISH LANGUAGE NEWSPAPER\nSign in\nWelcome! Get help\nPrivacy\nPassword recovery\nRecover your password\nyour email\nA password will be e-mailed to you.\nNo menu items!\nSign in / Join\nTico TimesSince 1956\nSearch\nCOSTA RICA'S LEADING ENGLISH LANGUAGE NEWSPAPER\nLocal News\nCoffee\nSports\nScience and Tech\nLatin America News\nExpat Life\nWeather\nTravel\nWildlife\nTico Shop\nClassifieds\nAdvertise\nToday in Costa Rica\nUS Begins Mass Deportations with Military Flights to Guatemala\nHistoric Rio Virilla: Site of Costa Rica’s Most Tragic Train Disaster\nCosta Rica Prepares for US Secretary Rubio’s Official Visit\nNew ₡500 Coin in Costa Rica: Design, Features, and Exchange Deadline\nCosta Rica’s President Chaves Welcomes Venezuelan President-Elect González\nHomeCosta RicaCrocodile Attack Kills Costa Rica Fisherman\nCrocodile Attack Kills Costa Rica Fisherman\nBy The Tico Times\nFebruary 18, 2022\nShare\nFacebookTwitterWhatsAppEmail\nIn a rare event in Costa Rica, a local fisherman was attacked by a crocodile, not once but twice, resulting in his death. The angler, Lidier Murillo, 43, was fishing along the Coto River, outside Golfito, when the tragedy occurred.\nAccording to a witness, Murillo was grabbed by the crocodile with is friend Alvaro Rodriguez.  Murillo had waded out into the river mouth while Rodriguez was fishing from shore.\nAccording to local media reports, Murillo cried out for help when the beast grabbed him.  Rodriguez was initially able to reach him but the crocodile soon began to drag them both out to deeper water.\nRodriguez was quickly able to find a heavy piece of wood and began to beat and stab at the crocodile resulting in Murillo being released from its grasp.\nRodriguez pulled his friend out of the water and onshore. However, while he went to get help from other fisherman nearby the crocodile returned to grab Murillo again.\nWith the help of fellow anglers, Rodriguez and the others were able to once again free Murillo and get him to shore.\nUnfortunately, the injuries suffered by Murillo were very severe and by the time ambulances arrived to the remote area, he was pronounced dead on the scene.\nPopular Articles\nUSA And Germany Take Top Honors At Costa Rica Coffee Bowl Tennis Tournament\nLast week marked the 60th edition of the traditional Copa del Café (Coffee Bowl). Narendar of Koovathur, had gone fishing with his relatives Surendar and Naresh when the accident took place. They were travelling in the boat when it capsized in high tide. Narendar came under the boat and the engine hit against his head, leaving him severely injured.His relatives rushed him to the Chengalpet government hospital where he was declared brought dead. The Koovathur police registered a case and are investigating.We also published the following articles recentlyOwners reluctant to insure fishing boats in APMany fishing boats in Andhra Pradesh lack insurance cover and fire-fighting equipment. The recent fire mishap in Vizag fishing harbour highlighted the owners' reluctance to pay high premiums for insurance. There are over 2,000 mechanised fishing boats in the state, with 700 in Vizag fishing harbour alone. The cost of insuring a fishing boat, which can be up to 50 lakh, is not mandatory. However, the high premiums, ranging from 25,000 to 50,000 per year, deter many boat owners. Lower income group fishers are particularly concerned about the expensive marine insurance schemes.Rs 25 crore loss: 45 fishing boats gutted in fire at Vizag fishing harbour45 mechanised fishing boats were reduced to ashes in a fire at Visakhapatnam fishing harbour. No loss of life is reported. The property loss is estimated to be several crores. The fire started during a party on one of the boats or after a fight between two groups of fishermen. The boats were not insured.End of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Visual Stories   PreviousHow to make vrat-friendly Coconut Peanut Chutney at homeFoodHow to make your 'Curry patta' plant grow     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/chennai/fisherman-dies-as-boat-sinks-in-bay-of-bengal/articleshow/109042553.cms": "Fisherman dies as boat sinks in Bay of Bengal | Chennai News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign  regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnapuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesToday's ePapercivic issuescrimepoliticsschool and collegestamil nadu electionscitizen reportervideosphotosweatherNewsCity Newschennai NewsFisherman dies as boat sinks in Bay of BengalTrendingArvind Kejriwal Resignation UpdatesAgra Lucknow Expressway RapeKolkata Murder SC HearingVinesh PhogatMamata BanerjeeSaurabh BharadwajArvind Kejriwal Resignation UpdatesAgra Lucknow Expressway RapeKolkata Murder SC HearingVinesh PhogatMamata BanerjeeSaurabh BharadwajArvind Kejriwal Resignation UpdatesAgra Lucknow Expressway RapeKolkata Murder SC HearingVinesh PhogatMamata BanerjeeSaurabh BharadwajThis story is from April 4, 2024Fisherman dies as boat sinks in Bay of BengalV Ayyappan / TNN /  Apr 4, 2024, 20:31 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us   CHENNAI: A fisherman died and another was missing after a fishing boat with 10 people onboard developed a hole and sank in the Bay of Bengal on Wednesday night. Eight fishermen were rescued. The Indian Coast Guard and three merchant vessels were searching for the missing fisherman. The boat named Periyanayaki that sailed from Chennai developed a hole when it was around 150km off Chennai.Water started entering the boat. The Maritime Rescue Coordination Centre (MRCC) received a distress call. ICG DIG V K Vijayakumar told reporters that the distress call was received in the evening. The Coast Guard diverted a merchant vessel to the location. Around 11.30pm the hole widened, and the boat sank. Eight fishermen were rescued by three merchant -- vessels that were passing by -- in coordination with MRCC. The driver of the boat died. \"A search is on by one Coast Guard ship and three merchant ships in that area for the missing fisherman,\" he added. Coast Guard Ship C-440 brought the rescued fishermen and the body of the dead boat driver to Chennai port.End of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Visual Stories   Previous10 reasons to have 1 pomegranate dailyLifestyleScenic hill station train journeys in North IndiatravelIndiaâs famous tigers and tigresses: The legends of the wildtravelTips for guiding your child to greater happinessLifestyleHow to make South Indian-Style Mysore Masala Dosa at homeFood'Stree 2, 'Aashiqui' and other films of Shraddha Kapoor to watchEntertainmentAI imagines how India's top metros will look like in the next 50 yearsLifestyle15 Indian states and the rice dishes they are famous forFoodHow to extract, store, and apply fresh Aloe Vera to aid hair growthLifestyle8 hybrid animals that were âinventedâ by humansLifestyle Next123Hot PicksArvind Kejriwal Resignation LiveOne Nation, One ElectionPM Narendra Modi BirthdayNew Mini MoonKolkata Murder Hearing LiveHarvest Moon Lunar EclipseNorth Carolina RainfallTOP TRENDINGSC on Bulldozer ActionSSC MTS 2024Hamster Kombat Daily Cipher CodesVince McMahonChampions Trophy FinalAtishiMS DhoniKolkata Rape CaseNEET PG Counselling ScheduleTrump vs KamalaTrending StoriesIn CityEntire WebsiteGK for students: Top 8 Largest Mammals in the WorldArvind Kejriwal Resignation Live Updates: 'Kejriwal will be back', says Atishi after staking claim; BJP questions CM-designate's 'background'India vs China Highlights, Asian Champions Trophy 2024 Final: Jugraj Singh stars as India beat China 1-0 to clinch record fifth titleKolkata Murder Supreme Court Hearing Live Updates: Court extends ex-RG Kar principal Ghosh, cop's custody by 3 daysMaharashtra schools closed on Sep 18: Hereâs whyCommunal tension hits Karnataka towns over Palestinian flags at rallies'If any shame left ...     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/chennai/fisherman-drowns-after-rescuing-duo-off-chennai-coast/amp_articleshow/109847800.cms": "Fisherman Drowns: Fisherman drowns after rescuing duo off Chennai coast | Chennai News - Times of India\nRead Ad-Free on App\nContinue Reading on TOI AppOpenNewsCityGamesEtimesVideosTOI INDTOI USTOI+HomeTop HeadlinesIndiaCity NewsPhotosBusinessWorld CupEntertainmentMovie ReviewsLifestylePodcastsElectionsWeb SeriesSportsTVFoodTravelEventsWorldMusicAstrologyVideosTechAutoEducationFollow Us OnOPEN APPNEWSTOI GAMESVIDEOSCITYINDIABUSINESSWORLDSPEAKING TREETECHCRICKETSPORTSENTERTAINMENTTVVoice Of ConscienceWEB SERIESLIFE & STYLEEDUCATIONThis story is from May 05, 2024Fisherman sacrifices life to save drowning college student in ChennaiCity | TNN | May 5, 2024, 09:08 ISTMurali, a Thiruvottiyur fisherman, drowned after rescuing Santhos...\nRead More\nMurali, a Thiruvottiyur fisherman, drowned after rescuing Santhosh Kumar and Anandan from the sea. The police conducted a post-mortem at Govt Stanley Medical College. Thiruvottiyur police managed the case with a rescue operation.\nRead Less\nShare\nFollow us  CHENNAI: A fisherman helped rescue two people including a college student who were caught in huge waves in the sea off Thiruvottiyur on Friday, but was himself swept out and drowned. Police identified the deceased as Murali, 50, of Ondikuppam in Thiruvottiyur.On Friday evening, Murali was fixing fishnets on the beach when he heard screams for help. He looked out and saw two men struggling in the grip of a big wave and struggling to swim ashore. A few others on the beach came to Murali and two of his friends, who were also mending nets on the shore, and sought help.The three fishermen immediately swam out and managed to bring ashore the two individuals, who police later identified as Santhosh Kumar, a 19-year-old college student, and Anandan, a 26-year-old resident of Thiruvottiyur’s Accountant Street. However, almost immediately after the rescue, Murali was pulled in by another big breaker. His fishermen friends swam out and brought him back to shore before rushing him to a private hospital where doctors declared him dead. Thiruvottiyur police registered a case and sent Murali’s body to Govt Stanley Medical College and Hospital for post-mortem.We also published the following articles recently \"After two-plus years as Murali, I've earned team praise for intoxication portrayal,\" says, Puttakkana Makklu fame Pavan Kumar'Puttakkana Makkalu' presents Sahana-Murali rift. Pavan excels in chaotic scenes with Aroor Jagadesh's mentorship. Pavan values character journey, intense confrontations, and heartwarming moments, keeping viewers engaged. Two kids die after drowning in canal in YamunanagarTwo kids, Mayank and Krish, drowned in Western Jamuna Canal near Chaudhary Devi Lal Herbal Nature Park in Chuharpur village, Yamunanagar. The incident led to a rescue operation by the police and diver Amar Singh. Post-mortem was conducted at the district civil hospital. 13-year-old pulls off risky theft to buy smartphoneA 13-year-old, inspired by C.I.D TV serial, executed a daring theft in Surat to buy a smartphone.     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/chennai/three-fishermen-missing-after-boat-from-tn-capsizes-in-sea/articleshow/104046620.cms?from=mdr": "Three fishermen missing after boat from TN capsizes in sea | Chennai News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOICitychennaimumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkataagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesToday's ePapertamil nadu electionsphotosweatherNewsCity Newschennai NewsThree fishermen missing after boat from TN capsizes in seaTrendingKolkata Rape and Murder CaseManish SisodiaBastar Maoist HideoutMaharashtra Stamp Duty HikeYogi AdityanathBaramati Student MurderKolkata Rape and Murder CaseManish SisodiaBastar Maoist HideoutMaharashtra Stamp Duty HikeYogi AdityanathBaramati Student MurderKolkata Rape and Murder CaseManish SisodiaBastar Maoist HideoutMaharashtra Stamp Duty HikeYogi AdityanathBaramati Student MurderThis story is from September 29, 2023Three fishermen missing after boat from TN capsizes in seaArockiaraj Johnbosco / TNN /  Sep 29, 2023, 18:23 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us  Representative image  MADURAI: Three fishermen from the Colachel area in Kanyakumari district of Tamil Nadu went missing after a fishing boat capsized in midsea on Thursday night. The fishing boat -- Suja Mol -- sailed from Colachel fishing harbour on September 25 with 16 fishermen, including six north Indians, onboard.While they were fishing 38 nautical miles off the Kanyakumari coast, the boat capsized after being caught in a huge tidal wave.According to accounts of fishermen, the fishermen were unloading a rather handsome haul of catch on the trawler when they were hit by the huge wave. The wave hit the astern and filled the deck with water. The boat tilted dangerously at the astern before another massive wave hit the boat. All the fishermen aboard were thrown into the sea. The fishermen did not have time to reach out to their VHF wireless sets to send out an SOS. Other boats in the vicinity saw Suja Mol taking water and sinking astern down. They rushed to the aid of fishermen. Three boats pulled out 13 fishermen, eight on one boat, four on another and one fisherman -identified as Michael â on yet another boat. Michael was brought ashore by the trawler -- that sailed from Chinnamuttom harbour -- by Friday evening. He was taken to his house in Colachel, and the family admitted him to a private hospital later. Meenavar Orunginaippu Sangam Secretary Johnson Charles said the other 12 rescued fishermen were likely to reach Colachel by Friday night. The Indian Coast Guard was alerted. Coast Guard Ship Atulya based in Tuticorin Coast Guard station was directed to assist in the search operations. The ship reached the accident spot. âAlong with the shop, some 20 trawlers that were in the vicinity are also looking out for three fishermen who went missing,â said Charles. The fishermen fear that these missing fishermen should have been caught in the net and trapped in the sinking boat. âThe boat is lying at the bottom of the sea, at least 50 metre deep. We have requested divers from Tuticorin but they canât dive beyond 20 metre. We need saturation divers who can dive deeper. We are appealing to the Indian Navy to provide their experts to search for our missing fishers in the wreckage of the boat lying at the bottom of the sea,â added Charles. The deceased has been identified as M Mohan Kumar, 23, of Avarangkadu near Pallipalayam in Namakkal district. Mohan was visiting his relative in Poolampatti, with his friend R Boopathi, 23, on Wednesday. Around 6pm the duo went to the Cauvery river for a bath.Mohan Kumar entered the river while Boopathi was standing on a rock. About the same time, a fisherman, identified as K Perumal, 45, from Poolampatti threw a country-made into the river. âThe bomb suddenly blast underwater,â said Boopathi. Mohan Kumar sustained injuries and died on the spot. It is learnt that Perumal used low density, country-made bombs to catch big fish from the river. Following an inquiry, police managed to nab Perumal during the early hours of Thursday. âThe fisherman admitted that he used the country-made bomb for fishing,â said a police official from Poolampatti police station. He added that Perumal was arrested based on his confession. A case has been registered and further inquiry is on. Police on Monday arrested two persons in connection with the crime.Ram Prasad Das (54) and Panu Das (41) are the arrested persons. The accused were arrested by Munambam police. The case pertains to the death of West Bengal native Alla (30) on Saturday.It was initially reported that he had slipped and fell into the water. The body was found near Munambam harbour on Sunday morning.A primary assessment by the police led by inspector M Vishwambharan found that the death was suspicious and a detailed probe was launched, police said. According to the police, the accused had an argument with the victim over money and they thrashed him after that. The accused later pushed him into the lake, police said.Sub-inspectors M Aneesh, T K Rajeev, ASI M V Rasmi, V S Suneesh Lal, and SCPO K R Sudheeshan were part of the investigation team.Man arrested for sexual assault bid: A 43-year-old man was arrested for allegedly attempting to sexually assault and murder a woman by breaking into her house at Oonnukal on Monday. The arrested person has been identified as Jaison Mathew (43) of Neriamangalam. The attack happened on Sunday evening. The accused attempted the crime when the woman was alone at her house, police said.We also published the following articles recentlyStreet crime: Call for more patrolling by police, faster arrestsThe police force in Ghaziabad has undergone significant changes since the introduction of the commissionerate system. However, recent street crimes, including a fatal snatching incident, have raised concerns among residents about the effectiveness of policing on the ground. The low rate of arrests is also a cause for worry. Residents have called for increased police visibility in areas prone to crime. The police commissioner has assured that steps will be taken to address these concerns, including increased patrols and the formation of special teams to tackle street crimes.Andhra Pradesh: Police arrest six in murder case of 54-year-old woman at KuppamSix individuals have been arrested in connection with the murder of a 54-year-old woman in Kuppam, Andhra Pradesh. The main suspect, identified as K Poornachand, and his father had previously borrowed money from the victim's husband, and they recently repaid the debt. Poornachand, with the help of five others, planned to rob the woman, who lived alone, under the assumption that she had a significant amount of cash and gold. They attacked and killed her, stealing her jewelry and cash. The police formed special teams and arrested the suspects within 10 days of the crime.21-year-old woman's parents plot her kidnapping; Mumbai Police arrests twoTwo people have been arrested by Mumbai Police for kidnapping a 21-year-old woman outside the Bandra family court. The woman and her husband had visited the court to correct a discrepancy in the husband's caste certificate when she was abducted. The police tracked down the kidnappers through CCTV footage and discovered that the lawyer was the wife of one of the accused.     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/madurai/body-of-missing-fisherman-recovered-at-pamban/articleshow/99021950.cms": "Pamban: Body Of Missing Fisherman Recovered At Pamban | Madurai News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign  regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnapuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesToday's ePaperweathertamil nadu electionsNewsCity Newsmadurai NewsBody of missing fisherman recovered at PambanTrendingKolkata Doctor RapeGoa European Girl RapeNarendra Modi Noida VisitSanjauli Mosque RowGurgaon Delhi Route ClosureShivajinagar Metro StationKolkata Doctor RapeGoa European Girl RapeNarendra Modi Noida VisitSanjauli Mosque RowGurgaon Delhi Route ClosureShivajinagar Metro StationKolkata Doctor RapeGoa European Girl RapeNarendra Modi Noida VisitSanjauli Mosque RowGurgaon Delhi Route ClosureShivajinagar Metro StationThis story is from March 27, 2023Body of missing fisherman recovered at PambanTNN /  Mar 27, 2023, 08:18 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us   Madurai: The body of a fisherman, who fell into the sea on March 20, was recovered in a decomposed state at Pamban on Sunday. A spot post-mortem was conducted and the body was handed over to his family. The deceased, R Pandi Muneeswaran from Therkuvadi in Pamban, fell into the sea from a country boat while transporting fuel from Pamban fishing jetty to a mechanized trawler anchored a nautical mile away from the shore.Fishermen and Coastal Security Group (marine) police took out a search, but could not trace Muneeswaran. A man-missing case was filed with the marine police. Under these circumstances, a body was found at Pamban fishing jetty on Sunday. Investigation revealed that it was Muneeswaran and police altered the case into a case of suspicious death. He was last seen on Friday evening. His absence was noticed by other crew members around 8.45pm that day. A Christian, 51, from Chinnathurai was part of the 11-member crew of fishing boat Felaxiya, owned by Austin Jose. Felaxiya sailed from Kochi harbour on April 5. âWe received a call from the boat through a satellite phone that Christian was missing,â said Rethi John, brother of Christian. John said that the boat ownerâs brother told them that he had alerted the local fisheries and marine police officials. However, the family members are worried since it has been three days and they are not able to reach the boat owner. âWe have been appealing to the authorities to look out for him,â said John. Justin Antony from International Fishermen Development Trust said that the coordinates of the boat when the crew noticed Christianâs absence were relayed to the Indian Coast Guardâs (ICG) Maritime Rescue Coordination Centre. âWe suspect that he should have fallen 15 or 20 minutes before the crew realized that he was missing,â said Antony. ICG communicated to the family members that it had directed its ship Sajag to launch a search for Christian and undertake a surface search. A case of accidental death was registered by Arnala police. Image used for representational purpose only  MUMBAI: A fisherman died of cardiac stroke mid-sea at Arnala in Virar (W) on Thursday evening. A case of accidental death was registered by Arnala police. Vijay Tare (45) along with 16 workers had gone fishing at Arnala. They were in the boat âNisargaâ, when Tare complained of uneasiness in the evening. The workers onboard got in touch with other boats only by midnight.Tare was taken to the Arnala shore by 5am. He was taken to the hospital but declared dead before admission. Police said the autopsy report was awaited. tnnEnd of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Visual Stories   PreviousHow to make easy dump & dine Tofu Salad for dinnerFoodHow to grow Blueberries in home The fishermen went missing after their anchored boats capsized at the Nava Bandar fishing port near Una in Gir Somnath district due to inclement weather.Coast Guard, Navy, marine police and NDRF teams are still searching for the other six fishermen. The boats anchored at the port collided with each other due to stormy weather in the wee hours of Thursday. While some of the fishermen were sleeping inside the boats others were preparing to sail when the weather suddenly worsened. At least 10 boats were totally destroyed and 40 other boats were partially damaged.End of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Visual Stories   Previousâ10 heaviest animals on EarthLifestyle8 plants that look best in hanging pots and basketsLifestyle9 animals that start hibernating in OctoberLifestyleââHow to make Vrat-friendly South Indian-style curd rice for NavratriâFoodExpert tips to boost brainpower in kids during their growing yearsLifestyleHow to make Sweet Potato Cutlets for vrat feastingFood8 tiger sanctuaries in India that are best explored by jeeptravelA 7-day Himachal itinerary for Navratri long weekendtravelDurga Puja 2024: Mouni Roy's pujo-perfect drapes that redefine graceEntertainmentThis iron-calcium rich Ragi Gajar Paratha is perfect for a strong immunityFood Next123 Photostories  Bigg Boss 18: Confirmed list of the contestants of Salman Khan hosted controversial show5 countries with the best anti-aircraft missile systems in the worldâBigg Boss Tamil 8: Confirmed list of contestants of Vijay Sethupathi hosted show Bigg Boss Tamil 8âBigg Boss 18: From Shehzada Dhami making serious allegations against Rajan Shahi to Alice Kaushik opening up about her parentsâ demise: Major highlights from the show5 types of people one should completely avoid for peace in life, as per psychology10 most powerful countries in the world in 20245 minimalist habits to stop wasting your timeâ10 most educated countries of the worldâFrom Aamir Khan's warm surprise with son Junaid to a musical tribute;     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/thiruvananthapuram/fisherman-dies-as-boat-capsizes/articleshow/91605499.cms": "Anchuthengu: Fisherman Dies As Boat Capsizes | Thiruvananthapuram News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign  regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnapuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichyudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesToday's ePaperkerala electionsphotosweatherNewsCity Newsthiruvananthapuram NewsFisherman dies as boat capsizesTrendingArvind Kejriwal Resignation UpdatesYoungest Woman Chief Minister AtishiKolkata Doctor Rape MurderKakkathope Balaji KilledSameer KhanPalestinian Flag Waved During EIDArvind Kejriwal Resignation UpdatesYoungest Woman Chief Minister AtishiKolkata Doctor Rape MurderKakkathope Balaji KilledSameer KhanPalestinian Flag Waved During EIDArvind Kejriwal Resignation UpdatesYoungest Woman Chief Minister AtishiKolkata Doctor Rape MurderKakkathope Balaji KilledSameer KhanPalestinian Flag Waved During EIDThis story is from May 17, 2022Fisherman dies as boat capsizesTNN /  May 17, 2022, 03:24 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us  A fisherman drowned after his boat capsized off Anchuthengu coast near here on Monday. The deceased has been identified as Babu Antony (54) from Puthenmanna in Anchuthengu. The incident occurred around 5.  Thiruvananthapuram: A fisherman drowned after his boat capsized off Anchuthengu coast near here on Monday. The deceased has been identified as Babu Antony (54) from Puthenmanna in Anchuthengu. The incident occurred around 5.45am when he went out for fishing in the sea along with his two other friends Robin and Prince.Robin and Prince have sustained injuries.The boat capsized about 50m away from the coastal area near Anchuthengu Mosque.According to Anchuthengu coastal police, fishermen were advised to stay extra vigilant and not to go fishing till the weather became calm. Police said strong winds and rain caused the boat to capsize. Two of them have sustained injuries and one person suffered injuries in his leg . Both returned home after taking primary treatment.Presently, Antonyâs body is being kept at the mortuary of Chirayinkeezhu hospital and it will be brought to his residence on Tuesday. He leaves behind his wife and his two daughters.Meanwhile, three missing fishermen from Kerala were located at the western coast of Tamil Nadu, a day after they had gone fishing. The three fishermen Meera Sahib, Mohammed Hanifa and Anwar started their journey from Vizhinjam coast by 4pm on Saturday. They were supposed to return by 11pm but they did not show up even after midnight. The Vizhinjam coastal police said that the fishermen were rescued by fishermen from Kanyakumari district and were brought to Colachel town. A press note issued by the defence PRO said that under rough sea conditions, the Coast Guard ship transferred all the three fishermen and taken them on board the ship.End of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Visual Stories   Previous10 reasons to have 1 pomegranate dailyLifestyleScenic hill station train journeys in North IndiatravelIndiaâs famous tigers and tigresses: The legends of the wildtravelTips for guiding your child to greater happinessLifestyleHow to make South Indian-Style Mysore Masala Dosa at homeFood'Stree 2, 'Aashiqui' and other films of Shraddha Kapoor to watchEntertainmentAI imagines how India's top metros will look like in the next 50 yearsLifestyle15 Indian states and the rice dishes they are famous forFoodHow to extract, store, and apply fresh Aloe Vera to aid hair growthLifestyle8 hybrid animals that were âinventedâ by humansLifestyle Next123Hot PicksJK Assembly elections 2024 LiveHarvest Moon Lunar EclipsePuducherry BandhLebanon Pagers ExplosionIsrael MossadNew Mini MoonIAS Tina DabiTOP TRENDINGChandrayaan 4Ricky PontingDelta AirlinesSalvatore SchillaciHamster Kombat Daily Cipher CodesTupperware BrandsNEET PG Counselling ScheduleElon Musk NeuralinkSakshi MalikBarron TrumpTrending StoriesIn CityEntire WebsiteGK for students: 7 Fascinating Features of These Unique Birds'Wearing undergarments must but...': Delta's 'specific' memo for flight attendantsWe're 'disturbed' by findings of CBI's RG Kar report: SCWhat are pagers? The deceased is Johny, a resident of Puthukurichy. The boat capsized at 3.30am when Johny and the other five fishermen ventured into the sea for fishing. At that time, the sea was very rough.However, the other five fishermen managed to swim safely to the shore. But Johny went missing.The fishermen and others from a nearby boat attempted to rescue Johny initially, but the forceful waves thwarted their efforts. His body was later found near a cliff and shifted to the nearby hospital. Later, his body was transferred to Chirayinkeezh Taluk Hospital. The body was later handed over to relatives.Meanwhile, the Latin Catholic Church association has warned the state govt that the fishermen would go for a protest if the ongoing issue at Muthalapozhi is not resolved.The fishermen of the area said the sea has been rough, and the unscientific way the harbour was built has increased the severity of accidents.For the past nine years, there have been more than 60 incidents of fishermen drowning at Muthalapozhi and nearby seas, according to the local fishermen. The fishermen have been raising the complaint that faulty construction of the harbour is one of the main reasons behind the surging incidents of drowning at Muthalapozhi. They maintain that sand has been accumulating alarmingly at the mouth of the âpozhiâ, reducing the manoeuvrability of the vessels.We also published the following articles recentlyFishermen seek policy changes, devpt authorityVisakhapatnam fishermen community faces migration issues, demands modern boats, subsidies, and classification under MBC category for equitable access to opportunities. The YSRCP government in Andhra Pradesh is implementing measures for their development.Five fishermen detained by Sri Lanka return India: Indian High CommissionFive Indian fishermen detained by the Sri Lankan Navy returned to India as announced by the Indian High Commission in Colombo. Repatriated from Sri Lanka to Chennai, they held a symbolic strike demanding action from the central government.21 dead, 23 missing after boat capsizes off Djibouti: Report21 migrants died, 23 missing in Djibouti boat capsize. UN migration agency reported tragic incident. 77 involved, incl. children. Representative image THIRUVANANTHPURAM: A 41-year-old fisherman drowned after the boat he was on board capsized in the sea off Mampally coast around 3.30pm on Sunday.The deceased was identified as Walter, son of John of Chayakkada Purayidam at Mampally in Anchuthengu.Police said there were four others on the boat, including Walter. The accident occurred some 30m off the coast after the boat capsized in a strong wave.The other three swam to safety. By not seeing Walter, they all jumped into the sea again in search of Walter and recovered his body. He was declared dead at Chirayinkeezhu taluk hospital. The autopsy will be held on Monday and the body will be released to the family after that. Anchuthengu coastal police registered a case under Section 174 of the CrPC.End of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Visual Stories   Previous9 easy-to-do yoga poses that improve memory and intelligenceLifestyleHow to make South Indian-style Rava Masala Dosa at homeFood10 baby girl names that mean 'beauty'Lifestyle10 most stylish sarees of Janhvi KapoorLifestyle10 baby boy names that mean \"gift from god\"Lifestyle10 Indiaâs most visited natural destinationstravel10 places in the hills to visit in November before it gets too coldtravelHow to use Turmeric (Haldi) for weight lossLifestyle8 life lessons that humans can learn from animalsLifestyle8 foods that Ratan Tata loved the mostFood Next123 Photostories  âCommon mistakes why magnesium supplements do not workâWalnut vs. almonds: Which is healthier and how much to consume?5 dry fruits that help reduce uric acid levels naturallyFrom a lavish 8 BHK to high-end car collection, a net worth approximately Rs 130 crore and more;     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/thiruvananthapuram/fisherman-killed-as-boat-capsizes/articleshow/84304087.cms": "Fisherman killed as boat capsizes | Thiruvananthapuram News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOICitythiruvananthapurammumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichyudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesToday's ePaperkerala electionsphotosweatherNewsCity Newsthiruvananthapuram NewsFisherman killed as boat capsizesTrendingDelhi Doctor Shot DeadHaryana PollsNoida College ShockerGujrat School Principal SuspendedRam Rahim SinghMaharashtra Medical CollegeDelhi Doctor Shot DeadHaryana PollsNoida College ShockerGujrat School Principal SuspendedRam Rahim SinghMaharashtra Medical CollegeDelhi Doctor Shot DeadHaryana PollsNoida College ShockerGujrat School Principal SuspendedRam Rahim SinghMaharashtra Medical CollegeThis story is from July 11, 2021Fisherman killed as boat capsizesTNN /  Jul 11, 2021, 04:18 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us  John Paul and fellow fishermen were returning to the shore after a nightlong fishing trip Thiruvananthapuram: A 40-year-old fisherman died on Saturday after his motorized boat failed and was caught in strong waves off the coast of Perumathura. John Paul of Ennakkidangu Purayidam House, Anchuthengu is the deceased. According to the police, the mishap occurred around 10.30am while Paul and fellow fishermen were returning to the shore after a nightlong fishing trip.He was part of a three-member crew that had set out into the sea from Anchughengu in a small boat fitted with an outboard engine. Paul was the one who was operating the outboard motor of the boat.The two fishermen who survived the mishap told the police that as the boat reached a distance of around three kilometres from the shore, its engine failed. However, strong winds and the current helped them drift close to the shore near Perumathura, around 500m south of the Muthalapozhi breakwater here. But, as they got closer to the shore, the intensity of the waves got stronger. They realized that the boat would crash against the shore owing to strong waves. Had it happened, the survival chances would have been lower. Hence they decided to abandon the boat and swim to the shore. While the two others managed to swim to safety, Paul could not. He drowned just a few metres away from the shore. His friends immediately dived back into the sea and helped him get to the shore. He was rushed to Chirayinkeezh Government District Hospital, but the doctors declared him dead on arrival. The police suspect that besides the strong waves, exhaustion might also have played a key role in the death of Paul. His friends told the police that until the moment they decided to abandon the boat, Paul was desperately trying to repair the motor and restart it. Paul is the fourth person to lose life in the sea at Anchuthengu. Three weeks ago, a five-year-old boy had died after he was swept away by strong waves while standing close to the sea along with his brother. Two days later, a 19-year-old man drowned after his boat capsized near Perumathura. A week later, a 57-year-old fisherman died after his boat capsized at the mouth of Muthalapozhi breakwater, which is a danger zone for the fishermen using small boats. All these mishaps, including the death of Paul on Saturday, have happened while the district collectorâs warning to stay away from the sea based on weather alerts was in effect. The collector had issued a warning on Friday asking fishermen not to venture into the sea till Tuesday after India Meteorological Department predicted strong winds with speed ranging from 40 to 45 km/hour along the coasts of Kerala, Karnataka and Lakshadweep. The collector has on Saturday extended the ban till Wednesday.End of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Visual Stories   Previous9 things that make Areca Palm the perfect indoor plantLifestyleSoaked moong dal benefits: 10 benefits for eating this energy powerhouse for breakfastLifestyleHow to make South Indian stye Paneer Dosa at homeFoodThe 8 perfect steps to grow âDhaniyaâ in the kitchen gardenLifestyle10 baby girl names that sound royalLifestyle15 Indian states and their famous state animalstravel10 delicious Indian dishes that can be made with raw bananaFoodHow to make protein-rich Lahori Paneer KormaFood8 fruits and veggies that can help get rid of eye glassesLifestyle10 green vegetables that have highest protein contentLifestyle Next123 Photostories  From being 3 months pregnant while sitting on the hotseat to her son calling Amitabh Bachchan 'dadu';     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/thiruvananthapuram/fisherman-killed-in-boat-capsizing-at-muthalapozhi-harbour/articleshow/111151737.cms": "Fisherman: Fisherman killed in boat capsizing at Muthalapozhi harbour | Thiruvananthapuram News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOICitythiruvananthapurammumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichyudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesToday's ePaperkerala electionsphotosweatherNewsCity Newsthiruvananthapuram NewsOne more fisherman killed as boat capsizesTrendingDelhi CRPF School BlastOnline Nikah Ceremony UPBengaluru RainsPublic Holiday November 1Mamnoor AirportHaryana Ministers PortfoliosDelhi CRPF School BlastOnline Nikah Ceremony UPBengaluru RainsPublic Holiday November 1Mamnoor AirportHaryana Ministers PortfoliosDelhi CRPF School BlastOnline Nikah Ceremony UPBengaluru RainsPublic Holiday November 1Mamnoor AirportHaryana Ministers PortfoliosThis story is from June 21, 2024One more fisherman killed as boat capsizesTNN /  Jun 21, 2024, 05:01 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us   Thiruvananthapuram: Accidents at Muthalapozhi harbour continue unabated as another fisherman lost his life after the boat in which he was travelling along with three others capsized in a strong wave on Thursday morning.The others escaped with minor injuries as they were able to swim back to the shore. The deceased Victor Thomas, 53, of Puthumanal Purayidam near Mambally at Anchuthengu, also tried to swim back to the shore along with them, but he went missing in a huge wave and his body was later recovered from the sea.With his death the total number of fishermen, who lost lives in the area, has crossed 80, said Eugine Periera, vicar general of Latin Archdiocese.He termed the death of Victor murder as the state govt is solely responsible for it. He was speaking after inaugurating the protest staged by the Kerala Latin Catholic Association in front of the legislative assembly. âDuring the end of our 140-day strike recently, the govt promised us seven remedies to solve the issues of the fishermen. Following it discussions were held and the fisheries minister promised us to hold an all-party meeting . But nothing has been done so far,â said Eugine.Owing to the pressure exerted by the fishermen, the CWPRS was asked to hold a study, he added.âOn the basis of this study, the state govt sent a proposal to the Centre worth just Rs 50 crore for curbing the mess. However, the Centre rejected the project by terming it a farce and later a new proposal worth Rs 164 crore was submitted. No proper discussion has been done on it later. Till we get a precise response from the govt, we will not withdraw from the strike,â said Eugine.We also published the following articles recentlyBihar: Boat capsizes in Ganga river at Barh in Patna, 13 rescued so far, 4 missingA boat carrying 17 passengers capsized in the Ganga river near Umanath ganga ghat in Patna. 11 rescued, 6 missing.     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/thiruvananthapuram/one-more-life-lost-at-muthalapozhi-harbour/articleshow/104200808.cms?from=mdr": "Fisherman: One More Life Lost At Muthalapozhi Harbour | Thiruvananthapuram News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOICitythiruvananthapurammumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichyudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesToday's ePaperkerala electionsphotosweatherNewsCity Newsthiruvananthapuram NewsOne more life lost at Muthalapozhi harbourTrendingHapur Boy Gang RapedPanvel Railway TrackDelhi Vasant Kunj SuicideDelhi Rangpuri DeathsTamilnadu Apartment Ownership ActIT Employee DeathHapur Boy Gang RapedPanvel Railway TrackDelhi Vasant Kunj SuicideDelhi Rangpuri DeathsTamilnadu Apartment Ownership ActIT Employee DeathHapur Boy Gang RapedPanvel Railway TrackDelhi Vasant Kunj SuicideDelhi Rangpuri DeathsTamilnadu Apartment Ownership ActIT Employee DeathThis story is from October 6, 2023One more life lost at Muthalapozhi harbourTNN /  Oct 6, 2023, 08:32 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us   Thiruvananthapuram: In yet another accident at Muthalapozhi harbour, a fisherman was killed after the boat in which he was travelling capsized after being hit by a strong wave on Thursday morning.The deceased has been identified by police as Noushad, 44, a Puthukurichy native. The others in the boat swam to the shore but Noushad, who received severe head injuries in the accident, did not survive.The accident took place when the fishermen were coming back from the sea after a fishing expedition. The boat broke into two in the accident.Noushad, who fell into the sea, was rescued alive by fishermen in a nearby boat. He was soon rushed to a nearby hospital and later shifted to the Medical College Hospital, where he was declared brought dead. Anchuthengu police registered a case under section 174 of CrPC for unnatural death over the incident.As per the fishermen in the area, this is the 25th accident that took place at the harbour in a span of 90 days. Soil and stone deposits at the harbour were indicated as the cause of the frequent accidents at the harbour, says a study conducted by the Janakeeya Padanasamithi. The study report also recommended immediate dredging works at the harbour to increase its depth.As per the pact signed by Adani Group with the harbour engineering department, the group is responsible to clear the sand and stones being deposited at the harbour. The state government had also promised that through sand bypassing technology stone and sand deposits will be removed from the harbour on a permanent basis at a cost of Rs 11 crore.We also published the following articles recentlyRailway work not complete, trans-harbour services hitSuburban train services on the Trans-harbour line between Belapur and Panvel stations in Mumbai were suspended due to non-completion of scheduled work during a block period. This is the second time in a week that commuters have faced inconvenience due to delays in completing work during scheduled mega blocks. Passengers were forced to travel on the Harbour line trains, which were also running late.Harbour lacks crane, annoyed Godinho to seek Centres helpThe Mormugao Ports Authority (MPA) is struggling to invest in a mobile harbour crane, hindering cargo container movement. Mauvin Godinho, the industries minister, expressed his frustration and stated that he will ask the Centre for intervention. Godinho emphasized the importance of addressing this issue promptly, as it is affecting the port's profitability, the economy, and the industry. The lack of a harbour crane discourages container vessels from operating at Mormugao and forces local manufacturers to transport cargo through alternate means. Godinho plans to discuss the matter with the chief minister and the Union minister for shipping and ports.Three fishermen missing after boat from TN capsizes in seaThree fishermen are missing after their boat capsized off the coast of Tamil Nadu. The boat, Suja Mol, was caught in a large tidal wave while 38 nautical miles from the shore. The fishermen were unable to send an SOS and were thrown into the sea. Thirteen fishermen were rescued by nearby boats, but three are still missing. The Indian Coast Guard and local fishermen are searching for the missing fishermen, but dive teams are needed to search the wreckage at the bottom of the sea.End of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA
