Anil Jose, 44, of Cheriyathura near Beemapally went for fishing on Monday along with 14 Tamil Nadu natives in a boat, named Samuel, owned by a Tamil Nadu native.When the boat came back after fishing on Tuesday night, it was found that he was missing. During the search conducted to find him, his body was found some 600-nautical mile off the coast. Anil had went missing off Azheekkal coast and the body was brought to Vizhinjam police station.âIt still remains a mystery how he fell into the sea. We have sent samples for chemical examination and more details will be known only later. A case is registered under section 174 of CrPC for unnatural death,â police said. Police are also investigating whether there was a clash with other fishermen on the boat. Anil Jose was staying with his mother and brother at his house, as his wife was not on good terms with him. He has no children. We also published the following articles recentlyKanyakumari boat tragedy: Third fishermans body washed ashoreThe body of the last missing fisherman from the ill-fated fishing boat Suja Mol has been found washed ashore on Rameswaram island, 12 days after the incident. The body was identified by a steel plate in his hand and was later confirmed by the family. The fishing boat sank off the Kanyakumari coast on September 28 due to a tidal wave, resulting in the loss of three fishermen. The Meenavar Orunginaippu Sangam has requested the government to provide compensation to the families of the deceased fishermen.Feb 1931 Azad encounter record found on tattered paper in UP police stn's registerA historical register from 1931 containing details of an FIR against revolutionary Chandrashekhar Azad has been discovered in a police station in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh. The register, partially eaten by termites, has been framed and displayed on a wall. The FIR was filed after a police encounter in which Azad was shot multiple times but managed to escape capture. He later shot himself to avoid capture by British police. The register is being preserved without altering its originality.KL Rahul is back to his original self: Anil KumbleFormer Indian spinner Anil Kumble has praised batter KL Rahul for his performance in the ICC Cricket World Cup opener against Australia. Kumble highlighted Rahul's ability to play spin and handle pressure in the middle order. Rahul's return to form and his understanding of his role as a middle-order batter has impressed Kumble. In 14 ODIs this year, Rahul has scored 628 runs at an average of 78.50. In the match against Australia, he scored an unbeaten 97 and formed a crucial partnership with Virat Kohli.End of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Visual Stories   Previous9 most unique and rare birds in the worldLifestyle10 foods that contain highest protein per 100 gramsLifestyle8 Indian cities where non-vegetarian food is bannedFoodHow to make South-Indian style Chicken PakoraFood10 lines from Shakespeare's sonnets that are profound life lessonsLifestyleMost beautiful hill stations in the Western Ghats for a serene vacationtravel8 yoga poses that can reduce waist size effectivelyLifestyle7 home remedies to remove yellow stains from teethLifestyle10 books that will help transform your life in the next 3 monthsLifestyleGanesh Chaturthi 2024: 10 South Indian dishes to make for Lord GaneshaFood Next123Hot PicksFastest Trains in the WorldWho is Jared IsaacmanAlberto FujimoriHaitian ImmigrantsStock Market TodayShimla Mosque ViolenceAyushman Bharat Insurance SchemeTOP TRENDINGCSIR UGC NET 2024 ResultsSitaram YechuryIphone 16 vs Iphone 15Vande Bharat Express TrainLargest Mammals in the WorldSunil GavaskarHamster Kombat Daily Cipher CodesShimla Mosque RowKing CharlesDiljit Dosanjh Concert Tickets OnlineTrending StoriesIn CityEntire WebsiteBreathtaking cosmic catwalk!     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/trichy/fisherman-dies-after-boat-capsize/articleshow/80355151.cms": "Fisherman dies after boat capsize | Trichy News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign  regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnapuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsuratthiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesToday's ePaperweathertamil nadu electionsNewsCity Newstrichy NewsFisherman dies after boat capsizeTrendingArvind Kejriwal Resignation UpdatesYoungest Woman Chief Minister AtishiKolkata Doctor Rape MurderKakkathope Balaji KilledSameer KhanPalestinian Flag Waved During EIDArvind Kejriwal Resignation UpdatesYoungest Woman Chief Minister AtishiKolkata Doctor Rape MurderKakkathope Balaji KilledSameer KhanPalestinian Flag Waved During EIDArvind Kejriwal Resignation UpdatesYoungest Woman Chief Minister AtishiKolkata Doctor Rape MurderKakkathope Balaji KilledSameer KhanPalestinian Flag Waved During EIDThis story is from January 20, 2021Fisherman dies after boat capsizeTNN /  Jan 20, 2021, 04:05 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us   Mayiladuthurai:A 30-year-old fisherman from Sirkazhi in Mayiladuthurai district died after a mechanized boat capsized near the shore in the Bay of Bengal on Tuesday. Marine police identified the deceased as Vijayabalan, a native of Vanagiri fishing hamlet near Sirkazhi. Another fisherman, Kaliappan of the same village, was preparing to venture into the sea on his mechanised fibre boat along with nine others including Vijayabalan.As they were moving the trawler into the sea from the shore, the boat capsized suddenly. In the incident Vijayabalan came under the trawler injuring his head severely. Others tried to rescue Vijayabalan, but he succumbed to his injuries on the spot. Based on the information, marine police rushed to the spot and sent the body to the government hospital for postmortem. tnnEnd of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Visual Stories   Previous10 reasons to have 1 pomegranate dailyLifestyleScenic hill station train journeys in North IndiatravelIndiaâs famous tigers and tigresses: The legends of the wildtravelTips for guiding your child to greater happinessLifestyleHow to make South Indian-Style Mysore Masala Dosa at homeFood'Stree 2, 'Aashiqui' and other films of Shraddha Kapoor to watchEntertainmentAI imagines how India's top metros will look like in the next 50 yearsLifestyle15 Indian states and the rice dishes they are famous forFoodHow to extract, store, and apply fresh Aloe Vera to aid hair growthLifestyle8 hybrid animals that were âinventedâ by humansLifestyle Next123Hot PicksJK Assembly elections 2024 LiveHarvest Moon Lunar EclipsePuducherry BandhLebanon Pagers ExplosionIsrael MossadNew Mini MoonIAS Tina DabiTOP TRENDINGHamster Kombat Daily Cipher CodesTupperware BrandsChampions Trophy FinalIndigo Flight Tail StrikeNEET UG Admission CriteriaHaryana Election 2024Barron TrumpLunar EclipseSalvatore SchillaciGangster KakkathopeTrending StoriesIn CityEntire WebsiteWhy has the iconic Tupperware Brands filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy?Meerut Metro: Indiaâs âFastestâ Metro Service Unveiled!     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/visakhapatnam/3-ap-fishermen-die-as-boat-capsizes-at-sea/articleshow/85334052.cms": "Three Andhra Pradesh fishermen die as boat capsizes at sea | Visakhapatnam News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOICityvisakhapatnammumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadaphotosWeb StoriesToday's ePaperweatherandhra electionsNewsCity Newsvisakhapatnam NewsThree Andhra Pradesh fishermen die as boat capsizes at seaTrendingPublic Holiday on November 1Baba Siddique MurderR G Kar caseTamannaah BhatiaLizard in Midday MealBagmati Express CrashPublic Holiday on November 1Baba Siddique MurderR G Kar caseTamannaah BhatiaLizard in Midday MealBagmati Express CrashPublic Holiday on November 1Baba Siddique MurderR G Kar caseTamannaah BhatiaLizard in Midday MealBagmati Express CrashThis story is from August 15, 2021Three Andhra Pradesh fishermen die as boat capsizes at seaTNN /  Aug 15, 2021, 05:33 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us Three fishermen including a father-son duo died when their country boat capsized in the Bay of Bengal off the coast of Bhandaruvanipeta under Gara mandal in Srikakulam district in the wee hours of Saturday. The deceased were identified as Pukkala Yerayya (27) and his father Pukkalla Gannaya (50) and Rayathi Narayana Swamy (55). SRIKAKULAM: Three fishermen including a father-son duo died when their country boat capsized in the Bay of Bengal off the coast of Bhandaruvanipeta under Gara mandal in Srikakulam district in the wee hours of Saturday. There was a strong gale and a high tide when the mishap occurred.The police have identified the deceased as Pukkala Yerayya (27) and his father Pukkala Gannaya (50) and Rayathi Narayana Swamy (55).The police said that the three fishermen went to the sea on Saturday morning for fishing in their country boat. While trying to sail through the high tide to go deep into the sea, they lost control over the boat due to a strong wind. The boat turned upside down drowning all the three. The fishermen attempted to swim towards the coast but drowned in the strong current.The police said the bodies of two fishermen washed ashore near Gullavanipalem under Polaki mandal. The body of Yerrayya was found near the coast. A pall of gloom descended on fishermen villages in Gara mandal. Animal husbandry and fisheries minister Sidiri Appalaraju spoke to senior officials and also assured the kin of the victims that the state will extend financial assistance.     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/visakhapatnam/two-fishermen-die-after-country-boats-capsize/articleshow/100407004.cms": "Two Fishermen Die After Country Boats Capsize | Visakhapatnam News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign  regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnapuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadachhatrapati sambhajinagarphotosWeb StoriesToday's ePaperweatherandhra electionsNewsCity Newsvisakhapatnam NewsTwo fishermen die after country boats capsizeTrendingBengaluru Camera Incident ArrestCylinder Placed on Rail TrackNIT Patna Student SuicideExport of Hilsa FishTaj MahalEY Employee DeathBengaluru Camera Incident ArrestCylinder Placed on Rail TrackNIT Patna Student SuicideExport of Hilsa FishTaj MahalEY Employee DeathBengaluru Camera Incident ArrestCylinder Placed on Rail TrackNIT Patna Student SuicideExport of Hilsa FishTaj MahalEY Employee DeathThis story is from May 22, 2023Two fishermen die after country boats capsizeTNN /  May 22, 2023, 08:14 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us   Visakhapatnam: In a tragic incident, two fishermen died after their country boats (teppa) capsized in Peddagedda reservoir in Pachipenta mandal of Parvathipuram Manyam district.The deceased were identified as Bantu Jogaiah (53), a native of Madavalasa and Pungari Seetharam (32) of Yerravodduvalasa.Police said that over 130 families (displaced families of the reservoir project) are living at different rehabilitation colonies and eking out livelihood by fishing in the waters.The locals said that Seetharam and Jogaiha had gone fishing in the reservoirs on May 19 evening. But their boats toppled due to a strong gust of wind and thunderstorm. Both went missing in the waters.Though the relatives launched a search in the waters to rescue the missing persons, their efforts proved futile. The locals said that the boats were not strong enough to withstand strong wind.Jogaiahâs body was found near Yaradavalasa on Saturday and Seetharamâs body was found at another place on Sunday.Sub-Inspector M V Ramana said that the duo tried to swim to safety after their boats toppled but they failed to swim safely to shore and drowned.A case has been registered under Section 174 of CrPC and the bodies were shifted for the post-mortem, he added.     "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/collision-with-sri-lanka-navy-vessel-kills-fisherman/articleshow/112205731.cms?utm_campaign=2024-08-09+ION&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Pew&subscriberkey=0030P00002FsFJaQAN": "Collision with Sri Lanka navy vessel kills fisherman | India News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOIindiaSaving Our StripesTimes EvokeMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesToday's ePaperNewsIndia NewsCollision with Sri Lanka navy vessel kills fishermanTrendingKejriwal ResignAadhar CardUP NEET UG CounsellingIBPS RRB Clerk PO ResultCBSE School NoticeKarnataka VoilenceRaghav ChadhaNavdeep SinghKejriwal ResignAadhar CardUP NEET UG CounsellingIBPS RRB Clerk PO ResultCBSE School NoticeKarnataka VoilenceRaghav ChadhaNavdeep SinghKejriwal ResignAadhar CardUP NEET UG CounsellingIBPS RRB Clerk PO ResultCBSE School NoticeKarnataka VoilenceRaghav ChadhaNavdeep SinghCollision with Sri Lanka navy vessel kills fishermanTNN / Updated: Aug 2, 2024, 02:22 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us Indian government expressed shock and anguish at the loss of life and the Indian high commissioner in Colombo, Santosh Jha, also raised the matter with the Lankan government later on Thursday. The collision was reported five nautical miles north of Katchatheevu Island. NEW DELHI: India on Thursday summoned the Sri Lankan acting high commissioner and registered a strong protest over the collision earlier in the day between a Lankan navy vessel and an Indian fishing boat that left an Indian fisherman dead. Another Indian fisherman was reported missing after the collision.Indian government expressed shock and anguish at the loss of life and the Indian high commissioner in Colombo, Santosh Jha, also raised the matter with the Lankan govt later on Thursday.Recalling that India has always emphasised the need to deal with issues pertaining to fishermen in a humane and humanitarian manner, Indian authorities told the Lankan govt that existing understandings between the two govts in that regard must be strictly observed. \"Utmost efforts should be made to ensure that there is no recurrence or resort to the use of force,\" said the Indian govt in a statement.The collision was reported five nautical miles north of Katchatheevu Island. Out of the four Indian fishermen who were on board the vessel, one unfortunately lost his life and another is missing, according to the Indian govt.\"Two of the fishermen have been rescued and brought ashore to Kankesanthurai. A search is ongoing for the missing Indian fisherman. Indian consulate officials in Jaffna have been instructed to immediately rush to Kankesanthurai and extend all possible assistance to the fishermen and their families,'' it said, adding that India attaches the highest priority to the safety and security of Indian fishermen. Issues relating to Indian fishermen have been raised regularly at the highest levels with the Sri Lankan leadership, it said.This is the second such incident reported between a Lankan naval vessel and an Indian fishing boat in recent times. In June, Sri Lanka had registered a protest with India for the death of a navy sailor who was killed while attempting to seize an Indian vessel allegedly poaching in Lankan waters. The sailor sustained critical injuries due to \"the aggressive manoeuvres of the Indian trawler, resisting its seizure\".Sri Lanka had detained 10 Indian fishermen for causing the death of the sailor. The MEA had later raised the issue with Lankan authorities and sought their release. Sri Lanka has in the past diplomatically conveyed to India its opposition to alleged IUU fishing, especially bottom trawling and indiscriminate poaching, by Indian fishermen in Sri Lankan waters.End of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Visual Stories   Previous10 reasons to have 1 pomegranate dailyLifestyleScenic hill station train journeys in North IndiatravelIndiaâs famous tigers and tigresses: The legends of the wildtravelTips for guiding your child to greater happinessLifestyleHow to make South Indian-Style Mysore Masala Dosa at homeFood'Stree 2, 'Aashiqui' and other films of Shraddha Kapoor to watchEntertainmentAI imagines how India's top metros will look like in the next 50 yearsLifestyle15 Indian states and the rice dishes they are famous forFoodHow to extract, store, and apply fresh Aloe Vera to aid hair growthLifestyle8 hybrid animals that were âinventedâ by humansLifestyle Next123Hot PicksIllia YefimchykArvind Kejriwal BailAnnapurna Interactive Staffs ResignedEx-Miss Switzerland FinalistHaitian ImmigrantsStock Market TodayDelhi Greater Kailash shootingTOP TRENDINGPolaris DawnGK for StudentsVande MetroHamster Kombat Daily Cipher CodesShimla ProtestsKolkata Rape Murder CaseNitin GadkariAadhar Card UpdateGarena Free Fire Redeem CodeLargest Mammals in the WorldTrending StoriesIn IndiaEntire WebsiteThe Secret Behind NFL Marriages: How These Couples Make It WorkUPI transaction limit to change from September 16!     "https://today.thefinancialexpress.com.bd/country/bodies-of-five-fishermen-recovered-after-five-days-1688224627": "Finance News: Latest Financial News, Finance News today in Bangladesh\nVOL 32 NO 82  REGD NO DA 1589 Thursday, 30 January 2025                            |\nOnline FE  |\ne-Paper  |\nArchive\nToggle navigation\nFIRST PAGE\nPOLITICS & POLICIES\nMETRO / NEWS\nVIEWS & OPINION\nEDITORIAL\nVIEWS & REVIEWS\nLAST PAGE\nSTOCK & CORPORATE\nCOUNTRY\nWORLD\nSPORTS\nTRADE & MARKET\nEDUCATION & YOUTH\nFEATURES & ANALYSIS\nLIFESTYLE\nSPECIAL ISSUES\nBudget FY25\nTECHexpress\nINTO 32ND YEAR  OF PUBLICATION\n31st\nAnniversary Issue - I\n31st\nAnniversary Issue - II\n31st\nAnniversary Issue - III\nGolden Jubilee of Independence\nNews\nAuthor\nSearch\nSearch\n/ COUNTRY\nBodies of five fishermen  recovered after five days\nBhola trawler capsize\nJuly 02, 2023 00:00:00\nBHOLA, July 01(UNB): The floating bodies of five fishermen have been recovered five days after a trawler capsized in the Bay of Bengal estuary near Charfesson upazila of Bhola.The bodies were recovered from the Bay of Bengal estuary at around 02:00 pm on Friday, Bhola Additional Superintendent of Police Md Asaduzzaman Khan and local administration confirmed the matter.The deceased were identified as Md Harun Dorji, Md Sharif Hossain, Md Shattar Hawlader, Md Nur Islam and Fazle Karim Bari.According to sources at Samraj Fishghat in Charfession, on June 25, 13 fishermen went fishing in the Bay of Bengal with the trawler of local Jahangir Majhi. A day later, on Saturday, June 24, the trawler capsized in the sea. Thirteen fishermen went missing.On Friday morning, six fishermen were rescued and were admitted to Charfession Upazila Health Complex. According to the information given by them, local fishermen and fish traders recovered the bodies of five fishermen from the Bay of Bengal at around 02:00 pm.Two fishermen are still missing. All the injured, killed and missing fishermen are from different villages of Charfession. The identities of the injured and missing fishermen were not immediately confirmed.Charfession UNO Al Noman told reporters that the Bhola district administration will provide financial assistance of Tk 20,000 each to the families of the five fishermen killed in the incident.\nShare if you like\nEditor : Shamsul Huq Zahid\nPublished by Syed Manzur Elahi for International Publications Limited from Tropicana Tower (4th\nfloor), 45, Topkhana Road, GPO Box : 2526 Dhaka- 1000 and printed by him from The Transcraft Limited, 229, Tejgaon Industrial Area, Dhaka-1208.\nPhone: 02223388153, 02223388154 and 02223380377\nPABX : 9553550 (Hunting)\nFax : 880-2-02223387049\nE-mail : [email protected], [email protected]\nGENERAL LINKS\nFirst Page\nPolitics & Policies\nMetro / News\nViews & Opinion\nEditorial\nViews & Reviews\nLast Page\n---\nStock & Corporate\nCountry\nWorld\nSports\nTrade & Market\nTrade & Commodities\nFeatures & Analysis\n---\nAdvertisement\nFacebook\n© 2025 - All Rights with The Financial Express\nAbout us\nContact us\nTerms of Service\nNavigation\nFirst Page\nPolitics & Policies\nEditorial\nViews & Opinion\nMetro News\nEditors' Council's Statement\nViews & Reviews\nReviews & Previews\nLast Page\nStock & Corporate\nDetailed DSE Trading\nCountry\nWorld\nSports\nTrade & Market\nTrade & Commodities\nEducation & Youth\nFeatures & Analysis\nSpecial Issues\nSpecial Supplement\nLifestyle\nPlease enable JavaScript to view the comments powered by\nDisqus.",
    "https://tribune.com.pk/story/2436620/compenion-sought-for-family-of-deceased-fisherman": "Compensation sought for family of deceased fisherman\nUS\nToday's Paper |\nJanuary 30, 2025 |\nePaper\nHome\nLatest\nPakistan\nBusiness\nWorld\nSports\nEntertainment\nOpinion\nLife & Style\nT-Magazine\nT.EDIT\nBlogs\nTech\nVideos\nFood\nCartoon\nMore\nhome\nSindh\nCompensation sought for family of deceased fisherman\nFisherman lost his life in a tragic incident near Keti Bandar, 21 others rescued after their fishing boat capsized\nOur Correspondent\nSeptember 19, 2023\nfacebook\ntwitter\nwhatsup\nlinkded\nemail\nAn aerial view of fishing boats covered with tarpaulin sheets parked on the shore, before the start of the monsoon season, on the outskirts of Mumbai, India, June 8, 2023. PHOTO: REUTERS\nKARACHI:\nIn a tragic incident near Keti Bandar, a fisherman lost his life, while 21 others were rescued after their fishing boat capsized in the deep sea.\nThe Pakistan Fisherfolk Forum (PFF) has urged the Sindh government to take immediate action by announcing compensation for the family of the deceased and initiating a thorough inquiry into the incident.\nFurthermore, the PFF insists that the fisheries department of the Sindh government prioritise safety measures to protect the livelihoods of fishermen and their families.\nPFF Chairman Mehran Ali Shah the fishing community’s vital role in national economy remains underappreciated.\n\"These victims require immediate relief. They have not only lost a fellow fisherman but also suffered damage to their boat during the accident, rendering them jobless,\" Shah mentioned.\nPublished in The Express Tribune, September 19th, 2023.\nfacebook\ntwitter\nwhatsup\nlinkded\nemail\nCOMMENTS\nReplying to\nX\nSaved !     "https://tribune.com.pk/story/2458561/at-least-14-fishermen-missing-after-boat-capsizes-near-thatta": "At least 14 fishermen missing after boat capsizes near Thatta\nUS\nToday's Paper |\nJanuary 30, 2025 |\nePaper\nHome\nLatest\nPakistan\nBusiness\nWorld\nSports\nEntertainment\nOpinion\nLife & Style\nT-Magazine\nT.EDIT\nBlogs\nTech\nVideos\nFood\nCartoon\nMore\nhome\nPakistan\nAt least 14 fishermen missing after boat capsizes near Thatta\nFishing boat departed Monday, fishermen unaware of rough weather\nSameer Mandhro\nMarch 06, 2024\nfacebook\ntwitter\nwhatsup\nlinkded\nemail\nFishermen haul in a net on their boat. PHOTO/Anadolu Agency\nKARACHI:\nAt least 14 fishermen were reported missing on Wednesday after their boat overturned near Thatta, said local sources.\nThe boat, named Al-Asad, had a crew of around 45 fishermen, out of which 31 were rescued after the incident.\nThe fishermen, hailing from Karachi's Ibrahim Hyderi, the largest fishermen community, departed on Monday afternoon for a fishing expedition and were expected to return Wednesday.\nA survivor, Riaz, stated that the boat was overloaded and they were unaware of rough weather. 'My brother was also with me,' he said, adding “I couldn’t save him despite all my efforts.'\nRead: Navy rescues six stranded fishermen\nPakistan FisherFolk Forum (PFF) Chairman Mehran Shah shared the list of missing fishermen, which includes Riaz Bengali, Ahmed Bangali, Shakeel Bengali, Sajjad, Koki, Hasho, Riaz Ashraf, Noor Alam, Rahim, Sher Mallah, Muneer, Alam Bengali, Qayoom, and Hussain.\n\"The families are in agony,\" Shah said stating that there was a need for immediate rescue efforts.\nHe criticised the government for its inaction, stating that the Sindh government has not issued any statements or visited the distressed families to offer condolences.\n\"This is not the first incident where fishermen have been left at the mercy of nature,\" Shah added.\nDeceased Koki’s father Sikandar pleaded for his son's return saying that Koki’s wedding was planned after the holy month of Ramazan.\nHe added that his son was the sole earner of the family. Echoing her husband’s sentiments, Koki’s mother, Najma, appealed to the government to bring her son back safe and sound.\nfacebook\ntwitter\nwhatsup\nlinkded\nemail\nCOMMENTS (2)\nMuhammad Rafiq\n|  10 months ago\n| Reply\nA very sad incident happened to the fishermen in the sea. PFF is supporting the families of the drowned but no help from the government.\nBalochistan News\n|  10 months ago\n| Reply\nThanks for sharing this useful information\nReplying to\nX\nSaved ! Entertainment\nVideos\nYouth Sports Spotlight\nHTML div\nTO SUBSCRIBE, CLICK HERE\nLog In\nMenu\nSite search\nSearch\nHome\nNews\n2020 Elections\nSpecial Report\nLocal News\nNews Extra\nRegional News\nWorld News\nFeatures\nOpinion\nTech\nSports\nLocal Sports\nRegional Sports\nWorld Sports\nBusiness\nLocal Business\nBusiness Extra\nRegional Business\nWorld Business\nDaily Express\nPress Releases\ne-Paper\nClassifieds\nPlace An Ad\nRead in E-Paper\nVIBES\nShare This\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nHome\nNews\nLocal News\nFisherman shot dead in 'pirate' attack\nCarolyn Kissoon\nCarolyn Kissoon\nAuthor email\nMay 20, 2022\nMay 20, 2022\nUpdated\nMay 20, 2022\nComments\n1 min to read\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nCarolyn Kissoon\nAuthor email\nFollow Carolyn Kissoon\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nPrint\nCopy article link\nSave\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nPrint\nCopy article link\nSave\nA Fullerton Village, Icacos, fisherman was shot dead in an incident out at sea yesterday.He was identified as 40-year-old Neemar Seepersad.Police said they are yet to determine what led to the shooting.The Express was told that Seeper­sad, a father of two, was among a crew of three men on a vessel out at sea.Investigators were told that a vessel, believed to be Venezuelan, approached the local men around 4 p.m. and the occupants opened fire.Seepersad was shot in the chest.The other fishermen steered their vessel to Columbus Bay, where they called for help.An eyewitness told the Express: “They brought him to shore and then the other fishermen helped to take him to the health centre, where he died. It is uncertain whether it was a pirate attack, but the fishermen are now fearful for their lives.”Seepersad has been a fishermen for all his life, residents said, and sold fish and shrimp in the community.The other two men were not ­injured.Councillor: Where wasthe Coast Guard?Local government Councillor Shankar Teelucksingh said he was concerned about the safety of fisher­men in the south-western ­peninsula.“Where was the Coast Guard today? Why was there no protection for these fishermen who went out to do their job? We are uncertain what happened, but the fishermen are now afraid to go out tomorrow,” he said.Homicide officers visited the scene last evening and were expected to interview the other two fishermen who were on board the vessel.\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nPrint\nCopy article link\nSave\nTags\nFisherman\nShot Dead\nIcacos\nAt Sea\nNeemar Seepersad\nFullerton Village\nColumbus     "https://trinidadexpress.com/newsextra/boat-found-fisherman-lost/article_ba5bd358-3027-11ec-9936-fb4576e91e51.html": "Boat found, fisherman lost | News Extra | trinidadexpress.com\nSkip to main content\nYou are the owner of this article.\nEdit Article\nAdd New Article\nClose\nYou have permission to edit this article.\nEdit\nClose\nFacebook\nTwitter\nInstagram\nEmail\niOS App\nAndroid App\nSubscribe to E-paper\nSign Up\nLog In\nDashboard\nLogout\nMy Account\nDashboard\nProfile\nSaved items\nLogout\nContact Us\nCustomer Service\nHome\nExpress Classifieds\nOpinion\nColumnists\nEditorials\nLetters to the Editor\nPhoto Gallery\nVibes - Entertainment\nVideos\nYouth Sports Spotlight\nHTML div\nTO SUBSCRIBE, CLICK HERE\nLog In\nMenu\nSite search\nSearch\nHome\nNews\n2020 Elections\nSpecial Report\nLocal News\nNews Extra\nRegional News\nWorld News\nFeatures\nOpinion\nTech\nSports\nLocal Sports\nRegional Sports\nWorld Sports\nBusiness\nLocal Business\nBusiness Extra\nRegional Business\nWorld Business\nDaily Express\nPress Releases\ne-Paper\nClassifieds\nPlace An Ad\nRead in E-Paper\nVIBES\nShare This\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nHome\nNews Extra\nTop Story\nBoat found, fisherman lost\nElizabeth Williams\nElizabeth Williams\nOct 18, 2021\nOct 18, 2021\nUpdated\nOct 18, 2021\nComments\n1 min to read\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nHTML div\nTO SUBSCRIBE CLICK HERE\nElizabeth Williams\nFollow Elizabeth Williams\n:‘FISHY’: Missing fisherman Atiba Williams’ pirogue which was found at Canoe Bay, Tobago, yesterday.—Photo: Elizabeth Williams\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nPrint\nCopy article link\nSave\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nPrint\nCopy article link\nSave\nTobago fisherman Atiba Williams, of Main Road, Goodwood, is missing at sea.Williams’ pirogue was recovered at Canoe Bay in Tobago yesterday afternoon.A team of police officers visited the area following the discovery of vessel TFT 1730 Mak’ Mak’, which is owned by the parents of Williams, who left from Crown Point last Wednesday.His sister Makini Williams told the Express that something is not sitting right with the situation as other fishermen who left in other boats at the same time as Williams returned to shore and did not initially report to police that her brother was missing.“But I keep telling the police it sounds fishy, the whole thing sounds fishy,” Makini Williams said yesterday.The engine, food, water and GPS equipment all remained intact on the vessel.Makini Williams denied that her brother is involved in any illegal activity. This comes on the heels of three other Tobago fishermen who went out to sea last week being allegedly held with drugs in Barbados, where they are now in quarantine.“My brother did not know anything about what was planned. He informed one of the senior police officers in the village that he was going fishing by the rig. He, Pastor George and another man, but he did not know the other man,” Makini Williams said.She was told by the two fishermen who made it back to shore that while at sea they went fishing in separate areas.“My brother was looking for dolphin, the other fishermen were looking for barracuda. The barracuda and the dolphin was not in the same place so they went off a little from each other and were to reach back at the same spot to come back in,” she said.All Tobago Fisherfolk Association president Curtis Douglas told the Express that searches continue to be conducted by fishermen across Tobago for Williams, as well as the Trinidad and Tobago Coast Guard.“Words cannot describe how I feel about the current situation. We hope for his safe return,” Douglas said.Commenting on some fishermen being involved in illegal activity, he said: “We have a zero tolerance concerning drug activity. We do not condone or conduct that kind of behaviour.”\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nPrint\nCopy article link\nSave\nTags\nTobago Fisherman\nAtiba Williams\nMissing At Sea\nFishing Vessel\nTft 1730 Mak’ Mak'\nCanoe Bay\nMakini Williams\nRECOMMENDED FOR YOU\nMissing man's ID found near skeletal remains\nPolice searching for a kidnapped central businessman in St James on Tuesday, found an employ…\nMurder at School Street, Esperanza\nA man was killed and another wounded in a shooting in Couva on Tuesday night.\nAccused of child molestation, man dies by suicide\nA man accused of molesting a seven year old child, is believed to have died by suicide in ea…\n'CAL aircraft have had multiple safety-rela­ted near misses'\nTrinidad and Tobago Airline Pilots Association (TTALPA) industrial relations representative …\nSquatters at Ramjattan Trace hold protest: Upset over ‘questionable’ notice to vacate\nRESIDENTS squatting at Ramjattan Trace, Tumpuna Road, La Horquetta, are fearful of losing th…\nKamla: ‘Rajesh’ Young now acknowledging roots\nOPPOSITION Leader Kamla Persad-Bissessar has questioned whether prime minister-in-waiting St…\nRecommended for you\nTRENDING\nBody found in shallow grave\nSchool of Accounting and Management founder passes away\nGRIEF ON THE BEACH\nCop on kidnap/rape charges arrested for child sex crimes\nPilot, 2 technicians ‘withdrawn’ after CAL plane emergency\nFacebook\nTwitter\nInstagram\nTweets by expressupdates\nInstagram\nTop\nNews\nLocal\nRegional\nWorld\nSports\nLocal\nRegional\nWorld\nFootball\nBasketball\nCricket\nMore\nBusiness\nLocal\nRegional\nWorld\nFeatures\nLocal\nEditorial\nWoman\nEditorial\nExpress Editorial\nContributors\nLetters\nLocal\nWorld\nU.S.\nRest of the World\nSubscription\nLocal\nRegional\nWorld\nContact Us\nMake Contact\nAdvertising\nTrinidad Express\nExpress Classifieds\nAgency\nDirect\nFeedback\nLet us know\nSocial Channels\nFacebook\nTwitter\nInstagram\n© 2023 Caribbean Communications Network. At around 4.45 p.m. while fishing on the sea stacks (rocks at sea), he got into difficulty and disappeared underwater.His body resurfaced 15 minutes later, and with the assistance of villagers, the body was recovered from the water and taken to the shore.Emergency Health Services paramedics tried to revive Ramjohn but attempts were not successful.A district medical officer examined the body and it was removed to the Sangre Grande mortuary pending a post-mortem examination at the Eric Williams Medical Sciences Complex.Toco police Sgt Edwards, Cpl Bhagan and other officers attached to the Toco station responded.WPC Charles is continuing investigations.\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nSMS\nEmail\nPrint\nCopy article link\nSave\nRECOMMENDED FOR YOU\nMissing man's ID found near skeletal The bodies of Ishmael Mohammed, 22, and Richard Ramlochan, 29, were found between 8am and 2pm. Mohammed was found at Pineapple Cove, Blanchisseuse while Ramlochan was found nearby.The bodies, police said, were about one kilometre away from the spot where they were fishing.They were missing since Thursday.The two were with another friend who went fishing on the rocks near the popular bay. However, a large wave knocked all three into the sea. The third individual managed to swim back to shore, however, Ramlochan and Mohammed could not be located.The TTCG said it initiated a search and rescue operation involving the use of its patrol vessel and began searching the area from that moment.More on this as it becomes available.\nLoop is better in the app. Customize your news feed, save articles for later, view your reading history and more. However, around 6am on Monday morning, his boat was discovered along the beach off Manzanilla Road.It appeared that the boat had washed ashore in the vicinity of Cascadoux Trace.Officials said around 10:30 am on Tuesday morning, Hector's body was discovered lying along the shoreline.The police were notified and a team of officers from the Eastern Division responded.The body as viewed by a district medical officer and ordered removed from the scene.WPC Jagroo is continuing inquiries.More on this as it becomes available.\nLoop is better in the app. Customize your news feed, save articles for later, view your reading history and more. Releases\nHome\nBangladesh\nLaw & Order\nHome\nBangladesh\nLaw & Order\nMan dies after being attacked for fishing in disputed waters in N’ganj\nNarayanganj\nMarch 29, 2024, 10:23 PM\nby\nUNB NEWS\nUNB News\nNarayanganj\nPublish- March 29, 2024, 10:23 PM\nUNB NEWS\nA 45-year-old man, who sustained severe injuries in an attack by his uncle and others over fishing in a disputed pond, succumbed to his injuries while undergoing treatment at a Dhaka hospital early Friday.\nThe deceased was identified as Nurul Haque, son of Latif Miah of Chhani area under Sadar union of the Rupganj upazila.\nVictim’s family and locals said paternal uncle Abul Hashem locked into an altercation with Nurul over the latter fishing in the water body with a net on the afternoon of March 15.\nIn the early hours of March 16, Hasem and his sons Babu and Sohag, allegedly equipped with locally-made sharp weapons, swooped on Nurul when he was on his way to the pond again, leaving him critically injured.\nHearing screams, locals rushed to him and took to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) and later shifted to a private hospital.\nNurul succumbed to his injuries while receiving treatment at the private hospital early Friday.\nRupganj Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Dipak Chandra Saha confirmed the matter saying that they have already arrested one named Babu.\nThe body was sent to DMCH morgue for autopsy, he said.\nA case filed earlier was recorded now as a regular murder case, the OC said, adding that drives are on to arrest the rest accused involved with the murder.\nSubscribe UNB YouTube missing\nBhola\nDecember 06, 2021, 08:56 PM\nby\nUNB NEWS\nUNB News\nBhola\nPublish- December 06, 2021, 08:56 PM\nUNB NEWS\nFile photo\nThirteen fishermen from Charfesson  upazila of Bhola went missing as a trawler carrying them sank in the Bay of Bengal  being hit by a fishing ship on Sunday night.\nThe trawler carrying 21 fishermen sank 47 kilometers south from Dhalchar union in Charfesson upazila around 10 pm.\nAnother fishing trawler from Patharghata upazila rescued eight of the fishermen immediately after the incident but the remaining fishermen and the trawler could not be traced until Monday, said Coast Guard members.\nREAD: Bride among 7 dead as trawler sinks in Meghna\nTen of the missing fishermen were identified as- boatman Md Bacchu, Al Amin, Jabed , Faruq, Khaleque,  Hafez, Yusuf, Jashim, Rafiq and Masud while three other’s names could not be known. They all were residents of Abdullahpur and Ahmadpur unions in the upazila.\nAccording to locals, the accident occurred when the trawler was returning from deep sea after getting a cautionary signal from the Met office due to depression in the Bay .\nOn Saturday, the trawler named ‘Ma Samsunnhar’ owned by Md Hossain left Charkacchapia ghat for fishing , they said.\nREAD: Cop, son missing as trawler sinks in Narail\nMaruf Hossain Minar, senior fisheries officer of the upazila,  said  local Coast Guard members have been asked to conduct a rescue drive while a trawler left Patharghata on Monday to bring back the rescued fishermen.\nSubscribe UNB YouTube Channel\nContact Us\nUnited News of Bangladesh (UNB)\nCosmos Centre 69/1 New Circular Road, Malibagh, Dhaka-1217,Bangladesh.\nEmail: [email protected]\nAbout\nPrivacy Policy\nAdvertisement\nContacts\n2025 | © Copyright United News of Bangladesh.",

The town will also be offering grief counselling to residents in need as the small community copes with the tragedy. Earlier StoryFour people were airlifted by search and rescue crews after a fishing vessel capsized near Lark Harbour on the province’s west coast. A spokesperson for the Joint Rescue Coordination Centre in Halifax says they received a call around 11 a.m. this morning to reports of persons in the water near Molly Ann Cove.A Cormorant helicopter from Gander’s 103 Search and Rescue Squad airlifted four people from the shore to a location where first responders were able to take over.The Canadian Coast Guard is leading the investigation and there is no word on any injuries or fatalities.The Town of Lark Harbour opened its doors this evening for residents in need of support following the incident. of drowning because at the time of the search items belonging to the ship were found.\"There are items found around the waters of Yesius Island floating in the sea, including ship hold covers and floating dead fish,\" Amiruddin said as quoted by ANTARA, Monday, March 18.Until the fifth day of the search, the four crew members of the ship had not been found.\nSEE ALSO:\n| BERITA\nBesok Polisi Mayo Seafood in Hobucken.He was employed by the fish market as a commercial fisherman.Pamlico County Sheriff Chris Davis said William Smith died when a piece of equipment fell on him while he was on a forklift. Janet Mills is delivering her 2025 State of the Budget  address.WATCH HEREBoat found washed up on shore as Coast Guard searches for missing fisherman off Kennebunkportby Mal Meyer, WGMESat, November 18th 2023 at 9:20 PM4VIEW ALL PHOTOSThe search is on for a Maine fisherman missing off the coast of Kennebunkport. (WGME)TOPICS:KennebunkportCoast GuardFishermanSearchMissingBoatKulesaShoreKENNEBUNKPORT (WGME) -- The search is on for a Maine fisherman missing off the coast of Kennebunkport.He was supposed to come back to shore Thursday afternoon but never returned.Friday morning, crews found his boat and other belongings, but no sign of him.Also read:Coast Guard launches search for missing 64-year-old fisherman off coast of KennebunkportIt was already dark, around 7 p.m., when police contacted the Coast Guard.“Inherently, searching at night does have its challenges. It does have its limitations,” Search and Rescue Mission Coordinator Commander Frank Kulesa said.Throughout the day, authorities have looked from the air, off the coast and along the shore.So far, they say they’ve found his boat overturned on the rocks by Walker’s Point Friday morning, along with a boot, a plastic tote, fishing gear and life jackets.“The potential area the missing fisherman can be in is a very tight area, close to shore,” Kulesa said.Also read:1 victim, 1 suspect killed in New Hampshire State Hospital shootingThey’re focused on looking from Walker’s Point to Turbats Creek.A man who identified himself as a friend says the missing boater is a longtime lobsterman and would go out around an island.The U.S. Coast Guard confirms he was out relocating some lobster pots.“We’ve had a number of fishermen and volunteer responders who have come out and aided in the search,” Kulesa said.The Coast Guard says they’ve had good visibility and not very strong winds, which helps.Large tidal cycles and the rocky coastline are creating challenges for searchers.“If you're an experienced mariner and you can get out on your boat, by all means, if you can do that safely, we'd welcome that assistance, walking shorelines,” Kulesa said. “We just don't want people taking unnecessary risks.”Also read:Scribner's Bridge in Harrison closed due to failed inspectionsAuthorities don’t believe the man was wearing a wetsuit, and they’re unsure if he had on a lifejacket.With water temperatures around 50 degrees, officials are aware that’s a serious concern.“At this point in time, we are still operating under that this is a search and rescue, and we're going to continue as long as there's a chance for survival,” Kulesa said.Authorities say all signs point to that he did go into the water.If you live along the water nearby and find anything that might be related to this search, you can contact the local police.Stay ConnectedLike UsFollow Ussbg-envelopeNewsletter Sign up /sign-up© 2025 Sinclair, Inc.TermsEEOFCCFCCPrivacy PolicyCookie PolicyCookie PreferencesLoading ...",
    "https://whatalife.ph/2-out-of-6-surigao-fishermen-rescued/": "2 out of 6 Surigao City fishermen rescued  - WhatALife!\nHomeNewsEntertainmentJob OpportunitiesRoom AssignmentExam ResultsGuideLotto Viral Stories\nCategory:Local\nAdvisory\nEvents\nGovernment Issuances\nInternational\nLocal\nNational\nWeather\n|\nRSS Feed\nInstagram\nFacebook\nTwitter\nHome  News  2 out of 6 Surigao City fishermen rescued\n2 out of 6 Surigao City fishermen rescued\nLocal, News\nMarch 4, 2024\nWhatALife Contributor\nShare on Twitter Share on Twitter\nShare on Facebook Share on Facebook\nShare on LinkedIn Share on LinkedIn\nBUTUAN, PHILIPPINES – Two of the six Surigao City fishermen reported missing were rescued, according to the Coast Guard Station in Surigao del Norte (CGS-SDN) on Sunday.\nThe CGS-SDN said the two fishermen were rescued by a passing fishing banca identified as FBCA Golden Top 888 on Saturday in the waters between the Bohol Sea and Siquijor province.\nThe FBCA Golden Top 888 turned over the rescued fishermen, identified as Joseph Mapalo, 35, a resident of Barangay Cagniog, and Jesmar Besing, 36, of Barangay San Juan, both of Surigao City, to the CGS-SDN.\nThe six fishermen departed Barangay Canlanipa, Surigao City, on the afternoon of February 28 to go fishing near Limasawa Island. As of this posting, the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) in Surigao City reported that a search was underway for the remaining passengers in the area.\nUnfortunately, solid waves in the waters at San Ricardo, Southern Leyte, wrecked the bow section of their fishing boat. The two people are survivors of a marine catastrophe in which six fishermen went missing on March 1, 2024, according to reports.\n“They managed to report the incident to their relatives through phone calls but lost communications due to an unstable network connection,” the CGS-SDN report read.\nThe six abandoned their damaged fishing boat and went swimming together, but the strong current caused them to split up. The CGS-SDN is still in contact with other Coast Guard units in case any of the four fishermen who may still be missing are spotted.\nWe urge the general public to render the necessary assistance and immediately report to authorities if they are sighted,” CGS-SDN station commander Jerick Maglangit said.\nThe rescued fishermen were later returned to the City Disaster Risk Reduction Management Office of Surigao City for immediate medical treatment.\nAs of this date, Coast Guard Station Surigao del Norte continuously coordinated with other PCG units and the Municipal Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office (MDRRMO)  through CDRRMO Surigao City for the possible sightings of the remaining four missing fishermen who are still nowhere to be found which possibly drifted at their respective area of responsibility.\nSources:(1),(2)Keep Reading: VP Sara commends anti-insurgency programs in Davao Region\nPrevious: Gela Atayde Clarifies Sister Ria’s Pregnancy Rumors Amid PCOS Challenges\nNext: PBBM arrives in Melbourne for ASEAN-Australia summit\nWhatALife ContributorContributor writers of WhatALife!\nLeave a Reply Cancel replyYour email address will not be published. Tweet  Facebook  Mail Police divers have joined the hunt for a missing Queensland spear fisherman as the search enters its third day.The 26-year-old man went missing at Sudbury Reef off Cairns on Saturday afternoon.He became separated from his 56-year-old fishing companion and failed to return to the boat at about 4.15pm.LIVE UPDATES: Mayor's midnight call to MelbourneA search and rescue operation resumed again this morning with police divers from Brisbane arriving to assist, a Queensland Police spokesperson said.The search - involving Cairns Water Police, the coast guard and police choppers from the air - began on Saturday afternoon and continued all day yesterday.The missing spear fisherman and his companion are both local to the area.Anyone with information for police can contact Policelink using the online suspicious activity form 24hrs per day at www.police.qld.gov.au/reporting.Continue readingmissing personsMissingFishingqueenslandCairnsCONTACT USSend your stories to contact@9news.com.auProperty News: Robin Williams's former San Francisco home sells for $28 million.Top StoriesSynagogue address, threats found near explosives-packed caravanan hour agoToday in HistoryDeliberately annoying mascot results in pizza shop workers held at gunpointWhat we know about the caravan found with explosives in SydneyLooking for a new job?     "https://www.aa.com.tr/en/aca/boat-carrying-20-fishermen-capsizes-in-northeastern-nigeria/3052994#": "Boat carrying 20 fishermen capsizes in northeastern Nigeria\nbreaking   •\nEDITION\nTürkçe\nEnglish\nBHSC\nPусский\nFrançais\nالعربية\nKurdî\nکوردی\nShqip\nفارسی\nмакедонски\nBahasa Indonesia\nEspañol\nBoat carrying 20 fishermen capsizes in northeastern Nigeria\nTürkİye (current)\nWorld (current)\nEconomy (current)\nPolitics (current)\nEnergy (current)\nSports (current)\nInfographics (current)\nOpinion (current)\nVideo\nPhoto\nTürkiye\nWorld\nMiddle East\nAmericas\nEurope\nAfrica\nAsia - Pacific\nEconomy\nPolitics\nEnergy\nSports\nInfographics\nOpinion\nPhoto\nVideo\nEnvironment\nEducation\nLife\nCulture\nOpinion\nHealth\nScience-Technology\nBusiness News\nFinance Terminal\nAnadolu Images\nEnergy Terminal\nAA Academy\nGreen Line\nDiscrimination Line\nFact Check Line\nCareer AA\nCorporate News\n×\nEDITION\nTürkçe\nEnglish\nBHSC\nPусский\nFrançais\nالعربية\nKurdî\nکوردی\nShqip\nفارسی\nмакедонски\nBahasa Indonesia\nEspañol\nTürkiye\nWorld\nEconomy\nPolitics\nEnergy\nSports\nInfographics\nOpinion\nPhoto\nVideo\nAfrica\nBoat carrying 20 fishermen capsizes in northeastern Nigeria\nInvestigation launched into incident\nIbrahim Garba Shuaibu  |\n14.11.2023 - Update : 14.11.2023\nKANO, NigeriaAt least 20 fishermen died after their boat capsized Monday in the Anyiin area of River Benue in northeastern Nigeria’s Taraba state.Taraba Governor Agbu Kefas confirmed the incident.“Today’s boat incident is even more unfortunate, since it comes on the heels of a similar one in Karim Lamido that plunged the state into mourning,” Emmanuel Bello, the spokesman for the governor, quoted him as saying.According to Taraba State Water Transportation Chairman Alhaji Jidda Suleiman, the boat was carrying fishermen from the Ibi and Wukari local government areas of Taraba to Kwara state.“I was informed that the fishermen converged and boarded the boat to Kwara state in search of greener pastures, and along the way, they had an accident and over 20 people died.\"Twelve of the dead are from Ibi, while some are from Gareji, in Gindin Doruwa, Wukari Local Government Area of Taraba state,” he added.He said the governor has condoled with the families of the victims.“It has been the tradition of our fishermen in Taraba state that once it is close to December, some will travel to Cameroon, some to Chad and other places to fish until August of the following year. It’s unfortunate that the usual tradition turned out to be sorrowful this time.”\nAnadolu Agency website contains only a portion of the news stories offered to subscribers in the AA News Broadcasting System (HAS), and in summarized form. Update : 03.04.2023\nFILE PHOTO\nOVIEDO, SpainTwo fishermen died and one was missing after a ship sank off Spain’s northern coast on Monday, local authorities said.“Once again, a new disaster at sea,” said Miguel Revilla, the president of the Region of Cantabria.Ten crew were on board the ship that sank six miles (9.6 kilometers) off the coast of the city of Santander in the hourly hours of Monday.Seven were rescued, one of whom is being treated for severe injuries, according to the local daily El Diario Montanes.One of the dead is originally from Ghana while the other is from the city of Santander.On Sunday, the coast guards also recovered the lifeless body of a sailor who fell off a container ship 23 miles (37 kilometers) off the coast of Asturias, also in northern Spain.\nAnadolu Agency website contains only a portion of the news stories offered to subscribers in the AA News Broadcasting System (HAS), and in summarized form. Pacific\nEconomy\nPolitics\nEnergy\nSports\nInfographics\nOpinion\nPhoto\nVideo\nEnvironment\nEducation\nLife\nCulture\nOpinion\nHealth\nScience-Technology\nBusiness News\nFinance Terminal\nAnadolu Images\nEnergy Terminal\nAA Academy\nGreen Line\nDiscrimination Line\nFact Check Line\nCareer AA\nCorporate News\n×\nEDITION\nTürkçe\nEnglish\nBHSC\nPусский\nFrançais\nالعربية\nKurdî\nکوردی\nShqip\nفارسی\nмакедонски\nBahasa Indonesia\nEspañol\nTürkiye\nWorld\nEconomy\nPolitics\nEnergy\nSports\nInfographics\nOpinion\nPhoto\nVideo\nMiddle East\nIsraeli drone strike kills 7 fishermen near Gaza City beach\nStrike targets group of Palestinians as they were fishing, medical source say\nHosni Nadim  |\n26.08.2024 - Update : 26.08.2024\nGAZA CITY, PalestineAt least seven fishermen were killed and several others injured in an Israeli drone strike near Gaza City beach on Monday, according to a medical source.The strike targeted the fishermen as they were fishing, the source told Anadolu.The drone fired a missile into a group of fishermen as they gathered on Gaza City beach, witnesses said.Israel has continued its brutal offensive on the Gaza Strip following an attack by the Palestinian group Hamas last Oct. 7, despite a UN Security Council resolution calling for an immediate cease-fire.The onslaught has resulted in over 40,400 Palestinian deaths, mostly women and children, and over 93,500 injuries, according to local health authorities.An ongoing blockade of Gaza has led to severe shortages of food, clean water and medicine, leaving much of the region in ruins.Israel faces accusations of genocide at the International Court of Justice, which has ordered a halt to military operations in the southern city of Rafah, where over one million Palestinians had sought refuge before the area was invaded on May 6.\nAnadolu Agency website contains only a portion of the news stories offered to subscribers in the AA News Broadcasting System (HAS), and in summarized form. Pacific\nEconomy\nPolitics\nEnergy\nSports\nInfographics\nOpinion\nPhoto\nVideo\nEnvironment\nEducation\nLife\nCulture\nOpinion\nHealth\nScience-Technology\nBusiness News\nFinance Terminal\nAnadolu Images\nEnergy Terminal\nAA Academy\nGreen Line\nDiscrimination Line\nFact Check Line\nCareer AA\nCorporate News\n×\nEDITION\nTürkçe\nEnglish\nBHSC\nPусский\nFrançais\nالعربية\nKurdî\nکوردی\nShqip\nفارسی\nмакедонски\nBahasa Indonesia\nEspañol\nTürkiye\nWorld\nEconomy\nPolitics\nEnergy\nSports\nInfographics\nOpinion\nPhoto\nVideo\nWorld\nYemeni Houthi group says fishermen killed by international forces in Red Sea\nBodies of 8 fishermen found on western Zol Hirab Islands after disappearance 1 month ago, says Yemeni group\nAnadolu staff  |\n26.01.2024 - Update : 26.01.2024\nSANAA, Yemen The Houthi group said Friday that eight Yemeni fishermen were killed \"deliberately\" by international forces in the Red Sea while fishing in territorial waters.\"The bodies of the eight fishermen were found on the Zol Hirab Islands in the west after they had mysteriously disappeared a month ago,\" Houthi-run news agency Saba quoted a statement by the Houthi Ministry of Fisheries.The statement denounced \"the ongoing hostilities by mercenaries and the US-Israeli alliance to protect Israel-linked ships and the use of force and threats against fishermen.\"The group did not specify the date when the fishermen were killed, nor whether it occurred on a single day or over several days.There have been no comments by the internationally-recognized Yemeni government or the US-led coalition on the Houthis' statement as yet.Tensions have escalated in the Red Sea amid Houthi attacks on Israel-bound ships.The Houthis say their attacks aim to pressure Israel to halt its deadly onslaught on the Gaza Strip, prompting the US and Britain to launch retaliatory airstrikes against Houthi targets inside Yemen.The Red Sea is one of the world's most frequently used sea routes for oil and fuel shipments.*Writing by Mohammad Sio\nAnadolu Agency website contains only a portion of the news stories offered to subscribers in the AA News Broadcasting System (HAS), and in summarized form.     "https://www.abc.net.au/news/2022-03-21/multiple-fatalities-after-boating-accident-in-wa/100927204": "Nine Indonesian fishermen feared drowned after boat capsizes off WA's far northern coast - ABC NewsSkip to main contentABC NewsJust InFor YouPoliticsWorldBusinessAnalysisSportLifestyleEntertainmentMoreSearch the news, stories & peopleLog inNews HomeJust InFor YouAnalysisRuralWatch LiveHealthIndigenousPoliticsScienceElectionsWorldEnvironmentInvestigationsBusinessFact CheckLocal newsSportAFLNRLFootballTennisCricketNetballLifestyleWellbeingRelationships & FamilyFood & RecipesPersonal FinanceHome & GardenEntertainmentTV & MoviesBooksMusicPop CultureArtsYour ABC AccountPersonalise the news andstay in the knowLog in to personaliseFacebookYouTubeInstagramTwitterEmergencyBackstoryNewsletters中文新闻BERITA BAHASA INDONESIATOK PISINABCABC iViewABC ListenTriple JABC KidsABC NewsABC News News HomeNine Indonesian fishermen feared drowned after boat capsizes off WA's far northern coastShare Nine Indonesian fishermen feared drowned after boat capsizes off WA's far northern coastBy Hannah MurphyABC KimberleyTopic:Maritime Accidents and IncidentsMon 21 Mar 2022Monday 21 March 2022Mon 21 Mar 2022 at 5:07amAshmore Reef is in northern Western Australia. (Supplied: Global FinPrint Project )abc.net.au/news/multiple-fatalities-after-boating-accident-in-wa/100927204Link copiedShareShare articleNine Indonesian fisherman are believed to have drowned after their boat capsized off Western Australia's far northern coast.Key points:Three of the ship's 12 crew were rescued, including a man in his 50s who is in a critical conditionThe remaining nine are feared to have drownedIndonesian media outlets are reporting that the wooden vessel was struck by a large wave en route to Australian watersRescue crews were dispatched from Broome and Cairns in the early hours of Monday morning after reports of an incident near Ashmore Reef.In a statement released late on Monday, the Australian Maritime Safety Authority said there were 12 people aboard the vessel, which was first seen at about 7pm on Sunday evening 180 kilometres west of Ashmore Reef.Three fishermen were rescued, but the remaining nine remain unaccounted for.\"AMSA diverted the Singapore-flagged bulk carrier PSU Sixth, which rescued three survivors from the fishing vessel,\" a spokesperson said.\"The helicopter crew refuelled en route at a nearby oil rig before conducting a winch recovery of one survivor, who was critically ill, and recovering them to Broome hospital.\"Australian Safety Maritime Authority personnel at Broome Airport. (ABC Kimberley)The man, aged in his 50s, was flown to Perth by the Royal Flying Doctor Service on Monday afternoon and remains in a critical condition.He is expected to be transferred to Royal Perth Hospital.\"The two remaining survivors were transferred to an Australian Government vessel and are expected to arrive in Darwin tomorrow,\" the AMSA spokesperson said.\"Unfortunately, there were nine crew members who were not able to be located.\"ASMA says three of the 12 crew aboard the ship (not pictured here) were rescued, but nine are feared to have drowned. (Supplied: Global FinPrint Project — file photo)Reports wave struck shipIndonesian media are reporting the wooden vessel left local waters on Thursday last week and ran into difficulty when it was struck by a large wave.Weather in the area has been particularly rough due to the presence of Tropical Cyclone Charlotte, which formed on Monday, but has tracked through the area as a tropical low in recent days.The report indicates the survivors are being supported by the Indonesian Consulate in Darwin and arrangements are being made to return them home.Ashmore Reef is located in the Indian Ocean, about 630 kilometres north of Broome.Illegal fishing crackdownPhoto shows A burning boat.Australian authorities set Indonesian fishing boats on fire and seize hundreds of kilograms of seafood in response to a surge in illegal foreign fishing.While authorities are yet to reveal full details of the incident, the area of Australian water between Ashmore and the Kimberley coast – and Australia's northern waters more broadly – have been heavily targeted by illegal fishing boats in recent months.Australian authorities began escalating patrols of the area in response, intercepting 231 boats between July and December last year.Twenty-nine vessels were seized and destroyed.While the onset of the monsoon season was expected to slow fishing activity, local skippers told the ABC in December they expected the illegal activity to continue.AMSA has extended its thanks to all involved in the rescue effort.Local news direct to your inboxABC Kimberley will deliver a wrap of the week's news, stories and photos every Tuesday. Sign up to stay connected.Posted Mon 21 Mar 2022 at 5:07amMonday 21 Mar 2022 at 5:07amMon 21 Mar 2022 at 5:07am, updated Mon 21 Mar 2022 at 12:02pmMonday 21 Mar 2022 at 12:02pmMon 21 Mar 2022 at 12:02pmShare optionsCopy linkFacebookX (formerly Twitter)Top StoriesAlbanese says discovery of potential mass-casualty event an act of 'terrorism'LIVEPhoto shows Albanese at a microphone in a courtyard gesturing with both handsSydney school vandalised amid concern about escalating antisemitismLIVEPhoto shows White long house with gate'Deeply disturbed': Jewish MP says possible terror plot sign of escalating hatredTopic:Federal GovernmentPhoto shows Julian Leeser Liberal MP for Berowra stands outdoors and looks at the cameraElizabeth died slowly in front of 14 people, but no-one called for help Topic:CourtsPhoto shows A smiling young girl in a park.     "https://www.abc.net.au/news/2023-11-01/fisherman-rescued-the-narrows-fitzroy-river/103047492": "Body found, two fisherman rescued after boat capsized from outlet of Fitzroy River, Keppel Bay - ABC NewsSkip to main contentABC NewsJust InFor YouPoliticsWorldBusinessAnalysisSportLifestyleEntertainmentMoreSearch the news, stories & peopleLog inNews HomeJust InFor YouAnalysisRuralWatch LiveHealthIndigenousPoliticsScienceElectionsWorldEnvironmentInvestigationsBusinessFact CheckLocal newsSportAFLNRLFootballTennisCricketNetballLifestyleWellbeingRelationships & FamilyFood & RecipesPersonal FinanceHome & GardenEntertainmentTV & MoviesBooksMusicPop CultureArtsYour ABC AccountPersonalise the news andstay in the knowLog in to personaliseFacebookYouTubeInstagramTwitterEmergencyBackstoryNewsletters中文新闻BERITA BAHASA INDONESIATOK PISINABCABC iViewABC ListenTriple JABC KidsABC NewsABC News News HomeBody found, two fisherman rescued after boat capsized from outlet of Fitzroy River, Keppel BayShare Body found, two fisherman rescued after boat capsized from outlet of Fitzroy River, Keppel BayABy Aaron KellyJBy Jasmine HinesABC CapricorniaTopic:Disasters, Accidents and Emergency IncidentsTue 31 Oct 2023Tuesday 31 October 2023Tue 31 Oct 2023 at 8:17pmThe rescue helicopter joined the search for a man in his 70s. (Supplied: RACQ Capricorn Helicopter Rescue Service)abc.net.au/news/fishermen-rescued-the-narrows-fitzroy-river/103047492Link copiedShareShare articlePolice have found a body believed to be a man who went missing after a boat capsized off the central Queensland coast, which sparked a major search and rescue.Key points:Three men fell overboard from a tinnie in the Fitzroy River on Tuesday eveningThe body of a man has been found, while two others were located alive on a beach early Wednesday morningThe trio reportedly clung to each other to stay afloat, but one of the men became separatedThree men were fishing at The Narrows in the Fitzroy River, near Keppel Bay, when their boat overturned about 5pm Tuesday in waters which are known crocodile habitat.The trio reportedly clung to each other to stay afloat but one of the men became separated from his friends.Rockhampton Acting Inspector Ben Wiltshire said a body believed to be a 79-year-old Bundaberg man was found in waters near Balaclava Island.\"The three men were mates. To be present while one of their mates has lost his life in a tragic accident like this, it must have been devastating,\" he said. Family members raised the alarm a few hours after the vessel failed to dock by the expected 6pm arrival time.It sparked a search that included police and State Emergency Service (SES) watercraft, as well as multiple rescue helicopters.A helicopter found two of the men on a beach about 3am today.Men found after fire spottedA LifeFlight Rescue helicopter spokeswoman said it had been a challenging mission in dark conditions, with no EPIRB (emergency position indicating radio beacon) or distress signal to follow. A fire had been spotted on Balaclava Island, which alerted the pilot to land the aircraft.Two of the missing men, who had managed to swim to shore, were found.Acting Inspector Wiltshire said the men swam a couple kilometres to get to safety.Acting Inspector Ben Wiltshire says officers are investigating the circumstances which led to the man's death. (ABC Capricornia: Jasmine Hines)\"We don't believe the vessel has struck anything, but it has capsized in rough water,\" he said. \"The three men are experienced boatmen and fishermen, they were familiar with the area and the conditions.\"He said steep waves and poor conditions were believed to have contributed to the incident.The boat, which has sunk 18 metres underwater, has also been located and a dive squad will work to recover it.Inspector Wiltshire said officers would also investigate why an EPIRB was not set off. \"It is possible there was an EPIRB on the boat but there was no time to set it off,\" he said.A Queensland Ambulance Service spokeswoman said the distressed fishermen were taken to Rockhampton Hospital in a stable condition with minor injuries.A report will be prepared for the Coroner.A map of the search area for the fishermen in central Queensland. (Supplied)Tough conditions for searchersEarlier, Rockhampton State Emergency Service controller Eddie Cowie said conditions had worsened as the day had gone on.There were about 15 SES personnel searching the area, which is known for mangroves and strong tidal flows. \"We've had confirmed crocodile sightings and, certainly, we know that there's a number of large sharks and bull sharks in this particular area,\" he said. SES crews have been stationed at the Port Alma boat ramp. (ABC Capricornia: Aaron Kelly)Mr Cowie said the men who were located were lucky to have made it to shore. \"It was a fairly treacherous incident from the time they found themselves in the water to when they were able to get through to land,\" he said. An RACQ Capricorn Helicopter Rescue said the service had also joined the search for the missing fishermen today.The Narrows is a 40-kilometre saltwater channel between the mouth of the Fitzroy River and Gladstone Harbour, inhabited by sharks and crocodiles.The northern outlet fishing spot connects to Keppel Bay and separates Curtis Island from the mainland.Crocodiles and sharks inhabit the 40km saltwater channel between the Fitzroy River mouth and Gladstone Harbour. (Supplied: RACQ Capricorn Helicopter Rescue Service)ABC Capricornia — local news in your inboxGet our local newsletter, delivered free each FridayYour information is being handled in accordance with the ABC Privacy Collection Statement.Email addressSubscribePosted Tue 31 Oct 2023 at 8:17pmTuesday 31 Oct 2023 at 8:17pmTue 31 Oct 2023 at 8:17pm, updated Wed 1 Nov 2023 at 5:09amWednesday 1 Nov 2023 at 5:09amWed 1 Nov 2023 at 5:09amShare optionsCopy linkFacebookX (formerly Twitter)Top StoriesAlbanese says discovery of potential mass-casualty event an act of 'terrorism'LIVEPhoto shows Albanese at a microphone in a courtyard gesturing with both handsSydney school vandalised amid concern about escalating antisemitismLIVEPhoto shows White long house with gate'Deeply disturbed': Jewish MP says possible terror plot sign of escalating hatredTopic:Federal GovernmentPhoto shows Julian Leeser Liberal MP for Berowra stands outdoors and looks at the cameraElizabeth died slowly in front of 14 people, but no-one called for help Topic:CourtsPhoto shows A smiling young girl in a park. (WLNE)FAIRHAVEN, Mass. (WLNE) — The U.S. Coast Guard said Monday that they found a body floating in the water off the coast of Fairhaven over the weekend.\nThe body was discovered on Sunday off West Island.\nThe Coast Guard said that they believe the body is of a missing fisherman who went overboard the Susan Rose near Martha’s Vineyard earlier this month.\nThe Susan Rose is a 77-foot vessel out of Point Judith.\nThe Coast Guard said an autopsy will be performed to positively identify the person.\nCategories: News\nFacebookPinterestTwitterLinkedin\nRelated\nMayor touts New Bedford as 'stronger today' during State of the City address\nRoof of church caves in after fire in Providence\nFall River construction worker dies after house collapse in Weymouth\nSuspects held without bail in killing of Providence 18-year-old\nMost Viewed\nMaine earthquake felt in Southeastern Massachusetts, Rhode IslandLocal, state police investigating motorbike crash in TauntonUPDATE: Victim in fatal Seekonk crash identified by Bristol County DA'Blue Envelope' program goes into effect in Rhode IslandProvidence Police respond to shots fired at shopping plaza\nFeatured\nPick of the LitterThe Preserve Club & Residences Live CamLive Weather Cams -     "https://www.adressa.no/debatt/i/Gy8Pvq/de-doer-mens-de-skaffer-oss-mat-fra-havet-kan-vi-leve-med-det": "Fiskerne elsker friheten og selvstendigheten, og de tar risikoen med på kjøpet - adressa.no\nNyhetsstudioNyheterSportKulturDebattUkeadressa     0     Adressa debatt Send din mening KommentarDebattKronikkLederArrangement      Søk\nHavet er et sted der ulykker fort får store konsekvenser, ikke minst for alenefiskere. Men det er jo ikke bare havet som er arbeidsplassen til fiskerne. Det er også fartøyet, skriver Ingunn Marie Holmen (t.h.) og Trine Thorvaldsen fra Sintef Ocean.\nFoto: Kari Williamson, SintefDe dør mens de skaffer oss mat fra havet. Kan vi leve med det?   Ingunn Marie Holmen  Forskningsleder, Sintef Ocean Trine Thorvaldsen  Seniorforsker, Sintef Ocean  Siden år 2000 har hele 157 yrkesfiskere mistet livet. Kan vi leve med at så mange dør på jobb for å skaffe mat til fellesskapet? Publisert:\n22. januar 2025 kl. 11:55\nOppdatert:\n22. januar 2025 kl. 11:55\nDu leser nå en kronikk. Den uttrykker innsenderens mening.De siste ukene har det vært stor oppmerksomhet rundt de høye drukningstallene for 2024, blant annet på lederplass i Adressa. Det er dessverre ikke bare fra fritidsbåter for mange drukner.En lørdag i august 2023 legger en sjark ut fra kai i Mehamn i Finnmark. Fiskeren skal på kongekrabbefangst og er alene i båten. På vei inn Tanafjorden setter han ut lenker med krabbeteiner. Når den sjette lenka går over rekka, sitter noe fast. Sjarken mister fart, fiskeren prøver å løse floka. I sin rapport antar Havarikommisjonen at han hekter seg fast i tauverket.Tungt utstyr og lunefull natur utfordrer sikkerheten til havs. Men det er likevel fullt mulig for samfunnet å gjøre arbeidsplassen til fiskere tryggere. Ved nyttår lanserte Sjøfartsdirektoratet en historisk handlingsplan for økt sikkerhet til havs. Det er vi som har forsket på dette temaet i over 20 år, glade for. For det trengs.Vi vet at mange fiskere elsker friheten og selvstendigheten i yrket. De tar risikoen med på kjøpet, slik generasjonene før dem har gjort. I primærnæringer til vanns og til lands må man håndtere uventede hendelser helt alene og ta raske beslutninger i situasjoner som kan ha store økonomiske konsekvenser. Da trengs det barrierer som kan forhindre de verste ulykkene. Selvstendig næringsdrivende på sjøen henger dessverre etter kollegene i landbasert primærnæring. De tre næringene med høyest andel dødsulykker, når vi ser ulykkestallene opp mot antall sysselsatte, er fiskeri, havbruk og landbruk – i den rekkefølgen.Havet er et sted der ulykker fort får store konsekvenser, ikke minst for alenefiskere. Men det er jo ikke bare havet som er arbeidsplassen til fiskerne. Det er også fartøyet. Og denne arbeidsplassen blir forma av regler, kvoter og reguleringer som myndighetene fastsetter. Samfunnet, ikke naturen, avgjør hvilke båter det er økonomisk forsvarlig å bruke.Samfunnet, ikke naturen, fastsetter hvordan fiskekvotene fordeles.Det er samfunnet, ikke naturen, som utvikler teknologien som kunne forhindret at fiskere faller over bord, blir klemt eller skadd av utstyr om bord.Det er samfunnet, ikke naturen, som bestemmer hvilke regler som gjelder for sikkerhetsutstyr.\nNaturen rår over vær og hav, men samfunnet kan og må gjøre fiskeryrket tryggere, skriver innleggsforfatterne fra Sintef Ocean.\nFoto: Anne-Marit DahlNaturen rår over vær og hav, men samfunnet kan og må gjøre fiskeryrket tryggere. Stortinget har vedtatt en visjon om at ingen skal dø mens de jobber på eller ved havet. Sjøfartsdirektoratets nye handlingsplan tar samfunnets ansvar og sammenhengen mellom rammer og sikkerhet på alvor. Ulykker skjer ikke i et vakuum. Vår forskning peker på at opplæring, fartøydesign, kvotepolitikk, sikkerhetsutstyr og regler knyttet til dette, spiller inn på den virkeligheten fiskeren står i den dagen hen for eksempel blir dratt med lenka med krabbeteiner over bord.Dagen etter at krabbefiskeren la ut fra Mehamn, er en venn av han på kaia. Han ser bilen til fiskeren stå på samme sted som dagen før. Han aner uråd og ringer inn en bekymringsmelding til Hovedredningssentralen. Nesten samtidig ringer en annen kollega inn samme melding. Sjarken ligger ikke til kai som forventa. Redningsmannskaper drar ut på fjorden og finner fiskeren flytende i vannet, nær en staur som markerte en krabbeteine. Båten har gått på grunn like ved, og motoren går fremdeles.Dette er en av mange dødsulykker Havarikommisjonen har gått inn i. Flere av dødsfallene kunne vært forhindret om næringa hadde vært underlagt andre påbud og krav. En sikkerhetsline kan hindre fall over bord. Nødstopp kan stoppe motoren om fiskeren faller. En trådløs alarmknapp som blir aktivert i kontakt med vann, kan varsle redningssentralen på land automatisk, slik at redningsaksjonen kunne blitt igangsatt umiddelbart.Ikke alle i næringa vil applaudere nye påbud. Sikkerhetsutstyr krever tilvenning og kan være en ekstra utgift. I den sammenheng kan vi minne om at sikkerhetsbelter i bil også var en uglesett nyvinning som aldri ville blitt tatt i bruk uten at de ble påbudt. Å innføre nye, selv upopulære, sikkerhetskrav er et ansvar myndighetene er nødt til å ta. De som skaffer oss mat på bordet, fortjener rammebetingelser som gjør det mulig å jobbe uten å risikere liv og helse. Fiskerne fortjener den omsorgen som ligger i strengere påbud, krav og økt tilsyn. Nå er en visjon blitt til plan. Den videre jobben er å gjøre planen om til handling. Vi venter spent på å se om myndighetene følger opp Sjøfartsdirektoratets arbeid med nødvendige ressurser.Hva mener du? Send inn din tekst til debatt@adresseavisen.no eller delta i debatten i kommentarfeltet nederst – og husk fullt navn! Music Mix\nLocal\nDomestic\nGlobal\nSports\nBusiness\nPress Releases\nPolitics\nEntertainment\nFisherman dies, two survive boat accident\n21 Apr 2024 | Staff Writer\nFile photo of the NSRI in action\nWarning:\nThis article may contain graphic and/or adult content unsuitable for minors and sensitive readers.\nRead the article\nThe National Sea Rescue Institute says after an extensive search for a missing fisherman, the man was found to have drowned.\nNSRI spokesperson Craig Lambinon says the unfortunate incident took place at Brightwaters on Saturday morning, on the Atlantic side of Cape Point.\nHe says two men, whose boat had capsized, raised the alarm and several emergency services teams were alerted.\nThe men reported that they had both managed to reach the shore after their boat capsized in the surf zone in dense fog.\nThey said their boat had then washed ashore, but they had found no signs of their skipper who was missing in the surf zone.\nLambinon said two NSRI Hout Bay rescue craft, Nadine Gordimer and Albie Matthews, were launched and responded.\n“Metro Control activated the Western Cape Government Health EMS rescue squad \"drone rescue unit\" and NSRI alerted the SA Police Services (SAPS), SAPS Sea Borderline Control and SAPS’ Water Policing and Diving Services.”\nHe said the two male survivors, aged 17 and 29, were treated by paramedics and were transported to hospital where they were recovering.\n“It appears that the casualty boat may have been swamped by a wave before running aground on the shoreline.\n“During the search the body of the man was located approximately between 30 and 50 meters off-shore at Brightwaters and was recovered onto the NSRI rescue craft.\"\nSadly, the man was declared deceased.\nPrevious Article\nElections 2024: A party for the children is a party for the future\n19 Apr\nNext Article\nMpumalanga police hunting narrator of fake voice note\n22 Apr\nMost Read\nNew development in double murder case against GQ tavern
