    "https://www.citizen.digital/news/30-year-old-fisherman-drowns-in-lake-victoria-n336322": "30-year-old fisherman drowns in Lake Victoria\nCitizen Sounds Live TV Live Radio      30-year-old fisherman drowns in Lake Victoria   By\nGeorge Amolo\nPublished on:  February 08, 2024 07:36 (EAT)\nLake Victoria. Photo/Courtesy.   A body of a 30-year-old fisherman was found floating on the waters of Lake Victoria near Uhanya beach in Bondo sub-county after he is suspected to have drowned.        The body of the fisherman who has been identified as Peter Murunga Omoding’ was spotted near the lakeshore on Wednesday.         According to Siaya County Police Commander Cleti Kimaiyo, the incident was reported to Usenge police station by the Assistant Chairman of Uhanya Beach Management Unit Naphtaly Oduor. He reported that they had received a report from their local fishermen that there was a body found while floating on the lake.         Officers from Uhanya police patrol base visited the scene and with the help of members of public retrieved the body of the deceased who hails from Teso in Busia County.        While confirming the incident, Kimaiyo stated that the body which had no visible physical injuries was moved to Bondo sub-county hospital mortuary to await postmortem as investigations into the matter continue. The body of the fisherman who has been identified as David Omolo Nyimba was discovered by fishermen at Kowang’e beach in Memba sub-location. The body of a fisherman who drowned in Lake Kanyaboli, Gangu Nyalaji village, in Siaya county has been found.         The deceased was fishing with a friend on Wednesday, when their boat capsized.        The deceased's colleague was able to swim and sought refuge from fishermen who rescued him. However, the deceased drowned before he could be rescued.         The search for the body took two days before it was finally found on Friday morning.         Assistant chief, Enock Otieno, said police took the body to Siaya County Referral Hospital mortuary as the family makes arrangements for his burial.        “Residents in Gangu Nyalaji, together with the local administrators have advised fishermen to wear life jackets when fishing, but many fishermen claim that they know how to swim and do not need the advice,” Kevin Odhiambo, a resident of Gangu said.     "https://www.daijiworld.com/news/newsDisplay?newsID=1009893": "Udupi: Malpe fisheries port poses more danger than sea, more than 100 lose lives - Daijiworld.com\nHome\nNews\nObituary\nRecipes\nCharity\nSpecial\nಕನ್ನಡ\nLive TV\nRADIO\nAdvertise\nMatrimonial\nProperties\nJobs\nClassifieds\nRed Chillies\nMusic\nAsk Dr\nGreetings\nAstrology\nTribute Of Love\nLatest\nIndians lose hope for quality life under PM Modi’s government: C-Voter survey\nWed, Jan 29\nUdupi: School bus overturns after multiple vehicle collision, major casualty averted\nWed, Jan 29\nMangaluru: Accused absconding for 8 yrs arrested in Sakleshpur\nWed, Jan 29    2\nBeltangady: Nuthan Cloth Center celebrates 75th anniversary with exciting lucky draw winners\nWed, Jan 29\nMother-daughter among four from Belagavi killed in Maha Kumbh Mela stampede\nWed, Jan 29    7\nTussle between Jarkiholi, DKS  set to escalate over Dy CM's growing influence in Belagavi\nWed, Jan 29    5\nWill stand by CM Siddaramaiah in any situation, says Parameshwara\nWed, Jan 29    2\nTop Stories\nUdupi: Malpe fisheries port poses more danger than sea, more than 100 lose lives\nFri, Oct 14 2022  07:13:10 PM\nDaijiworld Media Network - Udupi Udupi, Oct 14: The movement and anchoring of boats at the Malpe fisheries port has not only become a cause for worry due to large amount of silt gathered but it is also posing a danger to the lives of fishermen.\nMalpe fisheries port which is the second largest port in the country is facing serious issues as desilting work has not been taken up for the last 7-8 years.\nFishermen are finding the port more dangerous than the sea. They are finding it difficult to jump from one anchored boat to another as there is every danger of slipping into the water and losing their lives.\nIf a fisherman falls into the water at the port, it would be difficult for anyone to rise from the silt that has got accumulated over a long period. Fishermen accuse the administrators of turning a blind eye to the danger that the silt gathered is posing.\nSilt has accumulated up to the third phase of the jetty and it is difficult to anchor boats. In the Baputhota region, there is a substantial amount of silt accumulation that it is difficult to move the boats after emptying the fish in the first and second phase of jetties.  As Malpe is home to a number of big boats at least 3 metres of the vessel is submerged in the water at the port. If 2.5 metres of silt is removed the movement of boats would become easier, fishermen say.  In the last five years, more than 100 people have lost their lives after falling into the water at the port. Once they fall into the water and get under the silt it is difficult for anyone to come back on top. In the last two months itself, 8 of them have lost their lives. Moreover, there are many boats in the jetty that have gone kaput.\nThere is an urgent need for desilting and also devise an alternative system to save the fishermen's lives, according to expert Eshwar Malpe.  \"There have been many accidents happening all the time. Many representations have been made. Now, grants-in-aid has been released. The fishermen's problems must be solved at the earliest,\" said Dayananda K Suvarna, president of Malpe Fishermen Association.  \"The government has given its approval to take up desilting work for which Rs 3 crore has been made available. Desilting work at the channel and three phases of the jetty are likely to be taken up. The process is likely to be completed within two months and work will commence later,\" said Udaya Kumar, assistant executive engineer, ports department.\nFollow Daijiworld News Network on\nTop Stories\nComment on this article\nThomas,  Udupi\nSat, Oct 15 2022\nAll fish trading houses in Malpe are earning in millions from the sale of free fish they obtain from the sea, they should be made to pay for the desilting and upkeep  works of the Malpe seaport,  and that Mr,Yashpal Suvarna who is the President of the Fisherman’s union should be held responsible if he deserves his title  or better to have someone more responsible to take care of all fisherman's woes.\nDisAgree [4] Agree [8]\nReply Report Abuse\nSameer,  Riyadh\nSat, Oct 15 2022\nAsk Raghupathi Bhat. May be he can get a 'floating bridge' installed? ;) ;) ;)\nDisAgree [5] Agree [8]\nReply Report Abuse\nDr Alexander Dsouza,  USA\nSat, Oct 15 2022\nMr Suvarna and the govt waiting for few more fishermen to vanish and their kids and wife to be homeless or abandon , then only they are looking at the issue. the vanishing percentage still below the govt target. what a tragedy.. Mrs Shobha you only to  give Bla Bla bla, without presentable your self as a MP, where are you when family is loosing their husband and father. Useless human.\nDisAgree [3] Agree [11]\nReply Report Abuse\nshuba,  Mangaluru\nFri, Oct 14 2022\nThis is really sad.  What's the port authorities doing.  The concerned fisheries dept  is so bad they can't even  see  emergency required to be taken on top priority.\nDisAgree [1] Agree [10]\nReply Report Abuse\nAlan,  Mangalore/U.S.A\nFri, Oct 14 2022\nNo development since 2014. No silt was removed. B.J.P is busy fanning communal riots and making a fool of everyone. They are not bothered about the locals.  A student dies in Australia because of armed robbery and the whole of India is quick to point out that it was a racial attack and not because of robbery. Indians have a low opinion of themselves and are quick to point out about other people. How about treating minorities properly?  Instead of creating a wedge between people from different communities, how about uniting them? B.J.P has money to buy M.L.A's and ministers and lodge them in huge costly 5-star resorts but no money to fund the desilting and are putting people's lives in danger. He was on the country boat and left for fishing at around 3 am on February 23 from Hejamadykodi along with Dheeresh Bangera. As their boat reached the estuarine entrance, a huge wave struck the boat and it capsized. Dheeresh managed to swim to the shore.\nPadmanabha’s mortal remains were found on Friday at Hejamadi Kodi. A case of unnatural death is registered in Padubidri police station.\nFollow Daijiworld News Network on\nTop Stories\nComment on this article\nSense_shetty,  Mangalore\nSun, Feb 26 2023\nGovt should pay insurance premiums of the fishermen. He had gone fishing with other fishermen on Navaratna boat from Malpe port on September 12 in the night. All of them who were on the boat had slept in the night on September 13. As the boat driver drove the boat in the opposite direction from against the direction of the waves, Abhimanyu lost balance and fell into the water.\nIt is said that the driver went ahead without trying to rescue Abhimanyu who fell into the water. One of the fishermen who questioned the boat driver was hurled expletives and told by the driver that he was sacked and that he was sent home upon the boat reaching the Karwar port.\nSushanth Malik, brother of the missing who came to Malpe on September 18, has filed a complaint with Malpe police station stating that his brother fell into the water and died due to negligence and hastiness of the boat driver.\nMalpe police who have registered a case are investigating.\nFollow Daijiworld News Network on\nTop Stories\nComment on this article\nKaran,  Katapadi/Dubai\nWed, Sep 20 2023\nThere are no safety regulations for these boats. How can a sleeping boat employee can fall into water ? Was there no railings ? Is there no proper place for resting / sleeping ? Why the boat driver didnt throw Life Rings ?  Why not alerted coast guard ?  Many questions... We are lacking basic safety at work.\nDisAgree  Agree\nReply Report Abuse\nThomas,  Udupi\nWed, Sep 20 2023\nThese Fishing Boat owners in Malpe earn a huge amount of money from the exporters who buy the prime fresh fish and export it to tourist destinations such as Bombay, Goa, Bangalore, Tamil Nadu, and Andhra Pradesh.\nMoreover, they get huge subsidy on Diesel for the Trawlers.\nHowever, this industry is not regulated and therefore the local Trawler owners take advantage in not valuing the life of one of his helpers who fell in the sea.\nLife Insurance and Medical Insurance and compensation in work hazards and work related accidents must be covered.\nDisAgree  Agree [2]\nReply Report Abuse\nLeave a Comment   Your Email address will not be published.\nTitle: Udupi: Odisha fisherman falls into water, goes missing, feared dead; plaint filed\nYou have 2000 characters left.\nDisclaimer:\nPlease write your correct name and email address. Inside why Health Secretary nominee's voice is so gravelly and raspy\nCNN gives Karoline Leavitt nasty new nickname after first White House briefing\nThe View host Joy Behar hurls sexist insult at new White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt\nBLM activist mayor storms out of meeting after slamming black locals for questioning luxury trip\nNo-nonsense Dem launches blistering attack on clueless colleagues for pushing policy Americans will hate\nTrump scores stunning symbolic victory as feds flush out America's most notorious criminal migrant hub\nMicrosoft is down across the US as users report issues with 365 services\nNew Hulu series has viewers hooked after 'best pilot episode in history'\nThis 80s punk rock icon who traded hard drugs for cardio was spotted with a toothache in LA... can you guess who?\nPrevious\nNext\nRevenge of the grouper fish: Filipino fisherman dies after harpooning fish, only for cable to wrap around his legs and send him tumbling into the water where he hit his head and drownedFisherman Jovy Baldado Narciso was killed on August 9 in the PhilippinesWas spearfishing when his leg got tangled in a rope and was pulled underwaterHe hit his head on a rock and drowned after he couldn't free his leg from the ropeBy SAM BAKER FOR MAILONLINE  Published:  09:51 EST, 24 August 2021   |  Updated:  10:11 EST, 24 August 2021                e-mail        172 shares     145 View  comments\nA fisherman in the Philippines has died after being pulled beneath the water by a huge fish and hitting his head on a rock before drowning.Jovy Baldado Narciso, 31, had been harpoon fishing in the Negros Oriental province on August 9 when he was pulled beneath the waves.The fisherman had impaled a two-foot long fish with a spearfishing gun before the animal darted beneath a collection of rocks.      Jovy Baldado Narciso, 31, (pictured) has died after being pulled beneath the water by a huge fish and hitting his head on a rock before drowning      The 5Kg fish (pictured) darted off and pulled Jovy underwater, but refused to come out of a hiding spot, leaving the fisherman unable to return to the water's surface for airThe act of swimming off so quickly caused the rope attached to the harpoon to tangle itself around Jovy's legs and pull him into the water, where he hit his head on a rock. With the 5Kg fish refusing to come out from its hiding place, Jovy struggled to free himself and reach the surface of the water - but was unable to get loose and drowned.          RELATED ARTICLES  Previous 1 Next       Kamala Harris' flight from Singapore is delayed by three...    'This is really scary, oh my goodness!' Chilling last words...      Share this article Share   An officer from the Manjuyod Police Station said: 'Worried relatives reported that the man was missing the next morning. We did a search and rescue operation immediately found his body.'The rope was still tied around the man's body while the fish was still under the rock with the harpoon. They were both dead when we arrived.'      A rescue team recovered Jovy's body, which was then transported to hospital before being turned over to his familySuperstitious neighbours believed that the fish that killed the fisherman was 'evil' because Jovy's death was the second drowning incident that happened in the lake after a 14-year-old also died in the area last week.A neighbour said: 'You should be careful in a lake because the creatures have strange behaviour compared to the sea. Just like this evil fish.'The fisherman's body was taken to the hospital before being turned over to devastated relatives for funeral arrangements.\nShare or comment on this article:\nFisherman dies after tumbling into water and hitting his head while harpoon fishing\ne-mail\n172\nshares\nMost watched News videos\nShocking moment man stabs another after brushing shoulders in station\nShocking moment giant fish eats mermaid's face in front of children\nShameless father uses three-month-old baby as a windshield wiper\nKat-fight!     "https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/scottish-news/family-pay-tribute-hero-fisherman-31679945": "Family pay tribute to 'hero' fisherman who fell overboard near Scots island - Daily Record\ndailyrecordLoad mobile navigationNewsLatest NewsScottish NewsUK & World NewsPoliticsCrimeHealthReal LifeBusiness & ConsumerWeird NewsScience & TechnologyNews By AreaExpandPoliticsFootballScottish PremiershipScottish ChampionshipScottish CupPremier Sports CupScotland Football TeamTransfer NewsEnglish Premier LeagueExpandSportLatest SportFootballHorse RacingRugbyGolfTennisBoxingDartsExpandTV & CelebsLatest CelebsCelebrity NewsTV & Radio NewsCelebrity InterviewsExpandLife & StylePartner StoriesLegal MattersScotland NowIn Your AreaBusinessTravelFollow usBuy a PaperRoad RecordPropertyPublic NoticesCompetitionsHoroscopesDealsFuneral NoticesJobsCrosswordsAdvertise With UsNewsletter signupmynewsassistantIn Your AreaAbout UsContact UsWork for usGot A Story?Local NewsCookie NoticeAdvertisingMarketplaceBook an AdMarketplaceBeauty Box SubscriptionYimbly ShopJobsBuy a PhotoCompetition RulesHow to ComplainCorrections & ClarificationsGoogle SurveyPrivacy NoticeAI NoticeSunday Mail Centenary FundPaper Subscription to the Daily Record and Sunday MailPaper Subscription to the Paisley Daily ExpressNewsletters SignupSyndication & LicensingTerms and ConditionsNotifications and alerts help© 2025 Scottish Daily Record and Sunday Mail Ltd\nHomeNewsScottish NewsCoastguard\nNewsFamily pay tribute to 'hero' fisherman who fell overboard near Scots islandEoghann Maclachlan died at Belnahua, one of the Slate Islands in the Firth of Lorn, at around 4pm, December 13.dailyrecordBookmarkShareCommentsNewsByJohn-Paul Clark11:59, 15 DEC 2023BookmarkThe body of Eoghann Maclachlan was found at Belnahua, one of the Slate Islands in the Firth of Lorn. (Image: Facebook)Get the latest Daily Record breaking news on WhatsAppOur community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More infoJoin us on WhatsAppA fisherman who died after falling overboard has been named as 58-year-old Eoghann Maclachlan.  Emergency services were called to reports of a man falling overboard from a fishing vessel at Belnahua, 20 miles south of Oban, at around 4pm, December 13. Tragically, the body of Eoghann was recovered from the area a short time later.\nRead More\nRelated Articles\nWoman devastated as new immigration rules crush hopes of husband in Scotland\nRead More\nRelated Articles\nToddler fights for life after being attacked with belt by 12-year-old babysitter\nEoghann, from the Isle of Luing, was the skipper of the Nista and Vigilant creel boats, where he worked alongside his son Lorne. He leaves behind his wife Mandy, children, grandchildren, mum and brothers and sisters. His sister Fiona Cruickshanks led the tributes online to her \"hero and best friend\". She said: \"I can’t believe that I am sharing this post, it all seems so unreal. Eoghann wasn’t just my big brother.  \"He was my hero, my guide, and my dearest friend. He had the gift of accepting people just as they were - there was no bad side to him, and he truly was the best of us all - forever with us in the song of the sea.\"\nFamily and friends paid tribute to Eoghann Maclachlan following his tragic death.\n(Image: Facebook)\nFriends of the family shared their condolences to Eoghann's family.  Alison Logan commented: \"Heartbreaking for all his family and friends. A huge loss to the island. Eoghann had time for everyone and will be sorely missed.\" David Walker remarked: \"Deeply saddened by the news . Eoghann was a great family man , great fun and a true gentleman . My deepest condolences to all the family.\" Helen Finnie said: \"I am so shocked. He was such a lovely, gentle, capable, mischievous man. Even if you didn't know him well you felt safe in his company.\"\nTop news stories today\nKingpin snared by pal's brothel bender\nNC500 tourists in horror campervan crash\nEx-hoods swap criminal past to give back\nScuba diver's Orkney death 'preventable'\nA spokesperson for the Clyde Fishermen's Association added: \"The wider community have lost an exceptionally kind, humorous, skilled and hard working person. He was an excellent seafarer with a passion for people and music.  An integral part of his community.  \"Fundamentally he was a very good man, an uncommonly good sort all round. Indeed the kind of man seldom encountered. Taken far too early, we were all so privileged to have known him. We hope he rests in peace.\" A Police Scotland spokesperson said: “Around 5.15pm on Wednesday, 13 December, we were made aware of a boat running aground in the Belnahua area. The Coastguard attended and the body of a58-year-old man was recovered. His next of kin are aware.\nJoin the Daily Record WhatsApp community!\nGet the latest news sent straight to your messages by joining our WhatsApp community today. You'll receive daily updates on breaking news as well as the top headlines across Scotland. No one will be able to see who is signed up and no one can send messages except the Daily Record team. All you have to do is click here if you're on mobile, select 'Join Community' and you're in! If you're on a desktop, simply scan the QR code above with your phone and click 'Join Community'. We also treat our community members to special offers, promotions, and adverts from us and our partners. If you don’t like our community, you can check out any time you like. To leave our community click on the name at the top of your screen and choose 'exit group'. If you’re curious, you can read our Privacy Notice.\n“The death is being treated as unexplained but there are not believed to be suspicious circumstances. A report will be sent to the Procurator Fiscal.” An HM Coastguard spokesperson said: \"We received a call just before 16:00 yesterday, Wednesday 13th December, reporting a man overboard from a fishing vessel at Belnahua. \"Oban Coastguard Rescue Team, Oban RNLI lifeboat and a Coastguard helicopter were all sent.\"  Don't miss the latest news from around Scotland and beyond - Sign up to our daily newsletter   here   . Newsကျန်းမာရေး\nကပ်ရောဂါဆိုင်ရာကိုဗစ်အထူး ကဏ္ဍ\nစီးပွားရေး\nကုန်ဈေးနှုန်းစီးပွားရေးဆောင်းပါးစီးပွားရေးသတင်း\nနိုင်ငံရေး\nThe Coup စစ်အာဏာသိမ်းမှု\nပညာရေးပြည်တွင်းသတင်း\nမြန်မာ့ရေးရာ\nနိုင်ငံတကာသတင်း\nတစ်ပတ်အတွင်း နိုင်ငံတကာရေးရာ\nဒေသသတင်းတနင်္သာရီ နေ့စဉ်သတင်း\nတစ်ပတ်အတွင်း တနင်္သာရီသတင်းတနင်္သာရီပုံရိပ်ထားဝယ်မြိတ်ကော့သောင်း\nဖျော်ဖြေရေး\nဘဝနေနည်း၀တ္ထုတိုဗေဒင်\nဆောင်းပါး\nခရီးသွားဆောင်းပါး\nခရီးသွားလုပ်ငန်း\nဓလေ့/သမိုင်းဆောင်းပါး(အမျိုးသမီး/လူငယ်)\nပုံနှိပ်ထုတ်ဝေမှု\nDawei သမိုင်းပေါ့ကပ်\nအခြေပြမြေပုံFact CheckEnglish Version\nENG\nMM\nပင်မစာမျက်နှာ\nသတင်း\nထားဝယ်\nမြိတ်\nကော့သောင်း\nရွှေ့ပြောင်းလုပ်သား\nပြည်တွင်းသတင်း\nနိုင်ငံတကာသတင်း\nအားကစား\nဓာတ်ပုံ သတင်း\nအမြင်\nတနင်္သာရီပုံရိပ်\nအယ်ဒီတာ့ အာဘော်\nအင်တာဗျူး\nအတွေးအမြင်\nသရော်စာ\nပေးစာ\nစီးပွားရေး\nစီးပွားရေးသတင်း\nစီးပွားရေးဆောင်းပါး\nသုံးသပ်ချက်\nကုန်ဈေးနှုန်း\nဆောင်းပါး\nသတင်းဆောင်းပါး\nနိုင်ငံတကာဆောင်းပါး\nဓလေ့/သမိုင်း\nလမ်းညွှန်\nရသ\n၀တ္ထုတို\nအခန်းဆက် ဝတ္ထုရှည်\nဖျော်ဖြေရေး\nအက်ဆေး\nသမိုင်း\nခရီးသွားဆောင်းပါး\nရုပ်ပုံလွှာ\nအောက်မေ့ဖွယ်\nရုပ်သံ\nတနင်္သာရီ နေ့စဉ်သတင်း\nအားကစား/ကမ္ဘာ့ဖလား\nဓလေ့ သမိုင်းပေါ့ကပ်\nPSA\nရုပ်သံသတင်း\nတစ်ပတ်အတွင်း နိုင်ငံတကာရေးရာ\nတစ်ပတ်အတွင်း တနင်္သာရီသတင်း\nမြန်မာ့ရေးရာ\nရုပ်ရှင်အညွှန်း\nရုပ်သံ\nတွေ့ဆုံခန်း\nရွှေ့ပြောင်းလုပ်သား\nရွှေ့ပြောင်းလုပ်သားရုပ်သံ\nဓာတ်ပုံများ\nသတင်းဆောင်းပါး\nPSA\nInfographic\nစာစောင်များ\nတနင်္သာရီစာစောင်\nFE5 Tanintharyi\nHome » English Version » Crisis at Sea: The Life-threatening Work of Myanmar Fishers in Thailand\nCrisis at Sea: The Life-threatening Work of Myanmar Fishers in Thailand\nEnglish Version\nJuly 16, 2024\nMost of the fishers in Thailand—one of the countries that have received the biggest value from seafood export—are Myanmar migrant workers who have been fleeing from their country since the coup in 2021. In Thailand, they are facing another threat: working with many risks, ranging from losing body parts to death, without proper protection.\nThis post is also available in Burmese on Dawei Watch.\nA Myanmar migrant fisher, Maung Maung*, still remembers vividly the night he lost his younger brother, Chit Min Thu, to the sea. Maung Maung knows that working as a fisher has many risks, including death. He had always been worried when his younger brother joined him as a fisher in Thailand, especially because his brother did not know how to swim.\nOne night, on July 19, 2023, Maung Maung, Chit Min Thu, and their boss went to the sea in Thailand. Both of the brothers were fishing, while their boss became the boat leader.\nIn the middle of the dark, several waves came and hit their small boat. Then came one big tide that shook their boat. Maung Maung was still able to hold onto the rope in their boat, while Chit Min Thu failed and fell into the water.\n“After he fell off the boat while working, I attempted to save him, but it was already too late,” Maung Maung recounts the younger brother, tears streaming down his face looking at his picture. In a flash, his brother disappeared from his sight. Maung Maung immediately told his boss. His boss helped search for him for 30 minutes as per his duty but was unable to find him. He stopped the search.\n“The boss showed no concern for my little brother, who had fallen into the water. If we had continued the search, we might have been able to find him,” he recalls.\nHis boss continued to work as if nothing had happened. They didn’t continue the search and irresponsibly disembarked on the shore. “That was why I had to let go of my younger brother,” Maung Maung says.\nAfter 12 hours of disappearance, around 1 pm the following day, Chit Min Thu’s dead body was found at another port. However, the boat owner, who had been working for more than 10 years, did not allow him to load his body onto his boat.\nMaung Maung understands that working as migrant fishers means they always need to work as quickly as possible without any protection, including from rescue, police forces, and bay watch forces.\n“This is totally inhumane. The owner didn’t take the corpse immediately and didn’t call the police. He even threatened the person who informed the police, fearing that the case would be filed. He did not allow us to load the corpse to transfer it onto another shore. Thus, I had to tie my late younger brother to my chest, hug the boat body, and make the journey,” Maung Maung recounts.\n“I cradled my late younger brother’s body, crossing the sea for 30 minutes, and brought it back.”\nMyanmar Fishers in Thailand\nMaung Maung and Chit Min Thu were originally from the Phyuu township in the Bago region of Myanmar. Their family consists of nine members, including their parents and seven siblings, three men and four women.\nWhile the women of the family work at garment factories in Yangon, their incomes are not as good as those working in Thailand.\nMaung Maung has been working as a fisherman on a snail hunting boat at the Mekong port in the Samut Prakan district of Thailand for more than 10 years now.\nThe coup in Myanmar made his family more unstable than ever. The military coup started on February 1, 2021, and resulted in political instability and economic stagnation, further exacerbating the loss of job opportunities.\nAccording to a statement from the Myanmar embassy in Bangkok, the number of documented Myanmar workers in Thailand increased to 3 million following the coup as of December 2023. An estimated 5 million Myanmar citizens, both documented and undocumented, have sought employment in Thailand since.\nMost of the migrant workers have to take blue-collar jobs that Thai citizens often avoid. Chit Min Thu was one of those people.\nChit Min Thu joined his brother to support their family in 2023. Together, the two brothers earned over 30 lakhs MMK or about 1000 USD per month, which provided full financial support for the family.\nDisregarding the risks to life and safety, many Myanmar nationals are forced to work in the fishery sector, which is widely recognised as one of the most dangerous occupations in the world.\n“As I wanted to continue the traditional work that I did in my village, I chose to work on a boat in Thailand. I am familiar with the work and don’t really find it tiring. It is not difficult for me; I enjoy doing it. When I was in my village, I used to go fishing and set nets to catch fish,” says Maung Maung.\nOver 70,000 individuals are fishers in Thailand, most of them from Myanmar and Cambodia. Approximately 70% of fishers in Thailand come from Myanmar.\nAn illustration of a balance scale where money weighs more than a boat from which a person fell.\nAccording to the International Transport Workers’ Federation—Fishers Rights Network (ITF-FRN) report (2024), “Over 98% of fishers in Thailand are poorly educated male migrant workers from rural Myanmar or Cambodia.”\nIn Thailand, if a person wants to become a fisher, they need to apply for documents such as a work permit, passport or certificate of identity (CI), pink card (Non-Thai ID card), and social security (Prakan Sangkhom) card.\nHowever, according to Miss Phi Saw*, the Human Rights and Development Foundation (HRDF) representative, an organisation that advocates for migrant workers’ rights in Thailand, employers typically keep such documents, and the workers don’t even have a copy. Therefore, most workers are not fully aware of the details of the legal documents that they possess.\nOnly when Port-In-Port-Out (PIPO) officials come to check the documents, before the departure of the boat, do the employers give them to the workers temporarily and take them back upon disembarkation.\nObtaining a work permit, books, and permission to work legally on a one-year visa costs over 30,000 Baht or above 800 USD.\nDespite spending one-third of their pay to work with legal documentation, most fishers do not fully have access to their rights in accordance with the law.\nMany fishers like Chit Min Thu have lost their lives or disappeared at sea. According to the Royal Thai Police, there are at least 306 deaths and disappearances at sea between 2020 and 2022.\nLack of Protection\nAs mentioned earlier, most Myanmar migrant workers work blue-collar jobs since it is harder for them to find alternatives, and even harder for those who are undocumented. They need to earn some money to live with limited work options, including fishing.\nAt a glance, the fishing industry seems promising to the migrant workers. The fishers do not need to spend extra money on accommodation because the employer will provide meals and boats for free. Working together on the boat also removes the necessity for individual expenditures, unlike working on land.\nThese incentives attract many Myanmar workers, including undocumented migrant workers, to choose fishing jobs in Thailand.\nBecause they lack a detailed understanding of workplace hazards and difficulties, most Myanmar people come and work in fishing boats with the hope of getting a lump sum like the factory and construction industries. One of them is U Sein Shin.\nU Sein Shin, 37 years old, is a native of Mrauk-U, Rakhine State in Burma. He has left behind his two parents and one sister there.\nHe was a farm worker in his homeland, but he made a firm decision to work as a fishing boat worker, which he had never done before, to support his family.\nHe worked as a construction worker right after he arrived in Thailand, but earned his income irregularly.\nThus, despite having sea motion sickness, he decided to work as a fisherman, as the 10,000 Baht (around 274 USD) per month salary attracted him. He worked in a fishing boat in the Phanat area of ​​Chumphon District, southern Thailand.\nOnly five days after starting, he experienced a joint dislocation.\n“I went to the boat early in the morning to set the nets. Then, I hit a block and tripped over, resulting in my arm joint becoming disconnected. Perhaps my hand was also sprained and fractured. I lost consciousness and only became aware of what had happened to me when I woke up in the hospital,” he recounts.\nThe mishap happened in early January 2024, as the boat in-charge informed the bay watch force and received first aid assistance.\nHe was sent to the hospital in a timely manner. The employer only allowed him to have one day of medical leave at the hospital. Apart from that, the employer didn’t take any responsibility for it.\nBesides not asking about his medical costs, living expenses, and compensation until one month after the incident, the employer even kept important legal documents such as his passport.\nDue to the worsening of his arm injury, he couldn’t perform well at work anymore. The employer dismissed him.\n“The boss didn’t give me a penny or visit me. I’m still alive because my friends are feeding me,” U Sein Shin says.\nPower Abuse\nIn U Sein Shin’s case, we can see how the boss is able to abuse his power as an employer. Furthermore, until this article was published, his boss still held his social security card. Without the card, U Sein Shin is unable to withdraw medical costs and his medical leave allowance from the compensation fund.\nIn the case of a boat worker falling into the water or any mishap on a fishing boat, they need to activate the signal and inform the bay watch force to seek help.\nAccording to the Aid Alliance Commitee for Myanmar Workers (ACC), when a fisher activates it, they will be rescued in a timely manner and transported to the hospital with emergency services through the Thai military. AAC is an organisation that advocates for Myanmar migrant workers’ rights in Thailand.\nACC representative, Ko Nay Lin Thu, says if they fail to inform the Bay Watch Force to seek help in a timely manner, they may risk their lives, as Chit Min Thu.\n“[Often times], fishing boats do not only operate within their designated location. They go out of the designated boundary. When operating within their designated territory, there’s a rescue force available for their security. However, if they face trouble outside their designated area, they don’t dare to activate the signal for help, fearing being sued,” says Ko Nay Lin Thu.\nHowever, both U Sein Shin, who was injured while working on the boat, and Chit Min Thu, who lost his life, have not yet received any compensation from the social security fund.\nWorkers with social security cards are eligible for free medical treatment at the hospital and to withdraw medical leave allowance. Through this fund, compensation for fisher’s injuries, disabilities, and death will be available. However, it is noted that undocumented fishers are not eligible for this.\nHRDF explains that if the injured person loses a body part, they can withdraw the compensation themselves. In the case of loss of life, the compensation can only be claimed by family members, preferably parents. If workers and family members are unable to collect compensation themselves, they must seek help from Myanmar organisations and cooperate until compensation is received.\nHowever, it is impossible for the workers to withdraw it because, in many cases, the employer keeps the documents, like U Sein Shin’s case. According to the HRDF group, there are even some cases where employers withdrew compensations issued by the Social Security Office by using the documents they kept if the workers injured lost an arm or a leg.\nSystemic Violence\nThailand is well-known for its seafood industry. In 2022, the value of seafood exports from Thailand reached 22 billion Thai Baht (641 million USD) and ranked 6th in the world for seafood. These overseas revenues are largely contributed by over 70,000 migrant fishers working at sea, whose labour has been exploited and unprotected.\nOn the other hand, Thailand is one of the countries that ratified ILO Convention 188 of Work in Fishing in 2019 and issued policies that should protect fisher rights, but exploitation is rife throughout the industry.\nDespite more than 300 fishers missing and losing lives at sea from 2020 to 2022, only about ten asked for help from Myanmar labour organizations, according to the AAC group. AAC’s representative, Ko Nay Lin Thu, emphasized how migrant fishers have faced life-threatening situations on the boat.\n“In 2023 alone, there were incidents of death, accidents, fights, being kicked off the boat, individuals being hit with ropes in the boat and having limbs cut off. There were about 20 such cases as far as the team is aware of,” says Ko Nay Lin Thu.\n“Many cases went unnoticed. Most of them don’t dare to report the case. They didn’t dare to complain because they were afraid, whether it was fear of the employer or fear of losing the job.”\nHuman Rights Watch (HRW) urged the Thai government to solve the problems of working conditions.\nLabour violations are worsened by employers’ non-compliance with existing laws and the use of intimidation against migrant fishers. Fishers often do not have employment contracts in their hands, passports, bank books, or documents such as social security cards, and the salary was not transferred through an official bank account.\nAccording to Thai Law, employers must pay the fishers’ monthly salary via bank transfer. However, the ITF-FRN report shows that 99.4 per cent of fishers are not paid monthly by bank transfer.\nMost of the fishers are also not entitled to 30 days off per year under the Seafarers Protection Act 2557. According to HRDF, although the law requires employees to be paid double the regular rate for working on off days, most employers do not comply with this.\nAdditionally, the ITF-FRN report states, “Fishers working on these vessels report that most do not have adequate clean water onboard, lack fully stocked and accessible first aid kits, and are forced to work excessively long hours without adequate rest. These dangerous and unhealthy working conditions not only violate human rights—they violate existing labour law and are clear indicators of forced labour conditions.”\nU Sein Shin recounts how his work was “physically demanding.” Every day, he worked from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. Each trip lasted for 20 days without any day off on the boat.\nAAC reported that a big compound where fishers reside in Mahachai is always locked so that fishers cannot go out, and the employer has seized their legal documents.\n“Sometimes, organisations together with local authorities conduct a site visit. Though boat workers don’t dare say anything to us, we see fear on their faces. We have that sense once we see it. Considering the troubles that they have to bear, we did not say things we know to the authorities,” Ko Nay Lin Thu says.\nWorkers are faced with being beaten in the boat, arrested, or dismissed from work and risking deportation.\nFighting Against the System\nAfter facing all of the injustices, both Maung Maung and U Sein Shin decided to fight for their rights. Maung Maung sought help through the AAC organisation and has already filed a complaint at the Social Security Office to receive compensation.\nAt the time of writing, the boss still threatens him to close the case with a small compensation of about 50,000 baht (around 1370 USD) for his brother’s death. Maung Maung ignores the threat and chooses to fight for his brother’s rights instead.\n“We are working to take action against our boss,” says Maung Maung.\nKo Nay Lin Thu said ACC is open to advocating for and helping Myanmar migrant workers who faced incidents or death while working as fishers, such as Maung Maung’s case.\n“Boat cases are said to be rare. Many incidents go unnoticed, especially those that happen on boats,” he says.\nKo Nay Lin Thu, an AAC Alliance representative, suggested that Thailand’s government offices conduct thorough investigations into cases involving migrant fishers. Based on his experience, the success rate is high when the workers want to take it to the legal step.\nTherefore, Ko Nay Lin Thu suggests that when workers face rights violations by employers, they should report those abuses to police forces or workers’ rights protection offices collectively. Workers should especially seek help from Myanmar worker organisations near their places.\nBased on the type of rights abuse, documentation and unpaid labour charges will be further reported to workers’ rights protection offices, and compensation-related matters will be reported to social welfare offices.\nDue to limited knowledge, campaigns and education to increase awareness of migrant fishers’ rights still need to be pushed. HRDF conducts awareness campaigns for 1,000 workers annually in the field, while the Foundation for Education and Development (FED), a foundation that has advocated for migrants’ education and health for years, has been working on education and advocacy for decades.\nNot only from organisations but also from the Thailand government. HRDF and ACC also emphasise the need for the government to promote labour rights awareness in workers’ native languages to ensure effectiveness. Language barriers pose a significant challenge in educating workers, particularly in peripheral areas with limited government outreach.\nHRDF says that it will be handled only if the case is bravely reported to Thai authorities or workers’ organisations.\n“If something happens and a worker does not report it, nothing can be done. Therefore, workers need to report the case. Once family members are informed, they need to file for compensation, as they are all responsible for it. Thai employers rarely feel responsible and pay compensation,” says Miss Phi Saw, an HRDF female officer.\nAs a result, many workers, such as Ko Chit Min Thu and U Sein Shin, have experienced violations of their rights, including failure to receive medical costs and compensation.\nThe mother of Chit Min Thu hopes to receive compensation of over 800,000 Thai Baht for the loss of her son in accordance with the law, and she plans to cooperate with AAC. “I seek a reasonable amount of compensation for this tragedy,” she says.\nShe cried holding Chit Min Thu’s national scrutiny card. “I feel utterly inconsolable. He was my child, a good son who worked to support his parents and siblings. I am overcome with grief. My heart is shattered by this loss.”\n*Pseudonyms were used to protect identities.\nThe story is produced by Dawei Watch with the support from BEBESEA & New Naratif Fellowship Program.\nRecent Posts\nကော့ဖငန်းကျွန်းက မြန်မာစာသင်ကျောင်းကို ထိုင်းရဲဝင်စစ်၊ မြန်မာဆရာလေးဦး ဖမ်းဆီးခံရ\nထားဝယ်-သရက်ချောင်းလမ်းပေါ်ရှိ ‌ရွှေဂူတံတားစစ်ကောင်စီဂိတ်ကို PDF သိမ်းယူ\nပုလော ဆင်ထိုးကြီးရွာတွင် ဥယျာဉ်ခြံအချို့ ရက်ရှည်မီးလောင်နေပြီး မြေမြှုပ်မိုင်းကြောင့် မီးငြှိမ်းရန်ခက်\nဇန်နဝါရီလ ၂၉ရက် တနင်္သာရီနေ့စဉ်သတင်း အစီအစဉ်\nပုလောဒေသခံတစ်ဦး စစ်ကောင်စီတပ် စစ်ကြောရေးတွင် သေဆုံး\nMy Younger Brother …Alive But Suffocated – Elderly suffering the most in Myanmar conflictsRape and sexual assaults by both sides going unpunishedGuardians of Pat-Chan: How river conservations thrived before Myanmar’s crisis\n+95 9876 432 1\ndaweiwatch@gmail.com\nDawei Watch\nDawei Watch သတင်းဌာနကို ၂၀၁၂ ခုနှစ် မေလတွင်ထားဝယ်မြို့ အခြေစိုက် စတင် တည်ထောင်ခဲ့သည်။ Dawei Watch သည် ကနဦးတွင် တစ်နိုင်ငံလုံးခြုံထုတ်ဝေသည့် နေ့စဉ် သတင်းစာများ၊ အပတ်စဉ်များကို အဓိကအားဖြင့် တနင်္သာရီတိုင်းနှင့် မွန်ပြည်နယ်အတွင်းမှ သတင်းများ ဝန်ဆောင်မှုပေးလျက်ရှိသည်။ ယင်းအပြင် ထူးခြားမှုအလိုက် ထိုင်းရောက် မြန်မာ ရွှေ့ပြောင်းလုပ်သားများ သတင်းကိုလည်း တင်ဆက်သည်။\n© Copyright 2025.     "https://www.dawn.com/news/1710638/three-fishermen-die-of-suffocation-aboard-boat": "Three fishermen die of ‘suffocation’ aboard boat - Newspaper - DAWN.COM\nEPAPER\nLIVE TV\nDAWNNEWS URDU\nImages\nHerald\nAurora\nCityFM89\nAdvertise\nEvents\n/Supplements\nClassifieds\nObituaries\nDAWN.COM\nE-Paper | January 30, 2025\nHome\nLatest\nBreathe\nGaza siege\nPakistan\nOpinion\nBusiness\nImages\nPrism\nWorld\nSport\nMagazines\nTech\nVideos\nPopular\nArchive\nFlood Donations\nHome\nLatest\nBreathe\nGaza siege\nPakistan\nOpinion\nBusiness\nImages\nPrism\nWorld\nSport\nMagazines\nTech\nVideos\nPopular\nArchive\nFlood Donations\nSearch\nSearch\nThree fishermen die of ‘suffocation’ aboard boat\nThe Newspaper's Staff Reporter\nPublished\nSeptember 18, 2022\n0\nJoin our Whatsapp channel\nKARACHI: Three people aboard a fishing vessel died of suffocation in the open sea on Saturday, police and their community said.\nThe deceased were identified as Zaheer Moosa, 40, Qadir Ramzan, 30, and Deedar Ali, 35. The bodies were shifted to the Jinnah Postgraduate Medical Centre for medico-legal formalities.\nThe police said apparently they died of suffocation in a cabin of their boat near Gate No 1, Chashma Goth in Fisheries. However, further investigations were under way, they added.\nPakistan Fisherfolk Forum spokesperson Kamal Shah told Dawn that the fishermen had gone on fishing in a big boat. They usually stay up to one month in the sea for fishing.\nHe said on the boat, the catch and feed were stored in a room. It seemed that some toxic gases accumulated in that room and when one of the fishermen went there he fell unconscious, the spokesperson said.\nFour other fishermen tried to save their colleague, but they also fell unconscious, he said, adding that other fishermen reached Bhindar Island and moved their unconscious colleagues to the jetty from where they were taken to a hospital.\nHe said doctors declared three of them died on arrival, while two others got admitted for treatment and their condition was said to be improving.\nPolice Surgeon Summaiya Syed said that the three persons found inside the deck of a fishing boat in the open sea were brought dead at the Dr Ruth Pfau Civil Hospital Karachi at about 4am on Saturday.\nTheir relatives took the bodies without allowing doctors to perform medico-legal formalities.\nPublished in Dawn, September 18th, 2022\nNewspaper\nEmail\nYour Name*Cancel\n0\nRead more\nMotorcyclist drowns in roadside drain\nSit-in over Sanghar killings continues as relatives refuse to bury victims\nCM Murad calls for ‘aggressive and sustained’ efforts to make Sindh polio-free\nSponsored\nRevolutionising reproductive health: Viya launches Viya Telehealth\nOn     "https://www.deccanchronicle.com/nation/current-affairs/210523/four-dead-several-injured-in-intense-gale-winds-in-ap.html": "4 Killed, Many Hurt As Thunderstorm Lashes AP | 4 Killed, Many Hurt As Thunderstorm Lashes AP                     Top   ,          e-PaperCorporate Insolvency Resolution Process HomeFact CheckSouthAndhra PradeshTelanganaTamil NaduKarnatakaKeralaNationWorldSportsCricketFootballTennisOthersEntertainmentTollywoodBollywoodSandalwoodKollywoodMollywoodHollywoodMovie ReviewsTelevisionMusicTheatreOTTVideosOpinion and EditorialsColumnsDC CommentsBusinessTechnologyEducationHyderabad ChronicleIn FocusSpecial StoryFeaturedAstroguide Fact CheckSouthAndhra PradeshTelanganaTamil NaduKarnatakaKeralaNationWorldSportsCricketFootballTennisOther NewsEntertainmentTollywoodBollywoodSandalwoodKollywoodMollywoodHollywoodMovie ReviewsTelevisionMusicTheatreOTTOpinion and EditorialsDC CommentsColumnsVideosBusinessTechnologyEducationHyderabad ChronicleSpecial StoryFeaturedHome » Nation4 Killed, Many Hurt As Thunderstorm Lashes APNation K.M.P. PATNAIK22 May 2023 12:00 AM IST The IMD has warned that thunderstorms would lash both Andhra Pradesh and Telangana for the next three daysxThunderstorms may lash Anakapalli, ASR, Kakinda, Eluru, NTR, Palnadu, Prakasam, Nellore, Tirupati, Chittor, Annamaya and YSR districts on Monday, the weather office said. (Representational image: DC)Visahakapatam: Four persons were killed and many were injured as thunderstorms accompanied by gale winds lashed Andhra Pradesh since Saturday night. In addition, a woman from Vijayawada drowned in Bangalore when she and her five family members were trapped in their car in neck-deep water. In Parvatipuram Manyam district, two fishermen drowned in Peddagadda in Pachipenta mandal while they were fishing in the reservoir on May 19. Strong gusty winds accompanied by thunderstorms sank the country boat and both were missing. They were Seetharam and Jogaiah. The bodies were found on Sunday. In Jangamgutlapalem village under Medikonduru mandal in Guntur district, one person died and five were injured when they were struck by lightning. He was Battula Sambayya. Two children were among the injured. Two families travelling on two motorcycles were trapped in a hailstorm. They stopped the vehicles and took shelter under a tree. The injured were admitted into Sattenapalli government hospital. In another incident, one person died on the spot when flying sheets of a temporary shed hit him during a thunderstorm. Sources said the winds blew the roof of the shed located near a petrol bunk in Srinivasapuram under Gopavaram mandal and the sheets fell on the 33kv power lines and the victim. On Saturday evening, temporary sheds built for the workers crashed following the hailstorm in R5 zone in Amaravati area. Around 27 workers were injured. The IMD has warned that thunderstorms would lash both Andhra Pradesh and Telangana for the next three days due to a trough of low pressure formed, extending from western Bihar to north Telangana. Thunderstorms may lash Anakapalli, ASR, Kakinda, Eluru, NTR, Palnadu, Prakasam, Nellore, Tirupati, Chittor, Annamaya and YSR districts on Monday, the weather office said.( Source : Deccan Chronicle. )AP  reservoirs fishermen drown andhra pradesh news thunderstorms India Southern States Andhra Pradesh Vishakhapatnam About the AuthorK.M.P. PATNAIKLatest News   Next StoryX",
    "https://www.deccanchronicle.com/nation/fisherman-undergoing-treatment-at-kgh-dies-889173": "Fisherman Undergoing Treatment at KGH Dies                     Top   ,          e-PaperCorporate Insolvency Resolution Process HomeFact CheckSouthAndhra PradeshTelanganaTamil NaduKarnatakaKeralaNationWorldSportsCricketFootballTennisOthersEntertainmentTollywoodBollywoodSandalwoodKollywoodMollywoodHollywoodMovie ReviewsTelevisionMusicTheatreOTTVideosOpinion and EditorialsColumnsDC CommentsBusinessTechnologyEducationHyderabad ChronicleIn FocusSpecial StoryFeaturedAstroguide Fact CheckSouthAndhra PradeshTelanganaTamil NaduKarnatakaKeralaNationWorldSportsCricketFootballTennisOther NewsEntertainmentTollywoodBollywoodSandalwoodKollywoodMollywoodHollywoodMovie ReviewsTelevisionMusicTheatreOTTOpinion and EditorialsDC CommentsColumnsVideosBusinessTechnologyEducationHyderabad ChronicleSpecial StoryFeaturedHome » NationFisherman Undergoing Treatment at KGH DiesNation DC Correspondent11 April 2024 1:19 AM IST xThe mechanised boat, which had sailed from Kakinada, went up in flames around 65 nautical miles off the Visakhapatnam coast after a cooking gas cylinder aboard it exploded around 8 p.m. on April 5. Of the nine fishermen on board, five suffered severe burns. (Representational Image)Visakhapatnam: Fisherman Y. Sattibabu (43), who sustained critical injuries in a boat explosion off the Visakhapatnam coast on April 5, succumbed while undergoing treatment at the King George Hospital (KGH) here on Wednesday.The mechanised boat, which had sailed from Kakinada, went up in flames around 65 nautical miles off the Visakhapatnam coast after a cooking gas cylinder aboard it exploded around 8 p.m. on April 5. Of the nine fishermen on board, five suffered severe burns.The injured fishermen jumped into the water and used their VHF set to alert the Indian Coast Guard (ICG).ICG Vessel Veera responded swiftly to the distress call and rescued the injured fishermen from the sea. It brought all of them ashore and admitted them to KGH for treatment.Sattibabu, who had sustained 81 per cent burns, succumbed to his injuries while undergoing treatment on Wednesday. The other injured fishermen are Danti Palla Srinu (45), M. Sridhar (50), Gangotri (38), Veerababu (20), Satyababu (40), Vajram (40), S. Sattibabu (52) and Dharma Rao (42).     "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/science-environment/2308157-maha-two-fishermen-drown-one-missing-after-boat-capsizes-in-arabian-sea-off-ratnagiri-coast": "Maha: Two fishermen drown, one missing after boat capsizes in Arabian sea off Ratnagiri coast | Science-Environment\nHOME\nNEWS\nRESEARCH\nLIVE DISCOURSE\nBLOG / OPINION\nSUBMIT PRESS RELEASE\nAbout  Career  Advertisement  Team  Partnership    Knowledge Partnership  Media Partnership   Contact Us      NEWS  RESEARCH  LIVE DISCOURSE  BLOG / OPINION  INTERVIEW  SUBMIT PRESS RELEASE      Agro-Forestry  Art & Culture  Technology  Economy  Education  Energy  Politics  Law & Governance  Health  Science  Social  Sports  Transport  Urban Development  WASH\nAdvertisement\nHome\nNews\nScience & Environment\nArticle\nMaha: Two fishermen drown, one missing after boat capsizes in Arabian sea off Ratnagiri coast Two fishermen drowned and one went missing after their boat capsized in the Arabian sea off the Ratnagiri coast in Maharashtra, an official said on Wednesday. The bodies of the two fishermen were fished out of the sea, the official said.\nPTI  | Palghar | Updated: 04-01-2023 19:05 IST | Created: 04-01-2023 19:05 IST\nCountry:\nIndia\nSHARE\nTwo fishermen drowned and one went missing after their boat capsized in the Arabian sea off the Ratnagiri coast in Maharashtra, an official said on Wednesday. The official said all the fishermen belonged to Patkar Pada from Talasari in Palghar district.He said four boats set out for fishing in the Arabian sea from Mangrol port in Junagadh district of Gujarat on December 30. On January 2, seawater gushed in one of the four boats anchored near Dikshi, 80 nautical miles off the Ratnagiri coast, the official said. Of the seven fishermen aboard the boat four were saved by fishermen from other boats, while two others drowned and one went missing, he added. The bodies of the two fishermen were fished out of the sea, the official said. All fishermen were brought to the Ratnagiri coasts in other boats. Bodies of the two deceased are being brought to Talasari in ambulances, the official said.\n(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)\nREAD MORE ON:  Gujarat\nDikshi\nArabian\nMangrol\nJunagadh\nRatnagiri\nMaharashtra\nPalghar\nTalasari\nPatkar Pada\nAdvertisement\nALSO READ    Three persons killed, 15 injured as auto-rickshaw hits multiple vehicles in Maharashtra's Thane district: Police. knowledge is power, and this is never more accurate than when you establish yourself as a foreign resident in a new country, like Spain. Let us be your convenient and essential guide to all things that will likely affect you as a foreign resident living in Spain.\nFinance\nFinance\nBusiness\nCryptocurrency\nTechnology\nProperty & Investment\nLifestyle\nLifestyle\nHealth and Beauty\nHomes and Gardens\nMotoring\nPets\nHoroscopes\nEntertainment\nTV\nFilm\nTravel\nTravel Guides\nLiving in Spain\nCamping\nDining out on the Costas\nPuzzles\nPuzzles\nQuick Crossword\nSudoku\nCodeWord\nSolutions\nColumnists\nNewspapers\nRead The EWN Online\nAlmeria\nAxarquia\nCosta Blanca North\nCosta Blanca South\nCosta del Sol\nCosta Calida\nMallorca\nSocial Scene – Costa del Sol\nLatest NewspaperAlmeriaAxarquiaCosta Blanca NorthCosta Blanca SouthCosta del SolCosta CalidaMallorcaSocial Scene – Costa del Sol\nAdvertise\nHoliday Rentals\nMore\nContact Us\nContact Us\nAbout Us\nCareers\nTestimonials\nOur View\nViewpoint\nNewsletter\nFollow Us\nMedia Pack\nNewsdesk:\n+34 600 583 579\nSales:\n+34 600 583 578\nSpain\nSearch continues for fishing boat missing off Huelva coast\nBy Chris King •\nPublished: 06 Dec 2021 • 19:07\n• <1 minute read\nFour dead and 21 missing in boat wreck off Cadiz coast. CREDIT: Salvamento Maritimo\nSearch continues for fishing boat missing off Huelva coast\nA search is continuing today, Monday, December 6, for an octopus fishing boat and its crew that has been missing since last Friday 3. Maritime Rescue rescue services are searching off the coast of Isla Cristina, in the province of Huelva.\nAs reported to EFE, the SAR Malestero rescue ship operated throughout the night, accompanied by a Helimer 202 helicopter. These emergency services have been in action during the whole weekend Saturday. An emergency signal is being transmitted by VHF to all other vessels sailing through the Gulf of Cadiz, in the hope of one of them spotting the missing boat.\nThis rescue operation was initiated at around 1pm on Saturday 4, after the Guardia Civil received a call informing them of the possible disappearance. They in turn contacted the Maritime Rescue rescue services.\nMost Read on Euro Weekly News\nLionel Messi announces sensational Barcelona return to family and friends\nRobbie Williams ship blessing Malaga\nNew €1,350 monthly payout: How to get it\nOne of the fishing boat crew’s wives had called to report that her husband had not returned after they set sail at around midday last Friday. It is believed there are two crew members on board the vessel, as reported by 20minutos.es.\n___________________________________________________________\nThank you for reading, and don’t forget to check The Euro Weekly News for all your up-to-date local and international news stories, and remember, you can also follow us on Facebook and Instagram.\nShare this story\nshare on Facebook\nshare on Twitter\nshare on WhatsApp\nshare on LinkedIn\nshare on Flipboard\nshare on Email\nSign up for personalised news\nSubscribe to our Euro Weekly News alerts to get the latest stories into your inbox!\nDaily\nWeekly\nBy signing up, you will create a Euro Weekly News account if you don't already have one.     "https://www.ewn.co.za/2024/04/16/mozambique-boat-capsize-kills-8": "Mozambique boat capsize kills 8\nAFP16 April 2024 | 10:44Mozambique boat capsize kills 8Monday's capsize in the Sofala province comes a week after a shipwreck killed almost 100 people, many of them children, around 1,000 kilometres (600 miles) further north.MozambiquePicture: 123rf/Sahul HameedMAPUTO - A fishing boat sank in the Zambezi river in central Mozambique, killing eight people including six children, authorities said Tuesday.\nMonday's capsize in the Sofala province comes a week after a shipwreck killed almost 100 people, many of them children, around 1,000 kilometres (600 miles) further north.\n\"The boat was carrying a total of 12 people, mainly farmers,\" Nobre dos Santos, administrator of the Caia district, told AFP.\n\"Two people survived and two others are still missing,\" he said, adding that six of the dead were children.\nAuthorities said a search was on for the missing.\nOn April 7, an overloaded makeshift ferry boat capsized killing 98 people. It was carrying many panicked families trying to escape a rumoured cholera outbreak.\nThe southern African country, one of the world's poorest, has recorded almost 15,000 cases of cholera and 32 deaths since October, according to government data.Follow us Sections  Latest LocalPoliticsElections 2024MultimediaWorldSportBusinessLifestyleOpinionFeaturesEntertainmentAfrica Podcasts  Other  Contact Us  Privacy Notice  Terms and Conditions  PAIA  COPYRIGHT 2025 ALL RIGHTS RESERVED",

    "https://www.fox10tv.com/2024/06/04/local-fisherman-killed-during-powerful-storm-deckhand-recovering-hospital/": "Local fisherman killed during powerful storm, deckhand recovering in hospital\nSkip to contentAdvertise With UsHire OneContestsWatch LiveLatest VideoNewsWeatherInvestigatesMardi GrasSportsPelicansOur AppsStudio 10HomepageLatest VideoWatch LiveOur AppsMardi GrasSubmit Photos or VideosNewsAlabama NewsNationalMobile CountyBaldwin CountyFlorida NewsMississippi NewsEducationInvestigatesCaught in the ActFugitive FilesPoliticsDaily Dot ComMardi GrasWeatherRadarWeather CamsHurricane CenterBus Stop ForecastNext WeatherStudio 10Committed to Our CommunityAbout the HouseLegal MattersDoing GoodAsk the SheriffIn the KitchenStudio 10 Sound StageBeauty and StyleHealthy LivingDollars and SensePet of the WeekHappening HereSportsSenior BowlPlayer of the WeekSaintsPelicansAlabamaAuburnSouth AlabamaStudio InterviewsMedical MinuteMaking RoundsHealthy LivingGulf Coast SpotlightDoing GoodAbout UsOur AppsMeet the TeamContact UsProgramming ScheduleWhat's on FOXAdvertise with FOX10CareersCaptioningSpeaker Request FormPlayground ProjectNews EmailsTrafficPerspectivesFOX10 at 3Class ActPlayground ProjectThe PledgeClick Here to Send Your Pledge VideosNextGen TVZeam - News StreamsLiving It Up with LeniseHope for a HomeCircle CountryGray DC BureauPowerNationInvestigateTVWatching Your WalletAdvertise with FOX10Digital MarketingLocal fisherman killed during powerful storm, deckhand recovering in hospitalA fellow fisherman is sharing how he helped save on of the crew members. A fisherman died after his shrimp boat capsized. (Source: WALA)By Ariel MalloryPublished: Jun. 3, 2024 at 10:58 PM CDTEmail This LinkShare on FacebookShare on X (formerly Twitter)Share on PinterestShare on LinkedInFAIRHOPE, Ala. (WALA) - FOX10 News is following a tragedy on Mobile Bay.A local fisherman was killed when a powerful storm capsized his boat.Captain and shrimper Mike Bishop was found on Saturday.His boat was found flipped over in the water, trapping him inside.A fellow fisherman and friend, Patrick Gormandy, assisted in trying to rescue Bishop and his deckhand Mark Henderson.Bishop and Henderson went out into the bay early Saturday morning for the first day of shrimping season.Bishop’s boat is still waiting to be recovered out of the water, as his boat slip remains empty.Now, a wreath of flowers and a life jacket have been placed where “Old Navy” once docked.Gormandy says he got a call that morning asking if he had heard from Mike.“I got a phone call at 8:45 from a gentleman that has a boat in the marina and asked had I spoke to Mike, and I told him no I haven’t spoke to Mike,” Gormandy said. “The trooper got on the phone with me and said if I send you a picture would you confirm that it’s Mike’s boat? So I did and I knew it was his. I asked for GPS coordinates. We picked up our nets and we took off as fast as we could towards him.”The frantic search for Bishop and his deckhand began.Gormandy says he was more than an hour away from the two but eventually one of his crewmen spotted a hand in the water.It was Henderson, almost unrecognizable, after floating in the water for hours.“When we got about a mile and three quarter away from Mike’s boat we saw something pop up in the wave. My crewman put the binoculars up and we spotted Mr. Henderson,” Gormandy said. “He was very purple, he was cold, shaking, disoriented. We took him in the cabin and put a blanket on him.”Gormandy received the devastating news that Bishop didn’t make it.He returned to Bishop’s boat slip Monday to return the life jacket...overcome with emotion as he remembered his dear friend.“I came here five years ago and he was the first person to talk to me and we’ve been buddies ever since,” Gormandy said emotionally. “He was a good man. Thursday we sat on the deck of my boat. That was the last conversation I had with him.”After spending the last 36 hours out on the water Gormandy says Bishop loved this job, but says people don’t understand how dangerous it is.“I don’t think people realize what it actually takes for us to bring fresh seafood to their table,” he said. “What we do is dangerous. We take it for granted because we go in and out every day but that could have been me. We can get caught in those storms too. If you see a fisherman tell him thank you. If you’re eating fresh gulf seafood it’s a sacrifice.”Henderson is recovering in the hospital.Crews are expected to salvage Bishop’s boat sometime this week.Copyright 2024 WALA.     "https://www.freepressjournal.in/india/tragic-death-of-gujarat-fisherman-in-pakistani-prison-sparks-concerns-for-other-detainees": "Tragic Death Of Gujarat Fisherman In Pakistani Prison Sparks Concerns For Other Detainees\nFree Press Journal\ne-Paper\nGet App\nHome\nMumbai NewsFPJ ShortsEntertainmentBollywoodHollywoodTelevisionRegional Film NewsMovie ReviewsBusinessTech NewsGamesFeaturesWeekendLifestyleIndiaSportsViralEducationStudy Abroad\nHomeIndiaTragic Death Of Gujarat Fisherman In Pakistani Prison Sparks Concerns For Other Detainees\nTragic Death Of Gujarat Fisherman In Pakistani Prison Sparks Concerns For Other Detainees\nThe lack of communication between the prisoners in Pakistan and their families in India has only worsened the sense of anxiety. These detainees are living in constant uncertainty, with little to no contact with their loved ones, adding to the emotional distress they already endure.\nMegha ParmarUpdated: Friday, January 24, 2025, 10:52 PM IST\nRepresentation Image | IANS\nPalghar: A tragic incident has unfolded as an Indian fisherman, a resident of Gujarat, has passed away in a hospital within a Pakistani prison. This untimely death has ignited fear and concern among the families of other Indian fishermen currently detained in Pakistan, many of whom have already completed their sentences. The fisherman, who was arrested by Pakistan's Maritime Security Agency in 2022, had finished serving his sentence by the time of his death. His Indian nationality was communicated to the Pakistani authorities by the Indian government well in advance. As per the Agreement on Consular Access between India and Pakistan, Clause (5) states that, \"Prisoners from one country who have completed their sentences and whose nationality has been confirmed must be released and repatriated to their respective countries within one month.\" Despite this provision, the fisherman was not repatriated as required.\nRead Also\nIndia Asks Pakistan To Expedite Release Of 183 Prisoners During Annual Exchange Of Lists, Seeks...\nThe lack of communication between the prisoners in Pakistan and their families in India has only worsened the sense of anxiety. These detainees are living in constant uncertainty, with little to no contact with their loved ones, adding to the emotional distress they already endure.\nFPJ Shorts\n'Will Not Be Harsh On Devotees; Don't Want Them To Be Panicked By New Rules': Siddhivinayak Temple Trust On Dress Code For Devotees\nChhattisgarh: Jagdalpur ACB Arrests Accountant Arun Sethia For ₹30,000 Bribe Over Job Posting\nChhattisgarh: State Election Commission Urges Collectors & DEOs To Promote Awareness Of EVM\nChhattisgarh: National School Of Drama To Host 'Bharat Rang Mahotsav-2025' From Feb 4-9 In Khairagarh\nCurrently, 216 Indian fishermen are being held in the Malir Jail in Karachi, Pakistan. Nearly 170 of them have completed their sentences, and their nationalities have been confirmed.\nHowever, many of these individuals, including the fisherman who recently passed away, should have been released according to the terms of the consular agreement.\nRead Also\nIndia summons Pakistan diplomat in Palghar fisherman killing\nThis tragic event has led to a growing call for the immediate release of all Indian fishermen who have completed their sentences, as stipulated by international agreements. Families and human rights advocates are urging Pakistan to take swift action and honor its commitments under international law to ensure the safe return of these detainees.\nFollow us on\nRECENT STORIES\nChhattisgarh: Jagdalpur ACB Arrests Accountant Arun Sethia For ₹30,000 Bribe Over Job Posting\nChhattisgarh: State Election Commission Urges Collectors & DEOs To Promote Awareness Of EVM\nCBI Coordinates With Authorities For Return Of Fraud Accused Virendrabhai Patel From The US\nCBI Coordinates With Authorities For Return Of Financial Fraud Accused Janarthanan Sundaram From...\nMaha Kumbh Stampede: West Bengal Pilgrims Recount Horrific Scenes; CM Mamata Banerjee Condoles...\nFree Press Journal\nAnalysis\nCity News\nMumbai News\nIndore News\nBhopal News\nDelhi News\nEducation\nEntertainment News\nBollywood News\nHollywood News\nMovie Reviews\nMovie Trailers\nRegional Film News\nTelevision News\nBrandSutra\nCorporate Gallery\nFPJ initiative\nHoroscope\nLegal\nScience\nSpirituality\nSports\nCricket News\nFootall\nLifestyle\nHealth\nTravel\nFood\nTop News\nPhoto Gallery\nTech News\nVideos\nViral News\nWeekend News\nPress Release\nAbout Us\nEditorial Policy\nCareers\nDisclaimer\nPrivacy Policy\nContact Us\nAdvertise With Us\nRSS\n© The Free Press Journal",

to a draw\nNational News  Deadline for F1 bid extended\nLifeStyle  Varied February programme at U3A\nNational News  Eskom’s proposed retail tariff plan: The Green Connection joins calls for energy justice and stakeholder engagement\nWeather 23°C\nWednesday 21:58\nclear sky\nTomorrow:\nclear sky 24°\nGeorge\nLoading\nSouthern Cape beaches: four drown, three missing and three rescued\nWhile the two men were attempting to direct their friend to try to swim towards safety, a wave washed another one of the men into the water.\nJournalist\nMichelle  Pienaar |\nThursday, 08 February 2024, 07:00\nWith some of our hottest summer days still ahead, the public is reminded to exercise caution when swimming, especially in the absence of lifeguards. Photo: Jeff Ayliffe\nSOUTHERN CAPE NEWS - This past weekend three local fishermen went missing, two at the shoreline south of Thembalethu, and one at Hansmoeskraal, near Pacaltsdorp. On the same weekend, three individuals were rescued from a rip current at Victoria Bay, among them a male teenager who was hospitalised in a stable but serious condition; a man from George drowned at Souwesia beach in Great Brak; and three people, a man and two women, drowned in the Sedgefield lagoon.Two fishermen, ThembalethuNSRI Wilderness station commander Mike Vonk said it appears that three local men were fishing together on Saturday 3 February at the shoreline south of Thembalethu when a wave swept one of the men off the rocks. \"While the two men were attempting to direct their friend to try to swim towards safety, a wave washed another one of the men into the water. \"The third friend had tried to direct both men towards safety but after they were unable to reach safety he had hiked to their vehicles, above the cliffs, and on reaching cellphone reception he raised the alarm before returning to search for his friends who had disappeared in the surf,\" said Vonk.Several emergency services responded, including WC Government Health EMS rescue squad and ambulance, NSRI rescue swimmers, the police, WPDS (Water Policing and Diving Services), George Fire and Rescue Services and the EMS/AMS Skymed rescue helicopter, accompanied by an NSRI ASR (Airborne Sea Rescue) crewman.\"On arrival on the scene an extensive air, sea and shoreline search commenced,\" said Vonk. \"Despite an extensive search there remains no sign of the two missing men.\" Police divers are continuing the search.Fisherman, HansmoeskraalOn Sunday afternoon, 4 February, NSRI Wilderness duty crew were activated by the police following eyewitness reports of a fisherman missing at Hansmoeskraal, near Pacaltsdorp.All the emergency services that responded to the two missing fishermen near Thembalethu again responded to help in this search, except for the EMS/AMS Skymed rescue helicopter and the NSRI ASR (Airborne Sea Rescue) crewman. Although initially activated, they had to stand down due to dense fog on the scene.\"An extensive sea and shoreline search commenced in the search for the local adult male. George Fire and Rescue Services conducted an aerial search using a rescue drone,\" said Vonk. \"Despite the extensive air, sea and shoreline search there remains no sign of the missing man. It appears that while fishing from the shoreline the man was swept into the sea by a wave.\" Police divers are continuing the search.Three rescued, Victoria BayOn Saturday 3 February, three people who were swimming in the surf zone at Victoria Bay apparently moved out of the lifeguards' safer designated area and were swept out further to sea by rip currents.Four lifeguards went into the surf to assist. Shortly before 17:00, the lifeguards alerted NSRI Wilderness duty crew to a drowning in progress.\"The lifeguards rescued two casualties to safety, uninjured,\" said Vonk. \"While swimming towards the third casualty they lost sight of the male teenager in the breaking surf line and sea swells. \"Lifeguards reached the area where they had last seen the teenager and located him as he was being pulled under water. \"The lifeguards, assisted by a local surfer, placed the teenager onto the surfer's surfboard and initiated rescue breaths while rescuing him towards the beach.\"Once ashore three local doctors who happened to be on the beach, NSRI lifeguards, NSRI medics and an ER24 paramedic continued medical treatment and rescue breathing. They were joined by additional NSRI members, emergency services and paramedics who were arriving on the scene.\"With respiratory resuscitation efforts continuing, the teenager was transported to hospital by ER24 ambulance in a critical condition where ongoing medical care was provided by doctors and nurses. \"Following ongoing extensive medical care in hospital, the teenager was stabilised and hospital staff have reported that he is expected to make a full recovery,\" said Vonk.Vonk said NSRI lifeguards, the local surfer and the off-duty doctors who assisted on the scene are commended for their swift response that contributed to saving the teenager's life. \"Thoughts remain with the teenager and his family during the recovery phase.\"Souwesia beach, Great BrakA man from George in his early 30s drowned at Souwesia beach, near De Vette Mossel, on Sunday 4 February.NSRI rescue swimmers, WC Government Health EMS, Mossel Bay Fire and Rescue Services, the police and By Grace ambulance services responded to reports of a drowning in progress.\"While responding to the scene it was confirmed that two men were out of the water,\" said Andre Fraser, NSRI Mossel Bay duty coxswain.\"Paramedics exhausted all efforts to resuscitate a man, in his early 30s, who was sadly declared deceased.\"He said that apparently, a Good Samaritan, a 26-year-old man, went into the surf to help when it seemed that the swimmer was having difficulty in rip currents. \"The Good Samaritan was not injured.\"Fraser said they believe members of the public had assisted them out of the surf. The body of the man was taken into the care of Government Health Forensic Pathology Services. Police have opened an inquest docket. ‘We bring you the latest Garden Route, Hessequa, Karoo news’\nRead more about:\ndrowning\nsouthern cape\nsouwesia\nvictoria bay\nthembalethu\nPosted on: 07:00 Thu, 08 February 2024\nClick here to follow us on WhatsApp\nCOMMUNITY\nMunicipal Notices\nLocal Events\nLocal Sports Gallery\nAbout George\nSEARCH\nOR\nPROFILE\nFind your prefect match now!\nReadyornot1964\nI'm a 61 year old man looking to meet women between the ages of 50 and 60.\nView Profile\nAmo12\nI'm a 52 year old man looking to meet women between the ages of 30 and 60.\nView Profile\nAgapé100\nI'm a 60 year old woman looking to meet men between the ages of 55 and 69.\nView Profile\nSonSkyn_Liefde\nI'm a 33 year old woman looking to meet men between the ages of 32 and 45.\nView Profile\nView more profiles\nI am a:\nSelect Gender\nWoman\nMan\nI am interested in:\nSelect Gender\nWomen\nMen\nMen & Women\nAge range between:\n18 - 60\nSUBMIT\nBack to Top\nMore Group Editors Publications & Online Platforms\nGeorge Herald proudly displays the “FAIR” stamp of the Press Council of South Africa, indicating our commitment to adhere to the Code of Ethics for Print and online media which prescribes that our reportage is truthful, accurate and fair. In a statement, the PCG said its Sub-Station Araceli continues to search for the missing crew member identified as Edgardo Casuna. PCG District Palawan on Wednesday said fishing vessel master Booths Donasco informed Coast Guard Sub-Station (GCSS) Araceli that Casuna went missing in the vicinity off Barangay Calandagan. According to Donasco, Casuna was swept away by strong sea current. “The master alarmed the vessel to raise alert to all crew members and to halt the fishing-related activities to conduct Search and Rescue (SAR) operation,” the PCG District Palawan said. After hours, the SAR was halted due to rough sea conditions from strong winds. “As of this date, the said crew of FV Yellow Bell is still missing. Moreover, CGSS Araceli will conduct a follow up SAR if weather permits in the area,” the Coast Guard District Palawan said. “Likewise, said Sub-Station advised all watercrafts to be on the lookout for the said missing person and render assistance if sighted and report to the nearest PCG Unit or other government agencies,” the PCG district added. Further investigation into the incident is ongoing, according to PCG Palawan. —LBG, GMA News   Tags: sea incident, Palawan, PCG District Palawan, mission boat crew, news       More Videos       Most Popular               LOADING CONTENT      LOAD MORE ARTICLES    RETRY LOADING                ◀                   All Rights Reserved 2025 © GMA Network Inc. So nu’ng nakita nila ‘yung barko, nagtalunan po sila lahat,\" Captain Airland Lapitan, acting commander of the Coast Guard Station Oriental Mindoro, said.The Coast Guard reported that only parts of the boat were damaged and it did not sink, allowing the fishermen to return safely to the vessel.However, the whereabouts of a 20-year-old fisherman is still unknown.\"Nagka-conduct pa rin tayo ng search and rescue doon sa nawawalang mangingisda. Meron na rin tayong possible location base doon sa search pattern na ginawa natin para ma-locate natin ‘yung nawawalang mangingisda,\" Lapitan said.Meanwhile, a 52-year-old fisherman, the father of the missing young man, sustained an injury in the foot. He was brought to the hospital but was discharged later.The fishermen rescued have returned home.The Coast Guard Station Oriental Mindoro is coordinating with the Vessel Traffic Management System (VTMS) Batangas to identify the vessel that passed through the area.Investigation is ongoing as of this writing. —GMA Regional TV   Tags: Philippine Coast Guard, Oriental Mindoro       More Videos       Most Popular               LOADING CONTENT      LOAD MORE ARTICLES    RETRY LOADING                ◀                   All Rights Reserved 2025 © GMA Network Inc. While there, their boat, which they forgot to secure, got swept away by the wind and strong current. According to the fisherman's wife, her husband jumped into the water in an attempt to retrieve their boat but he reportedly struggled to return to the fish cage and drowned. “CGS Davao Oriental Station Commander, CG Lieutenant Vincent Bryan Marcos, urges the public to always take precautionary measures and observe maritime safety guidelines at all times,” the PCG said.\nTRENDING\nJail adopts waste oil stove to cut costs, reduce pollution\nMan hit with helmet, dies; suspect claims self-defense\nToy guns banned in Pangasinan during election gun ban\nNewborn abandoned dead in General Santos\nSINAG to probe high prices of chicken despite stable supply\nLATEST ON SYNERGY\n'GMA Masterclass: Eleksyon 2025 Dapat Totoo' goes to Mindanao\nSparkle stars to grace Miss Sinulog Kabankalan 2025\nX\ngmaregionaltv.com is home to the latest stories produced by news teams of GMA Regional TV from stations in key areas across the Philippines.\nGet Connected\n3rd Floor, GMA Network Studios, GMA Network Drive, Quezon City, The Philippines\ngmaregionaltv@gmanetwork.com\n(+63-2) 982 7777 loc. 9201\nAbout us\nAdvertise with us\nCopyright © 2023 GMA Regional TV",
