    "https://www.newindianexpress.com/states/kerala/2023/jul/05/three-dead-one-missing-as-rain-continues-in-kerala-2591483.html": "Three dead, one missing as rain continues in Kerala\nE-PAPERNATIONWORLDSTATESOPINIONSCITIESBUSINESSSPORTGOOD NEWSMOVIESPHOTOSVIDEOSWEB SCRAWLNATIONWORLDSTATESOPINIONSCITIESBUSINESSSPORTGOOD NEWSMOVIESPHOTOSVIDEOSWEB SCRAWL\nKeralaThree dead, one missing as rain continues in KeralaIt rained heavily in Kasaragod, Kannur and Idukki on Tuesday.A two-wheeler rider loses his balance as he struggles to move through a waterlogged road during heavy rain in Kozhikode on Tuesday. (Photo | E Gokul, EPS)Express News ServiceUpdated on: 05 Jul 2023, 11:42 am3 min readCopiedTHIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Three people died and another person went missing as heavy rains wreaked havoc across the state on Tuesday. As many as 95 houses were partially damaged and another 100 got waterlogged due to sea erosion in Kozhikode. Restrictions were imposed on movement to hilly regions in Idukki and Kannur. Holiday has been declared for educational institutions in six districts on Wednesday. The Kannur University has postponed all examinations scheduled to be held on Wednesday.It rained heavily in Kasaragod, Kannur and Idukki on Tuesday. Cherthala in Alappuzha recorded 15 cm of rain, while Kottayam, Kudulu (Kasaragod) and Ranni AWS (Pathanamthitta district) recorded 14 cm each, as per the IMD data on Tuesday morning. An orange alert was declared for 12 districts on Wednesday. The intense spell of rainfall is likely to continue, especially in northern districts, till Saturday. In Thrissur, a 19-year-old boy who went fishing drowned in a canal at Arippalam. Veron, son of Kollamamparambil Antony of Arippalam, was a student of Kallettumkara Government Polytechnic.An autorickshaw driver died after his vehicle fell into a canal in Adoor in Pathanamthitta on Tuesday evening. Unnikrishna Kurup of Thatta died as he was caught in the strong current in the canal. In Palakkad, a woman died when a coconut tree fell on her. Thankamani, 55, a native of Pallarode, was working in the paddy fields in Vadakkencherry.  Orange alert sounded in 12 districts todayA 65-year-old man went missing in Iruvanjipuzha at Kodiyathur. C K Ussainkutty of Karakkutti, who went to the riverside to spend time with family, drowned in the river. In view of the monsoon calamities, the revenue department has instructed officials who went on leave to report for duty within next 36 hrs. The government directed district collectors to announce holidays for educational institutions on the previous day.Fire and Rescue Services personnel cutting the branches of a huge tree that fell on the roadside near Palarivattom in Kochi on Tuesday amid heavy rain | T P Sooraj Three forest fringe villages in Pathanamthitta — Araynjilimon, Kurumpanmoozhy and Avanippara — were marooned after the causeways across the Pampa and the Achankovil got submerged. Water levels in Pampa, Manimala and Achankovil rivers have risen. In Idukki, a mudlsip was reported from Munnar. The IMD issued an orange alert for all districts except Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam on Wednesday. These districts can expect heavy rainfall (7- 11 cm) to very heavy rainfall (12-20 cm) in 24 hours. The weather in Malappuram, Kozhikode, Kannur and Kasaragod is likely to continue the same on Thursday. Rain or thundershowers are most likely to occur across the state till July 8, said the official forecast. Fishermen were advised not to venture into the sea due to the high-velocity wind (45-65 Kmph) and high waves reaching up to 3.5 - 3.7m between Vizhinjam and Kasaragod.ALSO READ | Sea surge batters geotubes, waves tear into KannamaliALSO READ | Disaster management: CBSE schools in district to be divided into 4 zonesFollow The New Indian Express channel on WhatsApp Download the TNIE app to stay with us and follow the latestKerala rainsheavy rainsShow CommentsRelated StoriesNo stories found.\nCopyright - newindianexpress.com 2024.     "https://www.newindianexpress.com/states/kerala/2024/Jun/02/kerala-fisherman-goes-missing-in-shankhumukham": "Kerala fisherman goes missing in Shankhumukham\nE-PAPERNATIONWORLDSTATESOPINIONSCITIESBUSINESSSPORTGOOD NEWSMOVIESPHOTOSVIDEOSWEB SCRAWLNATIONWORLDSTATESOPINIONSCITIESBUSINESSSPORTGOOD NEWSMOVIESPHOTOSVIDEOSWEB SCRAWL\nKeralaKerala fisherman goes missing in ShankhumukhamThe boat capsized around 8.15am; one person accompanying him was rescued by lifeguards & brought to safety Coastal guards conducting a search for Mahesh, who went missing after the fishing boat capsized at Shankhumukham on Saturday Photo | Vincent Pulickal, EPSExpress News ServiceUpdated on: 02 Jun 2024, 3:30 am2 min readCopiedTHIRUVANANTHAPURAM: A fisherman went missing after his boat capsized off the Shankhumukham coast on Saturday morning. The missing fisherman has been identified as Mahesh (32). He and another fisherman, Wilson had ventured out to the sea early in the morning to anchor their boat in Vizhinjam in preparation to go fishing on Sunday. Delayed response by the Coastal Police triggered protests.The incident happened at around 8.15am when their boat capsized. Wilson was rescued by lifeguards and brought to shore safely. The search for Mahesh is still ongoing. Lifeguards and local fishermen have been involved in the search efforts, but there has been no sign of Mahesh. “The chances of rescuing Mahesh are very low. The water flow is now inward, it is possible to rescue someone only if they are on the water surface. Mahesh is healthy and experienced with the sea, but since their boat overturned off the coast, lifeguards suspect he might have hit his head on the rocks,” said Robin, a lifeguard. Residents expressed frustration over the delayed response from the coastal police and lifeguards, who reportedly arrived at the scene around 10 am, almost two hours after the boat capsized. They added that the delay reduced the chances of a successful rescue. “The delayed response from the authorities is unacceptable,” said Ajith Shankhumukham, a resident and activist. Residents are mostly of the opinion that the unscientific shoreline protection methods have destabilised the coastline, making it difficult for fishermen to predict sea conditions. Residents of Shankhumukham have long been concerned about the lack of proper anchoring facilities in their area, which forces them to travel to Vizhinjam. According to them, this adds unnecessary risks to their daily activities. “The argument that sea walls are unscientific is baseless. Sea levels are rising, and water from areas like Azhimukham, Poovar, and Poonthura ultimately flows into the sea. Without the construction of sea walls, the impact of the waves would be even stronger,” added Robin.MLA Antony Raju visited the site on Saturday morning and addressed the concerns of the locals. He said that the coast guard had responded as quickly as possible, considering the distance from Vizhinjam and promised that no further delays were caused by the coast guard’s response. The man who escaped after the boat capsized was Vincent. Mahesh’s wife Sandra Manian is a homemaker.They have two children – Liya, 7, and Rayan, 5. Follow The New Indian Express channel on WhatsApp Download the TNIE app to stay with us and follow the latestShankhumukhamShow CommentsRelated StoriesNo stories found.\nCopyright - newindianexpress.com 2024. All rights reserved. Powered by Quintype\nX\nThe New Indian Express\nwww.newindianexpress.com\nINSTALL APP",
    "https://www.newindianexpress.com/states/tamil-nadu/2023/feb/18/tn-man-allegedly-shot-dead-by-karnataka-forest-department-staff-tension-grips-border-areas--2548515.html": "TN man allegedly shot dead by Karnataka forest department staff, tension grips border areas\nE-PAPERNATIONWORLDSTATESOPINIONSCITIESBUSINESSSPORTGOOD NEWSMOVIESPHOTOSVIDEOSWEB SCRAWLNATIONWORLDSTATESOPINIONSCITIESBUSINESSSPORTGOOD NEWSMOVIESPHOTOSVIDEOSWEB SCRAWL\nTamil NaduTN man allegedly shot dead by Karnataka forest department staff, tension grips border areas  A 40-year-old fisherman from Kolathur in Salem is suspected to have been shot dead by Karnataka forest department personnel near the Karnataka-Tamil Nadu border on Tuesday night.Image used for representational purpose only. (Express Illustrations)P SreenivasanUpdated on: 18 Feb 2023, 2:02 am3 min readCopiedERODE:  A 40-year-old fisherman from Kolathur in Salem is suspected to have been shot dead by Karnataka forest department personnel near the Karnataka-Tamil Nadu border on Tuesday night. The body of M Raja (a) Karavadaiyan, a resident of Arisipalayam near Govindhapadi in Kolathur in Salem district, was found floating on Palar River by the Salem district police on Friday. Salem superintendent of police R Sivakumar, however, said the cause of death could be conclusively established only after getting the postmortem report.M RajaAs villagers alleged that he was shot dead by Karnataka forest personnel, tension prevailed in border areas and Tamil Nadu and Karnataka authorities deployed additional police force to maintain law and order. Vehicular movement was also affected for some time. According to sources, a group of fishermen from Salem were fishing near the confluence of Cauvery and Palar rivers on Tuesday when Karnataka forest department personnel allegedly opened fire and killed one of them. Police sources said, “On February 14 night, Raja and four others from Salem were fishing at Palar on Tamil Nadu-Karnataka border. The gang is suspected to have gone for hunting in forests on the banks of the rivers when Karnataka forest department personnel allegedly opened fire on them.While everyone jumped into the river and escaped, Raja did not return home and was untraceable.” Subsequently, Raja’s relatives lodged a missing complaint at Mettur police station on Thursday. The relatives also told police that Karnataka forest personnel had shot Raja.‘Reason for death can be ascertained only after autopsy’The Mettur police registered a man-missing case and were investigating. “On Friday, police received information about Raja’s body floating on Palar near Kaveri Puram of Erode district. They sent the slightly decomposed body to Salem GH for postmortem. A case registered under Section 174 CrPC (drowning),” sources said. V Sasimohan, Erode superintendent of police, said, “As the body was decomposed, it could not be immediately ascertained whether he died of gunfire or drowning. Full details will be known only after we get the postmortem report.”Additional police forces have been deployed at Karaipatti check post on Tamil Nadu-Karnataka border near Kolathur in Salem district to avoid untoward incidents. Interstate vehicular movement was stopped for a while, sources said. Salem SP R Sivakumar said, “A postmortem will be held on Saturday. At present, police are engaged in security operations at important places on Tamil Nadu-Karnataka border. Traffic between the two states is smooth.”“Raja has several cases pending against him. In 2018, when Raja and his friend Palani went on a similar hunt together, Palani died in firing by Karnataka forest personnel,” police said. Communist Party of India (CPI) and Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) criticised Karnataka forest department for firing on Tamil Nadu fishermen.CPI state secretary R Mutharasan expressed his condolences to the victim’s family, and in his statement, called on the state government to conduct a thorough probe and provide compensation to the family. Meanwhile, PMK president Dr Anbumani Ramadoss also condemned the alleged shooting and called on the state police to register a case and arrest the accused. He also requested the state government to provide a compensation of Rs 50 lakh to the victim’s family and a government job to one of his family members.Postmortem  to be carried out today CM MK Stalin condemned the Karnataka forest department for firing at the TN fisherman and announced `5 lakh solatium to his family. Erode SP V Sasimohan said the reason for Raja’s death will be known only after getting the autopsy report.Follow The New Indian Express channel on WhatsApp Download the TNIE app to stay with us and follow the latestShow CommentsRelated StoriesNo stories found.\nCopyright - newindianexpress.com 2024. All rights reserved. Powered by Quintype\nX\nThe New Indian Express\nwww.newindianexpress.com\nINSTALL APP",

(File Photo | EPS)Tamil NaduFisherman missing for past 4 days, Nambiyar Nagar villagers stay away from sea; seek govt's help\"We stopped fishing to urge the government to retrieve him. We demand the government start measures to provide relief for his family.Antony FernandoPublished on: 04 Jul 2023, 1:29 amCopiedNAGAPATTINAM:  Fishing activity at Nambiyar Nagar fishing village stood at a standstill over the last four days since a fisherman from the village went missing while at work. Fisherfolk from the village have also demanded relief for his family.K Anjappan, (55) fell from his trawler and went missing on June 29. Since there has been no trace of him over the past four days, the representatives have requested to initiate action for relief and insurance provided for deceased fishers.\"We stopped fishing to urge the government to retrieve him. We demand the government start measures to provide relief for his family. We request to initiate sooner considering that his family is underprivileged,\" said V Balamurugan, a fisher-representative from Nambiyar Nagar fisherfolk panchayat. Officials from the Coastal Security Group said,\"A joint search operation was initiated immediately after they received the report of the incident. However, the search has been fruitless so far.\" Since June 29, hundreds of fishing boats including trawlers, deep-sea fishing vessels, and FRP boats stayed at the shore, affecting overall fishing and trade.Officials from the fisheries department in Nagapattinam met the family on Monday and assured them of action, after which the fishers announced that they would resume fishing on Tuesday. The officials added the search operation by the Navy and Coast Guard has not been abandoned and will go on for at least seven days from the date of the incident.\"As per norms, it takes a year from the report of missing to recommend for relief and another year more to recommend for insurance. Till the missing fisher is found, we can provide a daily livelihood assistance of '250 per day for the family,\" an official said.Follow The New Indian Express channel on WhatsApp Download the TNIE app to stay with us and follow the latestTamil Nadu fishermenShow Comments\nCopyright - newindianexpress.com 2024. Narrow Escape For 2 OthersCurated By : News DeskLocal News DeskLast Updated:February 02, 2022, 18:11 ISTThe fisherman was catching crabs in a canal with his friends when the tiger attacked his boat.resetFollow us on Google NewsThe Bengal Tigers are most affected by the human-wildlife conflict. (Image for Representation)In an unfortunate incident in the Chilmari forest of the Sundarban area in  West Bengal, a fisherman was killed by a tiger, who reportedly dragged his body. On Monday, three fishermen of Sundarbans had set out to catch crabs from Parashamani village, which comes under the Lahiripur gram panchayat.According to witnesses, while the three fishermen were catching crabs at around 10 am on Tuesday, a tiger suddenly leapt out of the bushes, jumped on the boat, and pounced on Chittaranjan Sarkar. The rest of the fishermen rushed after the big cat with sticks while shouting, but it was too late.related storiesAccording to sources, Subrata, Chittaranjan, and Subal went to catch crabs in the Chilmari canal of Jhila No. 4. At that time a tiger jumped into the boat silently without anyone noticing. Although Subrata and SUbal came out unscathed, they could not save their third colleague.Following this incident, the forest department was informed. The Sundarbans Tiger Reserve Field Director said that the fishermen fell into the creek while catching the crabs and were attacked by the tiger. Chitta Sarkar was accompanied by his friends Subal Mandal and Subrata Kayal. Sarkar, a resident of the Gosaba block, is survived by his four children and a wife.top videosView allSwipe Left For Next VideoView allSuch incidents, however, are extremely common in the Sundarban area, where residents are locked in a perpetual war of livelihood vs the dangers of the wilderness. In November 2021, 69-year-old Hazari Mondal, hailing from Chargheri in Lahiripur in the Gosaba block, had lost his life while catching crabs. According to a report in The Times of India, he had also gone fishing in the Jhila canal, just like Chittaranjan Sarkar and his companions.Read all the Latest India News heretags :SunderbanstigerFirst (Michael Hall/The Brunswick News via AP, Pool)1 hour ago`You’re going home,’ police tell Ahmaud Arbery’s killer in video shown to juryRead full article: `You’re going home,’ police tell Ahmaud Arbery’s killer in video shown to jury.1 hour agoLong sleeves in the morning, short sleeves in the afternoonRead full article: Long sleeves in the morning, short sleeves in the afternoonDEALS 4 JAXThese Insider Deals are focused on self-care and jewelry.Save big on self-care and jewelry with these Insider DealsRead full article: Save big on self-care and jewelry with these Insider DealsHow I'm preparing for my Spain trip in 2025—with BabbelLearning a new language: Is 2025 the year to take on this goal?Read full article: Learning a new language: Is 2025 the year to take on this goal?GeorgiaCoast Guard searching for 3 fishermen missing off coast of BrunswickMen were due to return Wednesday; attempts to contact vessel have been unsuccessfulScott Johnson, Reporter/weekend anchorPublished: October 23, 2023 at 11:15 AMUpdated: October 23, 2023 at 5:15 PMTags: Brunswick, Georgia, Coast Guard, missing boatersBRUNSWICK, Ga. – The Coast Guard is searching for three men on a 31-foot fishing boat 80 miles off the coast of Brunswick, Georgia.The owner of the boat, the Carol Ann, said he hired a crew of three men who failed to return on Wednesday, as scheduled.The owner of the Carol Ann told Coast Guard members that the crew extends fishing trips to maximize their catch, but he grew concerned Friday because his last communication with the crew was six days before.Sector Charleston and Sector Jacksonville tried to contact the Carol Ann via VHF-FM channel 16 but got no response.Sector Charleston received a report from a good Samaritan that he might have seen a vessel matching the description of the Carol Ann on Wednesday -- the day the boat was due to return.The Coast Guard said the missing men are Tyler Barlow, Caleb Wilkinson and Dalton Conway.News4JAX spoke with members of the mens’ families. “It’s just been horrible. The not knowing is just what’s really killing all of us. We just want them found,” said Jennifer Wilkinson who’s the mother of Caleb. “We have no idea. We’ve had no contact. The couple of leads we did have where they said they got visuals of them has given us hope. So we just want to keep getting leads in if anyone has laid eyes on them or seen them we want to know where as soon as possible.”Wilkinson said the families are slated to have a meeting with Coast Guard officials around noon Tuesday in Brunswick for an update on the search.Other people in the local maritime community are surprised they haven’t been found yet. “Every boat here has an EPIRB (Emergency Position Indicating Radio Beacon). Just about… if you go down it activates. Shows your location. So, I mean if they got hit by a rogue wave and they were all asleep and couldn’t find the EPIRB, the batteries were dead. That’s practical. … they were in the drink before they knew what was happening. That’s very strange,” said Michael Gill who knows members of the crew.Involved in the search are:Coast Guard Air Station ClearwaterCoast Guard Air Station Elizabeth CityCoast Guard Air Station SavannahCoast Guard Station BrunswickCoast Guard Cutter IbisGeorgia Department of Natural ResourcesSo far search crews have scanned more than 20,000 square miles from Brunswick to Charleston. Anyone with information that might help search efforts should contact Sector Charleston at 843-740-7050.The @USCG is searching for an overdue 31-foot fishing vessel, Friday, with 3 people aboard 80 miles offshore #Brunswick, Georgia.Anyone with information that may assist search efforts should call Sector #Charleston at 843-740-7050.More details here: https://t.co/G2qswnGjlq pic.twitter.com/BefJ2GpjOp— USCGSoutheast (@USCGSoutheast) October 20, 2023 Copyright 2023 by WJXT News4JAX - All rights reserved.About the AuthorScott Johnson headshotScott JohnsonScott is a multi-Emmy Award Winning Anchor and Reporter, who also hosts the “Going Ringside With The Local Station” Podcast. (Photo Source: Screengrab)\nNew Delhi:  A distressing event unfolded in Mumbai as two fishermen succumbed and another remained in critical condition following the gas leak in a storage chamber of a fishing boat. The devastating incident transpired at the New Fish Jetty during the retrieval of fish from the vessel Anjani Putra, at around 11 am.\nhttps://static.news9live.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/WhatsApp-Video-2023-12-26-at-5.53.01-PM.mp4\nBoat had returned to coast around 2 am\nAccording to Deputy Commissioner of Police Sanjay Latkar, the boat had returned to the coast around 2 am, and it is suspected that gas had originated as a result of fish decomposition within the storage chamber. The volatile gas took a severe toll on the workers, initiating a dire sequence of events.\nAlso Read\nTwo sanitation workers die while cleaning sewage treatment plant in Gurugram1 dead, several fall ill after gas leak incident in Bihar’s HajipurResearchers develop new type of breathalyser that can detect some forms of cancer\nFishermen who descended into storage chamber lost consciousness\nTragically, a worker who descended into the storage chamber lost consciousness, triggering a chain reaction. Five other individuals who entered the confined space also succumbed to unconsciousness. Swiftly responding to the situation, all affected fishermen were promptly rushed to the government-operated J J Hospital for urgent medical attention.\nAccidental death case has been registered at Yellow Gate police station\nSriniwas Anand Yadav (35) and boat owner Naga Don Sanjay (27), both natives of Andhra Pradesh, tragically lost their lives during treatment. Suresh Mekla, also from Andhra Pradesh, was placed on a ventilator, while the condition of the remaining three individuals was reported to be stable, according to the official.\nAn accidental death case has been registered at the Yellow Gate police station, with ongoing investigative efforts to crack the circumstances that led to this tragic gas-related catastrophe.\nClick for more latest India news. Also get top headlines and latest news from India and around the world at News9.\nJunaid Dar\nJunaid Dar is a multimedia journalist based in Delhi, currently working as the Chief Reporter for News9 Live. He has been at the heart of India’s most pivotal moments.  From the intense 2022 UP Assembly elections to the 2024 Assembly elections in Kashmir, and the high-stakes 2024 Lok Sabha polls, Junaid has been on the ground and brought fresh perspectives to his readers.\nHis work goes beyond politics. He has a special knack for telling human stories—whether it’s his Indepth coverage of the farmers' protests, where he focused on the lives and struggles of the protesters, or his courageous reporting during the COVID-19 pandemic, where he risked his own safety to capture the full scope of the crisis.\nHis reporting has appeared in leading national and international outlets, including Voice of America, Daily Vox, Huffington Post, TRT World, Article 14, and India Ahead, among others.\nRead More\nNews India News Mumbai: Gas Leak At Fishing Boat Kills Two Fishermen | Video News\nLatest Stories\nFire breaks out near Etihad Stadium before Manchester City vs Club Brugge Champions League clashArsenal see shocking bid for Ollie Watkins rejected as Aston Villa stand firm on star striker -ReportsDeepSeek vs ChatGPT vs Kimi vs Qwen Chat vs Gemini vs Grok: Comprehensive comparison of these AI bots\nNext Article\nFollow us on social media\nNews9live Channel\nLatest News\nMore\nFire breaks out near Etihad Stadium before Manchester City vs Club Brugge Champions League clash\nArsenal see shocking bid for Ollie Watkins rejected as Aston Villa stand firm on star striker -Reports\nDeepSeek vs ChatGPT vs Kimi vs Qwen Chat vs Gemini vs Grok: Comprehensive comparison of these AI bots\n'FIDE demanded $5,00,000': Freestyle Chess CEO hits back at Emil Sutovsky in open letter as feud grows\nAccidental run out! (Photo credit: PTI)\nThiruvananthapuram: Two fishermen were seriously injured when their boat capsized at Muthalapozhi again on Saturday. This is the fourth major accident in the fishing harbour in Thiruvananthapuram district in a month.\nThe incident happened at 7.20 AM. Six fishermen on board were rescued. Two of them, Babu and Christudas, were seriously injured in the accident. After treatment at taluk hospital Chirayinkeezhu, Christudas was shifted to Government Medical College Thiruvananthapuram.\nThe fishermen were rescued by the joint effort of other fishermen, coastal police and marine enforcement.\nFour fishermen died in a similar accident at Muthalapozhi on July 11. The fishermen led by the Latin Archdiocese have been demanding a speedy remedy to the issue. A proposal of the Fisheries directorate to close the harbour till the end of monsoon is facing stiff opposition from the fishermen community.\nAlso Read: Muthalapozhi harbour: Tension brewing between LDF Govt and Latin church\nMeanwhile, the body of a fisherman, who went missing following a boat capsize in Thumba, was found on Saturday. Francis Alphone, 65, went missing on Tuesday. Five other fishermen on board managed to escape as the boat capsized close to the shore.\nClick for more latest Kerala news. The Ministers reached the place to review attempts to rescue three fishermen who went missing after their boat capsized in the morning.\nNews9Live Staff\nPublished: 10 Jul 2023 20:52:PM\nMuthalapozhi is a fishing harbour (Photo credit: PTI)\nThiruvananthapuram: Tension prevailed in Muthalapozhi in Thiruvananthapuram district on Monday after a group of local people prevented three ministers from entering an accident site at fishing harbour where one died and three went missing in the early morning.\nMinisters V Sivankutty, Antony Raju and GR Anil were stopped by a group of agitated fishermen. The Ministers reached the place to review the measures taken to rescue three fishermen who went missing after their boat capsized in the morning. One person – Puthukurichu native Kunjumon – died while Robin, 42, Biju, 48 and Biju, 55 are still missing.\nAlleging delay in launching rescue works and failure in addressing the construction problems in Muthalapozhi which result in recurring accidents, the local people blocked the ministers. Following this, the Ministers returned from the place.\nAlso Read: Rough seas in Kerala: Fisherman dies as boat capsizes near harbour in T’puram\nLater Sivankutty alleged in a statement that Father Eugene Perira, a priest of the Latin Catholic Church, tried to create tension in the area by asking the people to block the way of the ministers.\nClick for more latest Kerala news. Independent\nThe Standard\nThe Southern Eye\nHSTV\nEpaper\nInConvoWithTrevor\nFisherman drowns after tyre burst\nLocal News\nBy OWN CORRESPONDENT  | Jan. 23, 2024 | 1 Min read\nDinhidza Murombo drowned while his uncle Daniel Makina managed to swim to safety at Karoi Farm in Guruve. Mashonaland Central police spokesperson confirmed Murombo’s death.\nA FISHING expedition ended tragically when a 55-year-old man from Guruve drowned on Thursday last week after an inflated vehicle tyre he was using as a boat burst.Dinhidza Murombo drowned while his uncle Daniel Makina managed to swim to safety at Karoi Farm in Guruve. Mashonaland Central police spokesperson confirmed Murombo’s death.\n“I can confirm a sudden death case in Guruve where a fisherman drowned after an inflated vehicle tyre they were using with his uncle burst,” Mundembe said.Police also warned people to desist from playing near water bodies.\n“We are warning people not to play near water bodies. If they want to fish they should do so in boats or outside the water,” Mundembe said.Drowning cases has been on the increase since the onset of the 2023/24 rain season.\nRelated Topics\nKaroi Farm\nGuruve\nMashonaland Central\nShare this article on social\nTrending Now\nR100m Powerball Lotto winner quits job after win\nChivayo wades into Zanu PF wars, attacks 'failed politicians'\nChivayo wades into Zanu PF wars, attacks 'failed politicians'\nNot so prophetic: Unisa disowns Magaya ‘doctorate’\nWarriors kick off  Afcon with Egypt tie\nClassifieds.co.zw\nElectronics\nCars\nBuilding Supplies\nServices\nDating\nHome & Garden\nVehicle Parts\nCommercial Supplies\nJobs\nProperty.co.zw\nHouses for Sale\nFlats for Sale\nLand for Sale\nCommercial for Sale\nHouses to Rent\nFlats to Rent\nCommercial to Rent\nLand to Rent\nRooms for Rent\nLatest News\nAttacks on ED harm economy, investments: Adviser\nLocal News\nBy Problem Masau\n2h ago\nNot so prophetic: Unisa disowns Magaya ‘doctorate’\nLocal News\nBy TRUST MAKORE\n7h ago\nR100m Powerball Lotto winner quits job after win\nLife & Style\nBy The South African\n7h ago\nChivayo wades into Zanu PF wars, attacks 'failed politicians'\nLocal News\nBy Staff Reporter\n8h ago\nSA’s EFTCorp appoints Tigere to oversee Zim operations\nBusiness\nBy LEE MUSAIDZI\n9h ago\nBranding Voice -     "https://www.newsfirst.lk/2022/01/02/missing-fisherman-police-inquiry-underway/": "Missing Fisherman : Police Inquiry Underway\nhomeHomeLatestFeaturedLocalSportsBusinessWorldEnglishsearchEnglishmenuMissing Fisherman : Police Inquiry Underway by Amani Nilar 02-01-2022 | 10:19 AMCOLOMBO (News 1st); The Ahungalla Police have commenced investigations into a fishing vessel which has not returned after leaving for fishing at the Ahungalla Balapitiya Brahmanawatta Port.\nAccording to the Police, one fishermen was on board the vessel and had left for fishing on the 31st of December.\nThe Police have received a complaint that the fishing vessel which was supposed to reach the shore last morning (01), has not appeared.\nThe missing person has been identified as a resident of Ahungalla.\nMeanwhile, Navy and residents of the area have launched a search operation to find the missing.Other ArticlesDr. Ramanathan Archchuna Arrested in Jaffna Navy Clarifies Incident Involving Indian Boat US Ambassador Meets SL Parliament Speaker New SLAF Commander Focuses on Global Operations Air Marshal Edirisinghe Assumes Command Of SLAF Expo Lanka Refutes Claims of Port Misconduct Featured NewsSL Navy Takes Command Of Combined Task Force Rare Planetary Alignment Visible Until January 29 Special Team to Investigate Galle Prison Clash 4,020 Suspects Arrested in Special Crime Operation Cabinet Approves Provincial Crime Divisions SL Navy Takes Command Of Combined Task Force Rare Planetary Alignment Visible Until January 29 Special Team to Investigate Galle Prison Clash 4,020 Suspects Arrested in Special Crime Operation Cabinet Approves Provincial Crime Divisions  News 1st, MTV Channel (Pvt) Ltd, MBC Networks (Pvt) Ltd, 45/3, Braybrooke Street, Colombo-02.     "https://www.newsweek.com/half-missing-fisherman-body-found-eaten-sharks-1800603": "Half of Missing Fisherman's Body Found After Being Eaten by Sharks - Newsweek\nU.S.WorldScienceHealthLifeRankingsOpinionEntertainmentFact CheckMy TurnEducation\nEventsSportsPodcastsBetter PlanetBetter WorkplacesVaultMightierAutosNewslettersUnconventionalVantageExpertsVoicesSubscribe for $1Login\n×\nSubscribe for $1\nLoginU.S.WorldScienceHealthLifeRankingsOpinionEntertainmentFact CheckMy TurnEducationEventsSportsPodcastsBetter PlanetBetter WorkplacesVaultMightierAutosNewslettersUnconventionalVantageExpertsVoices\nShare\nCopy Link ✓ Link copied to clipboard!\nAnimal Attacks\nSharks\nFishing\nWildlife\nNature\nAnimals\nOcean\nMarine Life\nPhilippines\nHalf of Missing Fisherman's Body Found After Being Eaten by Sharks\nPublished May 16, 2023 at 7:35 AM EDT\nCLOSE X\nBy\nPandora Dewan\nSenior Science ReporterFOLLOW\nShare\nCopy Link\n✓ Link copied to clipboard!  The body of a missing fisherman has been found after a two-day search, but by the time the authorities tracked him down he had been partially devoured by sharks.The victim was last seen on May 10, fishing in the waters off Lubang in the Philippines, according to GMA News Online.When the authorities first saw his body, they thought it was a bird floating on the water, Lubang Mayor Mike Orayani told GMA News. It was only after they got closer that they saw it was a corpse.\nWhen rescue teams found the missing man, his body was being devoured by sharks. They initially thought the body was a large bird.\nWhen rescue teams found the missing man, his body was being devoured by sharks. They initially thought the body was a large bird.\nMAYOR MIKE Orayani\n\"[When] they reached the corpse, the head was still there, [but] there were so many tiger sharks around [and] they were eating the body,\" he said.Members of the Municipal Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office, the Bureau of Fire Protection and the Philippine Coast Guard were at the scene and a maritime police officer shot one of the sharks. However, they were still only able to recover half of the victim's body and return it to his family.Tiger sharks are found throughout the world's tropical and temperate waters, with the exception of the Mediterranean sea. They thrive in the open ocean and in shallow coastal waters and will eat almost anything, according to the Florida Museum's Shark File. Read more\nMan survives shark attack in Florida after it \"smacked him from behind\"\nDiver shares how to escape a hungry shark with your bare hands: \"Fearless\"\nCritically endangered sawfish found with saws removed: \"Cruel\"\nTiger sharks are named after the distinctive tiger-like stripes that run across the length of their bodies and are one of the largest living shark species on Earth, growing up to 18 feet long and weighing up to 2,000 pounds.Although they are usually curious and unaggressive when encountered, tiger sharks are still implicated in more unprovoked attacks than any other species apart from the great white shark. Of these, 27 percent have been fatal, a higher percentage than any other species.\nThe man's body was half-eaten by the time rescuers arrived, although it is unclear whether he was dead before the sharks got to him.\nThe man's body was half-eaten by the time rescuers arrived, although it is unclear whether he was dead before the sharks got to him.\nMAYOR MIKE Orayani\nIt's unclear whether the man was already dead by the time the sharks got to him. A segment of the GMA News report was shared to social media, receiving tens of thousands of views on YouTube.\"There are a lot of sharks there,\" said one user.\"His death is very painful especially because he loved life so much. Condolences to the family,\" said another.Shark attacks are extremely rare, but should you ever find yourself swimming with sharks, there are a few safety measures you can take. The Florida Museum recommends always swimming with a buddy and staying close to the shore. Avoid swimming at dawn or dusk and do not swim around schools of fish or where people are fishing.If you see a shark, maintain eye contact, move away slowly and avoid excessive splashing.Update 5/16/23, 12:11 p.m. ET: This article was updated to include an additional picture.\nRequest Reprint & Licensing\nSubmit Correction\nView Editorial & AI Guidelines\nTop stories\nWhite House Rescinds Freeze on Federal Grants and Loans After Backlash: Live Updates\nTrump Directs Guantanamo Bay to Prepare to Hold up to 30,000 Migrants\nFed Pauses Interest Rate Cuts in First Key Decision of Trump's Second Term\nRFK Jr. Says He Would Study Abortion Pill Mifepristone for 'Safety Issues' About the writer\nPandora Dewan\nFOLLOW\nPandora Dewan is a Senior Science Reporter at Newsweek based in London, UK. Her focus is reporting on science, health and technology. Pandora joined Newsweek in 2022 and previously worked as the Head of Content for the climate change education start-up, ClimateScience and as a Freelance writer for content creators such as Dr. Karan Rajan and Thoughty2. She is a graduate in Biological Sciences from the University of Oxford. Languages: English. More\nVISION TVS & RADIO\nBUKEDDE AMAWULIRE KAMPALA SUN\nMystery surrounds fisherman's sudden death on Lake Victoria\nJul 10, 2023\nDavid Galiwango, the area deputy LC1 chairperson said that they are now stuck with the deceased's body since they do not know any of his relatives.\nThe fisherman collapsed and died while fishing on Lake Victoria and died. (Credit: Samuel Nkuba)\nSamuel  Nkuba\nJournalist\n@New Vision\n#Police\n#Kalangala district\n#Death\n#Nakibanga landing site\nNo Comment\n----------------KALANGALA - Shock gripped the community at Nakibanga landing site, Kyamuswa sub-county in Kalangala district, after a fisherman collapsed and died while fishing on Lake Victoria and died. The fisherman only identified as Zaamunda, 50, left the landing site with Geoffrey Kyandiya to go fishing as usual on Sunday, July 9. “As we started trapping our nets, Zaamunda coughed only three times, collapsed in the boat and died instantly,” said Kyandiya. He further narrated that the deceased had for the last month had a heavy bout of cough though he had recovered and he was feeling well by the time they left the landing site. David Galiwango, the area deputy LC1 chairperson said that they are now stuck with the deceased's body since they do not know any of his relatives. “The worst thing is that these fishermen don’t present their identification whenever they change to new working locations,” Galiwango added. Kalangala Police confirmed the incident and assured islanders that investigations into the circumstances surrounding Zaamunda’s death have commenced.  Last year, two fishermen died mysteriously at the same landing site, but no reports probing the deaths was ever made public despite assurances from the Police.\nRegister to begin your journey to our premium content .\nLink copied to clipboard\nClose\nLink not copied to clipboard\nClose\nAll Rights Reserved © NewVision\n2025\nPremium\nMy Subscriptions\nArchives\nE-Papers Privacy Policy Legal Policy\nTerms of Use\nContact us\n+256 (0)414 337 000\n+256 (0)312 337 000\nnews@newvision.co.ug",

More\nVISION TVS & RADIO\nBUKEDDE AMAWULIRE KAMPALA SUN\nTwo Ugandan fishermen allegedly go missing on Tanzanian waters\nJan 02, 2023\nIt’s alleged that the boat which was used by the duo was sighted in Tanzania waters near Ukerewe island without any fishing equipment.\nThe two sailed off for their fishing expedition on Lake Victoria as usual. File photo\nSamuel  Nkuba\nJournalist\n@New Vision\n#Fishermen\n#Tanzanian waters\n#Lujjabwa landing site\n#Mazinga sub-county\n#Kalangala district\nNo Comment\nFishermen at Lujjabwa landing site in Mazinga sub-county, Kalangala district are still on the hunt for their two colleagues who went missing on December 20, 2022.The two identified as Wasswa aged 30 and Ismail Ssekandi, 52 were working for Robert Kasozi, a fishing investor at Lujjabwa. The two sailed off for their fishing expedition on Lake Victoria as usual. They sometimes spend three-four days fishing.Ismail Ssekandi one of the missing fishermen from Lujjabwa Landing Site in Mazinga sub-county. Photos by Samuel NkubaKasozi said that fishermen tend to go beyond Ugandan waters. They can go as far as Tanzania since Mazinga is located at the border.“We realized towards the end of December that they had stayed long on water which is unusual for fishermen who do fishing activities in Kalenga,” said Kasozi.It’s alleged that the boat which was used by the duo was sighted in Tanzania waters near Ukerewe island without any fishing equipment.Wasswa, the other missing fisherman.Anthony Amanya, the marine Police commander on Lake Victoria, said they are aware of the missing fishermen from Mazinga sub-county.“Investigations have commenced to find out whether the boat which was sighted in Tanzania waters belongs to them and if they are alive or dead,” said Amanya.He added that there is a need for all security operatives including Kalangala district leaders to meet fishermen on both sides of Mazinga and Tanzania to resolve issues of robbery.Fishermen want the Fish Protection Unit officers to indulge in ensuring the security of fishermen rather than only enforcing illegal fishing operations on Lake Victoria.Over five fishermen from Tanzania and Uganda were allegedly killed while on their fishing expeditions on Lake Victoria waters. Since May 2021, there have been attacks and stealing of fishing materials from fishermen.\nRegister to begin your journey to our premium content .\nLink copied to clipboard\nClose\nLink not copied to clipboard\nClose\nAll Rights Reserved © NewVision\n2025\nPremium\nMy Subscriptions\nArchives\nE-Papers Privacy Policy Legal Policy\nTerms of Use\nContact us\n+256 (0)414 337 000\n+256 (0)312 337 000\nnews@newvision.co.ug",

                                            / 27 JANUARY 2024\nTwo fisherman deceased, one survived after vessel capsized in Lambert's Bay\nAt 09h32, Friday, 26 January, NSRI Lamberts Bay duty crew were activated following reports from Police of a boat capsized at Grootvlei, Lamberts Bay, with 3 local fishermen onboard.\nThe SA Police Services (SAPS), DRM (Disaster Risk Management) and WC Government Health EMS were responding.\nOur NSRI rescue craft JetRib, Spirit of Saldanha, was launched.\nNSRI Mykonos and SAPS WPDS (Water Policing and Dive Services) were alerted.\nOn arrival on the scene it was determined that a Kreefte Bakkie (small open fishing boat) had capsized close inshore on a shallow bank while fishing.\nAll three men had been thrown into the water.\nThe crew on a fellow fishing boat was able to rescue one man from the water and they raised the alarm.\nThe crew on the fellow fishing boat searched for the two men but both were missing.\nThey brought the survivor into Lamberts Bay harbour where he was treated for non-fatal drowning symptoms by EMS paramedics and transported to hospital by EMS ambulance in a serious but stable condition.\nDuring a sea and shoreline search DRM and Police spotted the 2 missing men in shallow surf. They waded into the surf and recovered both men onto the shore.\nSadly both men were declared deceased on the scene by paramedics.\nThe bodies of the 2 deceased men were taken into the care of Government Health Forensic Pathology Services.\nPolice have opened an inquest docket.\nThe survivor is expected to make a full recovery.\nThe casualty boat washed onto rocks nearby.\nCondolences are conveyed to family, friends and colleagues of the 2 deceased fishermen.\nFollow Us!\nHelp us save lives on South African waters.\nDONATE NOW\nSUBSCRIBE\nNext Article\nLooking back, moving forward\nRead More\nYou may also like\nRESCUES                                                                                                                     | Published: 29 January 2025\nSailing Yachts Drift Ashore at Clifton 4th Beach\nA sailing yacht run aground at Clifton 4th Beach is recovered safely, while a second sailing yacht self recovers after drifting into shallow water at Clifton 4th Beach. ...\nREAD MORE\nRESCUE OPERATIONS                                                                                                                                                                         | Published: 28 January 2025\nOngoing search for a missing man: Scottburgh Point Main\nA search is ongoing at Scottburgh Point Main Beach, KZN South Coast, where a man is reported missing. ...\nREAD MORE\nRESCUE BASES                                                                 | Published: 23 January 2025\nNew rescue base enhances readiness for Station 35 Witbank volunteers\nIn a significant milestone for the NSRI and the community it serves, Station 35 Witbank volunteers have officially moved into their dedicated rescue base. ...\nREAD MORE\nSUBSCRIBE TO OUR NEWSLETTER\nSubscribe today for information about NSRI rescues, news and appeals\nSubscribe\nCONNECT WITH US\nThe Charity that Saves Lives on South African Waters\nHead Office\nMon - Life Campaign\nCommunity Fundraising\nSurfski Paddlers\nVolunteer\nOnline Shop\nVessels for Sale\nRESCUES                                                                                 / 11 JUNE 2024\nA commercial fishing vessel, capsized at the backline surf zone at Umgababa Main Beach\nAt 08h16, Tuesday, 11 June, NSRI Rocky Bay, an NSRI lifeguard, an NSRI Durban crewman, the SA Police Services, Police Search and Rescue, Netcare 911 ambulance, eThekwini Fire and Rescue Services, KwaZulu EMRS (Emergency Medical and Rescue Services), Metro Search and Rescue and the KZN surf lifesaving network were activated by eThekwini surf lifeguards, on duty at Umgababa Main Beach, reporting a boat (a 5.5 meter RHIB – rigid hull inflatable boat), a commercial fishing vessel, capsized at the backline surf zone at Umgababa Main Beach, between Scottburgh and Amanzimtoti – KZN South Coast.\nThere were reportedly 4 local adult men on the boat when it capsized.\neThekwini municipal lifeguards launched into the water to assist, while fellow boats, in the area at the time, also assisted.\nNSRI Rocky Bay crew, an NSRI lifeguard, the SA Police Services, an NSRI Durban crewman, Police Search and Rescue, Netcare 911 ambulance, eThekwini Fire and Rescue Services, KwaZulu EMRS (Emergency Medical and Rescue Services), Metro Search and Rescue responded, to join eThekwini lifeguards at the beach.\n3 of the 4 casualty men were rescued from the surf zone to the shore by eThekwini lifeguards and by fellow fishermen. 1 man remained missing.\nOne of the three men that was rescued to the shore, the skipper, is suspected to have suffered a medical condition while he was on the beach.\nNetcare 911 paramedics, eThekwini lifeguards, Police medics and the NSRI lifeguard conducted extensive CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation) efforts on the skipper.\nAfter all efforts to resuscitate the man were exhausted sadly he was declared deceased.\nA search continued for the missing man.\nA private aircraft and a Police helicopter assisted and conducted an aerial search while Police, NSRI, emergency services and eThekwini lifeguards conducted shoreline search efforts.\neThekwini lifeguards launched surf rescue craft and conducted extensive search efforts for the missing man in and beyond the surf zone.\nDespite an extensive air, sea and shoreline search there remains no signs of the missing man.\nThe deceased man has been taken into the care of Police and Government Health Forensic Pathology Services.\nCondolences are conveyed to the family, friends and colleagues of the deceased man.\nOur thoughts are with those affected by the tragedy and the family, friends and colleagues of the missing man.\nPolice and lifeguards are continuing in an ongoing search effort for the missing man.\nFollow Us!\nHelp us save lives on South African waters.\nDONATE NOW\nSUBSCRIBE\nNext Article\nTwo men sadly deceased, and one man survived a tragic boating accident.\nRead More\nYou may also Life Campaign\nCommunity Fundraising\nSurfski Paddlers\nVolunteer\nOnline Shop\nVessels for Sale\nRESCUES                                                                                 / 14 JUNE 2024\nTwo men sadly deceased, and one man survived a tragic boating accident.\nAt 14h04, Thursday, 13 June, NSRI Table Bay, NSRI Bakoven and the CoCT (City of Cape Town) water rescue network was activated following eyewitness reports of a boat capsized at the back breakers surf zone, between Saunders Rocks and Queens Beach, Bantry Bay.\nNSRI Bakoven and NSRI Table Bay rescue swimmers, the SA Police Services (SAPS), WC Government Health EMS rescue squad and ambulance, Netcare 911 ambulance services, ER24 ambulance services, Cape Town Fire and Rescue Services and CoCT Law Enforcement responded.\nThe NSRI Table Bay rescue craft Spirit of Day was launched.\nSAPS WPDS (Water Policing and Diving Services) were placed on alert.\nEMS Metro Control activated the EMS/AMS Skymed rescue helicopter, accompanied by an EMS Metro rescue diver.\nIt remained unknown the number of people that were on the boat when the open fishing ski-boat capsized.\nBystanders had deployed NSRI pink rescue buoys into the surf where we believe at least 2 casualties may have reached pink rescue buoys, using them to stay afloat.\nNSRI rescue swimmers, arriving on the scene first, entered the water where they reached a male, believed to be aged in his 20’s, and they reached a male believed to be aged in his 60’s – both offshore of Queens Beach.\nThe rescue swimmer brought the younger man to shore where he was treated by paramedics for hypothermia and non-fatal drowning symptoms and he was transported to hospital by ambulance in a stable condition where he is recovering.\nThe second casualty, who was unresponsive in the water, was assisted to stay afloat by the rescue swimmer and he was then rescued onto the NSRI rescue craft. The man remained unresponsive, medical treatment was commenced. He was brought to the Three Anchor slipway where paramedics continued with CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation) efforts.\nIt was confirmed that three men had been on the boat when the boat capsized. One man remained missing.\nThe casualty boat washed ashore in amongst rocks near to Queens Beach.\nSea Point Police patrol officers reached the boat, that was smashed in amongst the rocky shoreline, where Police officers were able to investigate to determine that there was no person trapped in the wreck.\nThe NSRI rescue craft was dispatched from Three Anchor Bay to return to the scene to assist Skymed, that was conducting the aerial search, the NSRI rescue swimmers, who were searching in the water, and the emergency services, who were conducting shoreline search efforts.\nDuring an extensive air, sea and shoreline search the missing man was located in the surf zone by the EMS/AMS Skymed rescue helicopter.\nThe EMS Metro rescue diver was deployed into the water from the helicopter. He secured the man, who was unresponsive.\nThe helicopter static line hoisted both the casualty man and the Metro rescue diver to the parking area at Queens Beach where paramedics commenced CPR efforts on the man (believed to be aged in his 60's).\nAt Three Anchor Bay, after extensive CPR efforts by paramedics were exhausted, on the man rescued to Three Anchor Bay aboard the NSRI rescue craft, sadly he was declared deceased.\nAt Queens Beach, after extensive CPR efforts by paramedics were exhausted, on the man rescued to the shore by the Skymed rescue helicopter, sadly he was declared deceased.\nThe bodies of the 2 deceased men were taken into the care of Police and Government Health Forensic Pathology Services.\nIt appears that the three men, believed to be from Cape Town's Northern Suburbs, reportedly well known to the fishing, boating and maritime communities, had launched earlier at Three Anchor Bay to go fishing.\nIt appears that they may have been fishing offshore of Bantry Bay when their boat was capsized by a wave.\nNSRI commend the eyewitnesses that raised the alarm and the many public bystanders who aided the rescuers at Queens Beach and at Three Anchor Bay during this tragic, sad incident.\nEfforts to assist family members remain in progress.\nCondolences are conveyed to family and friends of the 2 deceased men.\nAn Inquest docket has been opened by Police.\nFollow Us!\nHelp us save lives on South African waters.\nDONATE NOW\nSUBSCRIBE\nNext Article\nNational Incident\nRead More\nYou may also like\nRESCUES man: Scottburgh Point Main\nA search is ongoing at Scottburgh Point Main Beach, KZN South Coast, where a man is reported missing. ...\nREAD MORE\nRESCUE BASES |\nAsking Eric\nNational News |\nToday’s horoscope\nNewsNational News\nNational News |\nBody pulled from Long Island Sound after fishing boat sinks, N.Y. man still missing\nShare this:Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window)Click to share on X (Opens in new window)\nEric Urquhart/Shutterstock\nA man was found dead in Long Island Sound on Monday after a small fishing boat carrying five people sank on Sunday near Westport, Conn. In this photo, a view of the Long Island Sound is pictured from Westport, Conn.\nBy Joseph Wilkinson | jwilkinson@nydailynews.com | New York Daily NewsPUBLISHED: October 24, 2023 at 1:01 PM EDTA man was found dead in Long Island Sound on Monday after a small fishing boat carrying five people sank Sunday near Westport, Conn.The body of Juan Gabriel Valle Pineda, 38, was located about three miles north of where the boat sank, the Hartford Courant reported. Members of the Bridgeport Fire Department located Pineda’s remains.Another person, who has been identified only as a resident of Suffern, N.Y., remained missing Tuesday. Three other people were rescued shortly after the boat sank on choppy waters in the sound.A passing boater noticed a man standing on a navigational buoy near Cockenoe Island, just over one mile from the coast, around 4 p.m. Sunday and alerted authorities when they reached shore.Rescuers quickly responded and saved the man on the buoy and two people in the water nearby, identified only as a man and a woman. They were taken to a local hospital for evaluation, as the water temperature in the sound was 61 degrees on Sunday.Police needed translators to communicate with the people they’d saved. They were told that two other men were on the boat and remained missing. Pineda, of Spring Valley, N.Y., was one of the two missing men.“Westport Police extend our sympathies to the family of the deceased and are hopeful of recovering the second missing person,” Westport police officer Eric Woods said Monday.Authorities suspended their search for the Suffern man around 9 p.m. Monday, but Coast Guard and local police officers were back in the area on Tuesday morning and located the sunken vessel.\nWith News Wire Services\nShare this:Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window)Click to share on X (Opens in new window)\nMost PopularMost PopularICE launches Video / NZ Herald A man has been found dead in the water after he fell overboard off the Dunedin coast.Emergency services responded to a mayday call from fishing vessel FV Venture about a man overboard, with a rescue helicopter and local Coastguard heading to the scene about 1.30pm.Police say the man was pulled from the water and medical attention was provided, however he sadly died at the scene.The death will be referred to the Coroner.AdvertisementAdvertise with NZME.AdvertisementAdvertise with NZME.SaveShareShare this articleCopy LinkEmailFacebookTwitter/XLinkedInRedditLatest from InSubscribeAdvertisementAdvertise with NZME.Home / New ZealandFisherman missing in water off Hawke’s Bay coast, colleagues join searchNZ Herald2 Apr, 2024 12:35 AM2 mins to readSaveShareShare this articleCopy LinkEmailFacebookTwitter/XLinkedInRedditMaritime NZ’s Rescue Coordination Centre ran the search for a person missing in the water off the coast of Hawke’s Bay. Rescue helicopter services, Coastguard Hawke’s Bay and NZDF were involved. Photo / Warren BucklandMaritime NZ’s Rescue Coordination Centre ran the search for a person missing in the water off the coast of Hawke’s Bay. Rescue helicopter services, Coastguard Hawke’s Bay and NZDF were involved. Photo / Warren BucklandThe colleagues of a fishing vessel crew member missing off the coast of Hawke’s Bay were on the water aiding search efforts more than 17 hours in.The man was reported overboard from a boat around 11km offshore of Waimārama, around 8pm on Easter Monday.Maritime NZ’s Rescue Coordination Centre was running the search, which included rescue helicopter services from Auckland, Gisborne and Hastings, Coastguard Hawke’s Bay and other vessels in the area.Coastguard Hawke’s Bay president Henry van Tuel said the vessel from which the man had gone missing was the Pacific Challenger.AdvertisementAdvertise with NZME.AdvertisementAdvertise with NZME.Coastguard Hawke’s Bay had been involved in the search since 9pm on Monday and had resumed efforts on Tuesday.A NZ Defence Force spokesman said crew on a Royal New Zealand Air Force NH90 helicopter had joined the search on Tuesday.Hawke’s Bay deputy harbour master Adrian Wright said rescue operations were ongoing as of 1.15pm and the vessel from which the person went missing, a commercial fishing vessel operating locally, was still out on the water with them.“We’re working hard to get this individual home to his loved ones.”AdvertisementAdvertise with NZME.The search for the person fisherman about 11km off the coast of Waimārama was ongoing into Tuesday afternoon. Photo / Warren BucklandHe said the circumstances of how the man ended up overboard were unclear and it was not known if he was wearing a lifejacket.Conditions off the coast of Hawke’s Bay remained mostly fine on Tuesday according to MetService, with a southeast swell of one metre.‘Grid search’ tracking of the three rescue helicopters involved in the search. Photo / Hawke's Bay Rescue HelicopterPolice said they were advised at 9.15pm on Easter Monday that the person was missing.Flight radar showed multiple rescue helicopters following a grid search pattern off the coast east of Waimārama Beach overnight Monday and into Tuesday.SaveShareShare this articleCopy LinkEmailFacebookTwitter/XLinkedInRedditLatest from New ZealandNew ZealandRevealed:     "https://www.observer24.com.na/former-samherji-fisherman-dies/": "Former Samherji fisherman dies – News Stand\nWednesday, January 29\nHomeLatestNationalMoneyEnergySportsOpinionsPodcastsLive\nHomeLatestNationalMoneyEnergySportsOpinionsPodcastsLive\nHomeFeaturedFormer Samherji fisherman dies\nFeaturedFormer Samherji fisherman dies\ninfo_e12wt4cs9 months ago9 months ago30962 Mins Read\nFacebookTwitterLinkedInPinterestStumbleuponEmail Share\nEster Mbathera\nA fisherman, who previously worked for Samherji on a fishing vessel linked to the Fishrot corruption saga, died on Tuesday morning.\nSamuel Japhet (41) died on his bed in a cabin onboard the MV Heinaste vessel which belonged to Heinaste Investment Namibia a joint venture company between Namibian rights holders and Icelandic seafood company, Samherji.\nThe vessel was sold to Tunacor Fishing Company in 2021 and renamed Tutungeni.\nAccording to police reports Japhet was found by his colleagues who went to wake him up for duty at around 03:00 in the morning.\n“A doctor from the same vessel was summoned to examine him. He was still not responding. He never complained of any sickness to the clinic or anyone. St.Gabriel Paramedics visited the scene and declared him dead,” reads the police report.\nNo foul play is suspected.\nThe next of kin have been informed.\nTunacor chief executive officer Peya Hitula also confirmed the incident.\n“Yes, there was an unfortunate event where one employee was on the vessel which had docked at Namport, as the vessel was preparing to leave the following day he was found unconscious and non-responsive. The vessel doctor onboard was alerted and they called the emergency services but he unfortunately passed away in his sleep,” said Hitula.\nJaphet is among the fishermen, who have been part of the crew of the vessel since the Fishrot scandal broke in 2019.\nAt some stage, the vessel was also impounded on orders based on Article 28 of the Prevention of Organised Crime Act (POCA).\nTunacor bought the vessel in December 2020 after Prosecutor-General Martha Imalwa ordered that it must be released.\nSamuel Japhet (41)\nPrevious PostNamibia’s Largest Museum Set to Anchor in Lüderitz\nNext PostSworn in\nRelated Posts\nNedbank Namibian Newspaper Cup 2025 edition launched\ninfo_e12wt4cs2 days ago\nGoagoses calls for the inclusion of netball facilities in schools & public spaces\ninfo_e12wt4cs2 days ago\nMTC Maris Cup to go ahead despite boycotting threats\ninfo_e12wt4cs6 days ago\n© COPYRIGHT 2023 WINDHOEK OBSERVER\nLike Us\nFollow Us\nSubscribe Us\nFollow Us\nLinkedIn\nNew Video\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cVONWDYjioo",

    "https://www.oldharbournews.com/content/missing-fisherman-feared-dead-sea": "Missing fisherman feared dead at sea | Old Harbour News\nSkip to main content\nOLD HARBOUR WEATHER\nSearch form\nSearch\nDisable Ad\nEnable Ad\nMain menu\nHome\nNews\nSports\nBusiness\nCommentary\nEntertainment\nEducation\nReligion\nLifestyle\nDiaspora\nInternational\nHealth\nMenu Second\nBuy & Sell\nDirectory\nEvent Calendar\nFamily Notices\nJob\nLetters\nMissing Children\nReal Estate\nWhy Advertise\nMissing fisherman feared dead at sea\nArticle by: Old Harbour News803 views02/20/2024 - 16:00A fisherman is feared dead after his boat capsized at sea over the weekend.\nGet the Latest news by email\nMaritime security personnel and other fishermen are currently searching the rough waters of the Portland Bight Protected Area with hope of finding Bernard Powell, a 53 year-old resident of\nPortland Cottage and also formerly of Old Harbour Bay.\nHopes of finding Powell, also known as ‘Bird Man’, are increasingly becoming remote with each hour that passes by.\nIt has been close to four days since the boat overturned with him and another colleague after they’d ventured out to sea last Friday (February 16, 2024) evening.\nThe distressed colleague was found Monday afternoon under the overturned boat by a crew of fishermen within the waters of Rocky Point, Clarendon.\nHe has taken to shore and transported to the Lionel Town Hospital where he’s receiving treatment.\nHis condition is said to be stable, while doctors on staff have initiated a battery of tests to determine his current health status and course of treatment.\nAccording to a relative of rescued fisherman, the boat was hit by a massive wave, causing it to overturn.\nThis was sometime between late Friday night and early Saturday morning.\nThere has been no sight or sound of Powell since either.\nThe relative said the fisherman, who is very conscious, told them that he staying underneath the boat was a better option in him staying alive.\nHe believed though that he could not survive for another day if fortune did not favour him yesterday, the relative said.\nCommentsView the discussion thread.\nOld Harbour News is a community-based online news media outlet based in Jamaica with more than 300,000 unique visitors since 2013. Photo: Special arrangement\nMail This Article\n×\nRecipient's Mail\nRecipient Mail address is Required\n( For more than one recipient, type addresses separated by comma )\nYour Name\nName is Required\nYour Email id\nMail address is Required\nInvalid Mail Format\nYour Comment\nThis is error message\nCaptche Code\nCaptcha is Required\nCaptcha Failed.Try again !\nSUBMIT\nReset\nEmail sent successfully\nTry Again !\nAlappuzha; A fisherman died while three others sustained injuries as two fishing boats collided off the Alappuzha coast on Tuesday.\nThe deceased was identified as 63-year-old Francis, a native of Chethi Kakkari near Cherthala. The injured fishermen were identified as Kuruthivelil Bhargavan (66), Puthanpurakal Jason (20) and Panajikal Nojan (46).\nADVERTISEMENT\nThe accident took place at 5 am when the fishing boat named Piller, owned by one Biju of Padinjare Kakkari, was rammed by another boat, Padannel. Both the boats capsized on impact, and the fishermen on board fell into the sea. Other boats in the vicinity soon rushed to the spot and brought the fishermen on board.\nThe body of Francis was shifted to the morgue of the Alappuzha Medical College while the injured were admitted to the same hospital for treatment. Both Francis and the injured fishermen were on board the fishing vessel `Piller’. A probe is on to ascertain the cause of accident.\nADVERTISEMENT\nMinister Saji Cherian visited the house of the deceased and offered condolences to the bereaved family.\nTAGS\nAlappuzha\nFishermen\nAccident\nThe comments posted here/below/in the given space are not on behalf of Onmanorama.     "https://www.oregonlive.com/pacific-northwest-news/2022/03/crew-member-found-unresponsive-after-fishing-boat-sinks-off-oregon-coast-search-for-ships-captain-ongoing.html": "Crew member dies after fishing boat sinks off Oregon coast; search for ship’s captain suspended - oregonlive.com\nSkip to ArticleSet weatherBack To Main MenuCloseQuick Look-Change your current location »Current -Mostly SunnyTonightLow -Mostly SunnyTomorrowHigh -Mostly SunnyView full weather reportUnlimited Digital Access - $1 a week for a whole year - Sale Ends 1/31/25Pacific NorthwestCrew member dies after fishing boat sinks off Oregon coast; search for ship’s captain suspendedUpdated: Mar. 27, 2022, 12:37 p.m.|Published: Mar. 26, 2022, 4:40 p.m.A file photo of a U.S. Coast Guard boat from Jan. 8, 2019.(U.S. Coast Guard via AP, File)By Zane Sparling | The Oregonian/OregonLiveAn unresponsive female crew member recovered from the Pacific Ocean has died and the search for another missing man has been suspended after a fishing boat sank Saturday off the Oregon coast, officials said.The 32-foot fishing boat, named “White Swan III,” was about 35 miles offshore from Florence when the ship’s captain, Mike Morgan, issued a mayday call early Saturday from the north end of the Heceta Banks fishing area, the U.S. Coast Guard said.Rescue crews spent more than 24 hours searching the water for Morgan, 68, but were unable to locate him, the U.S. Coast Guard said. The search for Morgan was suspended at 12:30 a.m. Sunday morning, officials said.An accompanying female crew member was pulled from the water and declared “unresponsive,” Chief Petty Officer William Colclough said. Officials said Sunday that she had died. The woman has not been identified.Helicopter crews and lifeboats scoured a 21-square-mile area near the location of a radio distress beacon sent out by the fishing boat. Air crews located a life raft and swaths of debris from the vessel in the area.Authorities have not yet determined what caused the fishing boat to sink.— Zane Sparling; zsparling@oregonian.com; 503-319-7083; @pdxzaneIf you purchase a product or register for an account through a link on our site, we may receive compensation. Odia\nNo Result\nView All Result\nNo Result\nView All Result\nFisherman dies as boat capsizes in Odisha\nPTI\nUpdated: December 31st, 2023, 00:12  IST\nin\nState, Top Stories\n0\nRepresentational image (pic-UN)\nShare on FacebookShare on TwitterShare on WhatsAppShare on Linkedin\nBerhampur: A 63-year-old man drowned when a fishing boat capsized in the Bay of Bengal near Gopalpur in Odisha’s Ganjam district Saturday, police said.\nThe deceased was identified as B Bairagi of Gopalpur.\nAlso Read\nGreen economy may boost Odisha’s GDP by 23% by 2030: Study\n6 hours ago\nOdisha signs 145 MoUs worth Rs 12.89 lakh crore in business summit: CM\n6 hours ago\nTwo other fishermen, who were also on the boat, managed to safely arrive at the shore, they said.\nThe incident took place in the early hours of Saturday, when the boat was struck by a strong tidal wave and it overturned, a police officer said.\n“We have registered an unnatural death case in Gopalpur police station, and started an inquiry,” he said.\nPTI\nTags: boat capsizefishermanOdisha\nShareTweetSendShare\nSuggest A Correction\nEnter your email to get our daily news in your inbox.\nLeave this field empty if you're (Representational Image) |\nFisherman dies after boat capsizes. (Representational Image) |\nA fisherman died after his boat capsized mid-sea due to high tidal waves off the coast of Muthalapozhi near here on Tuesday.\nAbraham (57) hails from the lighthouse area in Anchuthengu.\nAccording to police, the incident occurred early today when Abraham and three other fishermen were returning to the shore after catching fish.\nThough they were rushed to a nearby taluk hospital, Abraham's life could not be saved.\nThe others were undergoing treatment at a government hospital, they added.\nTags\nKerala Coast\nBoat Capsizes\nPrevious Story\nKerala Double Murder: Killer Returns After 6 Years, Murders Woman's Husband, Mother-In-Law\nNext Story\nStampede At Maha Kumbh Mela; Kejriwal's 'Yamuna Poison' Claim; Parl Panel Adopts Revised Waqf Bill | Jan 29 News Wrap\nClose Ad\nAdvertisement\nMOST POPULAR\nKerala Double Murder: Killer Returns After 6 Years, Murders Woman's Husband, Mother-In-Law\nStampede At Maha Kumbh Mela; Kejriwal's 'Yamuna Poison' Claim; Parl Panel Adopts Revised Waqf Bill | Jan 29 News Wrap\nGrap Stage 3 Invoked In Delhi-NCR Amid Rise In AQI; Classes Up To 5 To Shift Hybrid Mode\n9 Indians Killed In Road Accident In Saudi Arabia; EAM Jaishankar Expresses Grief\nAdvertisement\nWATCH\nLost Legacy: The Leather Tannery of Govt. A search-and-rescue operation was begun with the help of navy and maritime security boats, said Thatta Deputy Commissioner Ghazanfar Qadri.\nHe said the fishing boats were out to sea when the weather forced them to return but three boats carrying 44 crewmembers sank in high winds and rough waters.\nRescue teams were sent to bring back some of the fishermen who took shelter on small islands but two of them drowned attempting to swim to the coast, Qadri said.\nHe said the search-and-rescue operation will continue until all the missing fishermen are located.\nLocal fishing boats are typically not well equipped with modern navigation gear and safety equipment. Many fishermen ignore weather warnings and take other risks to land a good catch.\nFacebookTwitterLinkedinWhatsAppEmail\nPrevious articleTaliban, Western officials meet for talks in OsloNext articleSeven junior judges contract coronavirus in Lahore\nMonitoring Report\nRELATED ARTICLES\nNATIONAL\nRecord shows May 9 cases don’t fall under state security concerns: Justice Rizvi\nNATIONAL\nIHC returns PTI founder, wife pleas against £190m case verdict with objections\nNATIONAL\nPakistan ranked 12th global military power on GFP Index\nNATIONAL\nFIA DG, KP IG Police faced the music for ‘poor performance’\nNATIONAL\nPresident assents to PECA amend bill amid widespread outcry\nNATIONAL\nGovt proposes ‘parliamentary committee’ in response to PTI demand for JD\nMust Read\nNATIONAL\nIHC returns PTI founder, wife pleas against £190m case verdict with...\nJanuary 30, 2025\nISLAMABAD: The Islamabad High Court’s (IHC) registrar’s office on Wednesday returned the petitions of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) founder Imran Khan and his wife Bushra...\nPakistan ranked 12th global military power on GFP Index\nJanuary 30, 2025\nFIA DG, KP IG Police faced the music for ‘poor performance’\nJanuary 29, 2025\nPresident assents to PECA amend bill amid widespread outcry\nJanuary 29, 2025\nContact us: [email protected]\nPrivacy policy\nCopyright © 2025. Register for an account\nyour email\nyour username\nA password will be e-mailed to you.\nPassword recovery\nRecover your password\nyour email\nA password will be e-mailed to you.\nNATIONAL\nMarch 11, 2024\nPMSA, PN recovers bodies of 10 missing fishermen\nBy Staff Report\nThe Pakistan Maritime Security Agency (PMSA) and Pakistan Navy (PN) have recovered 10 of the 14 missing fishermen from the boat which sank last week, said a statement from the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR).\nAt least 14 fishermen were reported missing on Wednesday after the ill-fated boat overturned near Thatta. The boat, named Al-Asad, had a crew of around 45 fishermen, out of which 31 were rescued after the incident.\nOn March 5, a search and rescue operation was commenced by PN and PMSA. Despite challenging conditions, such as dense marine traffic, choppy seas, and the passage of time, the rescue team was able to recover the bodies of 10 fishermen who had been missing.\nUpon receiving information, PMSS Rehmat was able to achieve major breakthrough in the search operation today, reports the press release of Directorate General PR of Naval Headquarters.\nThe recovered bodies were handed over to the concerned authorities. The four bodies that were recovered earlier were laid to rest today.\n“The ongoing search and rescue operation by PN and PMSA is a clear demonstration of PN’s commitment to providing assistance during any unfortunate incidents at sea”\nInitially, fellow fishermen attempted to rescue those in distress, followed by coordinated efforts from the Maritime Security Agency, Pakistan Navy, and Fishermen’s Cooperative Society. These efforts led to the successful rescue of 43 fishermen, while two remained missing, prompting continued search operations. They were fished out by another launch and dropped at jetty on Thatta coast.\nFacebookTwitterLinkedinWhatsAppEmail\nPrevious articleGwadar Port Maintenance Dredging Navigation Channel project completedNext articleFazl seeks probe into notification of ‘unknown’ woman on National Assembly reserved seat\nStaff Report\nLEAVE A REPLY Cancel reply\nComment:\nPlease enter your comment!\nName:\nPlease enter your name here\nEmail:\nYou have entered an incorrect email address!\nPlease enter your email address here\nWebsite:\nSave my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment.\nΔ\nRELATED ARTICLES\nNATIONAL\nRecord shows May 9 cases don’t fall under state security concerns: Justice Rizvi\nNATIONAL\nIHC returns PTI founder, wife pleas against £190m case verdict with objections\nNATIONAL\nPakistan ranked 12th global military power on GFP Index\nNATIONAL\nFIA DG, KP IG Police faced the music for ‘poor performance’\nNATIONAL\nPresident assents to PECA amend bill amid widespread outcry\nNATIONAL\nGovt proposes ‘parliamentary committee’ in response to PTI demand for JD\nMust Read\nNATIONAL\nIHC returns PTI founder, wife pleas against £190m case verdict with...\nJanuary 30, 2025\nISLAMABAD: The Islamabad High Court’s (IHC) registrar’s office on Wednesday returned the petitions of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) founder Imran Khan and his wife Bushra...\nPakistan ranked 12th global military power on GFP Index\nJanuary 30, 2025\nFIA DG, KP IG Police faced the music for ‘poor performance’\nJanuary 29, 2025\nPresident assents to PECA amend bill amid widespread outcry\nJanuary 29, 2025\nContact us: [email protected]\nPrivacy policy\nCopyright © 2025.     "https://www.pna.gov.ph/articles/1162957": "2 fishermen reported missing in southern Negros | Philippine News Agency\nGOV PH\nOpen GOV.PH Menu\nHome\nAbout\nSubscription\nTransparency\nContact\nSearch\nPerform Search\nHome\nAbout\nSubscription\nTransparency\nContact\nSearch\nPerform Search\nOpen GOV.PH Menu\nHome\nNational\nProvincial\nOpinion\nBusiness\nFeatures\nHealth\nForeign\nSports\nTravel\nEnvironment\nSciTech\nHome\nNational\nProvincial\nOpinion\nBusiness\nFeatures\nHealth\nForeign\nSports\nTravel\nEnvironment\nSciTech\n2 fishermen reported missing in southern Negros\nBy Nanette Guadalquiver\nDecember 16, 2021, 4:18 pm\nShare\nShare\nX (formerly Twitter)\nViber\nEmail\nROUGH SEAS. The Philippine Coast Guard in Negros Occidental prohibits fishing vessels from venturing at sea as Tropical Cyclone Wind Signal is hoisted in the province due to Typhoon Odette. As of Thursday (Dec. 16, 2021), two fishermen from Binalbagan town are still missing after they went fishing on December 14. (PNA Bacolod file photo)\nBACOLOD CITY – Two fishermen from Binalbagan, Negros Occidental have been missing since Wednesday, according to an incident report released by the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG).They were identified as Joevel Tipon, 29, and Noel De la Cruz, 19, who ventured at sea on Tuesday morning.“They went fishing on December 14, 10 am, but failed to return to their residence as of the moment,” according to the report released on Thursday.Around 4 p.m. on Tuesday, both were last seen sailing off the nearby Pontevedra town and Guiwanin in Guimaras Island.According to the Coast Guard Station-Negros Occidental, its personnel has advised all watercraft transiting in the said areas to watch out and report to the nearest station any sighting of the missing fishing boat.In its latest bulletin on Typhoon Odette, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) said that in the next 24 hours, moderate to very high seas will be experienced over the seaboards of areas where Tropical Cyclone Wind Signal (TCWS) is in effect.On Thursday, central and southern parts of Negros Occidental have been placed under TCWS Signal No. 3 and No. 2 for the rest of the province.
