Dalat district police chief DSP Saga Chunggal said the body of Roslin Madale, 58, from Kampung Boom Oya was found by villagers in the river. In a statement, DSP Saga said a team of policemen were sent to the scene after receiving an emergency call at about 11.26pm on Friday (May 5). \"The body of Roslin was sent to Dalat Hospital and an examination by a doctor revealed that injuries on the victim's body were consistent with those seen in crocodile attacks,\" he said. The incident occurred around 10.30pm on Friday when the victim was fishing for prawns, he said, adding the case has been classified as sudden death. This is the eighth crocodile attack in the river since 2015. Six people have died while two others survived. – Bernama\nOpen Modal\n×\nFollow us on our official WhatsApp channel  for breaking news alerts and key updates!\nTags / Keywords:\nFisherman\n,\nCrocodile Attack\n,\nSungai Batang Oya\n,\nMukah\nReport a mistake\nWhat is the issue about?\nSpelling and grammatical\nerror\nFactually incorrect\nStory is irrelevant\nThis field is mandatory.\nPlease provide details of the report.\nEmail (optional)\nPlease enter valid email.\nReport issue\nReport issue\nCancel\nInvalid captcha response. Kuala Kedah maritime director Commander Noor Azreyanti Ishak said the body of Donbagee Tingsa, 33, was found at 8.30am on Saturday (May 13) about 2.0 nautical miles off Pulau Bidan. \"His body was taken to Jeti Sungai Udang Yan and handed over to the police for further action,\" she said in a statement on Saturday. The boat skipper realised the victim was missing at about 2.25pm last Thursday, when they were about 1.8 nautical miles southwest of Pulau Bidan and subsequently lodged a report. The Langkawi Maritime Rescue Sub-Centre activated a search and rescue operation, which also involved the Marine police, the Malaysian Civil Defence Force and local fishing boats. Noor Azreyanti advised those doing activities at sea to take safety measures such as wearing life jackets, checking the weather forecast and to ensure vessels are in good condition before heading out to sea, and to use a personal locator beacon. She also advised the public to report any emergency or accident at sea via the 24-hour emergency line MERS 999 or the Kuala Kedah Maritime Zone operations center at 04-731 0579. – Bernama\nOpen Modal\n×\nFollow us on our official WhatsApp channel  for breaking news alerts and key updates!\nTags / Keywords:\nMaritime Department\n,\nThai Crewman\n,\nDrown\n,\nFishermen\nReport a mistake\nWhat is the issue about?\nSpelling and grammatical\nerror\nFactually incorrect\nStory is irrelevant\nThis field is mandatory.\nPlease provide details of the report.\nEmail (optional)\nPlease enter valid email.\nReport issue\nReport issue\nCancel\nInvalid captcha response. The eight were said to have departed for their fishing trip in waters close to Kg Inderasabah on Sunday (July 23) but did not return home. Sabah Fire and Rescue Department assistant director of operations Hamsa Isnurdini said a missing people’s report was received at around 1.15pm on Monday (July 24). “It is suspected that the boat had sunk and the eight have gone missing due to this incident,” he said in a statement. He said firemen together with police and other enforcement officials are involved in the search of the vessel and victims.\nOpen Modal\n×\nFollow us on our official WhatsApp channel  for breaking news alerts and key updates!\nTags / Keywords:\nMissing\n,\nfishing trip\n,\nwaters\n,\nTawau\n,\nSabah\n,\nKg Inderasabah\n,\nSAR op\nReport a mistake\nWhat is the issue about?\nSpelling and grammatical\nerror\nFactually incorrect\nStory is irrelevant\nThis field is mandatory.\nPlease provide details of the report.\nEmail (optional)\nPlease enter valid email.\nReport issue\nReport issue\nCancel\nInvalid captcha response. Results\nDividends\nBonus\nIPO\nSport\nAthletics\nHockey\nFootball\nGolf\nBadminton\nTennis\nMotorsport\nOther Sports\nSay What\nMetro\nMetro News\nCommunity Sports\nViews\nLifestyle\nEntertainment & Style\nPeople & Living\nHealth & Family\nTravel & Culture\nViewpoints\nFood\nFood for Thought\nFood News\nEating Out\nKuali\nTech\nTech Thoughts\nEducation\nNews\nOpinion\nColumnists\nLetters\nVideos\nPhotos\nStarPicks\nMore\nClassifieds\nEvents\nStarCherish.com\nBodies of two missing anglers found after 36-hour search in Labuan\nBy DURIE RAINER FONG\nSabah & Sarawak\nTuesday, 22 Aug 2023\n2:23 PM MYT\nRelated News\nNation\n14h ago\nGerakan wants to contest in Sabah state elections, says Gerakan president\nNation\n6h ago\nFlood and landslide evacuees in Sarawak and Sabah surge to 4,000\nNation\n15h ago\nMalaysia's PETRONAS to decommission Sabah-Sarawak gas pipeline\nKOTA KINABALU: The bodies of two anglers have been recovered some 36 hours after they went missing while fishing in Labuan. Local fishermen found the remains of Yasin Johnar, 20, at 5.20pm on Monday (Aug 21) and Mohammad Shah, 19, two minutes later. Labuan Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency (MMEA) director Capt Nudin Jusoh said the bodies were found some 0.5 nautical miles from Kiamsam beach. \"Local fishermen took the remains to the Fire and Rescue Department which then transported the bodies to the search and rescue base,\" he said in a statement on Tuesday (Aug 22). The victims had gone fishing in an engine-less wooden boat at 6am on Sunday (Aug 20). A search and rescue mission was triggered after the families lodged a report when the victims failed to return home. The victims' boat was also discovered early Monday, not far from the jetty where they initially set sail. Nudin said the MMEA scoured a four nautical square mile area near Kiamsam beach. They were assisted by the marine police as well as the fire department and local fishermen. \"Families of the victims have been notified to identify the remains, which have been taken by the police for the next course of action. \"The MMEA urges the public to always look after their safety such as wearing life jackets when going out to sea,\" he said. Nudin also called on the public to report any incidents at sea to the Labuan MMEA operations centre at 087-427 999 or the Malaysia Emergency Response Services (MERS) 999 number.\nOpen Modal\n×\nFollow us on our official WhatsApp channel  for breaking news alerts and key updates!\nTags / Keywords:\nDrowning\n,\nLabuan\n,\nAnglers\n,\nWooden Boat\nReport a mistake\nWhat is the issue about?\nSpelling and grammatical\nerror\nFactually incorrect\nStory is irrelevant\nThis field is mandatory.\nPlease provide details of the report.\nEmail (optional)\nPlease enter valid email.\nReport issue\nReport issue\nCancel\nInvalid captcha response. Thoughts\nEducation\nNews\nOpinion\nColumnists\nLetters\nVideos\nPhotos\nStarPicks\nMore\nClassifieds\nEvents\nStarCherish.com\nFisherman missing in Kota Kinabalu waters, boat found with engine running\nBy DURIE RAINER FONG\nSabah & Sarawak\nMonday, 11 Dec 2023\n5:24 PM MYT\nRelated News\nNation\n14h ago\nGerakan wants to contest in Sabah state elections, says Gerakan president\nNation\n6h ago\nFlood and landslide evacuees in Sarawak and Sabah surge to 4,000\nNation\n15h ago\nMalaysia's PETRONAS to decommission Sabah-Sarawak gas pipeline\nVillagers found the fisherman's boat empty still with the engine still running.\nKOTA KINABALU: A search is on for a fisherman who went missing in waters near Pulau Gaya on Monday (Dec 11). The missing fisherman, Omar Ajid, 40, went out to fish at 5am but failed to return home. \"Villagers found his boat with the engine still running at about 10am, some 7.6 nautical miles north of Pulau Gaya,\" said Sabah and Labuan Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency (MMEA) director First Admiral Datuk Che Engku Suhaimi Che Engku Daik. He added that they activated the Kota Kinabalu Maritime Rescue Sub Centre (MRSC) at 2pm after the victim's wife alerted them of her husband's disappearance. Omar was last seen wearing a red long-sleeved shirt and green-striped trousers, he said. \"An MMEA vessel was deployed to the area where he was last seen. We have also notified other search and rescue agencies to be on the lookout,\" said Che Engku.\nOpen Modal\n×\nFollow us on our official WhatsApp channel  for breaking news alerts and key updates!\nTags / Keywords:\nMissing Fisherman\n,\nPulau Gaya\n,\nMMEA\nReport a mistake\nWhat is the issue about?\nSpelling and grammatical\nerror\nFactually incorrect\nStory is irrelevant\nThis field is mandatory.\nPlease provide details of the report.\nEmail (optional)\nPlease enter valid email.\nReport issue\nReport issue\nCancel\nInvalid captcha response.     "https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2024/06/04/search-underway-for-missing-fisherman-in-sungai-benut": "Search underway for missing fisherman in Sungai Benut | The Star\n×\nView\nSubscriptions\nLog In\nManage Profile\nChange Password\nManage Logins\nManage Subscription\nTransaction History\nManage Billing Info\nManage For You\nManage Bookmarks\nPackage & Pricing\nFAQs\nLog Out\nToggle navigation\nToggle navigation\nStarPlus\nNews\nAsean+\nESG\nBusiness\nSport\nMetro\nLifestyle\nFood\nTech\nEducation\nOpinion\nVideos\nPhotos\nStarPicks\nSubscriptions\nLog In\nManage Profile\nChange Password\nManage Logins\nManage Subscription\nTransaction History\nManage Billing Info\nManage For You\nManage Bookmarks\nPackage & Pricing\nFAQs\nLog Out\nHome\nStarPlus\nNews\nLatest\nNation\nWorld\nEnvironment\nIn Other Media\nTrue or Not\nFocus\nAsean+\nESG\nBusiness\nNews\nSMEBiz\nInsight\nUnit Trust\nExchange Rates\nMy Portfolio\nMarket Watch\nBursa Overview\nMarket Movers\nFinancial Results\nDividends\nBonus\nIPO\nSport\nAthletics\nHockey\nFootball\nGolf\nBadminton\nTennis\nMotorsport\nOther Sports\nSay What\nMetro\nMetro News\nCommunity Sports\nViews\nLifestyle\nEntertainment & Style\nPeople & Living\nHealth & Family\nTravel & Culture\nViewpoints\nFood\nFood for Thought\nFood News\nEating Out\nKuali\nTech\nTech Thoughts\nEducation\nNews\nOpinion\nColumnists\nLetters\nVideos\nPhotos\nStarPicks\nMore\nClassifieds\nEvents\nStarCherish.com\nSearch underway for missing fisherman in Sungai Benut\nBy MOHD FARHAAN SHAH\nNation\nTuesday, 04 Jun 2024\n8:10 PM MYT\nRelated News\nAseanplus News\n25 Jan 2025\nThree-story building collapses in Turkiye's central Konya province; search and rescue underway\nSingapore\n16h ago\nThree people, including two kids, rescued after floor collapses in Toa Payoh warehouse\nNation\n1d ago\nSix crew members rescued, skipper missing after cargo ship capsizes near Lawas\nPONTIAN: Another search and rescue (SAR) operation is underway to find a missing fisherman who fell into Sungai Benut here. Pontian OCPD Supt Mohammad Shofee Tayib said the missing person had been identified as 52-year-old Samsudin Bachok, who has been missing since Monday (June 3). He added that the victim’s 48-year-old wife lodged a report at 9.04am on Tuesday (June 4) as Samsudin failed to return home. “The wife said that the victim left their house on Monday, but he did not return home, and she could not locate him. The victim also did not bring a mobile phone with him. “The wife was only able to find her husband’s motorcycle, which is parked behind a pallet factory near Sungai Benut, and she has reason to believe that the victim may have fallen into the river,” he said here on Tuesday. Supt Mohammad Shofee added that according to the wife, her husband is a physical handicap card holder as he has a limp on the right leg. “Checks with several fishermen found that they spotted the victim along the riverbank of Sungai Benut on Monday evening,” he said, adding that the SAR was immediately called at around 11am. Supt Mohammad Shofee also said that 18 personnel from the police, Marine Police Region II, Fire and Rescue Department and Civil Defence Force were involved in the operation.\nOpen Modal\n×\nFollow us on our official WhatsApp channel  for breaking news alerts and key updates!\nTags / Keywords:\nSearch and Rescue\n,\nMissing\n,\nFisherman\n,\nSungai Benut\n,\nPolice\n,\nFire and Rescue\n,\nCivil Defence Force\n,\nMohammad Shofee Tayib\nReport a mistake\nWhat is the issue about?\nSpelling and grammatical\nerror\nFactually incorrect\nStory is irrelevant\nThis field is mandatory.\nPlease provide details of the report.\nEmail (optional)\nPlease enter valid email.\nReport issue\nReport issue\nCancel\nInvalid captcha response.     "https://www.thestatesman.com/india/fisherman-dies-as-two-fishing-boats-collide-off-kochi-coast-1503238117.html": "Fisherman dies as two fishing boats collide off Kochi coast - The Statesman\nAll Sections\nHome\nIndia\nWorld\nBusiness\nSports\nEntertainment\nOpinion\nLaw\nLifestyle\nDainik Statesman\nMore\nTechnology\nExclusive Interviews\nFeatures\nPhoto\nVideos\nCities\nTravel\nEducation\nLaw\nEpaper\nBhubaneswar\nDelhi\nKolkata\nSiliguri\nDainik Statesman\nHome\nIndia\nWorld\nBusiness\nSports\nEntertainment\nOpinion\nLaw\nLifestyle\nDainik Statesman\nMore\nTechnology\nExclusive Interviews\nFeatures\nPhoto\nVideos\nCities\nTravel\nEducation\nLaw\nEpaper\nBhubaneswar\nDelhi\nKolkata\nSiliguri\nDainik Statesman\nHome\nIndia\nWorld\nBusiness\nSports\nEntertainment\nOpinion\nLaw\nLifestyle\nDainik Statesman\nMore\nTechnology\nExclusive Interviews\nFeatures\nPhoto\nVideos\nCities\nTravel\nEducation\nLaw\nEpaper\nBhubaneswar\nDelhi\nKolkata\nSiliguri\nDainik Statesman\nSearch\n# India\nFisherman dies as two fishing boats collide off Kochi coast\nA fisherman died as two fishing boats collided off Munambam coast near Kochi in Kerala in the wee hours of Sunday.\nStatesman News Service | Thiruvananthapuram | November 5, 2023 8:25 pm\nRepresentation image (Photo by INDRANIL MUKHERJEE / AFP)\nA fisherman died as two fishing boats collided off Munambam coast near Kochi in Kerala in the wee hours of Sunday.\nDuring the collision, one of the boats was split in two, resulting in the tragic death of the fisherman. The deceased has been identified as Jose (63), a native of Kollam Pallithottam.Advertisement\nSeven other fishermen were rescued in the accident.\nAdvertisement\n“We were sleeping when the other boat, the Noorimol, hit us. As soon as we jumped, the boat was split in two halves. It was those boatmen who saved us. Seven people were rescued while the eighth could not be saved. Ours was a small boat,” said a fisherman in the boat named Silverstar, who is one of the survivors\nIn another tragic incident, two migrant workers were killed at Muvattupuzha near Ernakulam on Sunday.  The dead bodies of two migrant workers were found with their throats slit in a sawmill at Kampanypady at Muvattupuzha in Kerala’s Ernakulam district  on Sunday afternoon. The deceased have been identified as Mohantho and Deppasankar Basumma, both Assam natives.\nIt was around 4 pm when the dead bodies of the two were spotted by their co-workers. Both are working at the same sawmill. Police said one person, who is working in the sawmill, and his close friend are missing.\nThe police said an investigation is underway to uncover the details surrounding the suspected murder.\nAdvertisement\nFishermanKeralaKochi\nRelated posts\n# India\nTiger mauls tribal woman to death in Wayanad\nA 48-year-old tribal woman was mauled to death by a tiger at Priyadarshini Estate in Panchara Kolli , 10 km from Mananthavady town in Wayanad district of Kerala on Friday.\n# India\nRajnath Singh calls for inclusive and sustainable development at Sugathakumari’s 90th birth anniversary\nDefence Minister Rajnath Singh has emphasised the need for India’s development to be inclusive, equitable, ecologically sustainable, and morally desirable while ensuring the health of the planet is never compromised.\n# India\nKerala Shiv Sena leader quits party over ‘style of working of Uddhav Thackeray’\nM S Bhuvanachandran, founder of Shiv Sena’s Kerala unit, has left the party     "https://www.theyucatantimes.com/2023/11/tragic-year-for-fishermen-in-yucatan-12-victims-identified/": "Tragic year for fishermen in Yucatán: 12 victims identified - The Yucatan Times\nNews\nYucatan\nMerida\nCampeche\nQ. Roo\nNational\nInternational\nCrime\nColumns\nTravel\nLifestyle\nArt and Culture\nEntertainment\nOSY\nHistory\nMaya Universe\nHistoric Mexico\nBusiness\nBusiness & Money\nYucaTech\nFood and Drink\nHealth\nWellness\nSearch\nNews\nYucatan\nMerida\nCampeche\nQ. Roo\nNational\nInternational\nCrime\nColumns\nTravel\nLifestyle\nArt and Culture\nEntertainment\nOSY\nHistory\nMaya Universe\nHistoric Mexico\nBusiness\nBusiness & Money\nYucaTech\nFood and Drink\nHealth\nWellness\n@2024 All Right Reserved by San Miguel Times\nHome NewsPeninsulaBeach Communities Tragic year for fishermen in Yucatán: 12 victims identified\nBeach CommunitiesHeadlinesNewsPeninsulaYucatan\nTragic year for fishermen in Yucatán: 12 victims identified\nby \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tYucatan Times\nNovember 23, 2023\nwritten by                                     Yucatan Times\nNovember 23, 2023\n0 comment\nPhoto by Quang Nguyen Vinh on Pexels.com\n391\nTwelve fishermen have died so far this year, five more than the seven who died during the 2022 octopus season. One of them disappeared with his boat at high sea, according to a report.\nReynaldo Manzanilla, 79 years old, was the first fisherman to die in 2023. On January 18 in the early morning, he drowned when a massive wave capsized his boat “Paulina”, with four coast residents who were fishing for kingfish with nets, at 27.78 km from the coast of Progreso.\nThe second death occurred due to illness when José Raúl Cetina Tec, 56 years old, died of a heart attack while working on the boat “Propemex 24”, which was fishing for octopus off the eastern Yucatecan coast, in the early hours of January 23, 2023.\nIn March, a Tabasco fisherman who was not identified and was between 35 and 40 years old was found hanging on the outside of the boat “Neldy” in the sheltered port of Yucalpetén. It was said that the deceased had financial problems.\nOn April 2, on the first weekend of the Easter holidays, fisherman Nazaret de Jesús B.A., 27, from Dzilam de Bravo, died when he was thrown from the truck that, with five other fishermen, overturned in the Tizimín-Buctzotz road, after a tire on the vehicle burst.\nIn May, a fisherman was found hanging in his house, in the Ismael García neighborhood, in this city. It was also presumed to have been suicide.\nIn June, when extreme heat hit Yucatan, fisherman G.C.C., 47, suffered a fatal heat stroke while unloading produce from a boat. He died in a hospital.\nIn July, at the beginning of the lobster fishing season, fisherman Víctor U., 22 years old and from Tabasco living in Dzilam de Bravo, died because he decompressed while diving in the Cabo Catoche area, in Quintana Roo.\nOn August 4, on the fourth day of the octopus fishing season, the ship “Frehscolín VIII” arrived at the Yucalpetén docks, bringing the body of Eliel Esaú Loo Canul, 25 years old and a resident of Teya, who died of a sudden heart attack in the early hours of the same day, after saying that since the night his lungs hurt and he couldn’t breathe. The boat had finished fishing for grouper.\nThen, on September 3, Pedro Mariano Hernández Cervera, 62, from Progreso, was found dead floating in the dock of the sheltered port of Yucalpetén. The body had a blow to the forehead and body, so an investigation was opened for alleged homicide. That day it was said that he was killed during a fight that occurred on the ship “Gilbert VI”, which was going to sail to the pulpeada.\nDays later, on September 16, Miguel Hernández Hernández, 54 years old and a fisherman from Chuburná Puerto, was found dead, with fishing lines tangled around his neck, in his boat when it landed on the beach of that police station. after going out to catch the octopus.\nOn October 9, Gabriel Pacheco Campos, “Achicadero,” a well-known fisherman from Río Lagarto, suffered a decompression while diving for octopus and lobster. He died when he was being taken by boat to that port in the East.\nThis November, on Saturday the 4th, fisherman Carlos Alberto Reyes Jiménez, 37 years old, from Tabasco who arrived for the octopus’s fishing season, died of a heart attack on the boat “Freshco Rosa”, from Yucalpetén, which anchored offshore weathering “the north of deceased” caused by the cold front 8.\nHis companions called him to dinner and, when he did not come, they went to check on him and found him dead in his bunk.\nfishing seasonMeridaMexicoprogresoYucatan\nShare\n0\nFacebookTwitterPinterestEmail\nYucatan Times\nprevious Roo\nNational\nInternational\nCrime\nColumns\nTravel\nLifestyle\nArt and Culture\nEntertainment\nOSY\nHistory\nMaya Universe\nHistoric Mexico\nBusiness\nBusiness & Money\nYucaTech\nFood and Drink\nHealth\nWellness\n@2024 All Right Reserved by San Miguel Times\nHome Headlines Fisherman dies after shark attack in Sonora, Mexico\nHeadlinesNationalPlanetYucaWildlife\nFisherman dies after shark attack in Sonora, Mexico\nby \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tYucatan Times\nDecember 31, 2023\nwritten by                                     Yucatan Times\nDecember 31, 2023\n0 comment\n1.4K\nA fisherman, barely 20 years old, lost his life in Huatabampo, Sonora after a shark attack on the beaches of the port of Yavaros. The State Coordination of Civil Protection of Sonora confirmed the death that occurred on Friday, December 29.\nThe man was identified as Víctor Alejandro “N”, 22 years old, originally from the town of Moroncarit. According to the report, the altercation occurred when Víctor Alejandro was carrying out his crustacean fishing activities via diving.\nAt 1 p.m., a four-meter great white shark attacked the young man, detaching parts of his body.\n“He was an unlicensed fisherman and did not have an anti-shark repellent bracelet,” Sonora Civil Protection reported about the incident on Tojahui beach.\nLocal media indicated that the young man’s fishing companions put him on the boat after the animal attack and implemented rescue maneuvers while they took him to the dock, but they could not save his life.\nIt was reported that the young fisherman had lost one of his lower limbs due to the shark’s bite, which caused him to bleed to death.\nAgents of the Huatabampo Red Cross arrived at the El Tojahui fishing camp but could do nothing to save his life.\nExperts from the Sonora Attorney General’s Office came to take samples and begin default investigations. “Civil Protection, together with municipal authorities, has insisted on calling on fishermen to coordinate with the fishing authorities to be duly registered and have the necessary preventive measures to carry out their activities,” the agency indicated.\nTYT Newsroom\nMexicoshark attackSonora\nShare\n0\nFacebookTwitterPinterestEmail\nYucatan Times\nprevious post\nPeople in Sudzal protest against a foreigner who is allegedly killing their pets\nnext post\nExplosion in an apartment in Cancún, a foreign tourist is wounded\nYou may also like\nCampeche, Yucatan, and Quintana Roo join forces to combat the screwworm\nJanuary Roo\nNational\nInternational\nCrime\nColumns\nTravel\nLifestyle\nArt and Culture\nEntertainment\nOSY\nHistory\nMaya Universe\nHistoric Mexico\nBusiness\nBusiness & Money\nYucaTech\nFood and Drink\nHealth\nWellness\n@2024 All Right Reserved by San Miguel Times\nHome NewsPeninsulaBeach Communities The search continues for missing fishermen on the coast of Celestún\nBeach CommunitiesHeadlinesNewsPeninsula\nThe search continues for missing fishermen on the coast of Celestún\nby \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tYucatan Times\nFebruary 9, 2024\nwritten by                                     Yucatan Times\nFebruary 9, 2024\n0 comment\n521\nThe Secretary of the Navy (Semar) reported that a boat reported missing off the coast of Celestún for several days was found, with two crew members on board who were left without an engine and communication routes due to the attack by modern “pirates.”\nThe Mexican Navy also reported that another ship, called JCCDR-1, is still adrift, which was also reported missing for several days, with Manuel C. U., 40, on board; Eligio P. and Ángel E. C., who had to return to the port since last Sunday and have not yet done so.\nUnofficial sources close to the Secretary of the Navy assured that the search work has not stopped; it was indicated that the operation in which the boat “Lizandro 1” was found also included the search for the ship that remains missing, therefore, the search continues to be active to try to find the whereabouts of the seamen.\nIt should be remembered that the operation is carried out by sea and air, in a coordinated effort between the Defender-type vessel and a Persuader-type aircraft, both Navy search and rescue. The agency also indicated that it will continue the search for the fishermen to preserve their integrity and be able to bring them to land as soon as possible.\nTYT     "https://www.trackingsharks.com/diver-killed-in-fatal-shark-attack-in-cuba/": "Diver killed in Fatal Shark Attack in Cuba\nSkip to content\nWednesday, January 29, 2025\nRecent articles\nAmerican Teen Loses leg in Belize Shark Attack\nCaught on Camera Surfer Loses Leg to Great White Shark in Australia; Several Others Recovering from Shark injuries.\nVideo: Four Bull Shark Attacks Reported in One Day in Texas\nFatal Shark Attack Reported in Oahu\nThree Shark Attacks Reported Within Hours in Walton County, Florida\nTracking Sharks\nThe toothiest place on the web\nRecent Articles\nTrack Sharks\n2025 Shark Attack Map\n2024 Shark Attack Map\n2023 Shark Attack Map\n2022 Shark Attack List\n2020 Shark Attack Map\n2019 Shark Attack Map\n2018 Shark Attack Map\n2017 Shark Attack Map (Bites)\nShark attack prevention\nContact\nDiver killed in Fatal Shark Attack in Cuba\nJanuary 8, 2024January 8, 2024 Kevin McMurray\nShare on Facebook\nShare\nShare on TwitterTweet\nShare on Pinterest\nShare\nShare on Digg\nShare\nA diver has died after being attacked by a shark in Cuba.\nMaro Alejandro Diaz Jimenez was spearfishing on May 9, 2023 in an area known as Ojo de Tiburon. The avid fisherman was with several friends, possibly shark fishing, diving from a boat named the Eye of the Tiguron. As he was diving for a fish, he was bitten by a bull shark. Friends valiantly jumped in the water to save their comrade, but the wounds were too severe, and Jimenez died.\nHis grieving friends transported his body back to shore.\nAnother man was injured by a shark this year\nAn unidentified 17-year-old was around 15 miles off Majana Beach on March 25, fishing with relatives when he was bitten. Family members were able to call for emergency services who had an ambulance waiting on shore. He was taken to Ciro Redondo Hospital with a large bite extending from his forearm to his upper arm just below the shoulder. Doctors said the young man arrived in shock with massive blood loss. A local blood bank provided blood for the young man who sustained serious vascular damage to his arm and forearm.\nPhotos showed doctors performing surgery on the large wound, which they were thankfully able to repair and save the young man’s life.\nBoth locations have been marked on the 2023 Shark Attack Map.\nAnother man was died while trying to cross to the North America in 2021.\nAlexis Fernandez, 28, was nearing Mexico when his boat broke apart. Footage from the incident shows a large floating mass that appears to be the remains of a human being struck multiple times by a large shark. Witness said the shark severed the man’s legs as authorities were recovering the body from the water.\nAccording to Juventud Rebelde, there have been 39 unprovoked and 5 provoked shark attacks, of which 22 were fatal, in Cuba between 1749 and 2014.\nShare on Facebook\nShare\nShare on TwitterTweet\nShare on Pinterest\nShare\nShare on Digg\nShare\n2023 Shark Attack Bite, Bull Sharkcuba\nRelated posts\nJuly 8, 2024\nKevin McMurray\nVideo: Four Bull Shark Attacks Reported in One Day in Texas\nFour people are recovering after bull shark attacks July...\n2024 Shark Attack Bull Shark\nJune 9, 2024\nKevin McMurray\nThree Shark Attacks Reported Within Hours in Walton County, Florida\nThree women are recovering after being attacked by sharks...\n2024 Shark Attack Bull Shark\nMarch 4, 2024\nKevin McMurray\nMan Loses Leg in Bull Shark Attack\nA fisherman lost his leg in a bull shark...\n2024 Shark Attack Bull Shark\nShark Surprise\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oCHA2iMEZ-E&ab_channel=TrackingSharksFollow Tracking Sharks\nJoin the Tracking Sharks teamAd\nRecent Posts\nAmerican Teen Loses leg in Belize Shark Attack\nCaught on Camera Surfer Loses Leg to Great White Shark in Australia; Photo: Daily Nation, The Standard.Source: UGCThe papers also reported on the alleged abduction of the former Mungiki leader Maina Njenga by police believed to be police officers.1. Daily NationThe publication reported on the infighting in Kenya Kwanza administration over the recent increase in fuel prices.Key Cabinet Secretaries (CSs) in President William Ruto's administration have been in the limelight for allegedly issuing reckless remarks.PAY ATTENTION: Join TUKO.co.ke Telegram channel! Never miss important updatesKakamega senator Boni Khalwale called for the sacking of Trade CS Moses Kuria, Energy CS Davis Chirchir and Ruto's economic advisor David Ndii.The Senate Majority Whip said he was elected to represent the people. So, he expects the CSs and economic advisors to serve and protect the Kenyan citizens from adverse economic conditions. Read alsoKhalwale Asks Ruto to Sack CSs Kuria, Chirchir over Fuel Prices: \"Serikali Yako Inakaa Sura Mbaya\"\"I want to tell you that the people you have given jobs have put you in deep trouble. The minister for trade and energy and your economic advisors must tell Kenyans what they mean... Sack these people so that the fuel prices come down,\" Khalwale said. 2. The StandardAzimio la Umoja One Kenya Coalition Party leadership accused the Kenya Kwanza government of being behind the recent abduction of the former Mungiki leader, Maina Njenga.The opposition coalition linked the abduction of Njenga to what they perceive as a state-sponsored effort to hinder the opposition.Wiper leader Kalonzo Musyoka and Narc-Kenya leader Martha Karua said the abduction is a subversion of the rule of law by the state. “This is a country governed by the rule of law, but what we are witnessing is a complete reversal of the progress we have made,\" Kalonzo said.Karua said Njenga’s arrest was a government tactic to divert public attention from the current and unbearable economic hardships.Read alsoRaila Odinga Claims William Ruto's 1 Year In Office Flopped: \"Wamepata D\"3. The StarThe paper reported on the death of two fishermen in Mbitha, Homa Bay county, after fighting over a cigarette worth KSh 15.One fisherman, identified as Sikuku Odiko, allegedly stabbed his colleague Geoffrey Ngoge in the chest using a knife at Nyagina Beach after a heated exchange of words over a cigarette.Rusinga East location Chief Mboya Owuor said Sikuku attempted to borrow the cigarette, but Geoffrey ignored which infuriated him.Oduor said the verbal insults turned into a physical fight before Odiko drew a knife and stabbed Ngoje to death.“Ngoje started bleeding profusely before he succumbed to the chest injuries inflicted on him by Odiko.\"The mob caught up with Odiko as he was trying to escape. Some stoned him while others beat him with wooden rods and paddles. He succumbed to the injuries he sustained during the beatings,” said Owuor.4. People DailyThe paper reported on the call by Prime Cabinet Secretary Musalia Mudavadi for Kenyans to have hope and confidence even as the Kenya Kwanza administration does its best to deliver on its mandate.Read alsoRaila Odinga Rules Out Maandamano in Coming Days as Cost of Living Skyrockets: \"We've New Plan\"Mudavadi said the government continues to put in place measures to cushion Kenyans from the high cost of living and harsh economic times.He stated that President William Ruto’s government has been forced to make painful decisions to manage the country's national debt and fix other areas of the economy.He assured Kenyans that they would enjoy the fruits of the current economic hardship in the long run.\"We have had to make painful decisions to manage our national debt for which the previous regime borrowed to stay afloat. No doubt there is pain that we are taking, but it is not in vain. Honestly, it is a short-time pain for long-time gain. The previous regime gave Kenyans a false sense, resulting in long-term pain,\" Mudavadi said. 5. Taifa LeoThe Swahili publication reported on the threats by the Central Organization of Trade Union (COTU) to stage protests over high taxation.Read alsoKenya This Week: David Ndii Warns Kenyans against Trusting William Ruto's Gov't, Other Top StoriesLed by deputy secretary general Benson Okwaro, COTU slammed the Kenya Kwanza Alliance government over recent tax hikes on Kenyan workers.Okwaro urged the government to withdraw some of the new taxes imposed on the workers.\"Kenyans have not been able to get a salary increase, be it in the public sector or private sector, but instead of finding a way of cushioning members, the government is going around and adding taxes, which has resulted in the hiked cost of living,\" Okwaro said.PAY ATTENTION: check out news exactly for YOU ➡️  click on “Recommended for you” and enjoy! Never miss important updatesDidacus Malowa, a journalist at TUKO.co.ke, brings over three years of experience covering politics and current affairs in Kenya.Homa Bay - A middle-aged man has drowned in Lake Victoria while trying to pick up his boat's paddle.Fishermen sail through Lake Victoria during sunset. Photo: Michael Poliza.Source: UGCHow did Oyugi fall into Lake VictoriaForty-year-old Julius Okoth Oyugi, a fisherman, drowned on Thursday, November 2, near Sukru Island beach following heavy rains that were accompanied by strong winds.PAY ATTENTION: Follow us on Instagram - get the most important news directly in your favourite app!Read alsoCity Businessman Shot Dead at Home after Altercation with WifeCitizen Digital reported that Oyugi had just left the island for the neighbouring Sota beach when the strong winds prevailed, leading to his death.The fisherman was reportedly alone in the boat when the waves hit his boat, dropping the paddle in the water.Confirming the tragic loss of life, Sukru Island Beach Management Unit Chairperson (BMU) Peter Juma said Oyugi drowned while trying to pick up the paddle.The local authorities and fishermen have since launched an operation to retrieve Oyugi's body.2 police officers missing after boat capsizesIn a similar incident, at least two police officers were among three people missing after a boat capsized in Lake Victoria. According to a police report seen by TUKO.co.ke, the accident occurred on the night of Friday, March 24, 2023, in Nyatike South sub-county, Migori county. The case was reported at Muhuru Bay police station under Occurrence Book (OB.NO.2/24/03/2023). Read alsoRongo University Student Who Stabbed Colleague to Death after Altercation Arrested\"Today at around midnight, it was reported by one Omar Omar that they were on a joint operation involving officers from the Kenya Police Service, Marine Police, and Administration Police Service attached to the Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) and a KRA staffer in Lake Victoria,\" the police report reads in part.5 soldiers escape deathEarlier, five marine officers on a perilous mission to locate the victims of a recent boat sinking in Lake Victoria escaped death after their own vessel capsized.Their mission was to conduct a search and rescue operation for the 14 individuals who went missing during the tragic accident that occurred on August 2.According to Daily Monitor, Kampala Metropolitan deputy police spokesperson Luke Owoyesigire blamed the mishap on strong winds which toppled the rescue vessel.PAY ATTENTION: Unlock exclusive features from TUKO.co.ke - join our membership! Of its 27 crew members, 15 were rescued, including two who were found unconscious and later pronounced dead, while 12 others remained missing. Photo by Korea Coast Guard/EPA-EFE\nNov. 8 (UPI) -- Two people died and rescuers were searching for 12 others who went missing in the waters of the East China Sea on Friday after a fishing boat sank off South Korea's Jeju Island, authorities said.\nThe fishing vessel Geumseong, a 129-ton craft, sent out a distress call early Friday morning when it began sinking about 15 miles off the small island of Biyangdo, located just northeast of Jeju, Korean Coast Guard officials told the Yonhap News Agency.\nAdvertisement\nThey said the ship had 27 crew members aboard when it began sinking, including 16 Koreans and 11 Indonesians. Of those, 15 were rescued by a nearby vessel but two of them, identified as Koreans, were later pronounced dead after being hospitalized.\nThe 12 who remain missing include 10 Koreans and two Indonesians, officials said.\nRelated\nAt least 12 dead as boat carrying migrants capsizes in English Channel\nSuperyacht wreck: Authorities question captain amid manslaughter probe\nMedics airlift 3 after 7 injured in boat-bridge collision in Florida Keys\nCoast Guard Commissioner General Kim Jong-wook activated the agency's Central Rescue Headquarters to launch a full-scale effort to find any survivors, deploying dozens of divers who searched through waters reaching depths of nearly 300 feet.\nA spokesman for South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol told Yonhap he has issued authorization to mobilize all available resources and personnel for the rescue mission.\nAdvertisement\nCrew members said the boat capsized after unloading its catch onto a transport vessel and lifting the net, although questions remain about why the weight of an unloaded net would cause such a large boat to capsize.\nOne possibility is that heavy floating trash may have been caught up in the net, the Hankook Ilbo daily reported. Refuse floating the waters off Jeju Island has become an increasingly serious problem in recent years, it said.\nLatest Headlines\nWorld News // 3 hours ago\n3 Israeli, 5 Thai hostages to be freed on Thursday\nJan. 29 (UPI) -- Another exchange of hostages held by Hamas and other militants in Gaza and Palestinian prisoners held in Israeli jails is scheduled on Thursday.\nWorld News // 5 hours ago\nRussia says Aussie fighting for Ukraine and feared dead is alive in captivity\nJan. 29 (UPI) -- Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Wednesday Russia has reported Oscar Jenkins is alive and in custody. LifeFuneral Care ServicesIn MemoryPlace an ObituaryWeatherContact UsAbout UsContact InformationOur TeamBlack Press MediaSocial MediaToday in BCYoutube\nSearch Type\nSite\nDirectory\nSearch\nHome\nNews\nKayaker and boat captain missing on Okanagan lakes\n2 separate vessels capsized on Okanagan and Kalamalka lakes have not resurfaced following storm\nJennifer Smith\nJul 25, 2023 10:30 AM\nJul 25, 2023 11:05 AM\nShare by Email\nShare on Facebook\nShare on X\nShare on LinkedIn\nPrint\nShare via Text Message\nTwo men who went missing on two separate lakes Monday, July 24, have yet to be found.\nSearches are underway on Okanagan Lake and Kalamalka Lake for the individuals who went missing in separate boating incidents overnight.\nA missing kayaker is being sought on Kalamalka Lake, after a group of kayakers alerted police around 11 p.m. Monday.\nA storm blew in creating rough conditions for the group, which was able to land on the west side of the lake.\nOne of the men in the group left in an attempt to paddle back across the lake to Kalamalka Beach. The man was not seen again and his kayak has since been recovered.\nVernon Search and Rescue responded and conducted an initial search for the man who was not found.\nA short time later, around 11:15 p.m., RCMP received a report that one person was missing after a commercial fishing vessel had capsized on Okanagan Lake near Ellison Provincial Park.\nThe boat was engaged in fishing activities and towing a smaller vessel when it encountered high waves and strong winds brought on by an overnight storm, causing the vessel to overturn. The man operating the vessel did not surface. An initial search of the area was conducted by search crews as well as an RCMP police boat, unfortunately the man was not located.\n“Concurrent searches have been organized and are underway on both Kalamalka Lake and Okanagan Lake, utilizing both Vernon Search and Rescue and RCMP resources,” said Const. Chris Terleski, media relations officer for the Vernon North Okanagan RCMP. “These are both terribly unfortunate events and our thoughts are with the families during this difficult time as we continue our search for their loved ones.”\nTerleski said RCMP resources, including the RCMP’s Underwater Recovery Team, are involved in the search Wednesday.\nWorksafe BC and the RCMP’s investigation team are working together to determine the best way to safely recover the boat from Okanagan Lake, while ensuring its removal does not compromise the investigation.\n“The situation has presented some challenges that have impacted the recovery effort and are currently being worked through,” Terleski said.\nREAD MORE: Bonfire fuels $1,150 fine for Vernon man\nREAD MORE: Nearly $40K raised for Kamloops man injured trying to save stepdaughter near Revelstoke\n@VernonNewsnewsroom@vernonmorningstar.comLike us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter\nand subscribe to our daily newsletter.\nA police boat was parked at the dock at Hurlburt Park Wednesday, July 26, 2023. (Brendan Shykora - Morning Star)\nVernon Search and Rescue crews have not been able to locate two men missing in separate incidents on Okanagan and Kalamalka lakes. (VSAR file photo)\nSee a typo/mistake?\nHave a story/tip?\nAbout the Author: Jennifer Smith\n20-year-Morning Star veteran\nRead more\nShare this content:\n0\nShares\nShare by Email\nShare on Facebook\nShare on X\nShare on LinkedIn\nPrint\nShare via Text Message\nMore News\nFormer B.C. Asia\nEurope\nMiddle East\nSouth & Central Asia\nBroadcast Programs\nVOA Languages\nLatest Global Coverage\nFollow Us\nLanguages\nSearch\nSearch\nPrevious\nNext\nBreaking News\nEast Asia\n7 Fishermen Missing After Philippine Sea Collision\nMay 29, 2022 0:55 AM\nBy Agence France-Presse\nPalawan, Philippines\nShare\n7 Fishermen Missing After Philippine Sea Collision\nshare\nPrint\nMANILA, PHILIPPINES —\nRescuers searched waters off the Philippines on Sunday for seven people missing after a collision between a fishing boat and a cargo ship, authorities said.\nThe Philippine fishing vessel and Marshall Islands-flagged MV Happy Hiro collided Saturday east of Palawan Island, the Philippine Coast Guard said.\nThe fishing boat capsized and sank in the Sulu sea, coast guard spokesperson Commodore Armando Balilo said.\nThirteen of its 20 crew members were plucked from the water by another fishing boat before being transferred to the Happy Hiro.\nThey suffered minor injuries.\nThe coast guard deployed rescue teams from nearby stations to scour the waters for the seven missing crew members.\nThe Philippines, an archipelago of more than 7,000 islands, has a poor maritime safety record.\nMishaps and overcrowding are common on vessels that are often wooden-hulled outriggers used for fishing or transporting people.\nOn Monday, seven people were killed and 127 were rescued after a fire ripped through a ferry and forced passengers to jump overboard.\nThe 186-person capacity fast craft boat was about a kilometer from Real, in Quezon province on the main island of Luzon, when the blaze started.\nRelated\nUS to Strengthen Ties With Philippines, Promote Rule of Law\nBiden Congratulates Marcos on Philippines Election Win\nMarcos Jr. Declares Victory, Faces Calls to Ensure Democracy\nGrenade Attack Wounds Nine at Philippine Polling Station\nMore Asia News\nYear of the Snake is underway with Lunar New Year festivities\nAustralian police foil Wales\nNewsFamilies of missing fishermen supported as bodies of three men found off English coastThe fishermen had been on board the Nicola Faith boat which was reported missing on January 27walesonlineBookmarkShareCommentsNewsByLydia Royce15:24, 15 MAR 2021Updated16:02, 15 MAR 2021BookmarkFlowers at Conwy harbour at the beginning of this month for the missing fishermen (Image: North Wales Live)Keep up to date with the latest stories with our WalesOnline newsletterMore Newsletters SubscribePlease enter a valid emailSomething went wrong, please try again later.More NewslettersWe More info×Group 28Thank you for subscribing!We have more newslettersShow MeNo thanks, closeSee our\nPrivacy NoticeThe families of three missing Welsh fishermen are being supported after the bodies of three men were found off the coast of England over the weekend.  Ross Ballantine, 39, Carl McGrath, 34, and Alan Minard, 20, disappeared off the Conwy coast on January 27 and no trace of them has been seen since. The men were onboard the Nicola Faith, a 10-metre-long boat that failed to return to port in Conwy.  Despite a major sea search involving the RNLI, no trace of the boat or the men was found and the search was called off on January 29. But North Wales Police today confirmed it had informed and was supporting the families of the three fishermen after the discovery of three bodies off the coast of the Wirral and Blackpool.\nCarl McGrath was one of the three men on board the vessel\n(Image: GoFundMe)\nRoss Ballantine has been pictured on a fundraising page for the search\n(Image: GoFundMe)\nIn a statement, the force said: \"We have been in contact with colleagues from both Merseyside and Lancashire Police, and we await the outcome of the Home Office postmortem examinations. \"The families of the missing crew members from the vessel ‘Nicola Faith’ have been kept informed, and continue to be supported by specialist officers. We would request that they are given the necessary privacy at this difficult time.\"\nAlan Minard was also on board\n(Image: GoFundMe)\nAfter the search was called off in January, the families fundraised to fund a private effort to locate them, which was due to begin today. Earlier this month, a life raft from the missing fishing boat was found off the coast of Kirkcudbrightshire in Scotland.  Last month, Carl McGrath's mum, Julie McGrath, spoke about her heartbreak with her son missing.\nSubscribe to the WalesOnline newsletter today\nYou can now get all of the need-to-know news sent straight to your inbox by signing up for our free WalesOnline newsletter.  It takes just seconds to subscribe - simply click here, enter your email address and follow the instructions.\nShe said: \"My eldest son Anthony passed away when he was 26 and I've been dealing with that grief for 10 years. To then hear about Carl, the pain is unbearable, I can't believe this is happening, why me? Why my boys? \"Losing Anthony made me more over protective of my other two children because I was so scared of losing them. Life went on for everyone else but me after that moment, and I really struggled to deal with it. \"Me and Carl had our ups and downs over the years and for a while, we didn't speak until he had a serious motorbike accident and broke his back. I thought I was going to lose him then, he ended up on life-support, it was horrible. But he got out of hospital and back on his feet and that brought us back together again. \"I think, because I've smothered him, it's caused us to fall out again and the last thing I told him was: 'I love you, you can't take that away from me, but if you need me I'm here.'\"\nRead More\nRelated Articles\nMembers of 'armed and deadly gang' convicted of killing Harry Baker\nRead More\nRelated Articles\nCoronavirus infection rates, cases, and deaths for all parts of Wales on Monday, March 15\nStory SavedYou can find this story in  My Bookmarks.Or by navigating to the user icon in the top     "https://www.wionews.com/india-news/india-3-day-search-and-rescue-at-sea-off-kerala-coast-ends-2-rescued-1-dead-497454": "India: 3-day search and rescue at sea off Kerala coast ends; 2 rescued, 1 dead\nAdvertisment\n0\nBookmarks\nLog Out\nSubscribe\nVideos\nGravitas\nWorld\nCentral Asia\nWest Asia\nEast Asia\nSouth East Asia\nEurope\nAmericas\nAustralia and New Zealand\nAfrica\nBusiness\nIndia\nLive TV\nShowBiz\nHollywood\nBollywood\nOpinions\nSouth Asia\nIndia\nPakistan\nBangladesh\nNepal\nAfghanistan\nSports\nCricket\nFootball\nPhotos\nMore\nSCIENCE & TECH\nWeb Stories\nLifestyle\nVideos\nGravitas\nWorld\nCentral Asia\nWest Asia\nEast Asia\nSouth East Asia\nEurope\nAmericas\nAustralia and New Zealand\nAfrica\nBusiness\nIndia\nLive TV\nShowBiz\nHollywood\nBollywood\nOpinions\nSouth Asia\nIndia\nPakistan\nBangladesh\nNepal\nAfghanistan\nSports\nCricket\nFootball\nPhotos\nMore\nSCIENCE & TECH\nWeb Stories\nLifestyle\nAuthors\nIndia News\nIndia: 3-day search and rescue at sea off Kerala coast ends; 2 rescued, 1 dead\nThe Coast Guard vessel reached the point of the incident by Tuesday afternoon and carried out an extensive search and along with a Coast Guard helicopter\nby\nSidharth MP\nUpdated\n15 Jul 2022 00:48 IST\nLink copied!\nCopy failed!\nIndian Coast Guard Ships Photograph:(AFP)\nChennai, Tamil Nadu\nA three-day-long search and rescue operation involving ships and helicopters, off India's Southern Coast came to an end on Thursday, after the mortal remains of a fisherman recovered. Shihab and two other fishermen had set out to sea on the fishing boat 'Badhar' on Tuesday morning from Urupunya Kavu beach, Kozhikode, Kerala. Their boat had capsized by noon, owing to inclement weather.\nAdvertisment\nWhile the two fishermen who accompanied Shihab were rescued by nearby fishing boats, but the latter was missing. Based on a request from the Kerala Government, the Indian Coast Guard(ICG) immediately diverted 'ICGS Arnvesh' from its routine deployment to carry out search and rescue.\nThe Coast Guard vessel reached the point of the incident by Tuesday afternoon and carried out an extensive search and along with a Coast Guard helicopter. By Wednesday morning, an ICG chopper and two ICG vessels were at the location carrying out search and rescue. Finally, the missing fisherman Shihab's mortal remains were recovered on Thursday.\nWATCH WION LIVE HERE\nAdvertisment\nYou can now write for wionews.com and be a part of the community. Lucie\nMartin\nPalm Beach County\nNorth PBC\nCentral PBC\nSouth PBC\nThe Glades\nBroward\nMiami-Dade\nQuick links...\nTreasure Coast\nOkeechobee\nIndian River\nSt. Lucie\nMartin\nPalm Beach County\nNorth PBC\nCentral PBC\nSouth PBC\nThe Glades\nBroward\nMiami-Dade\n1 weather alerts\n1 closings/delays\nNewsTreasure CoastRegion St Lucie County\nActions\nFacebook\nTweet\nEmail\nMissing fisherman's body found in Fort Pierce Inlet days after disappearance\nBrian Ronshausen, 50, vanished Monday night\nPrev\nNext\nThe body of a commercial fisherman who vanished earlier this week was recovered from the Fort Pierce Inlet near Jetty Park on Friday afternoon, deputies said.\nBy:\nScott Sutton\nPosted\nand last updated\nST. LUCIE COUNTY, Fla. — The body of a commercial fisherman who vanished earlier this week was recovered from the Fort Pierce Inlet near Jetty Park on Friday afternoon, deputies said. The St. Lucie County Sheriff's Office and U.S. Coast Guard recovered the body of Brian Ronshausen, 50.Ronshausen was last seen launching a small boat from Stan Blum Boat Ramp at about 11 p.m. Monday.\nThe Coast Guard searched for Ronshausen for much of Tuesday but suspended the search Wednesday morning.\"Sheriff Pearson and the men and women of the St. Lucie County Sheriff's Office extend our heartfelt condolences to Brian's family and friends during this difficult time,\" a post on the sheriff's office's Facebook page said. The circumstances of Ronshausen's death are unclear.Danielle Myrter, his sister, has set up a GoFundMe account to help with expenses.\nCopyright 2024 Scripps Media, Inc. All rights reserved. Click here!Two fishermen from Tema have died after their canoe crashed into a patrol boat while fishing at night on Thursday, July 27, 2023.The patrol boat involved in the crash belonged to the Ghana Ports and Harbours Authority (GPHA).The fishermen were at sea at night despite the fishing ban. Source: Facebook/@FishingGHSource: FacebookReports have stated that the fishermen were engaged in ritual fishing for the Homowo festival.But the fishermen are suspected to have been defying the one-month closed season, which ends on Monday, July 31.Celebrate Ghanaian celebrities and their love for luxurious cars! The fishermen who died have been identified as Francis Tetteh Larbi, aged 27 and Samuel Acquaye Allotey, aged 45.About the closed seasonThe closed seasons were put in place to reduce the pressure on fish stocks.The ban is to allow the fish to lay their eggs during a period when they are most productive to replace the lost population which is the result of excessive fishing and other natural causes.In Ghana, the Ministry of Fisheries and Aquaculture ceremonially locks up the sea to signify the start of the closed season.Flouting of closed seasonThe Minister of Fisheries and Aquaculture, Mavis Hawa Koomson, cracked the whip on fishermen at Elmina for flouting the closed season back in 2021.Read alsoDeadly fire burning on car transport ship off NetherlandsYEN.com.gh reported that the fishermen at Elmina were not allowed to go fishing when the closed season was over. The minister said this was because the fishermen refused to accept her campaign against illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing activities.The closed season has reportedly borne fruit in places like Keta in the Volta Region where they recorded a bumper catch.New feature: Сheck out news that is picked for YOU ➡️  click on “Recommended for you”  and enjoy!     "https://kahawatungu.com/three-fishermen-found-alive-after-27-days-lost-in-the-indian-ocean/": "Three Fishermen Found Alive After 27 Days Lost In The Indian Ocean - KahawaTungu\nClose Menu\nFacebook\nX (Twitter)\nInstagram\nKahawaTungu\nFacebook\nX (Twitter)\nInstagram\nKahawaTungu\nHome » Three Fishermen Found Alive After 27 Days Lost In The Indian Ocean\nNEWS\nThree Fishermen Found Alive After 27 Days Lost In The Indian OceanBy Damaris GatwiriDecember 27, 2023No Comments2 Mins Read\nFacebook\nTwitter\nPinterest\nLinkedIn\nTumblr\nEmail\nShare\nFacebook\nTwitter\nLinkedIn\nPinterest\nEmail\nThree fishermen who went missing in the Indian Ocean for 27 days have been rescued.\nUnfortunately, one of their colleagues was discovered dead during the ordeal.\nThe fishermen, identified as Baraka, Brian, Fahadhi, and Baya, set out on a deep-sea fishing expedition on November 30, 2023, with the expectation of returning to Ngomeni on December 2.\nHowever, their absence raised concerns, leading to the initiation of search and rescue efforts by the Kenya Coast Guard Service (KCGS) after seven days.\n“Through the utilization of robust Maritime Domain Awareness and strategic engagements with key stakeholders, KCGS confirmed the location of the four missing fishermen,” Bruno Shioso, the Director-General of KCGS said.\nAfter confirming the location of the four missing fishermen, the rescue operation was set in motion.\nThe fishermen were discovered in the High Seas by a foreign fishing vessel, which acted swiftly after the group was swept by strong winds and currents.\n“Unfortunately, one of their colleagues lost his life, presumably to drowning,” he added.\nShioso expressed empathy for the harrowing 27 days the survivors endured, causing anguish and great pain to their families and friends.\nThe successful rescue was a collaborative effort that involved various stakeholders, including the Kenya Defence Forces (KDF), Kenya Navy, National Police Service, County Government of Kilifi, and local Beach Management Units (BMUs).\nShare.\nFacebook\nTwitter\nPinterest\nLinkedIn\nTumblr\nEmail\nDamaris Gatwiri\nDamaris Gatwiri is a digital journalist, driven by a profound passion for technology, health, and fashion.     "https://afloat.ie/safety/coastguard/item/61543-young-fisherman-s-body-recovered-after-extended-search-off-louth": "Young Fisherman's Body Recovered After Extended Search off Louth\nDubarry CrosswordBoats For Sale\nMenu\nHomeHomeSailSailPowerPowerWatersportWatersportPortsPortsSafetySafetyCoastguardCoastguardLifeboatsLifeboatsWater SafetyWater SafetyRescueRescueMarine WarningMarine WarningMCIBMCIBInlandInlandEnvironmentEnvironmentBlogsBlogsResourcesResourcesGalleryGalleryContactContact\nMenu\nIreland's sailing, boating & maritime magazine\nSee All Featured Sections\nSee All Featured Sections\nFeatured Sailing School\nFeatured Clubs\nFeatured Brokers\nFeatured Associations\nFeatured Chandleries\nFeatured Sailmakers\nFeatured Blogs\nYoung Fisherman's Body Recovered After Extended Search off Louth\n14th December 2023\nAfloat.ie Team\nThe Dublin-based Coast Guard helicopter R116, along with Coast Guard units attached to Clogherhead, Greenore and Drogheda and the Clogherhead RNLI lifeboat participated in the search\nCredit: Afloat\nThe body of a young fisherman who had been reported missing after a boat sank off Co Louth earlier this week has been recovered.\nThe young crewman had been one of two crew on board a razor clam boat when it sank north of Dunany Point in Dundalk Bay, Co Louth, early on Tuesday.\nOne man was recovered and was treated in hospital in Drogheda, and a search was mounted for the second man.\nThe man’s body was found by Garda divers early on Thursday close to where the vessel was located.\nThe location was identified after the fishing charity LAST (Lost at Sea Tragedies) sought the assistance of marine survey specialist StatKraft Marine.\nIt provided a vessel equipped with multi-beam sonar to help survey the search area.\nEmergency services had received a Mayday call from the vessel when it began taking in water at around 8.45 am on Tuesday, December 12th.\nCommissioners of Irish Lights vessel Granuaile joined in the search for the missing fisherman\nThe Dublin-based Coast Guard helicopter R116, along with Coast Guard units attached to Clogherhead, Greenore and Drogheda and the Clogherhead RNLI lifeboat participated in the search, along with a number of local vessels and the Commissioners of Irish Lights vessel Granuaile.\nPublished in Coastguard, Fishing\nPublished in\nCoastguard\nTagged under\nFishing\nFisherman\nAbout The Author\nAfloat.ie Team\nEmail The Author\nAfloat.ie is Ireland's dedicated marine journalism team.\nHave you got a story for our reporters? Email us here.\nRead more articles by Afloat.ie Team >\nGet Our Daily Digest\nThe Afloat daily newsletter highlights the best of our editors' picks, as well as the latest content from other popular sections of our website.\nView Previous Editions Here\n* indicates required\nEmail Address *\nFirst Name\nLast Name\nWe will only ever use your details to send you our enews and never pass them onto third parties.\nWe've got a favour to ask\nMore people are reading Afloat.ie than ever thanks to the power of the internet but we're in stormy seas because advertising revenues across the media are falling fast. Unlike many news sites, we haven't put up a paywall because we want to keep our marine journalism open.\nAfloat.ie is Ireland's only full-time marine journalism team and it takes time, money and hard work to produce our content.\nSo you can see why we need to ask for your help.\nIf everyone chipped in, we can enhance our coverage and our future would be more secure. You can help us through a small donation. Thank you.\nYou might also want to read...\nTimmy Dooley Appointed Minister of State for Marine\nNews Update\nIrish MEP Calls for Action Against Overfishing by Norwegian Trawlers\nFishing\nEU Fisheries Commissioner to Visit Ireland Amid Concerns\nFishing\nAfloat.ie Proudly Supported By\nAfloat.ie Proudly Supported By\nFoundation Supporters\nClubs & Associations\nMarine Industry\nThe Irish Coast Guard\nThe Irish Coast Guard is Ireland's fourth 'Blue Light' service (along with An Garda Síochána, the Ambulance Service and the Fire Service). It provides a nationwide maritime emergency organisation as well as a variety of services to shipping and other government agencies.\nThe purpose of the Irish Coast Guard is to promote safety and security standards, and by doing so, prevent as far as possible, the loss of life at sea, and on inland waters, mountains and caves, and to provide effective emergency response services and to safeguard the quality of the marine environment.\nThe Irish Coast Guard has responsibility for Ireland's system of marine communications, surveillance and emergency management in Ireland's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) and certain inland waterways.\nIt is responsible for the response to, and co-ordination of, maritime accidents which require search and rescue and counter-pollution and ship casualty operations. It also has responsibility for vessel traffic monitoring.\nOperations in respect of maritime security, illegal drug trafficking, illegal migration and fisheries enforcement are co-ordinated by other bodies within the Irish Government.\nOn average, each year, the Irish Coast Guard is expected to:\nhandle 3,000 marine emergencies\nassist 4,500 people and save about 200 lives\ntask Coast Guard helicopters on missions\nThe Coast Guard has been around in some form in Ireland since 1908.\nCoast Guard helicopters\nThe Irish Coast Guard has contracted five medium-lift Sikorsky Search and Rescue helicopters deployed at bases in Dublin, Waterford, Shannon and Sligo.\nThe helicopters are designated wheels up from initial notification in 15 minutes during daylight hours and 45 minutes at night. One aircraft is fitted and its crew trained for under slung cargo operations up to 3000kgs and is available on short notice based at Waterford.\nThese aircraft respond to emergencies at sea, inland waterways, offshore islands and mountains of Ireland (32 counties).\nThey can also be used for assistance in flooding, major inland emergencies, intra-hospital transfers, pollution, and aerial surveillance during daylight hours, lifting and passenger operations and other operations as authorised by the Coast Guard within appropriate regulations.\nIrish Coastguard FAQs\nWhat is The Irish Coast Guard?\nThe Irish Coast Guard provides nationwide maritime emergency response, while also promoting safety and security standards. It aims to prevent the loss of life at sea, on inland waters, on mountains and in caves; and to safeguard the quality of the marine environment.\nWhat is its main role of the Irish Coast Guard?\nThe main role of the Irish Coast Guard is to rescue people from danger at sea or on land, to organise immediate medical transport and to assist boats and ships within the country's jurisdiction. It has three marine rescue centres in Dublin, Malin Head, Co Donegal, and Valentia Island, Co Kerry. The Dublin National Maritime Operations centre provides marine search and rescue responses and coordinates the response to marine casualty incidents with the Irish exclusive economic zone (EEZ).\nIs the Irish Coast Guard service 24/7?\nYes, effectively, it is the fourth \"blue light\" service. The Marine Rescue Sub-Centre (MRSC) Valentia is the contact point for the coastal area between Ballycotton, Co Cork and Clifden, Co Galway. At the same time, the MRSC Malin Head covers the area between Clifden and Lough Foyle. Marine Rescue Co-ordination Centre (MRCC) Dublin covers Carlingford Lough, Co Louth to Ballycotton, Co Cork. Each MRCC/MRSC also broadcasts maritime safety information on VHF and MF radio, including navigational and gale warnings, shipping forecasts, local inshore forecasts, strong wind warnings and small craft warnings.\nHow many emergencies does the Irish Coast respond to each year?\nThe Irish Coast Guard handles about 3,000 marine emergencies annually, and assists 4,500 people - saving an estimated 200 lives, according to the Department of Transport. In 2016, Irish Coast Guard helicopters completed 1,000 missions in a single year for the first time.\nDoes it also handle medical emergencies?\nYes, Irish Coast Guard helicopters evacuate medical patients from offshore islands to hospital on average about 100 times a year. In September 2017, the Department of Health announced that search and rescue pilots who work 24-hour duties would not be expected to perform any inter-hospital patient transfers. The Air Corps flies the Emergency Aeromedical Service, established in 2012 and using an AW139 twin-engine helicopter. Known by its call sign \"Air Corps 112\", it airlifted its 3,000th patient in autumn 2020.\nIs the Irish Coast Guard an all-island body?\nThe Irish Coast Guard works closely with the British Maritime and Coastguard Agency, which is responsible for the Northern Irish coast.\nHow much does the Irish Coast Guard cost?\nThe Irish Coast Guard is a State-funded service, with both paid management personnel and volunteers, and is under the auspices of the Department of Transport, Tourism and Sport. It is allocated approximately 74 million euro annually in funding, some 85 per cent of which pays for a helicopter contract that costs 60 million euro annually. The overall funding figure is \"variable\", an Oireachtas committee was told in 2019. Other significant expenditure items include volunteer training exercises, equipment, maintenance, renewal, and information technology.\nWhat resources does the Irish Coast Guard have?\nThe Irish Coast Guard has four search and rescue helicopter bases at Dublin, Waterford, Shannon and Sligo, run on a contract worth 50 million euro annually with an additional 10 million euro in costs by CHC Ireland. It provides five medium-lift Sikorsky S-92 helicopters and trained crew. The 44 Irish Coast Guard coastal units with 1,000 volunteers are classed as onshore search units, with 23 of the 44 units having rigid inflatable boats (RIBs) and 17 units having cliff rescue capability. The Irish Coast Guard has 60 buildings in total around the coast, and units have search vehicles fitted with blue lights, all-terrain vehicles or quads, first aid equipment, generators and area lighting, search equipment, marine radios, pyrotechnics and appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE). The Royal National Lifeboat Institution (RNLI) and Community Rescue Boats Ireland also provide lifeboats and crews to assist in search and rescue. The Irish Coast Guard works closely with the Garda Siochána, National Ambulance Service, Naval Service and Air Corps, Civil Defence, while fishing vessels, ships and other craft at sea offer assistance in search operations.\nHow quickly can Irish Coast Guard assets respond?\nThe helicopters are designated as airborne from initial notification in 15 minutes during daylight hours, and 45 minutes at night. The aircraft respond to emergencies at sea, on inland waterways, offshore islands and mountains and cover the 32 counties. They can also assist in flooding, major inland emergencies, intra-hospital transfers, pollution, and can transport offshore firefighters and ambulance teams. The Irish Coast Guard volunteers units are expected to achieve a 90 per cent response time of departing from the station house in ten minutes from notification during daylight and 20 minutes at night. They are also expected to achieve a 90 per cent response time to the scene of the incident in less than 60 minutes from notification by day and 75 minutes at night, subject to geographical limitations.\nHow are Irish Coast Guard units managed?\nUnits are managed by an officer-in-charge (three stripes on the uniform) and a deputy officer in charge (two stripes). Each team is trained in search skills, first aid, setting up helicopter landing sites and a range of maritime skills, while certain units are also trained in cliff rescue.\nAre Irish Coast Guard volunteers paid?\nVolunteers receive an allowance for time spent on exercises and call-outs. What is the difference between the Irish Coast Guard and the RNLI? The RNLI is a registered charity which has been saving lives at sea since 1824, and runs a 24/7 volunteer lifeboat service around the British and Irish coasts. It is a declared asset of the British Maritime and Coast Guard Agency and the Irish Coast Guard. Community Rescue Boats Ireland is a community rescue network of volunteers under the auspices of Water Safety Ireland.\nDoes the Irish Coast Guard charge for rescue?\nNo, it does not charge for rescue and nor do the RNLI or Community Rescue Boats Ireland.\nWhat communications systems do the Irish Coast Guard use?\nThe marine rescue centres maintain 19 VHF voice and DSC radio sites around the Irish coastline and a digital paging system. There are two VHF repeater test sites, four MF radio sites and two NAVTEX transmitter sites. Does Ireland have a national search and rescue plan? The first national search and rescue plan was published in July, 2019. It establishes the national framework for the overall development, deployment and improvement of search and rescue services within the Irish Search and Rescue Region and to meet domestic and international commitments. The purpose of the national search and rescue plan is to promote a planned and nationally coordinated search and rescue response to persons in distress at sea, in the air or on land.\nIs the Irish Coast Guard responsible for pollution response?\nYes, the Irish Coast Guard is responsible for responding to spills of oil and other hazardous substances with the Irish pollution responsibility zone, along with providing an effective response to marine casualties and monitoring or intervening in marine salvage operations. It provides and maintains a 24-hour marine pollution notification at the three marine rescue centres. It coordinates exercises and tests of national and local pollution response plans.\nWhat is the Irish Coast Guard's safety record?\nThe first Irish Coast Guard volunteer to die on duty was Caitriona Lucas, a highly trained member of the Doolin Coast Guard unit, while assisting in a search for a missing man by the Kilkee unit in September 2016. Six months later, four Irish Coast Guard helicopter crew – Dara Fitzpatrick, Mark Duffy, Paul Ormsby and Ciarán Smith -died when their Sikorsky S-92 struck Blackrock island off the Mayo coast on March 14, 2017. The Dublin-based Rescue 116 crew were providing \"top cover\" or communications for a medical emergency off the west coast and had been approaching Blacksod to refuel. Up until the five fatalities, the Irish Coast Guard recorded that more than a million \"man hours\" had been spent on more than 30,000 rescue missions since 1991.\nWhat was the Government response to the Coast Guard fatalities?\nSeveral investigations were initiated into each incident. The Marine Casualty Investigation Board was critical of the Irish Coast Guard in its final report into the death of Caitriona Lucas, while a separate Health and Safety Authority investigation has been completed, but not published. The Air Accident Investigation Unit final report into the Rescue 116 helicopter crash has not yet been published.\nWhen was The Irish Coast Guard formed?\nThe Irish Coast Guard in its present form dates back to 1991, when the Irish Marine Emergency Service was formed after a campaign initiated by Dr Joan McGinley to improve air/sea rescue services on the west Irish coast. Before Irish independence, the British Admiralty was responsible for a Coast Guard (formerly the Water Guard or Preventative Boat Service) dating back to 1809. The West Coast Search and Rescue Action Committee was initiated with a public meeting in Killybegs, Co Donegal, in 1988 and the group was so effective that a Government report was commissioned, which recommended setting up a new division of the Department of the Marine to run the Marine Rescue Co-Ordination Centre (MRCC), then based at Shannon, along with the existing coast radio service, and coast and cliff rescue. A medium-range helicopter base was established at Shannon within two years. Initially, the base was served by the Air Corps.\nWho was The Irish Coast Guard's first director?\nThe first director of what was then IMES was Capt Liam Kirwan, who had spent 20 years at sea and latterly worked with the Marine Survey Office. Capt Kirwan transformed a poorly funded voluntary coast and cliff rescue service into a trained network of cliff and sea rescue units – largely voluntary, but with paid management. The MRCC was relocated from Shannon to an IMES headquarters at the then Department of the Marine (now Department of Transport) in Leeson Lane, Dublin. The coast radio stations at Valentia, Co Kerry, and Malin Head, Co Donegal, became marine rescue-sub-centres.\nWho is The Irish Coast Guard's current director?\nThe current director is Chris Reynolds, who has been in place since August 2007 and was formerly with the Naval Service. He has been seconded to the head of mission with the EUCAP Somalia - which has a mandate to enhance Somalia's maritime civilian law enforcement capacity – since January 2019.\nWhere are Coast Guard Units located in Ireland?\nAchill, Co. Mayo\nArdmore, Co. Waterford\nArklow, Co. Wicklow\nBallybunion, Co. Kerry\nBallycotton, Co. Cork\nBallyglass, Co. Mayo\nBonmahon, Co. Waterford\nBunbeg, Co. Donegal\nCarnsore, Co.     "https://antiguaobserver.com/community-mourns-drowning-of-fisherman/": "Community mourns drowning of fisherman - Antigua Observer Newspaper\nFacebook\nInstagram\nTwitter\nYoutube\nHome\nLocal\nRegional\nInternational\nToday’s Daily Observer\n#beyou\nLatest Stories\nSports\nRadio\nObserver Radio\nHitz FM 91.9\nEditorials\nContact Us\nAbout Us\nSearch\nHome  The Big Stories  Community mourns drowning of fisherman\nThe Big Stories\nCommunity mourns drowning of fisherman\n13 June 2022 0 1989\nDeceased, Courtney Charles. (social media photo) FacebookTwitterPinterestWhatsAppReddItEmailPrint\nBy Makeida Antonio[email protected]A close-knit community was plunged into mourning following the devasting news of a drowning yesterday.According to Police Spokesperson Inspector Frankie Thomas, a multi-pronged search effort by the Royal Police Force of Antigua and Barbuda, the Antigua and Barbuda Defence Force (ABDF) Coast Guard and the Antigua and Barbuda Search and Rescue was launched to locate a fisherman who reportedly fell in the waters near Shirley Heights while fishing.Police received the report of the incident around 7:00 am.Tragically, the man identified as 51-year-old Courtney Charles, was found dead a couple of hours later by the ABDF Coast Guard, approximately 9:30 am.Thomas said that further investigations are ongoing.Meanwhile, an outpouring of fond memories and sorrow filled the timelines of many social media users in the wake of losing Charles, also known as ‘Zyie’, a beloved member of Liberta village.A woman who claimed to be Charles’ sister, recounted his recent 51st birthday celebration and shared her hope for the family to come to terms with the tragic event and live on with his memory in their hearts.“I lost one of my brothers today, Courtney Winston Charles better known as Zyie.  He just celebrated his 51st Birthday on the 6th June 2022, along with his son, my nephew Keyon Charles. God said…find comfort in his words, and today, Lord, grant us as a family the courage to accept what has happened and be comforted in the memories and fond moments we’ve shared.”Charles’ son, Keyon Charles, also shared a message on his social media page on the passing of his father. “Yeah Papa. You left me heart a hurt ya now. I’ll try to hold the faith and carry on. IMMA MISS YOU PAPA.”Member of Parliament for St. Paul, E.P. Chet Greene, sent his condolences to Charles’ family members.“I extend my condolences to Yvonne, Namba, Valerie, St. Elma and the rest of the family and friends on the tragic and untimely passing of Zyie earlier this morning.”Other social media contributors referred to Charles as their friend and a “sweet soul,” and they expressed shock at his passing, right after celebrating his birthday.One friend told of the last time that they spoke to each other.“Me can’t believe this; just the other day you pass and say, ‘Love-sponge, me long for see you’ and we making jokes. Never think that would be the last ‘Love-sponge’ I would hear.”\nFacebookTwitterPinterestWhatsAppReddItEmailPrint\nPrevious article‘We are monitoring this disease closely’, says Tourism MinisterNext articleAstaphan: JCPC decision paves way for Barbuda land ownership Michael\nRELATED ARTICLES\nFamilies of four unclaimed bodies urged to make burial arrangements within...\njennelsa.johnson -  30 January 2025\nCUB continues to support MoE’s Inter-Secondary School Debate Series and Impromptu...\njennelsa.johnson -  30 January 2025\nPassport fraud case committed to the High Court again\njennelsa.johnson -  30 January 2025\nNO COMMENTS\nLEAVE A REPLY Cancel reply\nPlease enter your comment!\nPlease enter your name here\nYou have entered an incorrect email address!\nPlease enter your email address here\nSave my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment.\nPlease enter an answer in digits:five × 1 =\nABOUT USFOLLOW US\nFacebook\nInstagram\nTwitter\nYoutube\n© Newsco Ltd. 2022",

Nigeria\nHome\nNews\nPolitics\nMetro\nSport\nEntertainment\nOpinion\nEducation\nHealth\nInterview\nDaily Post Ghana\nConnect with us\nDaily Post Nigeria\nOne fisherman killed, 4 others abducted off Bayelsa coast\nHome\nNews\nPolitics\nMetro\nEntertainment\nSport\nMetro\nOne fisherman killed, 4 others abducted off Bayelsa coast\nPublished on December 4, 2023\nBy Matthew Atungwu\nGunmen suspected to be sea pirates have ambushed some fishermen off the Atlantic coast of Brass in Brass Local Government Area of Bayelsa State, killing one and kidnapping four others.\nThe gunmen also took their victims’ engines and fishing gear.\nThe incident reportedly occurred over the weekend in a coastal hamlet populated by fishermen.\nTwo of the fishermen were injured during the incident, according to sources but one died before receiving medical assistance.\nThe gunmen kidnapped four more people.\nMuhammed Musa, Spokesman for the Bayelsa State Police Command, said he had yet to be briefed on the incident.\nMeanwhile, Hanson Alabo-Karika, the Chairman of Brass Local Government Council, has condemned the attack and kidnapping of the fishermen.\nAlabo-Karika said the unjustified and inhumane conduct that killed one person should not go unpunished, urging security officers to investigate, arrest, and convict everyone engaged in the crime as soon as possible.\nHe stated that misguided people would not be allowed to disrupt the council’s current calm, which is the result of purposeful tactics implemented by Governor Douye Diri-led administration.\nRelated Topics:bayelsa\nUp
