    "https://nilepost.co.ug/news/195853/fisherman-drowns-in-lake-kyoga": "Fisherman drowns in Lake Kyoga\nNews\n2026 Election Watch\nSecurity\nClimate Change\nEducation\nExclusive\nInvestigations\nBusiness\nEducation\nHealth\nCoronavirus outbreak\nCrime\nPolitics\nOpinions\nColumns\nSports\n#Dismis\nlogin\nNews\n2026 Election Watch\nSecurity\nClimate Change\nEducation\nExclusive\nInvestigations\nBusiness\nEducation\nHealth\nCoronavirus outbreak\nCrime\nPolitics\nOpinions\nColumns\nSports\n#Dismis\nlogin\n-->\nFisherman drowns in Lake Kyoga\nNews\n-->\nA man drowning.\nTUE 16 APR, 2024 14:21\nBy\nKenneth Kazibwe\nTags:\nLake Kyoga\nuganda\nUgandan News\nBy Eddy Enuru.\nA 42-year-old man on Monday evening drowned in Lake Kyoga, local leaders and police have confirmed.\nKeep Reading\n>\nMuseveni, EAC leaders call for “immediate” ceasefire in DRC\n>\nUse prevailing peace to create wealth- Museveni tells Lango\n>\nCartel sells 22,000 Ugandans passports to criminals abroad\n>\nIGP Byakagaba touts subcounty model to improve response time as new security plan takes shape\nSam Omongole, a resident of Aguli Cell, Akwanget Ward, Kagwara Town Council, was out fishing at the Akwanget landing site when the unfortunate incident happened.\nAccording to Bernard Odikor, the LC3 chairperson of Kagwara Town Council, Omongole ventured into the annex murky waters of Akwanget landing site to fish on Monday.\nHowever, he was ensnared by strong winds that struck his boat, leading to his drowning.\n\" Omongole's absence from home since Monday morning prompted his family members to report his disappearance to the LC1 office.\nA search operation, spearheaded by residents and fellow fishermen, commenced immediately, culminating in the discovery of Omongole's lifeless body along the shores of Lake Kyoga on Tuesday morning,\"Odikor said.\nThe tragic incident serves as a stark reminder of the perils faced by fishermen, particularly in the face of adverse weather conditions. Odikor emphasized that the absence of life-saving vests and the use of dilapidated boats exacerbate the risks associated with fishing in Lake Kyoga.\nOmongole leaves behind a grieving family, including his wife, who has been grappling with mental health issues for the past two years, and their five children. One of his daughters is currently pursuing her studies at Halcyon High School, Serere Campus.\nJohn Jimmy Ameu, the OC Kagwara Police Marine, issued a stern warning to fishermen against engaging in illegal fishing practices and using substandard boats.\n\"I emphasize the importance of adhering to safety regulations to prevent further tragedies on the lake.\"\nAs the community mourns the loss of Sam Omongole, the Kagwara Police Marine unit has handed over his body to relatives for burial arrangements, marking the end of a promising life cut short by a tragic accident on Lake Kyoga.\nReader's Comments\nVIDEO OF THE DAY\nOver supply and lack of market for cassava is creating miseries for cassava farmers in Teso\nBy Edward Kafufu Baliddawa 7 months ago\nPOPULAR THIS WEEK\nNews .     "https://www.graphic.com.gh/news/general-news/ada-search-for-missing-fisherman-suspended.html": "Ada: Search for 2 missing fishermen suspended, one more body found at Anloga - Graphic Online\nSubscribe\nGRAPHIC ONLINE\nHomeNewsShowbizPolitics SportsLifestyle BusinessBusiness NewsCompaniesMarketsOpinionAuto News VideosJobs & VacanciesAfricaInternational NewsAunty BettyJunior NewsTell Us WhyDid You KnowI'll Tell My StoryFeaturesFeaturesOpinionNative DaughterElizabeth OheneReality ZoneGhana RegionsAccraBrong Ahafo Region NewsCentral Region - NewsEastern Regional - NewsNorthern Regional - NewsUpper East Regional - NewsUpper West Region - NewsVolta Region NewsWestern Region - News\nTop Sections\nElection 2024Today's HeadlinesJobs & VacanciesDaily Graphic EditorialsThe MirrorEntertainment NewsGhana Sports NewsGhana Business NewsGhana PoliticsGeneral NewsTelecomsEducation NewsOpinionsFeatured ArticlesGraphic ColumnistsRecommended\nPrevious article: Women in Ghana paid 34.2 per cent less than men\nBack to: Prev\nNext article: Accra: CMB dawn fire destroys about 350 wooden structures\nNext\nAda: Search for 2 missing fishermen suspended, one more body found at Anloga\nBenjamin Xornam Glover\nSep - 17 - 2023 , 09:42\n2 minutes read\nThe search for two missing fishermen in last Thursday's canoe disaster at Ada has been suspended.\nOut of the 19 fishermen who were involved in the accident, 17 have been found, 15 alive and two dead.\nTwo of them are still missing.\nThe Ghana Navy and the National Disaster Management Organisation (NADMO) on Saturday evening ended the search for  the two missing fishermen.\nThey fishermen went missing on Thursday after strong waves capsized two fishing canoes around the estuary at Azizanya in Ada.\nThe search and rescue mission on Saturday evening announced the end of the search efforts, three days after the canoes capsized.\nAnother body found\nOne more body was recovered Saturday morning. The body was found at Anloga in the Volta Region and has been handed over to the family in Ada for immediate burial due to its decomposing state.\nOf the 19 fishermen who were involved in the accident, 17 have been found, 15 alive and two dead.\nThe Public Relations Officer of the Ada East NADMO office, Ebenezer Dan-Doe speaking to journalists on Saturday, [Sept 16, 2023] said the team had decided to call off the search after three straight days of search.\nHe, however appealed to communities along the coast to be on the look out and alert the security agencies should they sight anything.\nMr Dan-Doe also advised fishermen and residents particularly those living close to water bodies to prioritise the use of life jackets to help reduce disasters on the water bodies in the area.\nRelated articles\nAda canoe disaster: 4 fishers found, 3 alive7 Fishermen missing at Ada\nWriter's email: [email protected]\nWhat Others Are Reading\nTrending Ghana News\nEnergy Minister     "https://www.graphic.com.gh/news/general-news/fishing-vessel-sinks-between-elmina-and-sekondi-captain-s-body-found-another-person-missing.html": "Fishing vessel sinks between Elmina and Sekondi, Captain’s body found, 11 missing - Graphic Online\nSubscribe\nGRAPHIC ONLINE\nHomeNewsShowbizPolitics SportsLifestyle BusinessBusiness NewsCompaniesMarketsOpinionAuto News VideosJobs & VacanciesAfricaInternational NewsAunty BettyJunior NewsTell Us WhyDid You KnowI'll Tell My StoryFeaturesFeaturesOpinionNative DaughterElizabeth OheneReality ZoneGhana RegionsAccraBrong Ahafo Region NewsCentral Region - NewsEastern Regional - NewsNorthern Regional - NewsUpper East Regional - NewsUpper West Region - NewsVolta Region NewsWestern Region - News\nTop Sections\nElection 2024Today's HeadlinesJobs & VacanciesDaily Graphic EditorialsThe MirrorEntertainment NewsGhana Sports NewsGhana Business NewsGhana PoliticsGeneral NewsTelecomsEducation NewsOpinionsFeatured ArticlesGraphic ColumnistsRecommended\nPrevious article: How Asantehene rounded off activities marking 44th Memphis in May festival\nBack to: Prev\nNext article: KNUST advances research in Artificial Intelligence\nNext\nFishing vessel sinks between Elmina and Sekondi, Captain’s body found, another person missing\nFishing vessel sinks between Elmina and Sekondi, Captain’s body found, 11 missing\nGraphic.com.gh\nMay - 08 - 2022 , 16:05\n2 minutes read\nThe body of the captain of a fishing vessel that sunk between Elmina and Sekondi-Takoradi has been retrieved.\nFifteen persons who were onboard the vessel including four Chinese nationals and 11 Ghanaians have been rescued by the Ghana Navy and have been taken ashore.\nHowever, 11 other persons, including the observer from Fisheries Commission who were onboard are missing.\nThe vessel, MV Comforter said to be of the size of about a 50-seater bus sunk between the sea waters of Elmina and Sekondi-Takoradi.\nReports indicate 26 persons were on board. They were five Chinese nationals and 20 Ghanaians.\nThe 11 persons missing at sea are all Ghanaians reports Graphic Online's Shirley Asiedu Addo from Cape Coast.\nThe vessel reportedly sunk in the early hours of Saturday (May 7, 2022) with all the crew on board.\nSome of them were able to swim to a nearby vessel, with the name Menghxin 6.\nThe crew was hauling a net that had so much fish in it.\nThe crew, it is reported had some difficulty pulling the net full of fish to the vessel.\nAround that same time, it was raining heavily with with thunderstorms.\nThe vessel, according to the survivors, could not sustain the balance on one side and sunk with all the crew on board.\nThe rescue mission began with the nearby vessel, Menghxin 6, and the Ghana Navy later joined.\nThe Navy has been combing the incident area and is still on a search of other survivors.\nSo far, the body of the captain of the vessel has been recovered but the observer on board the vessel is yet to be found.\nWhat Others Are Reading\nTrending Ghana News\nEnergy Minister inaugurates Committee to investigate ECG’s uncleared containers\n2024 withheld WASSCE results: WAEC dismisses claims of coercing VoiceIsolezweDFABusiness ReportPersonal FinanceSubscribeCapetimesNewsPolice divers search for missing fisherman after boat capsizes off Kommetjie, killing 1The search continues for a missing fisherman after an inflatable boat carrying three people capsized near Kommetjie. Picture: Armand Hough/African News Agency (ANA)Published Oct 13, 2023 | Published Oct 13, 2023ShareThe search continues for a missing fisherman after an inflatable boat carrying three people capsized near Kommetjie on Thursday, killing one of them.NSRI Kommetjie station commander Dave Smith said duty crew were alerted after 8am to reports of a rigid hull inflatable boat (RHIB) with motor mechanical failure.“It was reported, from Soetwater Resort security, of a fisherman who had approached them to raise the alarm for two of his fellow fishermen missing at sea and reporting his RHIB capsized near to Slangkop Lighthouse, Kommetjie.“Soetwater Resort security cared for the man while the alarm was raised,” Smith said.NSRI Kommetjie rescue swimmers responded and found the RHIB washed onto rocks.One man was found dead on the scene and a search commenced for another missing fisherman.“The survivor was treated on the scene by paramedics and in a stable condition. He was reunited with family members at the scene.“It appears that the survivor had managed to reach the shore after their boat had capsized in the early hours of the morning,” Smith said.NSRI rescue swimmers were deployed into the surf to conduct free-dive sweeping line search efforts while the Metro EMS rescue drone was deployed and conducted an aerial search.“An extensive air, sea and shoreline search has revealed no signs of the missing man.“Police divers are continuing in an ongoing search effort for the missing man,” Smith said.Cape TimesRelated Topics:nsrisapswestern capecape townsafetyYou may likeEskom reports a turnaround at its half year stage, with a R17.83 billion profit despite many challengesBy Edward WestNersa grants Eskom a 12.7% tariff increase ahead of winter seasonBy Ashley LechmanSA Reserve Bank cuts interest rates by 0.25%By Ashley LechmanRead nextEskom faces scrutiny over Auditor-General's dismal findingsBy Banele GinindzaIndependent Online, popularly known as IOL, is one of South Africa’s leading news and information websites bringing millions of readers breaking news and updates on Politics, Current Affairs, Business, Lifestyle, Entertainment, Travel, Sport, Motoring and Technology. StarPretoria NewsSaturday StarSunday IndependentWestern CapeCape ArgusWeekend ArgusCape TimesKwaZulu NatalDaily NewsThe MercuryThe Independent on SaturdaySunday TribuneThe PostDaily VoiceIsolezweDFABusiness ReportPersonal FinanceSubscribeCapetimesNewsSearch initiated for two local fishermen missing in Gordon’s BayThe search continues for two local fishermen after their boat was found washed up between Gordon’s Bay and the Steenbras River Mouth. Picture: Tracey Adams/ANAPublished Feb 21, 2023 | Published Feb 21, 2023ShareCape Town - Police have launched an investigation into two missing fishermen after their boat was found washed up in a crevice along the rocky shoreline between Gordon’s Bay and the Steenbras River Mouth.The National Sea Rescue Institute (NSRI) said the two men, aged 54 and 40, were locals. They had been fishing off-shore of Die Poort, Strand, and were reported missing to the NSRI.“At 8:44am, Monday, 20 February, NSRI Gordon’s Bay, NSRI Kleinmond, NSRI Strandfontein and NSRI Simon’s Town were activated.“Four NSRI rescue craft and an AGA helicopter launched an air and sea search while NSRI rescue vehicles conducted shoreline patrols between Kleinmond and Macassar in the extensive search.“An all-ships alert was posted by Telkom Maritime Radio Services, and they assisted in marine VHF radio communications.“During the search, the small boat was located broken up and washed up into a crevice along the rocky shoreline between Gordon's Bay and the Steenbras River Mouth.“There remains no sign of the two missing men.“The SA Police Services have launched an investigation, and a search for the missing men is ongoing.“Thoughts are with the families of the missing men in this difficult time,” the NSRI said. Separately, the search also continues for a 29-year-old who was swept away in a rip current in uMhlanga, KwaZulu-Natal, on Monday.The NSRI said the KZN Surf Rescue Network received reports of a drowning in progress when three locals, aged 29, 18 and 17, were in shallow surf when the eldest became swept away by strong rip currents.“An extensive search has revealed no sign of the missing man.“The SA Police Services are investigating, and Police Search and Rescue are tasked to continue in an ongoing search.“All services in the area are keeping a vigil.“Thoughts are with the family of the missing man in this difficult time,” the NSRI said.Cape Times Related Topics:nsricape townmissing personsbeachesYou may likeEskom reports a turnaround at its half year stage, with a R17.83 billion profit despite many challengesBy Edward WestNersa grants Eskom a 12.7% tariff increase ahead of winter seasonBy Ashley LechmanSA Reserve Bank cuts interest rates by 0.25%By Ashley LechmanRead nextEskom faces scrutiny over Auditor-General's dismal findingsBy Banele GinindzaIndependent Online, popularly known as IOL, is one of South Africa’s leading news and information websites bringing millions of readers breaking news and updates on Politics, Current Affairs, Business, Lifestyle, Entertainment, Travel, Sport, Motoring and Technology. in the Bay\nA-MAY-Zing Kids\nArt\nBAE\nBeauty\nContests\nCommunity\nLITB Dance\nDIY\nFamily\nFashion\nFood\nHappening\nHappy Hour\nHealth\nHome\nKids\nLIVE! in the Bay ‘viewers’ voice\nMoneyWise\nMusic\nPeople\nPets\nRead\nShop\nLITB Sports\nTheater\nTravel\nTrending\nBe on the Show\nAbout Us\nAbout Us\nKRON4-TV apps\nNewsletters\nReport It!\nLinks seen on KRON4\nMeet the Team\nContact Us\nRegional News Partners\nWork For Us\nAdvertise With Us\nClosed Captioning Contact Information\nDo Not Sell My Personal Information\nAbout BestReviews\nMarketplace\nEpic Discounts\nEmployer Highlights\nSearch\nPlease enter a search term.\nBay Area\n1 person found dead on crashed fishing boat at Point Reyes\nby: Hamza Fahmy\nPosted: Mar 29, 2024 / 03:32 PM PDT\nUpdated: Mar 29, 2024 / 06:28 PM PDT\nby: Hamza Fahmy\nPosted: Mar 29, 2024 / 03:32 PM PDT\nUpdated: Mar 29, 2024 / 06:28 PM PDT\nSHARE\n(KRON) — A person was found dead in a crashed fishing boat found by the Sonoma County Sheriff’s Office Helicopter Unit (Henry-1) on Thursday.\nAt around 4:30 p.m., Henry-1 responded to calls of a boat that crashed into the rocky shoreline near Chimney Rock in Point Reyes.\nPhoto Credit: Office of Spill Prevention and Response\nA rescue swimmer from the U.S. Coast Guard was deployed and located a person in the boat. However, the swimmer was unable to access the cabin without breaching equipment, the sheriff’s office said.\nThe Henry-1 crew then retrieved a paramedic from the Marin County Fire Department and was tasked with a 100-foot-long line rescue (video attached). According to the sheriff’s office, the boat “was resting on rocks and being battered by the incoming waves, causing it to list to the side.”\nBoth a tactical flight officer and the paramedic were inserted into the boat with breaching tools. Once the crew gained access, they determined the person inside the boat to be deceased.\nThe body was turned over to the Marin County Coroner’s Office, which will be investigating the death. The subject’s identity is being withheld pending the notification of their next of kin.\n“We would like to send our condolences to the subject’s family during this difficult time,” the sheriff’s office said.\nAccording to the Office of Spill Prevention and Response, the fishing boat’s diesel capacity was reported at about 400 gallons. It is unknown at this time if any product has been leaked.\nOSPR is coordinating with the U.S. Coast Guard Pacific Southwest, NOAA’s Greater Farallones and Cordell Bank National Marine Sanctuaries, National Park Service, and the Marin County Government to assess the vessel’s status and potential pollution onboard.\nThere have been no observed impacts to wildlife at this time, OSPR said. The investigation is ongoing into the cause of the crash.\nStay tuned to KRON4 for more updates.\nCopyright 2025 Nexstar Media Inc. All rights reserved.     "https://www.mizzima.com/article/three-myanmar-fishermen-suffocate-fishing-boat-pattani-thailand": "Three Myanmar fishermen suffocate on fishing boat in Pattani, Thailand | Mizzima Myanmar News and Insight\nSkip to main content\nSearch form\nSearch\nSearch form\nSearch\nTV App GooglePlay iOS Arakan Yoma Mizzima Weekly Tv Myanmar Donate NOW\nMizzima Myanmar News and Insight\nYou are viewing the old site.\nPlease update your bookmark to https://eng.mizzima.com.\nHomeNewsDomesticMultimediaRegionalInternationalFeaturesOpinionBusinessDomesticInternationalFeaturesOpinionLifestyleNewsFeaturesReviewsDevelopmentNewsFeaturesOpinionPolicy DialogueElection 2015Election NewsYouth & ElectionsWomen & ElectionsElection FeaturesElection LiveElection 2020Election NewsYouth & ElectionsWomen & ElectionsElection FeaturesElection Gallery\nSearch form\nSearch\nMizzima Weekly Magazine Issue...\nLatest News\n14 December 2023\nNew UK Burma sanctions welcome...\nLatest News\n13 December 2023\nSpring Revolution Daily News f...\nLatest News\n13 December 2023\nSpring Revolution Daily News f...\nLatest News\n12 December 2023\nSpring Revolution Daily News f...\nLatest News\n11 December 2023\nSpring Revolution Daily News f...\nLatest News\n08 December 2023\nSpring Revolution Daily News f...\nLatest News\n07 December 2023\nDiaspora journalists increasin...\nLatest News\n07 December 2023\nFake medicine worth $7 million seized across Asia: Interpol\nThree Myanmar fishermen suffocate on fishing boat in Pattani, Thailand\nNews Domestic\nBy Mizzima\n04 April 2022\nThree Myanmar fishermen suffocate on fishing boat in Pattani, Thailand\nThree Myanmar fishermen suffocated in the fishing boat they were on in southern Thailand’s Pattani, on 31 March, according to the Migrant Workers Rights Network.\nAfter fishing at sea for about 10 days the three Myanmar fishermen died due to a lack of oxygen.\n“The liquid from the rotten fish in the boat storage was not extracted properly. They did not have any ice and salt for the fish, so the smell of the rotten fish was too strong. The three fishermen died from suffocation due to a shortage of oxygen and an inadequate fan cooling system”, an expert from Myeik Township said.\nThe three fishermen are Maung San Hla (Ngepyatchay), Nyi Nyi, and Kyaw Win Maung from Laynyin Taung village in Mrauk-U Township, Rakhine State. They were cremated at the WatlanNote Monastery in Pattani on 3 and 4 April.\nThe fishermen’s families have been told that they are entitled to 1,080,000 baht compensation for each death from the Thai Social Security Department.\nTo receive the compensation the families will have to contact the Migrant Workers Rights Network and ask them to help, according to the source.\nTags\nMyanmar fishermenMigrant Workers Rights NetworkMyanmar migrant workers in Thailand\nMizzima - Myanmar News - English Edition\nNEWSLETTER SUBSCRIPTION\n*\nAbout\nAbout UsMission StatementCode of EthicsContact UsAdvertise with us\nContact\nwww.mizzima.com\nwww.mizzimaburmese.com\nwww.mizzimaweekly.com\n[email protected]\n[email protected]\n+95 1 295398\n+95 9421010111\nclose",
    "https://www.modernghana.com/news/1280196/missing-fisheries-observer-found-decapitated-after.html": "Missing fisheries observer found decapitated after disappearing on tuna vessel\nHome\nRadio\nTV\nPodcasts\nGames\nVideos\nMovies\nAdvertise\nGhana\nContact\nLogin\nNEWS\nSPORTS\nBUSINESS\nPOLITICS\nOPINIONS\nHEALTH\nAFRICA\nWORLD\nENTERTAINMENT\nLIFESTYLE\nSCIENCE\nTECHNOLOGY\nNOLLYWOOD\nMEDIA\nMEMBERS\nArchive\nMore\nHeadlines\nDiaspora\nOnAIR\nSearch\nMissing fisheries observer found decapitated after disappearing on tuna vessel\nFri, 15 Dec 2023\nHeadlines\nFRI, 15 DEC 2023\nThe decapitated body of Ghanaian fisheries observer Samuel Abayitey has been discovered a month after his disappearance aboard tuna vessel “Marine 707” stationed at Tema Harbour.Details surrounding his death remain unclear, prompting calls for a thorough investigation from his family.A brother of the deceased, Emmanuel Eugene Dorpumor told Citi News that the decapitated body of Samuel Abayitey was found on Saturday, December 9.“We received information last month that they woke up around 1 am and they were looking for him inside the ship but they couldn’t find him. His colleagues said they were chatting with him in the evening and that they were with him inside the ship but they couldn’t find him when they woke up around 1 am. They said they searched everywhere on the ship but they couldn’t find him.On December 9th, Abayitey’s body was discovered washed ashore near Tema. While the head was missing, Dorpumor identified the remains as his brother.“Last Saturday, we went to the seashore in the evening and found him dead. We were able to identify the body and so the police from Tema came for the body and so the body is now with the police. His head was not there when we found him but since he is our brother, we knew he was the one.”The brother appealed to the Ghana Police Service to thoroughly investigate the death to unravel the truth. Also, he called on lawyers to come on board to represent the family and get justice.“When the thing happened, they arrested some of the workers but they have been released and gone back to the sea and so as a family, we need lawyers to come in to help because it is a serious thing for us because we all know how to swim because we are from a coastal area and so his death is very serious to us.”—citinewsroom\nFollow our WhatsApp channel for meaningful stories picked for your day.\nComments\nHouse for sale at Kumasi\n5 bedrooms House for sale at Kumasi (Atwima Boko)\nAdvertise here\nTop Stories\n3 hours ago\n‘I’ll serve Ghana’ – Prof. Gyampo assures after appointment to Ghana Shippers Au...\n3 hours ago\nEnding galamsey requires deeper collaboration among ministries — Murtala\n3 hours ago\nMinistry of Environment should take lead in galamsey fight, not Lands Ministry —...\n3 hours ago\nCooperate with us to expedite action on upheld 2024 WASSCE results — WAEC to par...\n4 hours ago\n‘I’ll serve Ghana, remain true to myself’ — Prof. Gyampo on GSA CEO appointment\n4 hours ago\nThere’s no neutrality in helping to right the wrongs of the nation — Prof. Gyamp...\n4 hours ago\nSomeone may have used inflated free SHS beneficiary numbers for other purposes —...\n4 hours ago\nBan on plastic bags: We must look at the alternative before thinking about an ou...\n4 hours ago\nEnvironmental Protection Agency transitions to Authority\n4 hours ago\nEngage investors who will create real impact jobs, not gov’t propaganda jobs lik...\nJust in....\nVetting: 'I’ll reintroduce anti-LGBTQ bill; Click below to renew.\nRenew subscription\nMaybe later\nSubscribe for  a month to get full access\nPrime\nResidents in fear after hippos maul three Buikwe fishermen to death\nSunday, April 14, 2024\nA passenger boat setting from Katosi landing site in neigbouring  Mukono District on July 5,2023. PHOTO/ DANIEL M SSENFUMA\nBy\nDenis Ssebwami\nCorrespondent\nDaily Monitor\nWhat you need to know:\nUWA spokesperson, Mr Bashir Hangi said the affected residents have not officially alerted them.Conservationists say hippos are Africa’s most dangerous large game animals, and they kill more people every year than other predators like crocodiles and lions.\nThank you for reading Nation.Africa\nShow plans\nResidents alongside the shores of Lake Victoria in Buikwe District are living in fear after hippopotamuses invaded the area and killed three fishermen.Asuman Nsekere, Ssebwalunyu Kizito and William Kaayi, a resident of Lugonjo Village Ngowe Sub County were killed in two separate attacks in one week.Kaayi and Kizito were mauled on March 26 while fishing at night while Nsekere was attacked on April 5 at around 4pm. Residents of Namaziina and Lugonjo villages are now living in fear following the attacks.\nMr Julius Mukusike, the vice chairperson Beach Management Unity Namaziina Landing site said one of the hippos moves with her calves and becomes more aggressive whenever it sees a human being. “It[hippo]  becomes more aggressive when it sees people and you would be lucky to survive if you are its target,” he said.Mr Juma Kasozi, a fisherman at Namaziina landing site said the hippos attack their boats during day and night  which has forced them to suspend fishing activities.\nHe appealed to the Uganda Wild life Authority (UWA) to help trap the animals to safeguard the lives of residents.“Hippos have put us on tenterhooks and we have run out of ideas because they attack everybody who moves near the lake shores. We call upon UWA to swiftly intervene,” he said.\nRelated\nIslanders accuse govt of neglect as hippos kill 57 in 2 years\nNational\nJul 20, 2022\nUWA spokesperson, Mr Bashir Hangi said the affected residents have not officially alerted them.He advised them to be vigilant as they prepare to send their Problem Animal Capture team to the area.\"I am getting that information for the first time but if it's true, let them be vigilant as we prepare to send our technical team to capture the animals,” he said.\nAccording to him, residents who stay near the lake shoresshould avoid using the affected areas as gardens because hippos tend to get closer to the shores to nurse their newborns.“I advise those residents to stay away from the 100-metre reserves from the lake shores. With this, the hippos will be controlled from attacking their homesteads and destroying crops,” he said.\nConservationists say hippos are Africa’s most dangerous large game animals, and they kill more people every year than other predators like crocodiles and lions.For several years, stray hippos have attacked communities along the lake shores.\nIn August 2018, seven people were killed by hippos in their gardens on Bussi Island, Wakiso District.In September, the same year, hippos killed one person in Bussi and in the same month, two fishermen drowned in the water after their boat was crashed by the hippos .\nRegister to continue reading this premium article\nYes, please!\nYou already have an account?\nLog in\nRegister to begin your journey to our premium content\nSubscribe for full access to premium content\nSubscribe\nYou already have an account?\nLog in\nMonitor. Click below to renew.\nRenew subscription\nMaybe later\nSubscribe for  a month to get full access\nUPDF soldier shoots fisherman dead on Lake Kyoga\nThursday, May 02, 2024\nDeputy defence public information officer Col Deo Akiiki. PHOTO/ALEX ASHABA\nBy\nJuliet Nalwooga\nReporter\nNMG\nWhat you need to know:\nUPDF says the deceased fisherman attempted to fight the soldier using an oar, prompting a shooting by the armed officer in self defence.\nThank you for reading Nation.Africa\nShow plans\nA Uganda People's Defence Force (UPDF) soldier attached to the Fisheries Protection Unit (FPU) May 1 shot a fisherman dead on the shores of Lake Kyoga, authorities have said.\n\"It’s unfortunate that while our FPU soldiers were conducting an operation at Kitwe landing site on the waters of Lake Kyoga, S/Sgt Moses Niwagira shot Charles Wanya who died instantly,” deputy defence public information officer Col Deo Akiiki said.\nUPDF says the deceased fisherman attempted to fight the soldier using an oar, prompting a shooting by the armed officer in self defence.\nRelated\nPRIME\nUPDF soldiers shoot fisherman on Lake Victoria\nNational\nDec 21, 2018\n\"It's alleged that, during the scuffle, Niwagira sustained injuries on the arm. He tried to shoot in the air but the bullet hit Wanya on the head, killing him,” Col Akiiki explained.\nHowever, FPU spokesperson Lt Rauben Ndifula said the soldier was still under custody alongside 12 other suspects detained by police as investigations continue.\nUganda created the FPU as a UPDF outfit in 2017 in efforts to boost the economic viability of the fisheries sector, following rampant reports of illegal fishing practices.\nHowever, the unit's operations have been marred by extortion allegations and deadly operation with Dokolo South lawmaker Felix Okot Ogong recently telling President Museveni that FPU is illegally minting cash from vulnerable communities.\nIn response Museveni said: \"We have allowed the lakes to be invaded by even foreigners. People who come and eat the young fish. That's how the army came in.\"\nBut the Ugandan leader promised to meet elders in the fishing communities to find solutions before sending soldiers away from fishing communities.\n\"In the month of May or June I want you people who are near the lakes to guide me to get the elders of these areas. They should be the ones to tell us who is spoiling the lake so the army can go away,” he said at a campaign.\nRegister to continue reading this premium article\nYes, please!\nYou already have an account?\nLog in\nRegister to begin your journey to our premium content\nSubscribe for full access to premium content\nSubscribe\nYou already have an account?\nLog in\nMonitor. The news release stated Ramirez was seen not wearing a life jacket. AdvertisementArticle continues below this adCoast Guard crews searched approximately 1,416 square miles, using the support of an aircraft crew and response boat crews. The crew of the commercial fishing vessel Mr. Webb and other commercial fishermen also helped the coast guard in its search. \"Our hearts go out to Mr. Ramirez's family and friends during this difficult time,\" Captain Hans Govertsen, commanding officer of Sector and Air Station Corpus Christi, stated in the news release. \"We take solace in the ability of our community to come together in trying times. It was heartwarming to see so many people contribute to this search effort throughout the day.\"More For YouSAPD: San Antonio woman arrested for injury to a newbornPolice said the newborn was hospitalized in critical condition. Will ICE target San Antonio schools?     "https://www.portugalresident.com/fisherman-dies-as-boat-sinks-off-vila-do-bispo/": "Fisherman dies as boat sinks off Vila do Bispo - Portugal Resident\nPortugal\nBrief news\nAlgarve\nCommunity\nBusiness\nLifestyle\nFood\nGardening\nHealth\nNature\nTravel\nPet Corner\nWine\nSociety\nEducation\nHistory\nScience & Technology\nSecurity\nWhat’s On\nMore\nEconomy & Finance\nLetters\nMotoring\nProperty\nOpinion\nPremieres (trailers)\nSport & Leisure\nClassified Ads\nNewsletter\nSign in\nWelcome!Log into your account\nyour username\nyour password\nForgot your password?\nPassword recovery\nRecover your password\nyour email\nSearch\nPortugal Resident\nYour daily news from Portugal\nSign in\nWelcome! Log into your account\nyour username\nyour password\nForgot your password? Get help\nPassword recovery\nRecover your password\nyour email\nA password will be e-mailed to you.\nPortugal Resident\nPortugal\nBrief news\nAlgarve\nCommunity\nBusiness\nLifestyle\nFood\nGardening\nHealth\nNature\nTravel\nPet Corner\nWine\nSociety\nEducation\nHistory\nScience & Technology\nSecurity\nWhat’s On\nMore\nEconomy & Finance\nLetters\nMotoring\nProperty\nOpinion\nPremieres (trailers)\nSport & Leisure\nClassified Ads\nNewsletter\nHome  Algarve News  Fisherman dies as boat sinks off Vila do Bispo\nAlgarve News\nTAGSAlgarveAlgarve News\nFisherman dies as boat sinks off Vila do Bispo\nBy Michael Bruxo -   29th September 2022\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nPinterest\nLinkedin\nFive other fishermen were able to swim to land\nA 23-year-old fisherman died after the fishing boat he was travelling in sunk around three kilometres off Salema beach in Vila do Bispo.\nFive other fishermen were on the boat when it started to sink and were able to swim to land on their own, according to the National Maritime Authority (AMN).\nAuthorities were alerted at around 3.30am this Thursday morning, having dispatched to the scene a lifeboat from the Sagres sea rescue station, a Lagos maritime police boat, the NRP Cassiopeia ship from the Portuguese Navy and a team of divers from Lagos’ volunteer firefighters.\nThe men who made it to the beach were assisted by by-standers who were nearby until INEM emergency services and local firefighters arrived.\nA rescue operation was launched to save the missing fishermen, who was found unconscious inside the sunken boat by the divers.\nHe was taken to the beach where INEM emergency workers tried to revive him using a defibrillator. After “many attempts,” his death was declared on the spot by an INEM doctor.\nThe Public Prosecutor’s Office was notified and the body was transported to Portimão’s legal medicine office by Vila do Bispo firefighters.\nMaritime police’s psychology office is providing support to the family members of the victim, while the sunken boat remains in the sea. The owner has already been notified to create a plan to remove the boat from the sea.\nBy Michael Bruxo\n[email protected]\nFacebook\nTwitter\nWhatsApp\nPinterest\nLinkedin\nMichael Bruxo\nRELATED ARTICLESMORE FROM AUTHOR\nFLOW, a thought-provoking exhibition in Algarve\nAlagoas Brancas hosts special event on World Wetlands Day\nAlgarve dams at 49% capacity – water supply secured for more than one year!\nRainwater harvesting introduced at Faro schools\nAlgarve football round-up: Setbacks\nIllegal constructions surge in Loulé\nLatest News\nReality behind bold dream of opening “unique” bar in Portugal\n30th January 2025\nSilves sets record straight about Portugal’s new land law\n30th January 2025\nFLOW, a thought-provoking exhibition in Algarve\n30th January 2025\nGovernment wants preservation plan for Portugal’s wolves that works\n30th January 2025\nFarewell Burns Supper in Silves?\n30th January 2025\nFormer hospital administrators accused of money laundering\n30th January 2025\nLiving in the Algarve Free Seminar Events\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E2cB8CGTsCsAre you considering moving to Portugal/Algarve? leak | SeafoodSource                   Become a member Log in Newsletter  Cart Search Menu    Home     News      Aquaculture     Supply & Trade     Business & Finance     Environment & Sustainability    Advertise & Media Kit     Premium Membership     Subscribe     Contact Us       Premium Membership        Europêche is demanding answers after reports revealed the European Commission's environmental departments funded lobbying targeting other departments | Photo courtesy of Europêche  January 30, 2025  Europêche pushes for clarity in wake of reports EU funded environmental lobbying by NGOs      Regal Springs rasies tilapia in Lake El Cajón, Honduras | Photo courtesy of Regal Springs  January 30, 2025  After setbacks in Honduras, Regal Springs signs sustainability alliance with government      Though it suffered from a drop in import totals, French oysters are still coveted in Asia for their quality | Photo courtesy of Lesley Williamson/Le Guide Charente Maritime  January 30, 2025  China’s oyster imports hit slump in 2024, hurting French exporters      The funding will support two projects needed after the removal of two dams along the Eel River, which will open up 200 miles of spawning habitat to struggling salmon populations. | Photo courtesy of Danita Delimont/Shutterstock  January 30, 2025  Huffman announces USD 15 million for salmon restoration project      A Sysco truck in the U.S. state of Oregon | Photo courtesy of Tada Images/Shutterstock  January 30, 2025  Sysco earnings increase, restaurant expansions mark positive signs for US foodservice      August 24, 2023 American Seafoods crewmember dies due to suspected on-board ammonia leak     Cliff White   News » Supply & Trade     Share    A crewmember onboard an American Seafoods’ catcher-processor vessel has died from a suspected ammonia leak.David Kumah, a 43-year-old first engineer from Ghana, was found unresponsive on board the Northern Eagle just past midnight on Friday, 18 August. U.S. Coast Guard Petty Officer Second Class John Highwater told KUCB an ammonia leak likely killed Kumah.“One of their crew members was found unresponsive in one of their engineering spaces,” Highwater said. “They believe there was an ammonia leak somewhere in the vessel that caused the person to fall unconscious.”A satellite call was placed from the vessel to the U.S. Coast Guard at around 4 a.m. on 18 August, and the vessel was told to return to Dutch Harbor, Alaska, as it would have taken longer to send a Coast Guard crew to the Northern Eagle. The vessel arrived in port at 5 a.m. on 19 August, but Kumah had died en route to Dutch Harbor, according to Unalaska Fire Chief Ben Knowles.“The fire department, along with NOAA, the U.S. Coast Guard Marine Safety Detachment, and the Alaska State Troopers boarded the vessel around 6 a.m., once they were all tied up, and began the investigation into the incident,” Knowles said.The Coast Guard, Alaska State Troopers and NOAA are jointly investigating the death, and Kumah’s body has been received by the Alaska Medical Examiner’s Office for an autopsy.The Unalaska Fire Department assisted with decontamination onboard the vessel.An American Seafoods spokesperson told SeafoodSource the company is working to provide help to Kumah’s family and his crewmates.“We’re shocked and saddened at this loss, and are in contact with the family to express our deepest condolences and to provide whatever support we can,” the spokesperson said. “We are also providing grief counseling to crew members and are fully cooperating with local authorities. Our hearts and prayers go out to his family and friends during this difficult time.”The Seattle, Washington, U.S.A.-based fishing firm, which is currently for sale, is in the process of negotiating a settlement with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency in regard to civil penalties it received for alleged violations of the Clean Water Act. The company is also preparing to launch its retrofitted American Empress II, formerly the Phoenix, which it purchased from Phoenix Processor Limited Partnership (PPLP) in June 2023. In July 2023, American Seafoods settled a legal dispute with U.S. Customs and Border Protection for USD 9.5 million (EUR 8.5 million), avoiding over USD 400 million (EUR 359 million) in additional fines levied for its use of a dead-end railway in Canada as means of avoid trading restrictions related to the U.S. Jones Act.The company has revised its strategic direction under the leadership of CEO Einar Gustafsson, who was appointed in February 2022.Photo courtesy of American SeafoodsSubscribeWant seafood news sent to your inbox?You may unsubscribe from our mailing list at any time. fisherman found\nPhuket News\nPhuket News\nThailand News\nWorld News\nBusiness News\nQ&A News\nWeird News\nBody of missing fisherman found\nPHUKET: Search teams have found the body of the fishermen missing from the fishing boat that capsized off Phuket’s east coast late Saturday night.marineSafetydeathBy Eakkapop ThongtubMonday 13 December 2021 09:17 AM\nPhoto: Eakkapop Thongtub\nPhoto: Eakkapop Thongtub\nPhoto: Eakkapop Thongtub\nPhoto: Eakkapop Thongtub\n«\n»\nPrakanchai Suparat, 64, was last seen in the water separated from his fellow crewmates after the Chokhongthong fishing boat struck a sunken vessel and took on water between Koh Tapao Yai and Koh Tapao Noi about 8:20pm Saturday night (Dec 11).\nHis two crewmates were rescued and brought ashore at Saphan Hin yesterday, but a search continued Mr Prakanchai.\nA Royal Thai Navy helicopter, Marine Police and Kusoldharm rescue workers in a rubber dinghy all scoured Phuket Bay for Mr Prakanchai, and finally found a body matching his description among mangroves about one kilometre from the mouth of the Klong Koh Phi canal.\nThe body was brought back to Saphan Hin, where relatives confirmed it was that of Mr Prakanchai.\nHis body was taken to Vachira Phuket Hospital for post-mortem examination.\nskorchio\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t |\n14 December 2021 - 00:24:06\nThis is sad, all the info suggested he would have been rescued, but then maybe he didn't really have a life jacket on.     "https://www.thephuketnews.com/dead-body-found-off-ao-por-as-weather-alert-rene-88418.php": "Dead body found off Ao Por as weather alert renewed\nHOME\nNEWSNEWSPhuket NewsThailand NewsWorld NewsBusiness NewsQ&A NewsWeird NewsARCHIVEPOLLCURRENCYWEATHERPHUKET TIDE TABLESUBSCRIBE DAILY NEWSLIFELIFEArtsCommunityCultureDiningEducationPhuket EntertainmentEnvironmentHealthPeopleTechnologyTravelWorld EntertainmentPHOTO GALLERIESSPORTSPORTPhuketThailandWorldSURF REPORTPREDICTIONSCLASSIFIEDSCLASSIFIEDSPropertyCars & BoatsJobsPost a classified adEVENTSEVENTSBuy ticketsTodayNext Seven DaysAll EventsView in calendarPost an eventDIRECTORYDIRECTORYBars, pubs & clubsHotels & villasRestaurantsYellow PagesPost a listing\nABOUT\nABOUT\nThe Company\nWork with us\nDistribution points\nPay for advert\nTIP-OFF\nADVERTISE\nCONTACT\nPHUKET PROPERTY\nDEALS\nLogin |\nCreate Account |\nSearch\nLogin |\nCreate Account\nPoll |\nCurrency |\nWeather |\nFacebook |\nYoutube |\nSearch\nDead body found off Ao Por as weather alert renewed\nPhuket News\nPhuket News\nThailand News\nWorld News\nBusiness News\nQ&A News\nWeird News\nDead body found off Ao Por as weather alert renewed\nPHUKET: A missing resident of Pa Khlok has been confirmed dead after his lifeless body was found floating in the sea and brought ashore by a local fisherman yesterday (June 5) morning.deathweathermarineBy Eakkapop ThongtubTuesday 6 June 2023 11:00 AM\nPrachoen Thammawong, 59, failed to return home from his fishing routine on June 4 and was found dead in the sea next day. Photo: Eakkapop Thongtub\nPrachoen Thammawong, 59, failed to return home from his fishing routine on June 4 and was found dead in the sea next day. Photo: Eakkapop Thongtub\nA new weather alert for Phuket was issued at 5am today (June 6). Image: Phuket Met\n«\n»\nThe Thalang Police Station was notified of the discovery of a dead body at around 9am. Officers were asked to come to Ao Por to perform their duties in accordance with the prescribed procedures by law.\nUpon arriving at the scene, police officers and rescue workers found the body of an elderly Thai man floating in the water beside a blue pontoon jetty used by Ao Por villagers.\nOfficials were informed that Phanrit Longkhao, 33, one of the local fishermen, discovered the corpse in the sea and dragged it to the jetty with his longtail boat but did not bring it ashore thereafter.\nThe body was examined at the scene. Officials noted a small injury on the dead man’s head, but the cause of death was yet to be confirmed by a medical specialist at Thalang Hospital, where the man was taken by Kusoldharm rescue workers.\nPolice officers confirmed the deceased as Prachoen Thammawong, 59. The man was a local fisherman and had been missing since Sunday (June 4) when he went to check his fish traps in the sea and failed to return home.\nAt 5am today (June 6), the Phuket-based Southern Meteorological Center (West Coast) reissued its weather warning for Phuket and the surrounding area. The advisory was marked No. 1 (19/2023), indicating the beginning of a new series of warnings after the previous one concluded.\nThe today’s weather alert no longer mentions the typhoon ’Mawar’ but still warns of a \"rather strong southwest monsoon prevailing over the upper Andaman Sea and the Southern Thailand’s west coast.\"\n\"The wind waves in the upper Andaman Sea are becoming stronger and will reach up to 2-3 meters, and above 3 meters in thundershower areas and nearby. All ships should proceed with caution, and captains should avoid sailing in thundershower areas. Small boats in the upper Andaman Sea should stay at bay,\" the June 6 warning said.\n\"People should beware of severe weather conditions and stay tuned for further weather alerts,\" the annoncement stressed.\nHave a news tip-off? The corpse was discovered on the rocks yesterday (Feb 16).deathmarineSafetyBy Eakkapop ThongtubSaturday 17 February 2024 01:00 PM\nMr Wanchai, 39, was found dead on Feb 16 in Cherng Talay. Photo: Eakkapop Thongtub\nAt around 2pm yesterday (Feb 16), Lt Col Kittipong Noupeng of Cherng Talay Police was informed by a local fisherman about a body found on the rocks at Laem Kho Ma, in the vicinity of Bang Tao Beach.\nSurin Beach lifeguards and Phuket Kusontham Foundation rescue workers were dispatched to the scene to recover the body. The man was found lying face down on the rocks, with signs indicating he had died several days ago.The deceased was identified as Wanchai Puanglamyai, 39, a crew member of the fishing boat Thanapsomwang 9, who had fallen overboard and went missing during rough weather in the Bang Tao Bay area. His disappearance was reported by relatives on Feb 12.\nAuthorities then contacted Mr. Wanchai’s family to confirm the identity before the body was transferred to Vachira Phuket Hospital for an autopsy to determine the precise cause of death.\nHave a news tip-off? Taking part in the search are the Phuket Fisheries Office, a patrol boat from the Royal Thai Navy Third Area Command at Cape Panwa and the Tourist Assistance Center.\nA Chalong Hospital ambulance arrived to stand by to provide emergency medical care for any people brought ashore, while Phuket Provincial Administrative Organisation (PPAO) President Rewat Areerob, Rawai Mayor Aroon Soros and Pol Lt Col Jaruwat Phonrat arrived to coordinate efforts.\nThe search teams recovered the boat’s two crew members, who survived by swimming to shore. They were brought back to Chalong Pier and rushed to Chalong Hospital.\nOf the other two people on the boat, the search teams recovered the body of Witthaya ‘Aod’ Maliwan, while the search continues for Mr Khwan Ruea, who remains missing.\nAbidin Tummali, 46, one of the survivors, said that the four departed Palai Pier on a small three-seat fiberglass boat at 10am to go fishing.\nAt that time it was raining but the waves were not big, Mr Abidin said.\nHowever, the waves grew in size and came at the boat from overlapping directions. The boat started taking on water, and sank, he said.\nSittiphon Muangsong of the Phuket Fisheries Office confirmed that the search for Mr Kwan continues today.\nJohnC\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t |\n12 September 2023 - 09:16:47\nClearly not very experienced fisherman. Bhandimar passes away due to heart attack\n15 tents gutted outside Sector 22 of Maha Kumbh, no loss of life\nDocumentary filmmaker-activist Tapan K Bose dies at 78\nMany in BJP wish for an alliance with Sena (UBT): Raut\nNeither Godse nor others can kill Mahatma Gandhi’s values: CM Siddaramaiah\n“No Unnecessary Questions”: Kiccha Sudeep gets angry at journalist\nAdityanath pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi on death anniversary\nCrackdown on human trafficking and prostitution racket: Several women rescued\nMangaluru: Road closure near Kottara for exorcism ritual\nGeethartha Chinthane 171: The Eternal form is not the Physical Body, but the True Self\nKerala Government attempts to reduce the number of Kannada-speaking staff\n4 Bangladeshi women held in Thane for illegal stay; search on for house owner\nHigh Court warns Revenue Secretary over land encroachment case involving HD Kumaraswamy\nKokkada’s Satyanarayana Thodtillaya appointed as Chief Priest of Sri Anantha Padmanabha Swamy Temple\nLive-in couples must be registered with competent authority till enactment of law: Rajasthan HC\nHome\nState\nBudget Special\nNational\nInternational\nSports\nEntertainment\nExclusives\nGallery\nMore\nHomeStateMalpe: Fisherman goes missing after falling off boat\nA\nA\nATeam Udayavani,  Sep 9, 2023, 11:17 AM IST\nMalpe: A fisherman, accidentally fell into the water and has gone missing.The missing person is identified as Nagaswamy, (44).Nagaswamy worked on a boat called Jaimata in Malpe. After he finished his fishing work, he parked the boat at the dock, had dinner, and then went to sleep on the same boat. At around 10:45 PM that night, he fell into the water when he was trying to get out of the boat.Two men named Babuji and Muragesha, who were also sleeping on the boat, woke up when they heard Nagaswamy fall into the water.They tried to help him by throwing a rope from the boat into the water. Unfortunately, Nagaswamy couldn’t hold onto the rope and drowned. It is gathered that he had been drinking alcohol.After learning about the incident expert water rescuer, named Ishwara Malpe, arrived and searched for Nagaswamy, however, they couldn’t find him.Malpe Police have registered a case regarding this regard.\nUdayavani is now on Telegram. News\nBody of fisherman who fell off boat at Dutch Gap recovered\nPosted: Aug 9, 2021 / 03:02 PM EDT\nUpdated: Aug 9, 2021 / 03:02 PM EDT\nPosted: Aug 9, 2021 / 03:02 PM EDT\nUpdated: Aug 9, 2021 / 03:02 PM EDT\nSHARE\nCHESTER, Va. (WRIC) — The body of a fisherman who went missing after falling off a boat at Dutch Gap Friday morning has been recovered.\nThe Department of Wildlife Resources told 8News that 78-year-old Gary Lee Lane’s body was found at 9:50 a.m. Monday by a search crew near the Meadowville Landing subdivision in Chester. This is approximately 2.5 miles from where he went missing.\nRecovery underway after man in late 70s falls off boat at Dutch Gap\nMultiple units are on the scene of a water rescue in Dutch Gap. (Photo: 8News Reporter Alex Thorson)\nChesterfield authorities responded to a person in the water call around 8:40 a.m. on Friday. According to Paige Pearson with DWR, Lee was out on a boat fishing when he fell in the water.\nPearson said there was another person on the boat with Lee. “He saw him for just a split second when he turned around and looked and by the time he turned the boat around to go back to get him, he didn’t see him,” Pearson said.\nChildren killed, other family members injured in Chesterfield house fire\nDivers and crews searched until sunset Friday and continued their search over the weekend. It was an all-hands-on-deck mission. A coast guard chopper from Elizabeth City joined a cluster of first responders from several nearby agencies in the search.\nCopyright 2025 Nexstar Media Inc.     "https://thefinancialexpress.com.bd/national/13-fishermen-go-missing-for-five-days-in-bay-of-bengal": "13 fishermen go missing for five days in Bay of Bengal | The Financial Express\nBN             Thursday, 30 January 2025 Archive |\nThursday, 30 January 2025\nBN       HomeEconomy  Bangladesh Global Stock  Bangladesh Global TradeNational  Politics Country Law & Order World  America Asia/South Asia Europe Africa EditorialViews  Reviews Opinions Columns Analysis Letters Economic Trends and Insights More  Education   Article Media Bangla Sci-Tech Health Sports   Cricket Football More Sports Lifestyle   Living Entertainment Food Culture Others Environment Jobs and Opportunities Youth and Entrepreneurs   Startups  Today's FE E-Paper 32nd year of publication  31st anniversary issue-I 31st anniversary issue-II 31st anniversary issue-III   The Financial Express\nNational\na year ago\n13 fishermen go missing for five days in Bay of Bengal  UNB\nFile photo\nUNB Published : Jan 08, 2024 12:31 Updated : Jan 08, 2024 12:38 Share this news\nFile photo\nFor all latest news, follow The Financial Express Google News channel.\nA fishing trawler with 13 fishermen has been missing for the last five days since it went fishing in the Bay of Bengal from Anwara upazila of Chattogram.\nIn the meantime, another trawler was sent from the coast of Anwara to search for the trawler, but there is no trace of the missing fishermen and the trawler as of now.\nThe trawler left for fishing from Sarengaghat of the upazila at around 8:00 pm on Wednesday (January 3).\nMd Nizam Uddin, owner of the trawler, said that during the departure of the trawler, food was given to the trawler for 15 days. They left the coast on Wednesday night and contacted them last on Friday. At last contact, they said that there was a problem with the trawler's engine, the trawler was not running and they were floating in the water.\nAt that time, they were near St Martin's and Teknaf.\n\"Later, we sent another trawler to them. The trawler searched for three days but could not find any trace of them. We have reported the matter to the naval police,\" he added.\nMd Faruk, duty officer of the river police, said, \"We have been informed about the matter. But we were on election duty for the last few days. In the meantime, we have informed the matter in different places, so that if anyone gets the news, they can inform us.\" Share this news            More News          Job Opportunities   Editor: Shamsul Huq Zahid Published by Syed Manzur Elahi for International Publications\nLimited from Tropicana Tower (4th floor), 45, Topkhana Road, GPO Box\n: 2526 Dhaka- 1000 and printed by him from The Transcraft Limited, 229, Tejgaon Industrial Area, Dhaka-1208 PABX : 02223389780 (Hunting)\nMobile:\n01917231083 Fax : 880-2-02223387049\nEmail:\n[email protected]  [email protected]  [email protected] Quick links HomeEconomyStockTradeNationalWorldViews -------- EducationSci-TechHealthSportsLifestyleEnvironment -------- All News Today's FEE-paperOnline Rates Ad Tariff Sitemap  Subscribe to Newsletter  Subscribe You'll get monthly newsletter from us!      © 2025 - All Rights with The Financial Express About UsContact UsTerms of Service",

The church said in a statement Calvin Robinson's license had been revoked after he made a “gesture that many have interpreted as a pro-Nazi salute.” Robinson made the gesture during a Jan. 25 speech at the National Pro-Life Summit in Washington, D.C.  Robinson said in a statement posted to social media that it was a ”joke\" and that “in case it needs saying: I am not a Nazi.” Musk’s gesture that Robinson was mimicking came in a Jan. 20 speech during celebrations of Donald Trump’s presidential inauguration.\nSubmit Your News\nWe're always interested in hearing about news in our community.     "https://www.king5.com/article/news/local/one-found-alive-missing-vessel-evening-grays-harbor/281-07fa80e0-7430-4277-a610-f2669580a0de": "One missing mariner found alive in raft off Washington coast | king5.com\nSkip Navigation\nShare on Facebook\nShare on SMS\nShare on Email\nNavigation\nNews\nBack\nLocal\nSEAtoday\nMoney\nNear Me\nInvestigators\nNation World\nPolitics\nEnvironment\nHealthlink\nEntertainment\nCommunity\nFeatures\nLatest News Stories\nSeattle-area woman charged in a border patrol officer's death has been ordered held without bail\nCorporate layoffs at Amazon confirmed by company\nWeather\nBack\nForecast\nRadar\n10-Day\nHourly\nMaps\nTraffic\nDrive Times\nWebcams\nSchoolNet\nClosings & Delays\nLatest Weather Stories\nWestern Washington Weather Forecast\nStar-studded FireAid benefit concert for LA wildfire relief kicks off Thursday night. Here's how to watch\nSports\nBack\nHigh School Sports\nSeahawks\nMariners\nSounders FC\nReign\nKraken\nStorm\nHuskies\nCougars\nLocked On Podcast Network\nLatest Stories\nKraken to send Philipp Grubauer to Coachella Valley on waivers amid recent struggles\nSeattle's flag football star Eleana Lee earns national recognition and Seahawks nomination\nVERIFY\nSearch\nSearch:\nSearch\nRight Now\nSeattle, WA »\n40°\nSeattle, WA »\nWeather\nClosings\nAdvertise With Us\nEvening\nNew Day\nFacing Race\nInvestigators\nContests\nOn The Record\nExplore the PNW\nTV Listings\nMeet the Team\nBreaking News\nMore () »\nLocal News\nOne of two missing fishermen found alive in life raft after boat goes missing off Washington coast\nThe vessel Evening departed Grays Harbor on Oct. 12. A second person aboard the original vessel remains missing.\nMore Videos\nNext up in 5\nExample video title will go here for this video\nNext up in 5\nExample video title will go here for this video\nAuthor: KING 5 Staff\nPublished: 7:07 PM PDT October 26, 2023\nUpdated: 10:41 PM PDT October 26, 2023\nWESTPORT, Wash. — One of two people aboard a vessel that went missing in mid-October was found alive in a life raft on Thursday, Oct. 26.\nThe 43-foot vessel Evening departed Westport in Grays Harbor County on Oct. 12. It reportedly intended to return Oct. 15, according to the United States Coast Guard.\nOn Thursday, one of the fishermen was found in a life raft by good Samaritans approximately 70 miles northwest of Cape Flattery.\n\"I saw what looked like a life raft in the distance and ran inside and put the binoculars on him and then he shot off a flare,\" said Ryan Planes, one of the people who helped save the fisherman.\nRyan Planes and his uncle John, who are from Sooke, British Columbia, were out early with friends on a fishing excursion that turned into a rescue mission.\n\"We pulled him on board. He gave me a big hug and it was emotional,\" John said.\nJohn said the fisherman told him that he was alone on the raft for 13 days, eventually running out of food and water. He told the men that he caught a salmon and ate it to survive.\nCredit: PLANES FAMILY\nA man survived 13 days alone on this life raft off the coast of Washington. A second person who was aboard the original vessel remains missing.\n\"We made him breakfast. He drank three bottles of water. He was pretty hungry, poor guy,\" John said.\nIt was fate that sent John to the exact spot where the life raft was. He wanted to catch more fish and knew that was a good spot to go.\nWith the help of the Canadian Coast Guard, the fisherman was taken to a hospital in Tofino where he is recovering.\nThe second fisherman who was aboard vessel Evening remains missing, according to the Coast Guard.\nThis is a developing story. They are widely used in order to make websites work, or work more efficiently, as well as to provide information to the owners of the site.\nThe Scottish uses cookies to record when you have confirmed that you accept the use of cookies on the website. This helps us to make sure that you do not have to accept the use of cookies every time you move to another page on the website.\nThe only other cookies in use on The Scottish’s website are provided by Google Analytics in order to collect anonymous website usage statistics. “Performance” cookies such as these collect information about how users navigate the website. They identify how users interact with our website, any errors that occur, which pages are not often used, which pages take a long time to load, which pages users tend to visit and in what order.\nCookie\nCookies type/duration\nCategory of cookies as defined in the ICC Cookie Guide\nPurpose\nSitecore global session\nEach session\nFunctionality\nTo record when a user has confirmed they accept the use of cookies on the site.  It saves users having to accept each time they  move to a new page\nGoogle Analytics\nAnalytics/2 years\nPerformance\nAnonymous website usage statistics\n_ga\nAnonymous website usage statistics\n_gat\nAnonymous website usage statistics\n_utma\nAnonymous website usage statistics\n_utmt\nAnonymous website usage statistics\n_utmb\nAnonymous website usage statistics\n_utmc\nAnonymous website usage statistics\n_utmz\nAnonymous website usage statistics\n_utmv\nAnonymous website usage statistics\nIf you want to delete any cookies that are already on your computer, please refer to the instructions for your file management software to locate the file or directory that stores cookies.
